my_notes: Soft, lush with fruit. This highly extracted Syrah has been grown in a fairly warm climate and reminds us of an Australian Shiraz from Barossa.  It exudes rich chocolate and blackberry aromas, with hints of anise, toasted almond and vanilla.  The ripe meaty currant and black cherry flavors have a long lingering aftertaste.

Soft, lush with fruit. This highly extracted Syrah has been grown in a fairly warm climate and reminds us of an Australian Shiraz from Barossa.  It exudes rich chocolate and blackberry aromas, with hints of anise, toasted almond and vanilla.  The ripe meaty currant and black cherry flavors have a long lingering aftertaste.

other_notes: The 2000 Quilceda Creek Cabernet Sauvignon is reminiscent of the '98 Quilceda Creek but on steroids. This wine is packed full of blackberry liqueur, plums, and crème de cassis laden with anise, smoke and Asian spices. It has a fabulous syrupy texture, show-casing the amazing purity of cabernet fruit found in this wine. It is the most perfumed and well-balanced Quilceda Creek wine to date.  The dark ruby-colored 2000 Cabernet Sauvignon has a nose reminiscent of a blackberry-flavored Yoplait yogurt laced with roasted oak and hints of licorice. A full-bodied wine of power and structure, it is crammed with black currants, blackberries, and spices. Its dense fruit is matched blow for blow with a muscular, firm structure. Anticipated maturity: 2008-2020. Score: 94+

Anticipated maturity: 2008-2020. Score: 94+

other_notes: Robert Parker, The Wine Advocate, 28-08-92  93 Points. “The 1990 Symington's Quinta do Vesuvio possesses an opaque black/purple colour, and a sweet, rich nose with a whiff of liquorice and powerfully ripe fruit. In the mouth it is full-bodied, with superb concentration, as well as a rich, opulent, deep finish. Drinkable now, it has at least 20 years of evolution. Just as spectacular as any Vintage Port I have tasted from 1983 or 1985.” Michael Broadbent MW, Decanter Magazine, December 1992 “Impressive....virtually opaque, with a vivid purple rim so intense that it seemed to be exerting pressure against the sides of the glass. ......black, fiery, peppery, alcoholic, its sweetness masked by packed fruit, high extract and dry, mouth-puckering tannins”

variety: Bordeaux (60% Merlot, 30% Cabernet Franc, 10% Cabernet Sauvignon)
other_notes: 100 points Robert Parker: "Give Gerard Perse credit. People thought his numerous assurances that 2000 was the greatest Pavie ever produced were premature as well as arrogant. However, after tasting this extraordinary blend of 60% Merlot, 30% Cabernet Franc, and 10% Cabernet Sauvignon (made from low yields of 28-30 hectoliters per hectare) six separate times in 2003, it is unquestionably one of the most monumental wines Bordeaux has ever produced. Bottled in March, 2003, about nine months later than other 2000s, the color is an opaque purple, and the bouquet offers up notes of liquid minerals, blackberries, cherries, and cassis intermixed with spice box, cedar, and white flowers. On the palate, it exhibits a massive display of richness and extract, yet with pinpoint delineation and vibrancy as well as a 60+ second finish, this is the kind of phenomenal wine that Perse's critics were afraid he might produce - a no-compromise, immortal wonder that represents the essence of one of Bordeaux's greatest terroirs. Life is too short not to own and consume the 2000 Pavie. Anticipated maturity: 2012-2050." (04/03)

other_notes: From bottle:  Our Apalita estate is located in Santa Cruz in the heart of the Colchagua Valley, one of the best winemaking areas in Chile for red wines.  The melting snow from the Andes Mountains temper the heat of the summer sun and nourish the vines that were originally brought into the country during the XIX century from France, pre-phyloxera.

From bottle:  Aged “sur lies” in oak barrels for eight months, the 2001 Toasted Head Chardonnay has aromas of apricot and vanilla, flavors of tropical fruit and a slight spiciness, layered with toasty oak notes.  The Toasted Head name comes from the process of charring the barrel heads for caramelized oak tones.

NVWE:  CLEARLY IDENTIFIABLE AS CARNEROS CHARDONnay in both aroma and taste, this well stuffed beauty leaves the drinker with lingering impressions of baked apple, citrus, golden fig, vanilla, and tropical fruits, using subtle earthiness and zest to keep the palate alert.

NVWE:  We found this one bright, ripe and gently spicy in aroma, and its well-focused gooseberry, melon, lime, honeysuckle and preserved lemon notes are reprised on the palate, but with more intensity, depth and generosity.  Blended with 10% Semillon

NVWE Luxurious all the way; from it’s richly oaky peach-apple-lemon-toasted coconut scents to its long and wonderfully creamy finish where white peach, golden fig, baked apple, lemon, bees wax and vanilla butter cream all play a role.

NVWE:  Elegantly aromatic and caressing to the nose, offering melon, honeydew and peach blossom scents softly graced by vanilla and a hint of clove, it will prove a pert and cuddly sipper and worthy match to winter’s richer chicken and pork dishes.  Blended with 3% Chardonnay

NVWE:  Zesty, fruit dominated, grapefruit, melon and key lime aromas don’t disguise the bold mineral core that brands this Sauvignon Blanc as a classic seafood wine.  Give it barbecued prawns, steamed clams, raw oysters or sushi.

NVWE:  A cascade of fresh peach, lime, jasmine, yellow rose and lychee fruit scents bring drama to the nose, but it is the exquisite length, depth of flavor and pinpoint balance that make this a truly splendid dinner wine.

NVWE:  Supple and polished all the way, this lovely Cabernet accents a rich fruit core of blackberry and plum with black tea, dried herbs and a hint of coffee toffee.  It is not grand in scale but is deep and satisfying and the flavors and silky texture linger beautifully.

NVWE:  Full of dark plum, cherry, currant and toasty vanilla to the nose, this supple and tasty Cabernet has the zest for sauced meats, enough stuffing for a rich roast, but a tannic edge soft enough to comfortably match roast chicken or sausage pizza.

my_notes: Nice, rich sweetness.  Alan says “It’s good.”
other_notes: NVWE comments:  Darkly rich and sweetly ripe, this intense and juicy Zin fills the nose with dark cherry, black fig, black pepper, smoke, earth and other savory treats.  Perfect for beef, it is as boldly flavored as expected and fully dry, with the balance of a fine dinner wine.  Unfined and unfiltered.

NVWE comments:  This deeply ripe mountain Merlot has focused aromas and flavors of sweet dark cherry, red currant, sumac, briar and earth.  Long and gusty and flavorful, it deserves service with a rich roast or grilled steak and it should only get better over the next two years.

NVWE comments:  Grapey, sweet-natured and delightful, with scents and flavors of black raspberry, pepper, date sugar and dry flowers that just jump from the glass.  A perfect steak and burger wine, soft-edged sipper and God’s gift to pizza make this a bargain not to be missed.  Blended with 5% Malbec

NVWE comments:  A wine of the Fall, not the Spring, this Pinot offers layered, subtly herbal tones of ripe Bing cherry, dry rose, dry fruit and a hint of slightly peppery roast meat.  Palate-coating and long, it’s impression of plush complexity suggests service with rich stews.

From bottle:  Katherine’s Chardonnay represents the signature style of Cambria’s family-owned estate.  Located in the heart of the Santa Maria Bench, Katherine’s has consistenly produced lush, tropical Chardonnays for over a decade.

vineyard: Leonardini and Morisoli Vineyards for 94% Cabernet Sauvignon, Small vineyard block in Calistoga for Petite Verdot 6%
other_notes: Wine Spectator 93. 2000 presented a stunning growing season of warm days and cool nights. There was excellent grape flavor and acid development as the grapes ripened sweetly and evenly into September. In September and October, the weather cooled, delaying the ripening process. This cooler Fall weather gave the grapes longer hang time in the vineyard for added flavor development. The result is very good balance and soft, ripe tannin development. This classic Cabernet is easily approachable with a deep ruby color and enticing aromas of red cherry,currant and spicy oak. The texture of this wine is silky smooth on the mid-palate with ripe flavors of cassis, berry and cherry lingering well beyond the long velvety finish. There is outstanding balance and good structure that lends to the age worthiness of this elegant offering. A real mouthful of Cabernet. Ripe, rich and plush, with mouthcoating currant and blackberry flavors that are deep and concentrated. Echoes with spicy fruit, and is anchored by rich, chewy tannins.

Grapes were grown primarily on our 120 year old estate in the acclaimed reigon of Sonoma County’s Alexander Valley, and showcawse classic flavors of balck cherry, vanilla, and chocolate.  Additional fruit came from the southern end of the valley, unleashing flavors of blackberry and cassis.  Winemaker Ed Killiam aged the wine for 22 months in small oak barrels to compose this rich, succulent wine that gracefully lingers

vineyard: Russian River Valley, Alexander Valley and Carneros
other_notes: Winemaker Ed Killian chose grapes from three of Sonoma County’s acclaimed wine grwoing regions to create this multi-layered Chardonnay:  Russian River Valley for honeysuckle floral aromas and tropical fruit flavors; Alexander Valley for pear and peach flavors; Carneros for its ripe apple and lemon-citrus.  French barrel fermentation adds nuances of toasty oak and spice.

purchased_from: Gift to Laureen from Jim and Linda

other_notes: From bottle:  Aromas of spicy fruit liquorice and oak typical of this variety of grape.   Lovely big wine has lingering sublet peppery characteristics and flavoursome red berry overtones.  Youthful and fresh with good finish.

From the bottle:  The 2000 vintage was handled with some difficulty as there was light sporadic rain at the end of the season.  We were blessed by a window of clear, dry weather that allowed the fruit to reach full maturity.  Consequently, this wine is balanced and well structured.  The flavor and mouth feel is enhanced by 18 months of aging in new American oak barrels.  Look for the Alexander Valley fruit aromas of green pepper, beet, blackberry and cassis.  Because the wine has a nice soft mouth feel, it can be enjoyed now with most chicken, grilled meats or hard cheese.  If you would like to age the wine, under proper conditions, it should develop additional complexity.  It may form some sediment as it ages.
...shows exciting varietal intensity of fresh green lime and grapefruit aromas, refreshing citrus and crisp acidity on the palate with an attractive lingering finish.

From bottle:  Aged “sur lies” in oak barrels for eight months, the 2001 Toasted Head Chardonnay has aromas of apricot and vanilla, flavors of tropical fruit and a slight spiciness, layered with toasty oak notes.  The Toasted Head name comes from the process of charring the barrel heads for caramelized oak tones.

my_notes: Need to return one of the Monte Rosso for Napa Valley
other_notes: Charter Oak Winery Zinfandel is handcrafted in keeping with the Old World tradition passed down by (my) Grandfather Guido Ragghianti, who learned to make wine as a young man in Lucca Italy.  In the 1930s he brought his winemaking heritage to Charter Oak Avenue, St. Helena, in the heart of Napa Valley.  The wine is fermented on natural yeasts, and the cap is punched down by hand several times a day with special tools made by my grandfather.   Our grapes come from the famed Monte Rosso Vineyard of Sonoma Valley planted in the 1880s.   by winemaker

This is a big, thick, juicy, jammy, seductive blackberry-scented Napa Zin, including fruit from Charter Oak vineyard, with layers of lush fruit and well-integrated toasty French oak. The 2002 Napa is blended with old vine Petite Syrah (1/2 ton per acre) from an historic St. Helena vineyard for added muscle and Zinfandel from the famed Monte Rosso vineyard for added wild berry flavors. This wine has a dark chocolate, Bing cherry, black berry liquor velvet finish and is elegant in style. Only 300 cases produced, limited availability. Aged exclusively in 100% new French oak Burgundy barrels.

my_notes: Had a bottle on 12/09/2007, wait till late 2008 or 2009 at least.

other_notes: This wine has a wonderful texture showcasing layers of black and red fruits interwoven with cocoa powder, leather, vanilla, and minerals. This is an amazing wine that must be tasted again and again. The dark ruby-colored 2001 Cabernet Sauvignon (3,150 cases) contains 3% Cabernet Franc. This spectacular wine explodes from the glass with loads of flowers (mostly violets), cassis, black cherries, blackberries, and underlying fresh herbs. Feeling like liquid satin on the palate, it is broad, densely-packed, and has stupendous depth. A refined effort, its medium to full-bodied personality is crammed with highly-detailed black fruits and loads of exquisitely ripe tannin. In addition, the taster has the distinct feeling that this wine is holding much of its fruit in reserve...This blockbuster has it all. Projected maturity: 2007-2018. Score: 98+

Had this wine at Bizou on 6/17/04.  It was a little tight at first, but opened up into a full lush Zin that went well with the duck that LK had, and the seabass that ARM had.  It was worth going to find the next day.
other_notes: In this warm year with its scant spring rains, the York Creek vines again reached "Late Picked” levels.  We work closely with our growers to harvest at full flavor, but more moderate ripeness.  For the third consecutive year, York Creek has gone beyond that.  To add structure to the very ripe zinfandel, we have included a major amount of petite sirah.  A third of the wine aged in new and one-year-old air-dried american oak barrels, and the rest in similar, tempered oak.  Chalky tannins behind the rich fruit of this massive wine assure it continuing development.  Enjoy no, it will be at its best over the next five to seven years.

From bottle:  Barrel aged in select French oak cooperage.  This remarkably concentrated 100% varietal Merlot will reward the wine enthusiast with the delightful experience of mountain top fruit.The San Francisco Chronicle (Feb. 24, 2005) -- "Aromas of blackberry, violet, milk chocolate, orange peel and coffee. Juicy and complex on the palate, with blueberry, violet, coffee and milk chocolate. Tobaccoflavor increases with air. Soft but recognizable tannins; medium-long finish."Connoisseurs' Guide to California Wine (March 2005) --92 points out of 100. "... this deep and complete wine combines lots of fancy oak with fruit that has both the succulence of flatland grapes as well as some of the structure that comes from its mountain-top home.  It is rich in creme brulee character and mixes the ripe cherry fruit of Merlot with the brightness of fresh cranberries in a friendly, open set of flavors..."Robert M. Parker Jr./The Wine Advocate (Feb. 28, 2005)-- 90 points out of 100. "... elegant, with wonderfully sweet black cherry fruit intermixed with a hint of mocha, white chocolate and some background sappy wood notes. Its beautiful integration of acidity and tannin make for an elegant, polished and stunning Merlot ...."Pride winemaker Bob Foley's notes -- "... this cuveereveals thoroughly ripe blackberry aromas and flavorswith a seductively rich mid palate. Troncais oakcooperage contributes a balanced oak profilereminiscent of roasted espresso beans."Blackberry and blueberry versus ripe cherry andcranberry versus black cherry ... milk chocolateversus white chocolate versus no chocolate ... coffeeversus mocha versus roasted espresso beans -- onewine, varied descriptions. It's part of the intrigueof tasting wine.

my_notes: Drank with heirloom tomato salad and blue cheese.  Tasted great.

other_notes: From bottle:  Our White Riesling expresses what is best in the grape:  moderately floral aromas that evoke honeysuckle and lemon blossoms, balanced by flinty mineral characteristics and flavors that resemble peach, apricot and pear.  A hint of sweetness was achieved with the addition of muté, the unfermented juice retained from the day of harvest.

From bottle:  Aged “sur lies” in oak barrels for eight months, the 2001 Toasted Head Chardonnay has aromas of apricot and vanilla, flavors of tropical fruit and a slight spiciness, layered with toasty oak notes.  The Toasted Head name comes from the process of charring the barrel heads for caramelized oak tones.

From bottle:  An intriguing hint of ginger, a seductive honeycomb fragrance, silky lemon custard.  Its full body and rich flavors partner well with recipes that use butter, cream or cheese.

From bottle:  We achieve depth of flavor by blending our estate-grown grapes with wines made from the vineyards that produce our Single Vineyard Series.  Luch Satsuma plum and teaberry aromas predominate, followed by cinnamon, clove and balsam fir, with silky rose petal texture and particularly long-lasting flavors.

my_notes: Creamy, velvety apricot and floral finish, perfect with fruit and/or cheesecake
other_notes: Located in the historic appellation of Lodi, long recognized for its grape growing,Viognier grown in this warm climate is a perfect match. The appellation provides the warm weather and perfect hang time to produce extremely ripe and flavorful fruit.

variety: Tawny Port, 51% 1994 Tinta Roriz 28% Tawny, 14% 1995 Zin,  7% 1991 Malvasia Bianca Ports
other_notes: Chocolate and Port are a highly compatible and often romantic combination. Why not combine these flavors in a pleasant dessert wine--and in addition save the calories of the chocolate mousse. An experience unto itself in the world of wine--the almost Madeira quality of the Port is co-mingled in your nose with a luscious milk chocolate. Hints of black cherry, spice, orange zest and vanilla roam on your palate.A blend of fine California Port was assembled which, without any chocolate addition, was wonderful by itself. It consists of 51% 1994 Tinta Roriz from Madera County, Tinta Roriz being one of the classic Portuguese Port varietals, 28% Cucamonga Valley Tawny Port of mixed vintages, 14% 1995Zinfandel Port and 7% 1991 Malvasia Bianca Port, also from the Cucamonga Valley. It should be noted that the Cucamonga Valley has a long history ofpremium wine making with many vineyards being close to 100 years old. In fact, U.S. Bonded Winery #1 was located in Cucamonga. At this point weturned to two natural chocolate essence producers, one in Southern California, and one in Milwaukee, Wisconsin to create a compatible chocolate essence to match the Port. After numerous sessions of tasting and brain storming the final blend was achieved and was stored in 60 gallon French oak barrels for an added 6 months before bottling. This was done to add complexity.

my_notes: The 2001 vintage has provided one of the most explosively rich, highly extracted and intensely perfumed examples of Viognier. Nuances of tropical fruits intertwined with vanilla bean and exotic spices combine to produce our most powerful but elegant Viognier to date.A combination of 70% French and 30% American oak from twelve different cooperages, and the use of nine different yeast selections help to accentuate the wine's natural flavors and aromas.This wine is a perfect accompaniment to many fruits, cheeses, patés, and shellfish
other_notes: This wine is a very exotic and spicy Viognier with tropical overtones of pineapple and mango. The grapes are grown by Fess Parker's "Rodney'sVineyard" on a mesa located just outside Los Olivos in Santa Barbara County. It has been 100% barrel fermented and has undergone malolacticfermentation.Top of the TastingNov 2003Wine Country Living Gold Medal2003 National Orange Show, Pacific Rim Wine Competition90 Points Oct 2002 Beverage Testing Institute World WineChampionshipsSilver Medal2003Tasters Guild International Wine Judging86 PointsJan 2003Wine SpectatorBronze Medal2003West Coast Wine CompetitionBronze Medal 2004 San Francisco Chronicle Wine CompetitionThe Viognier grape produces a wine that is both exotic and seductive. The grape originates from the tiny appellation of Condrieu in the Northern Rhône Valley of France. In the United States, only a handful of vineyards grow Viognier of the same caliber. A few are located in the Central region of Santa Barbara.The intoxicating aromas of honeyed apricot and peach are intertwined with vanilla and spice. The rich flavors echo the aromatics with added layers of creamy tropical fruit.This wine is a perfect accompaniment to many fruits, cheeses, patés and shellfish.

my_notes: The RustRidge vineyard is located in the eastern hills of Napa Valley at about 1000-feet elevation. The hot days and very cool nights produce aChardonnay similar in character to good Carneros wine. The wine has been 100% barrel fermented, and was sur lees with stirring for ten months. Itexhibits a wonderful pear, apple and melon quality with spicy, toasty vanilla elements.
other_notes: Perfectly ripe small berries were harvested cool and whole cluster pressed, settled, and placed into barrels from one of nine different cooperages. Thebarrels were then individually inoculated with one of eleven different yeasts that have been isolated from France (Rhône Valley, Burgundy, Bordeaux, and Champagne regions) and the Hunter Valley of Australia.The wine is cool fermented for three months with the lees getting stirred twice a week. This labor intensive procedure creates the richest and most exotic Chardonnay possible.This incredibly rich wine has aromatics and flavors of ripe apples, pears, cinnamon, honey and a slight mineral component from the terroir of this Lower Chiles Valley vineyard

Grown in one of the oldest grape regions of California, these Syrah vines were planted by Phillip Abba in Lodi's rich soils. By using advanced techniques in trellising and keeping his yields low, the fruit developed an intensity which is very reminiscent of Syrah from the Southern Rhône.This wine exhibits blackberry and wild cherries. Smoked game and white pepper are very intense in both the palate and aromatics, with subtle hints of vanilla and spices complimenting the fruit.Perfect for Bistro style foods that are very robust, such as a well aged cheese and roasted meats.This wine is a great example of Syrah finding another great hot climate home. The extravagant and rich in aromatics and mouth feel, highlighting the black berry and smoked bacon aspects,but also showing a hint of minerality that brings the wine together.

This rich and supple Merlot was grown on a steep hillside located 200 feet above the Russian River just north and east of Guerneville.The warm days and cool foggy nights contribute to a long and slow maturation process. This gives these small berry clusters just the right hang time to produce full flavored intense Merlot with elegance and balance.Serve this wine with grilled pepper steaks, cassoulet, or duck stuffed ravioli.This Merlot is a fine example of the intensity that can be achieved in growing quality Merlot fruit in a cool climate in the Russian River Valley. It has a superb black cherry bouquet with evidence of chocolate cream and dark currants. The flavors are soft ripe Bing cherry with evidence of currant and spice. This wine is eminently drinkable in its current youthful state, but it will cellar well for 10-12 years. For a great combination, serve with grilled duck breast, a marinated Chateaubriand or rosemary lamb chops.

my_notes: Nice smooth velvety.  Worked well with red pasta sauce.
other_notes: These small hillside vineyards sit high above Lake Sonoma in the upper Dry Creek Valley. The unique location and the fact that the vineyards are planted to a rare clone of old vine Zinfandel makes this wine a very special creation.The bouquet of this exotic and extracted wine show ripe black cherry and rich currant with hints of vanilla and black pepper. The flavors are intense-rich blackberries, currant and creamy spice with hints of anise.This rich Dry Creek Zin will nicely accompany roasted game, barbecue, roast beef, rich stews and hearty pasta.The bouquet of this rich, extracted wine shows ripe black cherry and black currant with hints of vanilla and black pepper. The flavors are ripe black cherry, currant and creamy spice with hints of dark chocolate. This rich Dry Creek Zin will nicely accompany hearty pasta and grilled marinated salmon, slow-smoked pork ribs, or Duck ala Orange

my_notes: It stood up to lamb.  Fruity and rich berry
other_notes: Eagle Point Vineyard sits at 1200 feet elevation in the mountains just south and east of Ukiah. The cool Mendocino climate, mountain exposure, and mature vines help produce some of the most luscious and balanced Zinfandel grapes in California.This wine has been produced using a labor intensive small batch hand-punch down fermentation, and has been aged for over 16 months in new French coopered American oak.The wine shows stunning bright blackberry fruit with evident Bing cherries, chocolate and spice.Incredibly intense and aromatic, this wine shows stunning bright blackberry fruit with evident Bing cherries, chocolate and spice.

The cool Mendocino climate, mountain exposure, and mature vines help produce some of the most luscious and balanced Zinfandel grapes in California.This wine has been produced using a labor intensive small batch hand-punch down fermentation, and has been aged for over 16 months in new French coopered American oak.The wine shows stunning bright blackberry fruit with evident Bing cherries, chocolate and spice.Incredibly intense and aromatic, this wine shows stunning bright blackberry fruit with evident Bing cherries, chocolate and spice.

The Yates Ranch, located at 1200 feet on Mt. Veeder in Southern Napa Valley is one of the finest microclimates in the world to grow Cabernet Franc.These 30+ year-old vines have produced ripe grapes with extreme intensity and flavor. Here at Rosenblum Cellars, we have used a very labor-intensive fermentation method to maximize the extraction in the wine.You will find a wonderful, full-bodied, rich and flavorful Cabernet Franc that will pair nicely wine with grilled lamb, chicken Marsala and Moroccan beef.Mt. Veeder is a great place to grow Cabernet Franc and 2002 was a great year. This exotic rich wine shows gobs of blackberry jammy fruit with creamy dark cherries and vanilla. It has an aging potential of 8-12 years.

The Yates Ranch, located at 1200 feet on Mt. Veeder in Southern Napa Valley is one of the finest microclimates in the world to grow Cabernet Franc.These 30+ year-old vines have produced ripe grapes with extreme intensity and flavor. Here at Rosenblum Cellars, we have used a very labor-intensive fermentation method to maximize the extraction in the wine.You will find a wonderful, full-bodied, rich and flavorful Cabernet Franc that will pair nicely wine with grilled lamb, chicken Marsala and Moroccan beef.Mt. Veeder is a great place to grow Cabernet Franc and 2002 was a great year. This exotic rich wine shows gobs of blackberry jammy fruit with creamy dark cherries and vanilla. It has an aging potential of 8-12 years.

vineyard: This lovely Amador County wine is a blend of two Zinfandel vineyards and one Petite Sirah vineyard. Aparicio Vineyard (70%) Rios Vineyard (20%)Van Reuter Vineyard, Lodi (10%)See Notes for more detail.
my_notes: Good deal.  I like it.  Retains bouquet after being opened a few days.  Good everyday wine.
other_notes: Chateau La Paws prides itself in creating wines that are full of character, eager to please and exhibit a great sense of adventure. Our veterinarian turned winemaker makes the Chateau La Paws wines so that they are easy to drink and affordable. Fetch a favorite meal, chase down a good friend and retrieve the cork from this doggone good wine. One of our great regional Zinfandels, the fruit for this wine comes from the Sierra foothills. Pair it with garlic marinated butterflied leg of lamb, stuffed poblano chile rellenos, or a Margarita pizza baked in a wood fired oven.  Paws to enjoy the experience.This beautiful foothill wine exhibits extraction, balanced fruit and a lovely finish. The bouquet shows dark black cherry jam with elements of violets and black pepper. The full rich flavors are of black cherry, rich ripe currants and elements of chocolate. Serve this wine with grilled butterflied leg of lamb marinated in crushed garlic and olive oil, or fresh from the garden eggplant Parmigiana with a fresh tomato sauce.This lovely Amador County wine is a blend of two Zinfandel vineyards and one Petite Sirah vineyard. Aparicio Vineyard (70%): These are 14 year old vines planted on a steep hillside on an 8 x 10 trellis system. The soil is a loamy shale and the climate is hot during the day and cool in the evenings with cold air from the Sierra Nevada bathing the vines. Rios Vineyard (20%): This is a 7 year old vineyard planted to an ancient Amador clone. 6 x 8 spacing with a vertical trellis system, it contains 6% Barbera.The soil is alluvial loam and gravel. Van Reuter Vineyard, Lodi (10%): 70-year old head trained Petite Sirah with alluvial loam and blue clay. Yields are 2 * tons per acre in this warm climate.

The grapes for this world-class Reserve Zinfandel were hand harvested in October 2002 from a hillside block of the Hendry Ranch located in Southern Napa Valley.The wine was produced using a special small batch fermentation technique with extended skin maceration. We have taken the best lots of this wine and designated it as Reserve. It has been aged primarily in French oak 60-gallon barrels for almost 24 months.The wine exhibits rich currants and blackberry scents in the bouquet, with ripe flavors of black cherry, boysenberry, and hints of pepper, spice and chocolate.This wine is from one of the premium hillside Napa Valley vineyards, and is aged in French and American oak. The ’02 exhibits rich currants and blackberry scents in the bouquet, with ripe flavors of black cherry, boysenberry and hints of pepper, spice and chocolate

This fine 2001 wine is a blend of 86% Zinfandel, 12% Petite Sirah and 2% Carignane, all grown in Richard and Annette Rhodes' vineyard located in the beautiful Redwood Valley area of Mendocino County. The 44 year old head pruned vines, along with the special oak barrels and extended aging are the basis of our Annette's Reserve.The wine shows a rich bouquet of ripe black currants, Asian spices and chocolate with flavors of dark currants, fat blueberries and hints of licorice and pepper.This beautiful wine comes from Annette and Richard Rhodes’ estate in Redwood Valley. A blend of 84% Zinfandel, 14% Carignane, and 2% Petite Sirah from the same ranch. This wine is a scholarly Zinfandel -- a Rhodes scholar, with deep red color and an exotic bouquet of blackberries, vanilla and mulled spice with evidence of rose petal. The flavors are rich black cherry with hints of chocolate, black olives and exotic spice

Hand picked at the peak of ripeness and aged in French oak for 20 months, this extremely dnese and complex red wine displays hints of black cherry, pepper and spice on the palate.

purchased_from: Gift from Jim to Alan for BD 2004
other_notes: From bottle:  Winemaker Ed Sbragia hand-selected the grapes for the 1997 Beringer Private Reserve Merlot from our Bancroft Ranch vineyard on Howell Mountain in Napa Valley.  He aged the wine for twenty-one months in new French Nevers oak barrels to create a highly complex Merlot, with layers of intense mountain fruit flavors.

From bottle:  Our White Burgundy pays homage to the great white varietals of Burgundy, two of which - Chardonnay and Pinot Noir - are the foundation of this blend.  Together with a small amount of Pinot Meunier for added depth, they produce a luscious textured wine with layers of apple, pear, tropical fruit and browned butter.

variety: North Coast Red Wine - Wow Red
other_notes: This vintage blend of French and Italian varietals brings together the lushness of Malbec, the intensity of Petit Verdot and the well-integrated tannins of Syrah.  Lagrein and Petite Sirah.  Rich blueberry notes, spicy earthiness and toasty oak define this age-worthy, well-structured wine.  The result is wow.

Carved out of a virtual rock quarry, Sunny Slope Vineyard was planted in holes pick-axed out of fractured stone.  The deep roots, a result of maturity and years of laboring for water, combine with the warm southwest exposure to produce a thick-skinned Cabaret Sauvignon with the concentrated berry and bramble flavors, inky color and extracted tannins that distinguish this vineyard and wine.

From bottle:  This richly colored Zinfandel was produced from family owned Bacchi Vineyards located int he northeastern part of the Russian River Valley.  This is a true old vine Zinfandel, hand harvested at the peak of ripeness, loaded with ripe fruit aromas, jammy blackberry flavors with a hint of smoke, toast and mint.  Created exclusively for our winery visitors.

From bottle:  This Clayton Petite Sirah Vineyard is located just East of Lodi California.  These vines were planted in our deep Hanford Loam soil.  We head prune and dry farm these vines in order to produce a delicious, rich fruit with full tanning (sic).

From bottle:  Quivira’s Dry Creek Zinfandel represents the finest that the Dry Creek Valley has to offer, viticulturally speaking.  A complex gem with many facets, bold yet elegant, profound yet approachable, our Zinfandel is made by real people in  real place.

From bottle:  Aged “sur lies” in oak barrels for eight months, the 2003 Toasted Head Chardonnay has aromas of apricot and vanilla, flavors of tropical fruit and a slight spiciness, layered with toasty oak notes.  The Toasted Head name comes form the process of charring the barrel heads for carmelized oak tones.

The Toasted Head name comes form the process of charring the barrel heads for carmelized oak tones.

my_notes: drinks well now and promises subtlety and complexity for the future.
other_notes: Our view from the top of Spring Mountain is breathtaking.  Above the summer fog, the growing season is cool and long.  Steep, rocky  terraces help forge this rich, full-bodied Merlot.  Layered with youthfully intense berry and fruit flavors with a nuance of chocolate, this estate wine drinks well now and promises subtlety and complexity for the future.

Our majestic rolling mountaintop provides a mosaic of volcanic soils which breed intense character into our wines.  Small cuvees are individually vinified and hand crafted to an elegant balance.  The most expressive lots are selected for the reserve blends which are aged an additional year.  Our reserve Cabernet Sauvignon was blended with 2% Petit Verdot for complexity and finish.

Our majestic rolling mountaintop provides a mosaic of volcanic soils which breed intense character into our wines.  Small cuvees are individually vinified and hand crafted to an elegant balance.  The most expressive lots are selected for the reserve blends which are aged an additional year.  Our reserve Cabernet Sauvignon was blended with 2% Petit Verdot for complexity and finish.

my_notes: From web site: Garys’ Pinot Noir shows a deep black-red hue. The nose shows notes of spicy cherry and black cherry, with cassis and raspberry notes that continue on the palate. The wine shows balanced tension between fruit and acidity, and finely ripe tannins with mineral notes. While featuring the ripe Santa Lucia Highlands fruit as the focal point of the wine, one notes all the components of taste and texture in a long and focused finish.
other_notes: A great wine.  Fruity bouquet - cherry.  Did not hold up on second day.

my_notes: This was really good with Chicken  Piccatta.  Especially considering the price, it held up well.

vineyard: Napa Ranches - Biale Vineyard and other premier sites in Napa Valley
other_notes: From bottle;  This wine is our blend of Zinfandel and  Petite Sirah.

From the bottle:  The Monga Zin is named both for its immense (humongous) mouthful of flavors and for its southern Califonria region of origin, Cucamonga Valley, home to many of California’s oldest Zinfandel vineyards. Drawn from dry-farmed vines planted in 1918 in the Jose Lopez Vineyard, the fruit is like rich berry jam, with a creamy milk chocolate finish.

From the bottle:  The Wild Thing derives its name from the use of a"wild yeast" fermentation, using only the native yeasts of both vineyard and winery.  This gives the wine a more fully integrated mouthfeel and more completely in aroma than wines made by selected yeast culture additions.  The vines in the Cox Vineyard, north of Ukiah in Mendocino County, were grown on gentle hills of rocky soils, which yielded a wine of deep raspberry fruit and vibrant black pepper spice.

my_notes: Very crisp and clean.  It went well with Steamed Mussels, probably would go well with other shellfish.  Good bargain
other_notes: From the bottle:  A nearly perfect example of what a Sauvignon Blanc should smell and taste like.  Good fruit, slightly grassy with mild herbaceousness.  Ready to drink now slightly chilled.  Try with grilled or chilled prawns, oysters, clams or almost any seafood dish or just for sipping pleasure.

Full ruby-red. Explosive, perfumed aromas of black raspberry, cassis, minerals, and chocolatey oak. Fat, supple and aromatic in the mouth, with flavors of plum, black cherry and chocolately torrefaction. Lush, and deep, with impressive body and personality for American merlot. Finishes very ripe and long, with sweet, fine-grained tannins. Promises to be the best merlot to date from this elite producer.  Score: 91-93 barrel sample

Full ruby-red. Explosive, perfumed aromas of black raspberry, cassis, minerals, and chocolatey oak. Finishes very ripe and long, with sweet, fine-grained tannins. Promises to be the best merlot to date from this elite producer.  Score: 91-93 barrel sample

This wine presents a delicate balance of power versus finesse showcasing nuances of lilac, sweet dark fruits, smoke, and Asian spices. We worked very hard to make this wine rival or surpass our 2001 Cabernet. By rigorously applying the finest viticultural practices to the vineyard, meticulously selecting the best fruit, and integrating these ingredients with gentle fruit handling we arrived at this classic, age worthy wine.

my_notes: Great buttery yet crisp wine.  Went really well with the Sashimi of Avocado with Lime and Almond Oil, and then it went well with the Marsala Chicken.

other_notes: From bottle:  Here, in sandy loam soil, laced with ribbons of gravel, the grapes develop pure citrus and ripe characater.  In the winerey we enrich the crisp melon fruit with barrel fermentation.

my_notes: We had the 1990 Dom Perignon at Michael Mina and it was wonderful.  Per Jim this compares well with the 1990
other_notes: 1996 was a year of contrasts, with an unpredictable damp early summer.  But the unusually hot month preceding the harvest led to a vintage of exceptional maturity, with a notable balance of power and acidity.  Pale yellow with golden highlights, Dom Pérignon Vintage 1996 embodies luminosity.  Subtle and spicy aromas are exhaled in succession:  white peaches, candied lemon, vanilla, praline and white pepper.  On the palate, it reveals a wonderful paradox, a rivalry between movement and warm concentration.  The structure is affirmed, taut.  The energy, contained for a few fleeting instants, suddenly explodes, leaving a decisive impression of extraordinary richness.

Wine Enthusiast Review: 94 POINTS:Extraordinarily fine for its smoothness and finesse, and the way the wine glides over the palate with a yeasty creaminess that turns smoky and spicy on the finish. The dosage stands out, yet this bubbly is also very acidic now. It should age well for at least 10 years.

my_notes: I think that I prefer the regular Toasted Head (the 9.99 guy)
other_notes: From bottle:  Russian River Valley is known for producing world-class Chardonnay.  The foggy, cool mornings and warm afternoons allow for a long ripening period, with extended hang time on the vine.  the result is wine with depth and character.   The 2003 Toasted Head Russian River Chardonnay has apple and citrus blossom aromas.  The mouth feel is very rich, with apple, pear and citrus zest.  Light oak flavors are integrated with delicate vanilla and caramel notes, leading to a long finish of spiced pears.

From bottle:  Our oldest vineyard was planted to Zinfandel by our great grandfather, Edoardo.  In 1895 near the family home.  By our standards, a vine must be a minimum of 50 years in age to be called “old vine.”  These low yielding, head-trained vines produce a very small amount of exceptionally rich and concentrated fruit.  This wine is a blend of our best old vine lots.  After fermentation, the wine is barrel aged for 12 months in American and French oak.

From bottle:  Winemaker Edward Sbragia created this wine from carefully selected Chardonnay grapes grown in Beringer’s Napa Valley vineyards.  Traditional French sur lie aging and malolactic fermentation produced a full-bodied wine with the rich aromas and flavors of creamy butter, citrus-tinged apples and toasted almonds.

From bottle:  Winemaker Edward Sbragia produced this Private Reserve Chardonnay from grapes gorwn in our Napa Valley vineyards.  It is a rich, full-bodied Chardonnay with lush varietal flavor, perfectly balanced by vanillin oak nuances.

my_notes: Big fruity nose.  Alan can taste the French oak.  He wants to call it Freedom oak.
other_notes: From bottle:  Mark West Winery specializes in Pinot Noir. Our Pinot Noir from Napa Valley-Carneros lies in this historic appelation near the San Francisco Bay with its cooling morning and afternoon fog.  the grapes for this wine were carefully sorted and then whole cluster fermented in open top tanks where the cap was repetedly punched down.  After being gently pressed, the wine was then aged in predominantly French oak for approximately 12 to 18 months.  Rich in texture with a lingering finish and versatile enough to complement just about any cuisine.

my_notes: Very crisp and clean.  It went well with Steamed Mussels, probably would go well with other shellfish.  Good bargain
other_notes: From the bottle:  A nearly perfect example of what a Sauvignon Blanc should smell and taste like.  Good fruit, slightly grassy with mild herbaceousness.  Ready to drink now slightly chilled.  Try with grilled or chilled prawns, oysters, clams or almost any seafood dish or just for sipping pleasure.

my_notes: It is being used for a short ribs recipe.  The wine is ok for $2 but it doesn’t have any character to distinguish it as a Cabernet.

other_notes: Grenache, Mour Védre, and Syrah have been carefully blended to produce this fragrant, full-bodied wine. 165 cases produced. Medium ruby. Explosive, fragrant aromas of red fruits - cherry, strawberry, and pomegranate with earthier, spicy notes lurking in the background. On the palate, quite rich and full-bodied. Not as elegant as the 2001 but surprisingly much more harmonious and complete with no rough edges. A real step up from the 2001. Drink from release through 2007. (MRO - 11/3/04)

Well drained soils intensify the color and aromatic character of this Rhone Varietal.  Extremely concentrated, spicy grapy and as dense as ink, the ripeness of this Syrah makes it look like blackberry pancake syrup.  Massive extract tattoos the tongue with red cherry and blackberry flavors and fine tannins that linger in the finish.  Neutral oak was favored for aging this 100% varietal mountain-grown Syrah.

Rich in mouth-feel, yet balanced with bright acidity, this 100% Viognier expresses our mountain terroir with fresh flavors of white stone-fruits and enticing aromas of citrus blossom and gardenias.  Exclusively neutral barrels were used for fermenting and gaing to maintain the focus on the beautifully articulate mountain-grown Viognier fruit.  A delicious spiciness lolls on the tongue in a long, lingering and unforgettable finish.

my_notes: It was really great at the winery.  Darryl said "This is what Merlots should taste like.”
other_notes: Built more like a Cabernet Sauvignon than a Merlot, this powerhouse vintage of 100% Merlot is as firm and extracted as can be, with an amazing concentration of color, ripe black fruit flavors and aromas. Currant and cassis, cocoa and espresso bean elements are jam-packed into this gentle giant, coating the entire palate with soft chewy tannins that melt away in a two-minute long finish.

Low crop levels in the 2003 vintage were disappointing, but served to intensify the already delightful character of our Cabernet Franc. Blended with 25% Merlot, this remarkable wine is virtually opaque in its deep ruby hue. Aromas and flavors of boysenberry, red currant and fresh sage gush from its rich and explosive mid-palate, followed by ripe blueberry, espresso and deep chocolate flavors in the finish.

From the May 15, 2005 issue of the Wine Spectator:RATED 90 POINTS!“2003 Siduri Arbre Vert Vineyard Pinot Noir – A wine of restraint, smooth and open-textured, with beautifully focused and fresh cherry, raspberry and cinnamon spice flavors that remain soft through the fine finish.  Drink now through 2013.  123 cases made.”From the March 2005 Siduri newsletter:  We are pleased to introduce our first single-vineyard Pinot Noir from Oregon. The 2003 vintage in Oregon was certainly abnormal in that it was hotter and drier there than it was in California. It seems that the vines that dealt best with this type of heat were the older vines (withdeeper roots) and the older clones (that usually ripen later). The Arbre Vert Vineyard is exactly this type of vineyard as it is 19 years old and planted primarily to an old Charles Coury Pommard selection.The 2003 Siduri Arbre Vert Pinot Noir shows enough forward fruit to appeal to California Pinot Noir fans(especially when paired with food) but enough backbone and restraint to those of you who prefer a moreBurgundian style wine. It shows blackberry, currant, and pepper flavors and a rich medium body. The finish reveals a bit more of the acidity typical of Oregon along with a few tannins that promise positive evolution if cellared for the next several years.

From the May 15, 2005 issue of the Wine Spectator:RATED 90 POINTS!“2003 Siduri Arbre Vert Vineyard Pinot Noir – A wine of restraint, smooth and open-textured, with beautifully focused and fresh cherry, raspberry and cinnamon spice flavors that remain soft through the fine finish.  Drink now through 2013.  123 cases made.”

From the March 2005 Siduri newsletter:  The 2003 Siduri Santa Rita Hills Pinot Noir is a blend of wine from the Cargasacchi and Clos Pepe Vineyards. These barrels were especially selected for the blend in a blind tasting with the hope of producing a wine that represents the style of the region. We succeeded in this beyond our wildest expectations as the wine was one of the hits at this year’s Russian River Barrel Tasting.The 2003 Santa Rita Hills Pinot Noir is a big, rich wine. Upon opening it is impressively concentrated but still a bit tight. However, within an hour the wine begins to blossom revealing loads of dark blackberry and plum flavors. It also shows an underlying minerality (almost a coal-like character) along with superb levels of natural acidity. This is truly an impressive Pinot Noir of vineyard-designate like quality.

From the March 2005 Siduri newsletter:  For a wine produced in tiny quantities (you could combine the 01,02, and 03 vintages and have less than the 350 cases), our Carlisle Zinfandel has created quite a stir. Undoubtedly some of it comes from the great success of Mike and Kendall Officer and their Carlisle Winery. Another large part of this wine’s success is the vineyard itself—a remarkable old-vine Zinfandel vineyard dating back to 1927. And, of course, another large part of the success stems from customers like yourselveswho have embraced our foray into the world of Zinfandel.The 2003 Novy Carlisle Zinfandel is as good, if not better, than our 2001 offering and certainly a step-upfrom the 2002 wine. It is still slightly tight on the nose but on the palate the wine explodes with big, ripe red fruit flavors (but not pruny) but also some complex earthy and black truffle character. On the finish the wine shows the good levels of acidity that are reflective of its Russian River location along with hintsof vanilla from the oak. A wonderful Zin, it is one of our most exciting wines of the year.

vineyard: 55% Garys’ Vineyard Syrah and 45% Rosella’s Vineyard Syrah.
other_notes: Wine Advocate 90 pts.  From the March 2005 Siduri Newsletter:  2003 Novy Santa Lucia Highlands Syrah– The Novy Santa Lucia Highlands Syrah has probably been our most consistent Syrah over the past few years. This despite the fact (or maybe because) the wine is a blend of two great vineyards, the Rosella’s and Garys’ Vineyards. Each year these two vineyards produce some of our most distinctively flavored Syrahs. The cooler climate location combined with impeccable grape growing produce wines with immense flavor concentration and a unique, white pepper and grapefruit character that truly make them special.The 2003 Novy Santa Lucia Highlands Syrah is a blend of 55% Garys’ Vineyard Syrah and 45% Rosella’s Vineyard Syrah. It shows a more creamy character in the mid-palate than previous versions of this wine and also a bigger concentration of flavors. However, the pepper and grapefruit character remain (and actually blossom with some aeration). This wine makes a superb pairing with more earthy, gamy foods such as lamb and venison.

From the March 2005 Siduri Newsletter:  The PaperaRanch is yet another Russian River Zinfandel Vineyard made famous by DeLoach Winery. It was planted in 1934 (a young pup compared to the Carlisle) and produced one of our most forward and hedonistic wines in 2003. Unfortunately, only 2 barrels were produced so there isn’t much to go around.The 2003 Novy Papera Zin is more aromatic than the Carlisle. It shows an incredible perfume of vanilla, spice, strawberries and cherries that literally leap out of the glass. In the mouth the wine shows a creamy, velvet-like texture and a long lush finish. This is one hedonistic glass of Zin!Case production:  45 cases

Wine Advocate 90 pts.  We will begin by acknowledging that this wine is not for everyone.If you prefer a well-balanced, higher acid, lower alcohol, more European style wine then you don’t need to read any further. However, if you like a wine with incredible richness, gobs of fruit, and a mouthful of flavor as well as a healthy dose of alcohol then you will love this wine.So how did this wine come into being? It originated in a small vineyard owned by Joe and Gail Judge in  the rocky hills of Bennett Valley. The Judges thinned the vines by hand reducing the normally prolific Grenache to a tiny yield. After harvest, the grapes were fully destemmed, allowed a 5 day cold soak, and then fermented using, appropriately, Grenache yeast. The wine was pressed directly to barrel and aged, without racking for 14 months. Ultimately, half of the barrels made the cut for the single-vineyard wine.We absolutely adore the 2003 Novy Grenache. It is unashamedly over the top. With a combination of fruit and concentration that you just can’t ignore this is a perfect wine for drinking by itself and also with backyard barbecues. It probably won’t make “old bones” (we’ll drink our share before the start of 2006) but it is a blast to drink right now.

appellation: Sonoma, Bennett Valley, Dry Creek Valley, Russian River
other_notes: The Sonoma County Syrah has long been one of our most popularSyrahs. Certainly the wine represents one of the best bargains in the Novy portfolio. In 2003 the wine represents a blend of Syrah grapes grown in the Bennett Valley Appellation (at the Judge Family Vineyard), the Dry Creek Valley (at the Simpson and Unti Vineyards) and in the Russian River (at the Chris-tensenFamily Vineyard). The 2003 Novy Sonoma County Syrah differs from its predecessors in that it is a bigger wine than previous vintages. With dark fruits and a rich, full body along with good tannins this is a wine that should improve with several years of bottle age.

From bottle:  Indian Wells Charodnnay features fruit form Washington state’s Wahluke Slope region.  Our ,ost northern growing area, the wahluke Slope is bordered on both the west and south by the Columbia River.  This unique site is often one of the warmest in the Columbia Valley, and benefits from the cooling effects of the river.  The result is a luscious, full-bodied wine with fresh pineapple and ripe apple flavors and a round, rich finish.
Lindemans Bin 45 Cabernet Sauvignon is a smooth, full flavoured wine that can be enjoyed with red meat dishes or cheese.
From bottle:  Tropical fruits, orange blossom, and gentle oak spice are keynotes of this supple, elegant Chardonnay.  It pairs beautifully with poultry, seafood and light cheeses.
From bottle:  Tropical fruits, orange blossom, and gentle oak spice are keynotes of this supple, elegant Chardonnay.  It pairs beautifully with poultry, seafood and light cheeses.

Sacramento Magazine:  Gary Farrell has been producing wines in the Russian River area of Sonoma County for 30 years—and he’s darned good at it. Gary Farrell 2003 Pinot Noir Russian River Selection ($32) is his workhouse wine, made with a blend of fruit from some of his best vineyards. It has a cherry/berry nose, medium tannins and full flavors, with strawberry and smoky overtones. This wine is a good example of how nice these Pinots can be.

From Terranova wines: Brilliant, deep garnet-ruby color, revealing aromas of black cherry, fresh plum, mineral and hard spices. The most powerful Morgan Pinot Noir to date, while maintaining a rich, elegant, texture that is supported by dense fruit and ripe tannins. New World fruit with the expression of terroir, structure and elegance more often found in Old World wines

From bottle:  The 2003 Toasted Head Russian River Chardonnay has apple and citrus blossom aromas.  The mouth feel is very rich, with apple, pear and citrus zest.  Light oak flavors are integrated with dleicate vanilla and caramel notes, leading to a long finish of spiced pears.

From bottle:  This elegant Pinot Noir displays an array of ripe plum and fig fruit characteristics and subtle floral notes.  Oak ageing in French and American barrels adds complexity and a hint of spice.  Enjoy with roasted meats, lightly spiced Asian cuisine and risottos. Store site:Medium bodied with clean fruit and a long finish. C&B website: Due to a long warm summer season,both the Napa and Russian River lots were harvested very ripe;in Monterey County,things moved a little more slowly,so the fruit from these vineyards produced more manageable alcohols and flavors that complimented the North Coast fruit very well.The largest portion of the blend (79%)from the Greenfield/Soledad areas of Monterey County displayed lots of the true Pinot character:violet,rose petal,cherry &plum fruit with earthly mocha/herbal ntoes.The remainder of the blend (11%Napa Valley and 10%Russian River)were surprisingly brawny,with wonderful baked black cherry and fig fruit,mineral and licorice flavors bolstering it.And as usual,the Russian River segments were stars,adding refinement in the form of bright,juicy fruit and exotic hints of baking spices and its unique earthiness.While only 21%of the Monterey County elements saw Oak,100 %of the Napa Valley,and Russian River portions spent an average of five months in 75%American and 25%French Oak.

Rich in texture with a lingering finish and versatile enough to complement just about any cuisine.
Intense, dark and rich

This wine is crafted in the classic French Sancerre style, with crisp citrus flavors and a deep sense of minerality.  Its quintessential varietal character has made it a benchmark Sauvignon Blanc in California.

From bottle:  Aged “sur lies” in oak barrels for eight months, the 2003 Toasted Head Chardonnay has aromas of apricot and vanilla, flavors of tropical fruit and a slight spiciness, layered with toasty oak notes.  The Toasted Head name comes form the process of charring the barrel heads for carmelized oak tones.

my_notes: Per Alan - have with Chicken Piccata
other_notes: From bottle:  Banfi Chianti Classico is a rich ruby red wine made from (Tuscany’s) famous  Sangiovese grapes.  Fresh and well-balanced with pleasing aromas of cherries and plums, Banfi Chianti Classico is a perfect match to hearty stews, grilled meats and red sauced pasta dishes.

my_notes: Per Alan - have with Chicken Piccata.  It worked well with the Chicken Piccata
other_notes: From bottle:  Ruby red in color, with ripe cherry flavors and a touch of spice, this wine is ideal with white or red meat, marinated or spicy dishes, as well as creamy and medium sharp cheeses.

my_notes: Will benefit from a few hours of being upright before being served.
other_notes: Our 2004 Brosseau Chardonnary is a full bodied mineral laden wine with layers of texture offering notes of wet stone, burnt almond, poached pear and citrus that seamlessly integrate for a long and lingering finish.  With zippy acidity this ia a vibrant and pure expression of California Charodnnay and should drink well for at least the next 3 - 5 years.

my_notes: Our wine is unfiltered and unrefined and will drop sediment so we recommend either pouring from a horizontal bottle position or allowing the wine to stand upright for 24 hours prior to serving.  You should drink in whatever position is most comfortable!
other_notes: Our 2004 presents an intoxicating nose of herbs (thyme with a hint of basil) and spice mixed with meaty aromas interlaced with ripe red fruit.  Soft and sweet tannins combined with a awell balanced acidity make this wine a wonderfully pure expression of Syrah’s potential for finesse and elegance.

my_notes: Our wine is unfiltered and unrefined and will drop sediment so we recommend either pouring from a horizontal bottle position or allowing the wine to stand upright for 24 hours prior to serving.  You should drink in whatever position is most comfortable!
other_notes: This inky, ruby-purple Syrah is by far our boldest effort and exudes spicy aromas intertweined with meaty components and ripe dark fruit laced with a hint of caramel.  A full bodied wine with sweet, round tannins; this is a Syrah to cuddle up with on a cold winter’s night.

Llama Farm is a take no prisoners, in your face, full throttle, pedal to the metal, monster Pinot Noir.

I think that for many of you that prefer Pinots with a bit more elegance and not as much searing fruit, this will be your favorite of our wines.  It has that quintessential Sonoma Coast nose and sophisticated attitude.  But it’s also a tad bit different than other traditional Sonoma Coast Pinots in that it has some really deep, dark fruit flavors.  We weren’t sure initially about this wine in barrel because it was so tannic, but it blossomed into a very silky wine.

Our first ever Keefer Ranch wine...and boy howdy are we happy about hooking up with Marcy!  We’ve been HUGE fans of the Pinots made from this vineyard by Siduri, Failla, and Red Cat.  We’re happy to announce that we think that our 2004 fits in nicely wit that Tradition of Tastiness.  It’s probably most like the Siduri versions you might have tried.  Big, juicy, and a lot of fun.

This is the best Brosseau Vineyard Pinot we’ve made.  AS with teh 2003, it shows that interesting minerality, along with the pretty fruit profile that comes fro the 25 year old David Bruce clone we started getting in 2003. All of you Brosseau fans will really like this wine.

This wine screams GARYS’!! It’s got the typical sweet fruit profile and Christmas spice that makes Garys’ Vineyard so identifiable.  I know it’s almost boring since it’s become so routine, but this is yet another tasty Pinot from the Masters of the Santa Lucia Highlands.

The 2004 Rosella’s is slightly different than our previous model years.  We got some 777 and Pisoni clones, in addition to the 667 we’d gotten in the past.  I can hear everyone saying...”so what the heck does that mean?”   Well, the wine is more plushg and round.  Imagine adding a few ounces of ROAR Rosella’s and a touch of August West Rosella’s to the previous vintages of Loring, and you have an idea of what I mean.  If you can’t accomplish that mix in your mind...then trust me when I say it’s a good thing.

From bottle:  An easign drinking Merlot that tastes like red berry and chocolate with a touch of smoke from toasted barrels.  Excellent with red sauced pastas, lasagna or hamburgers fresh off the grill.
From bottle:  Good fruit, slightly grassy with mild herbaceousness.  Try with grilled or chilled prawns, oysters, clams or almost any seafood dish or just for sipping pleasure.
This is a new vineyard for Siduri located south of Santa Rosa, near Cotati; rich and ripe with lots of red cherry and spice.
This is a new vineyard for Siduri located south of Santa Rosa, near Cotati; rich and ripe with lots of red cherry and spice.

Medium-dark ruby in color. Effusive, hi-toned aromas of raspberries and cocoa powder with a slight note of buttered popcorn. Yum! On the palate, pure raspberry fruit. Full-bodied but with excellent acidity to ensure many years of development in the bottle. Truly speaks of Russian River Valley and its cool climate origin. Peak enjoyment for this wine should be from late 2006 through 2012. (MRO - 8/7/05)

Medium-dark ruby. An absolutely gorgeous nose of blackberries, fresh cream, earth, and tar. Something wild about it. Damn it smells delicious! On the palate, full bodied yet very harmonious with plenty of wild blackberry fruit. Not as bright and zinberry-ish as our other zins but darker, blacker, more mysterious, perhaps from the abundant inter-planted alicante and grand noir. A lick of tannin on the finish suggests this wine will age nicely. Drink from late-2006 through 2012. (MRO - 8/7/05)

Dark purple. Captivating aromas of blackberry, blueberry, smoked meats, and mocha. Even a hint of new saddle leather. A great sniff! In the mouth, rich and full-bodied, with plenty of blackberry fruit through the lasting finish. Imminently drinkable now but best between mid 2006 and 2009. (MRO - 8/7/05)

Not only do you taste the usual big, bright cherries, but also multifaceted aromas of   wet stones and fresh flowers. The wine has a clean, polished feel to it. There is also a hint of sweet fruit that gives the wine a very monstrous presence, and tannins give it structure and a long , lingering finish. This wine has been drinking beautifully since the day we pressed it, and should continue to drink well over the next 5 years.

Flavors of cherry Jolly Ranchers, violets, and cigar box. The wine is quite full bodied , but with a strong backbone of acidity.  This wine should be an ideal candidate for the cellar.

vineyard: Sapphire Hill, Olivet, Ewald, Keefer Ranch, Amber Ridge
other_notes: Combining the complexity of vineyards like Sapphire Hill and Ewald and the big, rich flavors of Keefer Ranch, Olivet Grange and Amber Ridge, we ended up with a very textured wine.  A blend of 38% Keefer Ranch fruit, 24% Sapphire Hill, 22% Olivet Grange, 11% Ewald, and 5% Amber Ridge, it screams Russian River with its flavors of dark cherry, tobacco, roses, lilac and vanilla. Although this wine is drinking well young, we believe that it will improve for a few years in the bottle.

variety: Sangiovese, 60% Sangiovese, 20% Cabernet Sauvignon, 15% Merlot, 5% Syrah
my_notes: At first, burst of tannins, later a smooth red wine.

other_notes: Drawing on the tradition and classic techniques of the Mosel’s Dr. Loosen and Chateau Ste. Michelle’s viticultural experience and innovation, our combined winemaking efforts crafted a wine that’s focused and intense, a highly aromatic Riesling.
From bottle:  a classic Zin, crammed with inky blackberry fruit flavors, plenty of black pepper spice, and topped off with a whiff of fragrant, blueberry jam.

my_notes: Give it a good hour or two in the glass.  Had the 2003 at Jim and Linda’s on Superbowl day.  Cherry flavors,  Great!
other_notes: Pinot Report:  Score 94  Deep ruby purple color, subtle plum and earthy aromas; rich and full with earthy, cherry and plum flavors; slight tannins, sweet oak, spice and pepper; good structure and balance, long finish.  Stylish and incredibly well balanced, this Pinot is destined for pairing with a hearty beef braise.  600 cases

Pinot Report:  Score 95.  Deep ruby purple color; deep, earthy aromnas of cassis, plum and pepper; rich and deep, with opulent flavors of cassis and plum; earthy and peppery notes are there as are moderate tannins and toasty oak; great structure and balance; long finish.  Opulent, deep and mouth -watering, this Clos Pepe bottling has much development ahead of it, but it sure is nice to drink right now!

my_notes: Give it a good hour or two in the glass
other_notes: Pinot Report:  Score 97.  Deep ruby purple color; deep, slightly closed aromas with hints of pepper and cassis; big, bold flavors of black cherry and cassis, deep layers of pepper and spice notes; moderate tannin; smoky oak; great structure and balance; very long finish.  Amazing depth and complex flavors mark this Pinot from a great vineyard and a great winemaker.  Contrary to what Brian Loring always says about his wines, this one will definitely reward some time in the cellar.  If you can’t wait, make sure you give it (and all of his wines) a good hour or two in the glass.

The 2004 Rosella's Vineyard Syrah is Augsut West's first release of this Rhone variety.  Its shy nose at first opens up with decanting to reveal a full spectrum of peppery and berry spiciness.  Although the tannins are quite firm now, we predict they will soften with a few years of patient cellaring.

my_notes: Brought to Manresa for Paul’s birthday.  Was fabulous with the dishes they served.  Alan and Laureen’s favorite wine of the evening.
other_notes: Has the characteristic Santa Lucia Highlands spicy fruitiness in the nose, followed by a soft and lush mouthfeel.  As with most Rosella's Pinots, it will be hard to resist upon release, but should develop well over the next two years.

From bottle:  The Sauvignon Blanc displays natural varietal flavors of spice and melon with a richness resulting from partial barrel fermentation.  A touch of Semillon adds a layer of mouth-filling fruit.

From bottle:  This superbly versatile St Supery Sauvignon Blanc from Napa Valley vineyards shows exciting varietal intensity of fresh green lime and grapefruit aromas, refreshing citrus and crisp acidity on the palate with an attractive lingering finish.

Wine Enthusiast Review: 94 POINTS:Extraordinarily fine for its smoothness and finesse, and the way the wine glides over the palate with a yeasty creaminess that turns smoky and spicy on the finish. The dosage stands out, yet this bubbly is also very acidic now. It should age well for at least 10 years.

From bottle:  Aged “sur lies” in oak barrels for eight months, the 2003 Toasted Head Chardonnay has aromas of apricot and vanilla, flavors of tropical fruit and a slight spiciness, layered with toasty oak notes.  The Toasted Head name comes form the process of charring the barrel heads for carmelized oak tones.

my_notes: It’s very fruity and sweeter than our usual, but great for a nice warm evening.
other_notes: Drawing on the tradition and classic techniques of the Mosel’s Dr. Loosen and Chateau Ste. Michelle’s viticultural experience and innovation, our combined winemaking efforts crafted a wine that’s focused and intense, a highly aromatic Riesling.

my_notes: This was so silky and smooth on Dec.23.  What a fabulous wine!  We had it with Ahi Longhi (the tuna marinated in olive oil, garlic & basil).  Fabulous!
Broght to Jim and Linda’s 4th of July party to go with poke

other_notes: Roshambo Sauvignon Blanc drinks smooth and easily; fine ripe citrus flavors go all the way to the finish.

This backward, tightly wound wine is all structure and sinew now, with a reticent but still exceptionally fine nose of purest cassis, smoke, and the faintest hint of green olives, all nicely balanced by a deft touch of oak. In the mouth, one was struck immediately by the great palate saturation and thrust of this wine, with the powerful mid-palate coverage giving way to a slowly unwinding finish that lasted 45 seconds. This is the most complete wine I tasted that afternoon, delivering great power, perfect balance, underlying finesse all at the same time.

Boysenberry, pomegranate syrup and sweet vanilla aromas lend a preview to this lush and chewy wine. Deep black fruit tannins coat your entire palate with hints of dark chocolate on a polished finish with great length. This wine is a definite keeper. Petite Sirah's usually cellar very well, about 10 years, and this years blend has been bottle-aged since June of 2005. The blend is 85% Sonoma County Petite Sirah from Dry Creek and 15% Napa Valley Solari Ranch.

The 2004 Novy Sonoma County Syrah shares many of the same flavors as its predecessor with plenty of plum and boysenberry fruits.  It is a bit more complex than the 2003 wine with abit of white pepper poking through (probably due to more cool climate fruit) on the mid-palate.

Fresh cracked black pepper, iron and spicy blackberry pie. Humongous in the mouth, (this one goes to 11) with outrageously sweet fruit, mouthwatering acidity, teeth-staining tannin and that density of palate that you can only get from low yielding vines grown on a rocky hillside. More soil inflected flavors of iron and spice lead into a ripe tannic finish.

Created from a single block of estate Petite Sirah, the 2003 “The Other” has extra dimensions of créme de cassis, hickory wood smoke and a dusty, crushed stone liqueur on the nose.  The toasty oak gives the wine a young left bank Bordeaux quality to the aromatics and the palate.  The fruit charcter is very sweet and approachable turning toward a polished tannic grip on the finish.

Possessing an exotic, perfumed white flower, créme de cassis and spice box nose, it boasts a deep garnet color.  The palate is sweet and expansive with elements of espresso roast, chocolate, blackberries and smoky oak.  the finish goes on for days.

Color should never be a problem with Petite Sirah, and this wine is no exception.  It is a deep, saturated dark red/black bruiser with a nose of seared beef, wet river stones, and blackberries.  The tannins are sweet revealing notes of graphite, smoke, blueberries, and cassis.  Made from two blocks on the estate planted to selections out of the old Park Muscatine vineyard, the wine drinks well now but will certainly benefit from time.

Upon opening the 2004 Novy Barbieri Vineyard Zinfandel reveals its youth.  It really needs to sit open for an hour or so to start showing its stuff.  As it opens, the wine displays a caramel and cinnamon character  along with intense dark berry fruit flavors.  In the mouth it is concentrated, but surprisingly well balanced with a sweet, woodsy, oak finish.

The 2004 Pinot Noir (which was about to be bottled when I tasted it) possesses sweet plum and black cherry fruit along with notions of earth, licorice, and forest floor.  Medium to full-bodied with supple/velvety tannins that caress the palate, it should drink well for 3-4 years..Robert Parker.   It is a very lush, very immediate wine with the aforementioned black cherry fruit and hitns of pine needles and other forest floor elements.  Personally, we think this is an early drinking Pinot, one that tastes great right now.

The 2004 Novy Carlisle Vineyard Zinfandel is bright and lively on the nose with fresh candied apples, blackberries, and clove aromas.  In the mouth these flavors continue on and are joined by cherries and wet stones.  The wine is huge and yet lively due to the good natrual acidity of the Russian River Valley site.

Only 24 Cases produced.  The 2004 Novy Unti Syrah is a big, full-bodied wine.  Plum fruit flavors dominate the immediate palate along with taffy, herbs, anise, and hints of barbecue rub.  The wine is inky with substantial tannins.  This wine really needs time (or significant breathing time) to really show its best.

This Cabernet Sauvignon is dense and has tremendous concentration.  The nose reveals ripe blackberry aromas, black licorice, cedar and sage with underlying mineral and earthy tones.  The wine is big-bodied with mouth-coating tannins.

This Cabernet Sauvignon is dense and has tremendous concentration.  The nose reveals ripe blackberry aromas, black licorice, cedar and sage with underlying mineral and earthy tones.  The wine is big-bodied with mouth-coating tannins.
This Syrah is ripe and complex.  It offers aromas of black cherry, currant liqueur and bittersweet cocoa.  The wine has hints of vanilla and well-integrated tannins on the palate.
This Syrah is ripe and complex.  It offers aromas of black cherry, currant liqueur and bittersweet cocoa.  The wine has hints of vanilla and well-integrated tannins on the palate.
The Esca Zinfandel is elegant and focused.  It shows classic Zinfandel characteristics through wild berry, boysenberry and peppery aromas.  This bright and balanced wine pairs very well with food.

vineyard: 52% Bennett Valley Judge Family Vineyard, 48% Bennett Valley Syrah, Dry Stack Vineyard
other_notes: Opaque ruby/purple in color.  Aromas of super-ripe black olives mixed with notes of blackberry liqueur, earth, and game.  On the palate, full and concentrated with explosive flavors of smoked meat, mocha, and leather.  Man this is delicious!  Plenty of structure for bottle development.  Peak enjoyment for this wine should be from late 2006 through 2012. (MRO – 1/28/06)Low yields, ripe fruit, and simple winemaking have combined to create this inky, glass-staining, yet elegant wine.  Approximately 160 cases produced. (Label)

variety: Three Birds Red Blend 69% Grenache, 23% Mourvédre (both from Unti Vineyard), 7% Russian River Valley (Atoosa’s Vineyard) Syrah.
other_notes: Medium to medium-dark ruby.  Hi-toned aromas of cherry and pomegranate with hints of iron, mace, and carpaccio.  On the palate, full-bodied and creamy with all kinds of delicious, exotic flavors from the mourvèdre component.  Very decadent!  Drink from late 2006 through 2011. (MRO – 1/28/06)

vineyard: 50% Dry Creek Valley Zinfandel, Teldeschi Ranch, 25% Dry Creek Valley Zinfandel, Mounts Ranch, 13% Dry Creek Valley Petite Sirah, Unti Vineyard, 12% Dry Creek Valley Petite Sirah, Del Carlo Ranch
other_notes: Dark ruby.  Verging on opaque.  Deep, dark aromas of black cherries, iron, earth, and herbs.  Screams Dry Creek!  On the palate, rich, full-bodied, but not at all oafish or ponderous.  Plenty of structure and muscle to ensure years of development.  Superb balance.  Drink between 2007 and 2011. (MRO – 1/28/06)

Medium to medium-dark brilliant ruby.  Delicious aromas of red cherries, raspberries, freshly-tilled earth, and cream.  Full-bodied and quite lush.  Although drinkable now, teasing tannins on the finish suggest this wine will be best from 2007 through 2010. (MRO – 1/28/06)From vines planted in 1922.  Interplanted petite syrah and syrah were included for colar and complexity.  Approximately 250 cases produced.

variety: Zinfandel  82% Zinfandel, 18% Mixed Black Varieties (Alicante Bouschet, Grand Noir, Petite Sirah, and others)
other_notes: Medium-dark to dark ruby.  Captivating aromas of boysenberries, black raspberries, and white pepper.  On the palate, huge, rich, and totally mouth-coating.  A totally slurpable, hedonistic wine.  Drink from release through 2009. (MRO – 1/28/06)

vineyard: 59% Russian River Valley Zinfandel, Fava Ranch, 23% Russian River Valley Syrah, Atoosa’s Vineyard, 12% Dry Creek Valley Zinfandel, Teldeschi Ranch, 6% Dry Creek Valley Zinfandel, Mounts Ranch
other_notes: Dark ruby in color.  Despite the syrah component, the nose shouts zinfandel with aromas of black cherry, raspberry, and a hint of white pepper. Compared with previous releases, the 2004 Siduri Pisoni Vineyard Pinot Noir is more about complexity than pure size.  Not only do you taste the usual big, bright cherries, but also multifaceted aromas of   wet stones and fresh flowers. The wine has a clean, polished feel to it. There is also a hint of sweet fruit that gives the wine a very monstrous presence, and tannins give it structure and a long , lingering finish. This wine has been drinking beautifully since the day we pressed it, and should continue to drink well over the next 5 years.  By the way, for those of you who care about such things, wine writer Robert Parker rated the 2004 Siduri Pisoni Vineyard Pinot Noir 90-92 points.

Our 2004 Vieilles Vignes Syrah shows a wonderfully complex and layered palette that begins with aromas o bacon fat and white pepper and quickly reveals rip red fruit laced with herbs de Provence.  Robust and structured tannins provide a masculine backbone for the long and lush finish.  This wine will only get better for the next 5-7 years (at least)

other_notes: Its layered, floral, tropical spicy flavors and lush texture make it pleasing to the palate as well as complementary to a wide range of contemporary foods.

appellation: Mayacamas Mountains of southeastern Mendocino County
other_notes: Isabel’s Cuvée is made from the McDowell Valley Vineyards 90+ year old Grenache Gris vines which more closely resemble apricot trees than the trellised and trained vines found today.  But looks overrated - unruly and gnarled - they produce an intensely flavored and complex wine.

A rhubarb and cola nose comes out of the 2004 Russian River Valley Pinot Noir, and opens up into black cherries and raspberries.  The wine is fairly closed when it is first opened, and seems to do well with decanting for 30 to 60 minutes.  The mouth-feel is soft with just enough acidity for balance.  There is a wonderfully long finish with a good taste of French oak.

A very fragrant wine with a nose bursting of cherry pie, dried flowers, exotic tea, and Asian spice.  There is excellent acidity on the palate which carries the flavors form the nose right through to a long toasty finish.  The wine seems to drink well without decanting, though it gradually reveals even more half an hour after opening.

Exhibits aromas of plums, black cherries and toast.  A fragrance of rose petals comes out of the nose if the wine is decanted for 30 minutes.  There is firm acidity on the palate which seems to weave this very complex wine together.  Enjoy this incredible balance of ripeness, acidity and structure.

my_notes: Drank on 8/5/2007.  Needed over 2 hours to really open up after being decanted.
other_notes: The 2004 Akiko’s Cuvee has much in common with the 2004 Sonoma Coast when it is first opened, but it is soon apparent that it needs some more time to develop and soften compared with its appellation sibling.  The spicy nose jumps out of the glass right away, with a abundance of fragrant flowers and elegant fruit.  In spite of its early approachability, there is a good bit of tannin on the palate, but also plenty o dense, chewy fruit.  With a year of cellaring, the 2004 Akio’s Cuvee should be drinking beautifully as the wine integrates fully, although you should try one soon to see what it’s like upon release.
