Our deeply colored 2004 Pisoni Estate Pinot Noir has a very floral and spicy nose with hints of berry, lavender and cloves. Fine tannins frame the full, rounded texture, and fresh acidity draws out the finish. Decant it for thirty minutes and enjoy!

The vintage was very hot for Howell Mountain, producing wines with more abundant forward fruit at this stage without sacrificing a bit of the backbone present in these wines in their youth. This wine has the classic Outpost nose: rare beef, pepper, sweet, brambly red fruits and sage. The palate is a bit more expansive young then we are accustomed to with notes of black licorice, spearmint, black raspberry, blackberry and kirsch liqueur. The finish has a nice roundness to it, lacking some of the rough and tumble youthful elements of past vintages.

With the addition of 25 percent whole clusters, the 2004 version of our Grenache has taken on added dimension. A more varietally true nose of bacon fat, lavender and dried herbs precedes flavors of kirsch, herbes de Provence and grilled meats. The concentration of sweet red fruit fills out the mid-palate with the stem inclusion providing complexity on the nose and middle, and length to the finish.

80% Zinfandel, 17% Petite Sirah, 3% Barbera.  It is quite dark, with jammy berry fruit with a touch of spice, and a warm, rich finish. It should improve from 2005 to 2006; then don’t waste anymore time and just drink the stuff.

80% Zinfandel, 17% Petite Sirah, 3% Barbera.  It is quite dark, with jammy berry fruit with a touch of spice, and a warm, rich finish. It should improve from 2005 to 2006; then don’t waste anymore time and just drink the stuff.

my_notes: Brought to 2011 Super Bowl at Jim and Linda’s to have with casoulet.
other_notes: This is clearly our most complex and concentrated Syrah we’ve ever made. It is darker, juicier and more aromatic than any previous vintage. You’ll recognize the classic Unti blackberry/smoked meat character along with violets, lavender, pepper, blueberries and toasty oak. It is the most Northern Rhone-like we have ever made. This full-bodied Syrah has excellent depth, richness and balance. The wine will age for 7 to10 years.This 100% Syrah was bottled unfined and unfiltered.  470 cases produced

This is clearly our most complex and concentrated Syrah we’ve ever made. It is darker, juicier and more aromatic than any previous vintage. You’ll recognize the classic Unti blackberry/smoked meat character along with violets, lavender, pepper, blueberries and toasty oak. It is the most Northern Rhone-like we have ever made. This full-bodied Syrah has excellent depth, richness and balance. The wine will age for 7 to10 years.This 100% Syrah was bottled unfined and unfiltered.  470 cases produced

80% Zinfandel, 20% Petite Sirah. This is by far our jammiest and most full-bodied Zin to date. The wine is quite dark, with super-ripe berry fruit, a touch of spice, and a warm rich finish. Because we have such a great tradition of blending Petite Sirah into Zin here in Dry Creek, this wine will appeal to those fanatics of this appellation. It should improve from 2006 to 2007; then don’t waste anymore time and just drink the stuff.

While our Petit Frere might lack the complexity and elegance of our Grenache bottling, it delivers plenty of ripe jammy Grenache and meaty Mourvedre and Syrah flavors. Think of this wine as Dry Creek’s version of a Côtes du Rhone that has been on an aggressive weight lifting program.  475 cases produced

my_notes: We tried it at tasting room and enjoyed it. Chocolate

Partially aged in small oak barrels, this refreshing wine is superb as an aperitif and excellent with seafood, pasta and poultry dishes.

Ripe red berry-wild cherry fruit, vanilla-caramel oak.  Fragrant Asian spices-Chinese 5-spice, white pepper and saffron.  Very smooth and nicely structured, long creamy finish.  This will lay down for another year or two, but it’s tasting great now - so enjoy.

Intensely jammy, black razzberry fruit, vibrant and alive in both nose and mouth, nice hit of black pepper.  Smoothly textured in mouth, creamy vanilla oak, and the finish is long and lushly jammy fruit - dangerously good.  The Wild Thing will improve with another year, two or even three under its belt.  1703 cases produced

Extra ripe red fruit - cranberry/pomegranate and deep sagebrush spice.  A bit of tar deepens the milk-chocolately oak toast.  Big mouthfeel but it’s a gentle giant, soft and round.  Lay this down for 2-3 years for optimal flavors.  1054 cases produced

Inky blue-purple in color, moderate black pepper spice on deep blue-blackberry fruit.  Cedary oak spice, very dark chocolate, bit of warm vanilla at finish, structured tannins for aging.  This Zin with a heart of a Cab willa ge gracefully for another three to six years.  556 cases produced.

variety: Zinfandel Karma Zin 85% Zinfandel plus field blend of Alicante Bouschet, Petite Sirah, Carignane, etc.
other_notes: Very complexly layered spice and black fruits, pretty blueberry fragrance.  Creamy oak, a bit of vanilla, dark chocolate and peppery tannins.  A bit chewy in its youth, rich in mouth, good structure for aging another 3-5 years.  670 cases produced.
Deep blackberry fruit and big spice plus black pepper, a touch of chocolate and cola in the oak contribution.  Richly textured in mouth, good structure for aging, long black fruit finish.

other_notes: Rosella’s usually shows more earthiness than its sister vineyard, Garys’ - and this year is no exception.  A bit deeper than Garys’ as well, it has more dark fruit characteristics.

While it’s closer in proximity to Carneros than the 2md amd 3rd ridgeline from the Pacific that people normally associate with Sonoma Coast, Durell does show typical earthy Sonoma Coast characteristics.  It’s usually a touch more tannic than some of our other wines, so it can be a good candidate for a little more aging.

This is Peter Cargasacchi’s new vineyard, located just west of the Santa Rita Hills AVA.  This vineyard, like Turner, produces big, Santa Rita Hills profile wine.  The Pali Cargasacchi has really nice forest floor, anise and smoky oak components that complement the bold and bright fruit.

From bottle:  Aged “sur lies” in oak barrels for eight months, the 2003 Toasted Head Chardonnay has aromas of apricot and vanilla, flavors of tropical fruit and a slight spiciness, layered with toasty oak notes.  The Toasted Head name comes form the process of charring the barrel heads for carmelized oak tones.

Aromas of apricot, pear, pippin apple and white blossoms.  The flavors are crisp yet refreshing from a long cool fermentation.  Perfect complement for Pacific Rim, India or as an apertif.
Rich fruit and spice flavors are tempered by a fruit flavored sweetness.  A perfect match for hors d’oerves or Pan Asian cuisine.
Soft scent of toast and dry, lingering citrus qualities on the palate.  Clean bubbly that is sophisticated enough for any meal.  Salud!

It is full of rich citrus fruits along with hints of butterscotch and vanilla from the oak. That oak is well balanced out, however, by the crisp natural acidity which helps the wine finish with a long, mouthwatering finish. This wine is wonderful with food but should only become more complex with some time in bottle.

Very dark ruby.  Verging on opaque.  Hi-toned, penetrating aromas of black raspberry, black olive, bay leaf, and well-aged beef.  A suggestion of mocha as well.  Rich, full-bodied, but not at all over-the-top due to its excellent acidity.  This wine will age well.  Drink between 2007 and 2014.  (MRO – 11/1/06)

Dark black-ruby. A deliciously floral nose of violets, lavender, licorice, and black olive. Can you say “Côte-Rôtie”? Quite fleshy on entry but not at all heavy or over the top. Flavors of blackberry, cherry, and olive tapenade are supported by fine tannins and acidity. Concentrated yet elegant. A joy to drink and a wine that we would like to achieve in every vintage. Drink 2008 through 2015.

variety: Rhone Blend Red Wine Blend of 85% Mourvèdre, 12% Petite Sirah, 2% Valdepeñas, 1% Alicante Bouschet
other_notes: Medium to medium-dark ruby.  Hi-toned aromas of cherry, mace, cinnamon, orange peel, carpaccio, and tree bark.  Very complex!  On the palate, totally mouth coating with flavors of pepper, game, iron, and blood.   The creamy texture of this wine is such a turn-on!  This very well could be one of the most unique wines produced in California.  Drink from release through 2012.  (MRO – 11/1/06)

Opaque ruby-purple.  Aromas of black plums and blackberries are highlighted by notes of spring flowers.  On the palate, a mouth-coating, blackberry-laced entry gives way to mountain tannins on the finish.  Absolutely scrumdillyicious!  Drinkable now with a good splash decanting (at least 4 to 6 hours air time), optimum drinking should be from late 2007 through 2014.  (MRO – 11/1/06)

The 2005 Novy Viognier possesses aromas of pears, apples, and tropical fruits. With a medium body and good crisp acidity this wine is perfect for summer drinking. No need to wait, this wine is drinking amazingly right now.

By not allowing the wine to go through this secondary fermentation we retain the bright, crisp acidity that makes it so attractive. On the nose, the wine possesses aromas of aged Gouda, baking spices, tropical and citrus fruits as well as some mineral flavors of wet stone and flint. In the mouth, the wine’s fruit character come to the front showing flavors of pear tart, green apple, and spice. This is followed by hints of citrus fruits that lead into the lush and expansive mid-palate. The wine finishes crisp and clean with a laser-beam of bright acidity and minerals. We hope you enjoy drinking it as much as we enjoyed making it!

This wine, because of the warm year in 04, produced a lush, spice-filled Pinot Noir.  It also produced a lighter colored Pinot as we chose not to try and over extract the color in favor of balance and harmony.  In this way, the wine reminds us of many of our 2005 Pinots with loads of flavor but not as dark of a color as previous vintages.  We think that lovers of more classic styled Pinots will find this wine to be particularly attractive.

This legendary vineyard located on the bench of Sonoma Mountain, at this point, needs no real introduction. The Van der Kamp family can boast that it had one of the oldest blocks of Pinot Noir grapes planted in Sonoma County (over 45 years old), and has a variety of clones planted (some very young, some teenaged). With that diversity, this wine is always exciting for us to blend because each clone is vinified separately, and kept in separate barrels until the final blend is created. It is very interesting for us to sit down and blend because each block is so different in flavor, texture and aroma. The older vines tend to produce wines that are earthy, rustic and very complex in their herbal characteristics. The younger vines tend to produce energetic, fruit-forward wines. The end result is always an interesting combination.  The 2004 version of this wine ended up begin a mix of four clones: 2 barrels of the older block, 3 barrels of the teenage Martini Clone vines, 1 barrel from the first crop of the new Clone 828 planting, and 5 barrels worth of the 777 clone.  The different blocks were harvested between September 3rd and Sept 14. These were all fermented separately and kept in separate French Oak barrels until blending. This wine, because of the warm year in 04, produced a lush, spice-filled Pinot Noir.  It also produced a lighter colored Pinot as we chose not to try and over extract the color in favor of balance and harmony.  In this way, the wine reminds us of many of our 2005 Pinots with loads of flavor but not as dark of a color as previous vintages.  We think that lovers of more classic styled Pinots will find this wine to be particularly attractive.     268 Cases Produced Allocation: 6 bottles  Price: $42 per bottle   SPECIAL PRICE $35

Dark ruby purple.  Again, nearly opaque.  Intoxicating, deep aromas of blackberries, dark chocolate, with a hint of black pepper and orange peel.  On the palate, rich and full bodied with that unmistakable Rossi “garrigue” (pepper, lavender, and wild herbs).  Pleasing tannins on the finish.  A real step up from the outstanding ’03.  Enjoy from early 2007 through 2011.  (MRO – 11/1/06)

On the palate, rich and full bodied with that unmistakable Rossi “garrigue” (pepper, lavender, and wild herbs).  Pleasing tannins on the finish.  A real step up from the outstanding ’03.  Enjoy from early 2007 through 2011.  (MRO – 11/1/06)

Dark ruby-purple.  Opaque.  Ripe blackberries and black olives spill from the glass.  A smooth, supple entry leads to flavors of plums, blackberries, and a touch of vanilla.  Full-bodied and quite lush.  Very enjoyable now, this wine should be at its optimum between 2007 and 2011.  (MRO – 11/1/06)

Dark ruby-purple.  Opaque.  Ripe blackberries and black olives spill from the glass.  A smooth, supple entry leads to flavors of plums, blackberries, and a touch of vanilla.  Full-bodied and quite lush.  Very enjoyable now, this wine should be at its optimum between 2007 and 2011.  (MRO – 11/1/06)

Opaque ruby-purple.  Aromas of black plums and blackberries are highlighted by notes of spring flowers.  On the palate, a mouth-coating, blackberry-laced entry gives way to mountain tannins on the finish.  Absolutely scrumdillyicious!  Drinkable now with a good splash decanting (at least 4 to 6 hours air time), optimum drinking should be from late 2007 through 2014.  (MRO – 11/1/06)

Medium-dark ruby-red.  Beautiful, perfumed aromas of red cherries, orange zest, and fresh cream.  On the palate, full-bodied but oh so well balanced with an incredible burst of red raspberry/cherry flavor.  The natural acidity in this wine keeps the finish fresh and lively.  Certainly enjoyable on release but best from early 2007 through 2011.  An outstanding new addition to the Carlisle portfolio!  (MRO – 11/1/06)

Medium-dark ruby-red.  Beautiful, perfumed aromas of red cherries, orange zest, and fresh cream.  On the palate, full-bodied but oh so well balanced with an incredible burst of red raspberry/cherry flavor.  The natural acidity in this wine keeps the finish fresh and lively.  Certainly enjoyable on release but best from early 2007 through 2011.  An outstanding new addition to the Carlisle portfolio!  (MRO – 11/1/06)

Dark ruby red, verging on opaque.  Deep aromas of black raspberry, licorice, and white pepper.  Once again, the “terroir” of Carlisle Vineyard shines brightly.  On the palate, an explosion of black raspberry fruit intertwined with briary spice.  While quite rich and full-bodied, surprisingly elegant and refined.  Noble tannins on the finish dictate at least another year in bottle before enjoying.  Drink this age-worthy zinfandel from mid-2007 through 2010.  (MRO – 11/1/06)

The 2005 Ancient Vines Zinfandel shows wonderful dusty raspberry, blackberry, white pepper and spice, with coffee and chocolate characters. Aging in new and used wood has lent this wine a subtle vanilla quality that nicely complements the explosive fruit notes. Enjoy now or cellar for 5 to 7 years.

The 2005 Graham Pinot gives off a wonderful nose of earth, spice and jasmine tea with hints of black cherry.  The palate is quite a mouthful of Pinot Noir with plenty of fruit, balanced tannins and acidity.  This is a Pinot that could stand a year or 3 in the cellar, but it still drinks well now with a long decanting

A wine of deep raspberry fruit and vibrant black pepper spice.

variety: Late Harvest Trousseau Gris Sweet Caroline
other_notes: Lucious honey-spiced pear deliciousness.
Richly jammy and lusciously sweet, it complements many food from savory cheese plates to decadent chocolate desserts.
The Grenach shows red fruits, along with kirsch, clove and black currants.
The Grenach shows red fruits, along with kirsch, clove and black currants.

vineyard: Ventana Vineyard, eastern slopes of Santa Lucia mountains
Ventana Vineyard, eastern slopes of Santa Lucia mountains

variety: White Wine  Cote du Bone Blanc
my_notes: This went very well with the Mango Chili salmon.  It would go well with other spicy foods and other fish.
other_notes: This lovely wine shows refreshing pear, melon and mango in the bouquet, followed by flavors of apple, peach and creamy vanilla. This is an ideal wine paired with seafood, including oysters on the half shell and curried Dungeness crab.

winemaker: Paul Golitzin, Marv Crum, Alex Golitzin
other_notes: The 2004 vintage resulted in wines that have stunning aromas, flavors and texture. Juicy blueberries, blackberries, violets, cocoa, and minerals coat the palate with complex layers adding notes of wood smoke and Asian spice. This wine will mature nicely over the next 7-8 years and continue to age gracefully for at least another 10-20 years thereafter.

winemaker: Paul Golitzin, Marv Crum, Alex Golitzin

winemaker: Paul Golitzin, Marv Crum, Alex Golitzin
other_notes: This wine displays many layers of flavors and a complexity rarely seen in New World Merlot. Lush red and black fruits, licorice, spice and smoke describe this unctuous wine. Drink it over the next 15-20 years.

Good intensity, richness and concentration, with excellent depth to the earthy, loamy wild berry and blueberry flavors.  Ends with firm, integrated tannins, and it takes some time to open up, but it’s compelling once it does.

Good intensity, richness and concentration, with excellent depth to the earthy, loamy wild berry and blueberry flavors.  Ends with firm, integrated tannins, and it takes some time to open up, but it’s compelling once it does.
Fresh, alluring, smoky, toasty oak is evident in the aroma, and it shows up on the palate too, joining loamy, fresh earth and blueberry flavors that are rich and intense.
Fresh, alluring, smoky, toasty oak is evident in the aroma, and it shows up on the palate too, joining loamy, fresh earth and blueberry flavors that are rich and intense.

Loamy earth and dusty berry scents carry over to the palate, where they are vibrant and tangy, repeating the dark berry fruit themes.  Fine balcne with tannins and acidity, too, returning the loamy berry flavors.

Loamy earth and dusty berry scents carry over to the palate, where they are vibrant and tangy, repeating the dark berry fruit themes.  Fine balcne with tannins and acidity, too, returning the loamy berry flavors.
Light cranberry color, juicy strawberry-watermelon fruit aromas, nice mineral, hint of pink grapefruit.  Refreshingly crisp and dry.  Great with almost any food, from sushi to salmon to BBQ

Black razzberry fruit, vibrant and alive in both nose and mouth, nice hit of black pepper.  Smoothly textured in mouth, creamy aok and the finish is long and lushly jammy fruit - Dangerously good!  Can age for another 3 years at least but great right now.

Intense dark razzberry fruit, very smoky-chocolatey oak, almost cola-like - nose opens up more with an hour to breathe.  Very rich and dense mouthfeel, nice creamy vanilla-cocoa oak, long blackberry finish.  Still young, needs 6 months to get over bottle shock and will cellar another 5 years.

my_notes: It opens up nicely after a day or so of breathing - take out a glass and taste it, then cork it back up and let is sit if you can for a day or more.
other_notes: Inky blue-purple in color, moderate black pepper spice on deep blackberry fruit. Cedary oak spice, very dark chocolate, bit of warm vanilla at finish, structured tannins for aging.

variety: Zinfandel Karma Zin 85% Zinfandel plus field blend of Alicante Bouschet, Petite Sirah, Carignane, etc.
other_notes: Very complexly layered spice and black fruits, pretty blueberry fragrance.  Creamy oak, a bit of vanilla, dark chocolate and peppery tannins.  A bit chewy in its youth, rich in mouth, good structure for aging another 3-5 years.  670 cases produced.

Wonderfully wildberry fruit nose, very pretty with candied violets and a bit of orange peel, nice warm brown spices like nutmeg and clove.  Lots of stuff going on once it opens up.  Nice soft mouthfeel - creamy oak but showcases fruit more than oak - not heavy in body but good intensity nonetheless.  Needs to open more but is showing well now too - can age another 5 years.

variety: Trebbiano, Vermentino  and Chardonnay. Tuttobene bianco igt
other_notes: Aromas and flavors of baked apples, flowers and minerals. Medium body and balanced with lively acidity and a fresh, crisp finish.  Trebbiano, Vermentino  and Chardonnay.

my_notes: Nose of grapeade.  Would not buy again
other_notes: tuttobene is a very pleasant wine with great structure and balance. The nose and palate display ripe fruit, red berries and subtle herbal notes. It is medium to full-bodied with remarkable tannins, yet is also silky with a smooth acidity and a rich, fruity finish. Serve with light dishes, pasta and pizza. tuttobene can also be enjoyed as aperitif.

There’s a very fragrant, rose petal, toasty, and forest floor nose followed by a soft and lush palate feel.  The long, fruity finish predicts a good lifespan for this wine, but it’s drinking so nicely already, no need to wait.

variety: White Bordeaux, something like 35% Sauvignon Gris, 35% Sauvignon Blanc and 30% Sémillon.
other_notes: The citrusy, herby notes of the Sauvignons dominate the nose and the Sémillon contributes a bit of texture on the palate.  It's fresh, dry and bright...perfect for simple seafood or aperitif service.  The wine also will beautifully 'set up' a red wine, so serving this for cocktails or with a simple salad or seafood starter is ideal.

Aromatics: Bright strawberry with hints of blood orange and cranberry.On the palate:  Crisp and cleansing, our rosé shows bright strawberry and cranberry with a lingering finish of juicy grapefruit and wild berry. The approach is lively and crisp with red fruit and citrus. The palate is dry and crisp and carries the nuances of pure Pinot Noir flavors.

Aromatics: Bright strawberry with hints of blood orange and cranberry.On the palate:  Crisp and cleansing, our rosé shows bright strawberry and cranberry with a lingering finish of juicy grapefruit and wild berry. The approach is lively and crisp with red fruit and citrus. The palate is dry and crisp and carries the nuances of pure Pinot Noir flavors.

Aromatics:  Bold black cherry and blackberry accented with hints of mushroom and cocoa.On the palate:  True to the appellation, the 2005 Sonoma Coast is brimming with dark, deep fruit. Hints of earth and black tea offer depth while juicy plum and blackberry make up the mouth-coating, rich structure. Hints of boysenberry, shitake mushroom and dusty cedar round of the finish.

Aromatics:  Rich and dark with black licorice, black pepper, plum and dry cocoa.On the palate:  Savory structure of pepper and spice carry a core of black cherry and plum. Dusty tannins and pipe tobacco offer a masculine touch to the rich black fruit. Black licorice and dried cherry offer depth on the long, smoky finish.

Aromatics:  Rich and dark with black licorice, black pepper, plum and dry cocoa.On the palate:  Savory structure of pepper and spice carry a core of black cherry and plum. Dusty tannins and pipe tobacco offer a masculine touch to the rich black fruit. Black licorice and dried cherry offer depth on the long, smoky finish.
Baron Herzog Syrah is a very “fruit forward” wine that displays notes of blackberry, blueberry, white pepper and spice.  Enjoy this wine with beef or lamb, hearty pasta dishes and barbequed chicken.
A concentrated wine of impressive complexity with layers of berry, blackcurrant, chocolate, leather and oak.

my_notes: Took a little while to really open up, but very nice.  Nose of strawberry and Rosella’s funk
other_notes: Rosella’s usually shows more earthiness than its sister vineyard, Garys’ - and this year is no exception.  A bit deeper than Garys’ as well, it has more dark fruit characteristics.

While the color is a brilliant red reminiscent of black cherries, the nose offers hints of warm toast and cassis.  Bearboat Pinot Noir has a mouth of fresh strawberries and raspberries while delicate suggestions of black licorice enhance the lingering finish.

Just like an old fire and brimstone sermon, it starts easy and lures you in with scents of christmas spices and then it kicks up the volume with an explosion of juicy red and black berries, plums and chocolate. Be healed with a smack to the forehead of spicy, smooth tannins. You will surely be back next Sunday for some more! Named after the Reverend Martin Luther King and the Reverend Horton Heat.

Gold Medal Winner - 2006 Sonoma County Harvest Fair!Roshambo "imago" chardonnay bursts bravely with Vibrant flavors of golden juicy pineapple, glowing orange, and floral jasmine. Witness and experience the metamorphosis of California chardonnay. This wine is made with out any oak.

Gold Medal Winner - 2006 Sonoma County Harvest Fair!Roshambo "imago" chardonnay bursts bravely with Vibrant flavors of golden juicy pineapple, glowing orange, and floral jasmine. Witness and experience the metamorphosis of California chardonnay. This wine is made with out any oak.

Fine tiny bubbles and a long lasting mousse are the usual footprints of the L’Ermitage cuvée. This cuvee of the Millenium is fruity (apple, peach) with a delicate bread crust note. Mouth feel is on well balanced wine with baked apple flavors and a long and round creamy finish.

Filled with vibrant aromatics and flavors of peaches, apricots and tropical fruits, with just a touch of sweet creamy vanilla and cinnamon spice.  This beautiful expression of Viognier is full bodied but elegant, incredibly ripe, yet balanced.

my_notes: This was nice and crisp with a Waldorf salad
other_notes: Richly textured, assertive wine. The classic slate soil gives a distinct mineral character to the wines.  This densely packed yet elegant, Kabinett has an intense citrus fruit aroma and a crisp, racy finish.

vineyard: Teldeschi Ranch, Mounts Ranch and Gold Mine Ranch
other_notes: Medium-dark ruby garnet.  Fragrant scents of red cherries, iron, and spring flowers.  Classic Dry Creek zin!  On the palate, absolutely seamless with plenty of delicious lip-smacking cherry fruit.  As with many of our wines in 2005, easily my favorite Dry Creek zinfandel to date.

vineyard: Teldeschi Ranch, Mounts Ranch and Gold Mine Ranch
other_notes: Medium-dark ruby garnet.  Fragrant scents of red cherries, iron, and spring flowers.  Classic Dry Creek zin!  On the palate, absolutely seamless with plenty of delicious lip-smacking cherry fruit.  As with many of our wines in 2005, easily my favorite Dry Creek zinfandel to date.

variety: Champagne  Brut de Noirs 60% Pinot Noir, 40% Chardonnay
my_notes: The 1997 vintage was great at Pinot Days.  Brought to Manresa for Paul’s birthday.  It was nice and festive in the mouth.
Take to Jim and Linda’s house, especially if Mike is there.
other_notes: Blended from two distinct vineyards on River Road in Sonoma County's famed Russian River Valley, this wine combines Dijon clones 114 and an old field selection of Pinot Noir from one of the area's acclaimed vineyards. One provides juicy berry notes, the other contributes spice and structure. Both were open top fermented using wild yeast and gentle handling then aged 14 months in new and French oak barrels. 136 cases.
bright, fresh and remarkably versatile, with aromas and flavors of peach, dried grass and melons. Oak aging contributes to the wine's rich texture and long finish.

my_notes: Very good.  Had it at Jim and Linda Labor Day BBQ.  Lamb riblets, salmon.
other_notes: Deep, rich aromatics. The nose is dominated by strong floral notes woven around a core of baking spice and red, berry fruits. This wine is dense in the mouth and possesses much grip. The flavors are very expressive on the palate, and the wine finishes with firm tannins. Decant for thirty minutes before serving.

The experience begins with the crimson red color and bright aromatics lifting out of the glass. This is a pure expression of Pinot Noir from the Santa Lucia Highlands: ripe flavors in elegant balance. The full-bodied wine has a strong focus towards its fine tannins and acid at the finish. Approachable now, these Pinot Noirs will also age very well.

my_notes: Serve slightly chilled but not cold
other_notes: This Chardonnay is very lively and fresh on the nose. It displays hints of Asian pear, white peach, melon and Meyer lemon zest. The palate has a full and coating texture that draws out the finish. The wine is balanced by a mineral-like acidity that cleanses the palate.Serve this wine slightly chilled. Not too cold, though, or the aromatics will be muted. Watch the nose open up as the wine warms slightly.

my_notes: Serve chilled.  Good summer quafing wine
other_notes: Aromatics are a mouth-watering display of wild strawberries, watermelon and crushed rose petals. Its delicate flavors dance across the palate, and its bright acidity proves very refreshing. This is a wonderful wine for many occasions.Serve chilled.

Aromatics: Fresh cherry, bright raspberry and cranberry with hints of cola nut and spice.On the palate: Bright acidity greets the palate, carrying red stone fruit and cherries. The mid-palate boasts of creamy raspberry and fresh plum. Clean, juicy structure offers an extended finish, with lingering bing cherry and raspberry.

Aromatics: Fresh cherry, bright raspberry and cranberry with hints of cola nut and spice.On the palate: Bright acidity greets the palate, carrying red stone fruit and cherries. The mid-palate boasts of creamy raspberry and fresh plum. Clean, juicy structure offers an extended finish, with lingering bing cherry and raspberry.

Aromatics: Bold black cherry and blackberry accented with hints of mushroom and cocoa.On the palate: True to the appellation, the 2005 Sonoma Coast is brimming with dark, deep fruit. Hints of earth and black tea offer depth while juicy plum and blackberry make up the mouth-coating, rich structure. Hints of boysenberry, shitake mushroom and dusty cedar round of the finish.

Tasting Notes: Black cherries, cola and cocoa on the nose. A serious, complex wine with dark, brooding berry scents and flavors. Explosive in the mouth. Soft tannins give the finish silkiness and length. Drink now or over the next 5 years.

Tasting Notes: Black cherries, cola and cocoa on the nose. A serious, complex wine with dark, brooding berry scents and flavors. Explosive in the mouth. Soft tannins give the finish silkiness and length. Drink now or over the next 5 years.

my_notes: This was still young to drink on 2/28/2008.  On the next day it was ever so wonderful.
other_notes: Velvety soft, with fresh, floral, cherries and raspberries on the nose. The palate shows slight earthiness and cola and an overall great balance of oak and fruit. As the wine opens, it gains complexity showing hints of spiciness. Drink now for the next 3 years.

The 2005 Keefer Vineyard Pinot Noir starts with an intriguing, tell-tale Clone 23 nose that seems to change ever so delicately each time you smell the wine. There is plenty of acidity to go along with some wonderfully spicy fruit on the palate. In many ways, the '05 Keefer is remarkably similar to Freeman's 2004 version, but with less new oak in the nose and on the finish. We expect the '05 Keefer to age gracefully for many years, but with its solid core of fruit, it can also be enjoyed at a young age.

The 2005 Akiko's Cuvée has an exotic, flowery nose that is comprised of rose petals and jasmine. The feel on the palate is firm and tightly-knit, but softens with decanting and/or time in the glass. There is an extremely long finish which tends to predict this will be a very long-lived wine. In some ways the '05 Akiko's is reminiscent of the '05 Keefer Pinot Noir, but it is also similar to the '05 Sonoma Coast. We anticipate the 2005 Akiko's Cuvée to reach maturity around 2009.

The 2005 boasts aromas of lemon peel and pear interlaced with wet stone, mineral and the barest hint of vanilla.  This is a vibrant Chardonnay that finishes with long and elegant layers of texture.It offers notes of oragne, blossoms, citrus and lemon with the oak clearly pushes to the background.  Enjoy this attractive Charonnay over the next several years. (Robert Parker)Peach skin color. Pear, melon, lemon ice tea, incense and a leesy nuance on the nose.  Juicy on entry, then nicely concentrated an drich in extract. (Stephen Tanzer)

variety: Rhone style Three Thirteen Red Wine or Chateauneufdu-Pape  Mourvedre, Syrah and Grenache in equal portions
other_notes: The ‘05 Three Thirteen exudes summer fruit aromas, dominated by strawberries, and then gives way to herbs, lavender, and spice with earthy undertones.  This medium bodied wine is exceptionally harmonious and structured and finishes with round, soft tannins that leave a lingering memory.  It is a wonderful companion to a wide array of cuisine and especially enjoyable over a lingering lunch.A Rhone Valley-like bouquet of strawberries, cherries, peppers, herbs, lavender and spice emerge from this straight forward red.(Robert Parker)

The intoxicating bouquet is dominated by aromas of violets, blueverry and spice interlaced with meaty and earthy undertones.  This is a pure and vibrant Syrah of exceptional depth and strcture that will drink well for decades.It exhibits plenty of blueberry, raspberry, sweet cherry, floral and spice characteristics.  Pure, medium-bodied, elegant and authoritatively flavored. (Robert Parker)

The 2006 is a vibrant pink hue that nearly sparkles in the glass.  The nose bursts with early summer fruit aromas intermingling with earth and mineral.  It offers textured yet crisp and zesty pallet and this wine truly pairs well with nearly everything and simply shouts summer all year long.

Black ruby-purple.  A powerful, blueberry-laden nose is complimented by intriguing notes of iron and earth.  Full-bodied and concentrated but with a measure of elegance rarely found in a petite of this size.  Enjoyable now with plenty of time in a decanter (and if you don’t mind tannin), this petite has the balance of fruit and structure to age gracefully for up to several decades.  (MRO – 3/1/07)

Enjoyable now with plenty of time in a decanter (and if you don’t mind tannin), this petite has the balance of fruit and structure to age gracefully for up to several decades.  (MRO – 3/1/07)

Dark ruby-purple.  Nearly opaque.  Complex, intense aromas of blackberry, ripe black olive, and smoked meats.  On the palate, full-bodied but not at all over the top with beautiful structure and delineation.  Without question, our finest Dry Creek syrah to date, even perhaps one of our finest syrahs ever!  Drink from 2008 through 2013.  (MRO – 3/1/07)

Dark ruby-purple.  Nearly opaque.  Complex, intense aromas of blackberry, ripe black olive, and smoked meats.  On the palate, full-bodied but not at all over the top with beautiful structure and delineation.  Without question, our finest Dry Creek syrah to date, even perhaps one of our finest syrahs ever!  Drink from 2008 through 2013.  (MRO – 3/1/07)

Inky black-purple in color.  Heady aromas of blackberry compote and fresh churned butter.  Smells just like Grandma’s blackberry cobbler!  As full-bodied as our Dry Creek syrah but perhaps with slightly brighter acidity (as expected from Russian River Valley).  Slurp-able now but even better with cellaring.  Drink from mid-2008 through 2013.  (MRO – 3/1/07)

Inky black-purple in color.  Heady aromas of blackberry compote and fresh churned butter.  Smells just like Grandma’s blackberry cobbler!  As full-bodied as our Dry Creek syrah but perhaps with slightly brighter acidity (as expected from Russian River Valley).  Slurp-able now but even better with cellaring.  Drink from mid-2008 through 2013.  (MRO – 3/1/07)

Medium-dark ruby garnet.  Fragrant scents of red cherries, iron, and spring flowers.  Classic Dry Creek zin!  On the palate, absolutely seamless with plenty of delicious lip-smacking cherry fruit.  As with many of our wines in 2005, easily my favorite Dry Creek zinfandel to date.  Drink mid-2007 through 2011. (MRO – 3/1/07)

Medium-dark ruby garnet.  Fragrant scents of red cherries, iron, and spring flowers.  Classic Dry Creek zin!  On the palate, absolutely seamless with plenty of delicious lip-smacking cherry fruit.  As with many of our wines in 2005, easily my favorite Dry Creek zinfandel to date.  Drink mid-2007 through 2011. (MRO – 3/1/07)

Medium-dark to dark ruby.  A delicious nose of sweet red cherries and plums is highlighted by notes of citrus peel, earth, and cream.  Full-bodied but with plenty of structure and tannin to keep everything in balance.  Although drinkable now, tannins on the finish suggest this wine will be best from 2008 through 2012.  (MRO – 3/1/07)

Medium-dark to dark ruby.  A delicious nose of sweet red cherries and plums is highlighted by notes of citrus peel, earth, and cream.  Full-bodied but with plenty of structure and tannin to keep everything in balance.  Although drinkable now, tannins on the finish suggest this wine will be best from 2008 through 2012.  (MRO – 3/1/07)

Medium-dark ruby in color.  Mouth watering aromas of boysenberry, black cherry, and licorice.  The wine enters full and rich, with flavors echoing aromas.  A long, lasting finish.  Enjoyable on release but best from late 2007 through 2010.  (MRO – 3/1/07)

Medium-dark ruby in color.  Mouth watering aromas of boysenberry, black cherry, and licorice.  The wine enters full and rich, with flavors echoing aromas.  A long, lasting finish.  Enjoyable on release but best from late 2007 through 2010.  (MRO – 3/1/07)

Medium-dark to dark ruby garnet.  Brooding, dark aromas of blackberry, black cherry and white pepper.  On the palate, while certainly dry, terrific “sweetness” of fruit, finishing with refreshing tannins and acidity.  A better balanced wine than the 2004.  Drink from early 2008 through 2012.  (MRO – 3/1/07)

Medium-dark to dark ruby garnet.  Brooding, dark aromas of blackberry, black cherry and white pepper.  On the palate, while certainly dry, terrific “sweetness” of fruit, finishing with refreshing tannins and acidity.  A better balanced wine than the 2004.  Drink from early 2008 through 2012.  (MRO – 3/1/07)

Dark ruby-purple in color. Verging on opaque. Perfumed aromas of black raspberries, boysenberries, and bittersweet chocolate. On the palate, full-bodied but with wonderful balance. Tannins and acidity dictate this wine be given at least a year in bottle after release. Best from 2008 through 2012. (MRO – 3/1/07)

Dark ruby-purple in color. Verging on opaque. Perfumed aromas of black raspberries, boysenberries, and bittersweet chocolate. On the palate, full-bodied but with wonderful balance. Tannins and acidity dictate this wine be given at least a year in bottle after release. Best from 2008 through 2012. (MRO – 3/1/07)

Beautiful dark ruby garnet.  Aromas of red and black raspberries are intertwined with notes of smoke and earth.  Full bodied and creamy on entry but with pleasing tannins and acidity on the finish.  Another terrific Sonoma County Zinfandel at an even better price.  Enjoy late 2007 through 2011.  (MRO – 3/1/07)

Beautiful dark ruby garnet.  Aromas of red and black raspberries are intertwined with notes of smoke and earth.  Full bodied and creamy on entry but with pleasing tannins and acidity on the finish.  Another terrific Sonoma County Zinfandel at an even better price.  Enjoy late 2007 through 2011.  (MRO – 3/1/07)

Rated 94 by Wine Advocate. 85% Lake County and 15%Napa County. Age in neutral oak for 26 months. This rich, full bodied wine, possesses an opaque purple color in addition to a big sweet nose of black cherry, black pepper, and fresh earth. Cocoa aroma increase it’s attractiveness to one’s taste. It has a long broad finish that carries to the end.

Rated 91 by Wine Advocate. Aged for 18 months in French Oak barrels, 75% new, with a blend of Kenefic Ranch and Blackbird Vineyards, creates a medium dark ruby Merlot. It opens with a dense aroma of cedar cassis, black cherry and blackberry with a long powerful finish of coffee and dark chocolate. This huge expressive Merlot has good structure, supple integrated oak and great balance.

The 2005 Siduri Amber Ridge Pinot Noir has already received a 91 point rating from Allen Meadow’s highly respected publication that focuses on the wines of Burgundy (for more information check it out at www.burghound.com). Here’s what he writes, "A relatively reserved, deeply pitched and impressively complex nose offers lovely hints of spice, blueberry and violet aromas that give way to sweet, round and nicely detailed flavors that possess much better depth as well as excellent overall balance. This is an understated effort that has a real sense of harmony and grace to it.”

Substantial as well as soft and velvety-textured, the 2005 Pinot Noir Rosella’s Vineyard reveals a medium plum/ruby color, moderate body, sweet tannin, good acidity, and loads of pomegranate, cherry, raspberry, and forest floor notes. Drink this charmer over the next 5-6 years.- Robert Parker

Substantial as well as soft and velvety-textured, the 2005 Pinot Noir Rosella’s Vineyard reveals a medium plum/ruby color, moderate body, sweet tannin, good acidity, and loads of pomegranate, cherry, raspberry, and forest floor notes. Drink this charmer over the next 5-6 years.- Robert Parker

my_notes: Decant for up to four hours
other_notes: The 2005 Siduri Garys’ Vineyard Pinot Noir has already been the recipient of some wonderful press. Wine writer Robert Parker rated it “91-93 points” and described it this way, “dense and rich with underbrush and dark fruit characteristics as well as additional body and muscle, the 2005 Siduri Pinot Noir Garys’ Vineyard boasts fragrant aromatics and long, heady flavors. Enjoy it over the next 5-7 years.” Having recently tasted it alongside the 2004 Garys’, we can only say that we think the 2005 has tightened up a tad in the last few months and really starts blossoming after being open for 4 hours. We love this wine and think it will make for “old bones” should you choose to cellar it, but if you want to enjoy it now give it a bit of breathing time and you will be amply rewarded.

my_notes: This was very good with ribs.  Slightly sweet.

other_notes: This is a wine with a crisp natural acidity producing bright varietal characteristics. This Sauvignon Blanc is very fruity and lightly herbal in style (grapefruit, lemon grass, plum notes). It is a full bodied Sauvignon Blanc with good balance and length.

The Tokaj wine region is in north east Hungary and boasts the world’s first vineyard classification originating in the 17th century. The confluence of its two rivers, the Tisza and Bodrog, at Tokaj enable the wines to be produced in a unique style which has never been imitated. Now less than three hours from Budapest, more and more visitors are making their acquaintance with this classic wine region. Hungary is now part of the EU and the Tokaj region is now a World Heritage Site.The characteristics are a vivid gold colour with honeyed apricot and orange peel flavours which are uplifted with dramatic acidity.
Ripe red berry - wild cherry fruit, vanilla-caramel oak.  Fragrant Asian spices - Chinese 5-spice, white pepper and saffron.  Very smooth and nicely structured, long creamy finish.
Jammy red berry fruit, moderate creamy-caramel oak, rosemary and cardamon, white pepper in finish.  HUGE mouthful of wine, a bit chewy at the moment.
Deep blackberry fruit, with bit of black pepper spice.  Cedary oak spice, very dark chocolate, bit of warm vanilla at finish.  Structured tannins for aging.  Very young, better in six months.
Deep blackberry fruit and big spice plus black pepper, a touch of chocolate and cola in the oak contribution.  Richly textured in mouth, good structure for aging, long black fruit finish.

Pretty blackberry fruit and exotic lavendar floral.  Black pepper, a touch of cocoa-chocolate.  Richly textured in mouth, good structure for aging, long black fruit finish.  Very young yet, better in six months.

variety: Late Harvest Trousseau gris Sweet Caroline
other_notes: Luscious peach and pear fruit with a touch of mineral and floral spice.  Very crisp acidity balances sweetness delicately, so it dances on your tongue.  Finishes dryer than it really is, just a touch of honey.  Absolutely Divine with creamy blue cheese on grilled peaches.
Rich, full bodied Merlot.  Layered with youthfully intense berry and fruit flavors with a nuance of chocolate,  This estate wine drinks well now and promises subtlety and complexity for the future.

The palate has great texture and is both smooth and inviting, while the fruit (which is predominantly more red than black) has great Russian River Valley freshness. The finish is clean with a fine length.

my_notes: Very good with pasta and anchovy sauce.
other_notes: Fresh, crisp, ripe strawberry and cherry fruit give way to an easy drinker that was fermented dry and should be consumed before the summer ends.

my_notes: Good with meals, can’t taste the oak
other_notes: The family tradition of rich, harmonious and elegant oak-aged Burgundies continues in their range of leading appellations from the Cote-d’Or, Cote Chalonnaise and Chablis

my_notes: Good with meals.  No oak taste

other_notes: We have sourced three distinct vineyards in 2005 for our Sonoma Coast blend:  the various picking dates and clones from these vineyards located in Sebastopol, Freestone and Carneros added richness and layers of complexity to our”assemblage.”...In spite of its id palate weight and intensity, the wine shows red cherry freshness and good acidity.  Oriental spices and white pepper in the nose give way to fine grain tannins and creamy texture.  The wine is still young but yet very approachable now.

This elegant and crisp SB comes from Villa San Juliette vineyard lcoated in the northeast of the Paso Robles appelation.  The limestone-rich soil of this vineyard brings minerality and freshness to the wine.The wine can be characterized as rich and elegant with gorgeous aromatics.  The pale straw color is subtle and pure.  The nose is fresh, flinty and the wine expresses tropical notes of ripe peaches and agrumes (who knows?).  The wine is balanced by mineral acidity and fine grain tannins that keep the palate fresh, vibrant and crisp.  This food-friendly wine is ideal for light summer fare.

my_notes: Wine will gain in depth and complexity if decanted at room temperature for 2 or 3 hours before serving.
other_notes: This wine made from mature hillside vines has ripe, deep and exotic layered aromas built around plums, smoke and earth.  The rich palate shows multiple layers of concentrated black fruit with chocolate, spices and roasted flavors.  The wine has a full and smooth palate that displays a linearity and purity of fruit.  The finish lingers with fruit freshness and acidity.  Wine will gain in depth and complexity if decanted at room temperature for 2 or 3 hours before serving.

variety: Champagne or Sparkling Blanc de Blancs
other_notes: Blanc de Blancs (white from white) made from Chardonnay is the counterpart to the Blanc de Noirs (white from black), made from Pinot Noir.The Schramsberg style of Blanc de Blancs is dry and crisp. Small lots of malolactic- and barrel-fermented wines are added for complexity. The wine is aged on the yeast lees in the bottle for some two years prior to disgorgement. With its vibrant, fruitful and crisp nature, this sparkling wine will maintain its freshness, structure and refined finish for many years, even decades following its initial release. While this wine can be enjoyed by itself as an apéritif, it is also perfect with fresh oysters and other shellfish, crab cakes, ceviche and grilled sea bass. It is also delicious with lemon chicken and Thai curries. Serve with aged Gouda or other hard cheeses and as a counterpoint to soft triple creams. Tasting Notes “The relatively warm 2004 season delivered a generously flavored Blanc de Blancs with alluring aromas of green apple, citrus and tropical fruits. Rich, tart, Bayview Avenue Carneros Chardonnay form the core, with components ranging from the Marin Coast to the Anderson Valley contributing further depth of fruit. Yeast-derived notes of fresh sourdough and toasted almond blend with hints of crème brûlée. On the palate, this lively sparkler is ripe and crisp with tangy lemon zest early on, progressing to a clean, balanced finish.”

Medium bodied and angular in it’s youth, our 05 Garys’ Vineyard Pinot Noir shows lush plum color, creamy, blackberry and black cherry notes on the nose and layers of dark fruit, cinnamon and rhubarb on the palate. This is a very elegant wine that will only improve with cellaring for up to five year

Immediately gratifying, our 05 Pisoni Vineyard Pinot Noir shows vibrant color, classic Pisoni earth, black cherry and minerality on the nose followed by lush, bright and well rounded flavors on the mouth. Drink now or hold for up to five years

Immediately gratifying, our 05 Pisoni Vineyard Pinot Noir shows vibrant color, classic Pisoni earth, black cherry and minerality on the nose followed by lush, bright and well rounded flavors on the mouth. Drink now or hold for up to five years

A beautifully harmonious and deeply flavored wine, our 05 Rosella’s Vineyard Syrah shows fresh, lively aromas with touches of citrus and earth . On the palate, round, creamy, lush-blackberry flavors abound. A great food wine, drink now or hold for up to five years.

Our '05 Garys’ Vineyard Syrah is a beautifully structured, elegant wine revealing lush blackberry, plum , blueberry and subtle mint and rubbed spice on the nose. On the palate, fresh, silky and generous flavors are balanced by a good backbone of acidity. Another tremendous food wine that can be opened upon release or cellared for up to five years.

Sourced predominantly from Garys’ Vineyard, our 05 Santa Lucia Highlands Syrah is a fresh, clean, silky and deeply aromatic wine highlighted by energetic blackberry notes, a round mouthfeel and a touch of SLH’s classic citrus notes. Drink now or hold for up to five years

The result is a wine with a crisp natural acidity producing bright varietal characteristics. This Sauvignon Blanc is very fruity and lightly herbal in style (grapefruit, lemon grass, plum notes). It is a full bodied Sauvignon Blanc with good balance and length.

This wine exhibits the aromas and flavors we love: loads of grapefruit, gooseberry and citrus flavors along with tropical fruit and grassy notes.  Vineyard Blend:  Sauvignon Blanc:73% Griva Vineyard, 23% Ventana Vineyard, both Arroyo Seco Appellation  Semillon: 4% Takahashi Vineyard, Napa Appellation
Our Fumé Blanc exhibits bright citrus, melon, floral and mineral character from Napa Valley vineyards and a silky texture for sur lie barrel aging.

Dark ruby purple.  Again, nearly opaque.  Intoxicating, deep aromas of blackberries, dark chocolate, with a hint of black pepper and orange peel.  On the palate, rich and full bodied with that unmistakable Rossi “garrigue” (pepper, lavender, and wild herbs).  Pleasing tannins on the finish.  A real step up from the outstanding ’03.  Enjoy from early 2007 through 2011.  (MRO – 11/1/06)

my_notes: Christmas dinner Pork Roast with Mustard
other_notes: A brilliant effort, this dark ruby/purple-hued 2005 Pinot Noir Pisoni Vineyards exhibits aromas of forest floor, spring flowers, black currants, blueberries, and raspberries. Full-bodied, opulent, rich, structured, and dense, 2-3 years of cellaring will bring out additional nuances. It should keep for 12-15 years.- Robert Parker, Wine Advocate Issue 172

Nice light Viognier to go with a light meal.  Worth getting again
This went well with food, but didn’t hold up on its own afterwards.
This went really well with Shrimp Creole.  At this price the wine is really a great find.

other_notes: This wine SCREAMS Keefer Ranch. A laser beam focused rush of bright cherry on the nose. Big, expansive mouthfeel of cherry and tangy acidity. If youre a fan of Keefer Ranch, you will be thrilled with this wine.

Big and bold -- another winner from the Santa Rita Hills. Rivaling the Momtazi in weight, the Turner's nose is all about black fruit and spice. Reminiscent of early Clos Pepe Pinots, this wine shows huge depth and structure.

Deeply layered and complex, not unlike Peter Cargasacchi himself. On the nose and palate are loads of dark fruit and a touch of earthiness. Good structure with some fine-grained tannin and bright acidity.
Dark and brooding, the 2006 Durell is packed with dark fruits and forest floor on the nose. Super rich and concentrated, with a nice earthy component. Nice hint of tannin adds to a killer finish.

Given our yields ran counter to most of the valley, the resulting wines reflect the density that small crops are capable of.  Is the 2005 Zinfandel the darkest, richest, sappiest, most forward Outpost yet?  We’re not sure it’s up to us to say.  It’s blacker hued this year for sure with a strong streak of blackberry cream that usually takes a few years in bottle to develop.  The brambly spice/pepper combo is present as always but this year’s version seems to strike a balance between fruit and spice much earlier than previous editions.  The fruit profile also leans more toward black than red which tends, and maybe it’s just psychological, to translate as richer and more forward.  Crop levels could also be behind this or full physiological maturity through true ripening.  In truth it’s probably elements of all of the above.

This wine is bound to create some controversy.  For clarity’s sake we feel like we should first explain what this wine isn’t.  It’s not dark, it has no new oak, and it’s not a fruit bomb.  The wine does possess incredible nuance and layering that extends from the first smell to the very long finish. The wine is barely medium colored owing to its 100% Grenache nature.  We employed 50% whole cluster in the ferment to add varietal character and complexity to both the aromatics and the finish. The stems impart more of what people think of as soil driven characteristics:  black tea, pine needles, dried herbs, lavender, sweet tobacco and sassafras, especially on the nose.  Pure Grenache fruit takes over on the palate.  Again, the stems keep the wine from turning into a one dimensional wine by cutting into the fruit with something savory.  In this case and owing to its Howell Mountain origins, it’s white and black pepper, seared beef, a continuation of the tobacco leaf and something else just beyond description.  It’s definitely a unique experiece as far as California wines go.

The fruit is hugely jammy razzberry with some dusty Asian/Moroccan spices like cumin, coriander and white pepper. It is slowly developing some lovely creamy milk chocolate, as well as a bit of brown sugar in the finish. With 15.1% alcohol, this is a "humongous" wine indeed, but does not appear awkwardly hot or overtly alcoholic, just big, chewy, and mouthfilling!On its June release, the 2004 Monga Zin® was still showing a bit chewy tannins and had not opened up much in nose or mouth. That has changed now, and the wine has developed a depth of flavor and complexity that has caught the approval of quite a few judges. It has won 5 Gold medals and the Best of Show at the Jefferson Cup Invitational n MO in December 2004. It has at least 5-7 years ahead before that powerful red fruit fades out.

The overall impression is not over-oaked for the amount of big fruit present. The jammy-peppery fruit flavors married beautifully with the sweetly smoky-chocolatey oak, and the alcohol, a hefty 15.8%, while making a BIG impression, does NOT appear terribly hot. It is delicious in the short term, with a round creaminess in the mouthfeel and bright red berry fruit, but it will improve for at least 5 years from its release date. Try it with any BBQ, tomato sauces, spicy stuff like chipotle or Szechwan glazes on ribs, and it has a special affinity for game and DUCK.

We love to just drink this Zin for its lush juicy fruit and the layers of interesting spice and earthy richness. Full of freshly-ground black pepper aromas and some nice cedary-spicy oak components, it has a rich creamy mouthfeel despite its firm tannic backbone. This vintage shows a touch of gaminess that I find quite reminiscent of a nice Cotes du Rhone. That wild note is beautifully compatible with game meats, especially duck, or actually with any grilled meats. I also had a nice paring which surprised me—Alaskan halibut with a porcini mushroom sauce.
Deep blackberry fruit and big spice plus black pepper, a touch of chocolate and cola in the oak contribution.  Richly textured in mouth, good structure for aging, long black fruit finish.

my_notes: This was really good.  It was almost like a Zin.  Great with red beans & rice
other_notes: Lush blueberry and plum fruit, smoky-earthy essence and a nice bit of white pepper and Asian lilies.  Round and juicy and meaty in flavors.  Can age for at least 5 years.  Great with hearty foods, stews.

variety: Zinfandel  Late Harvest Zinfandel Black Magic
other_notes: Inky blue-purple in color, yummy deep razz=blackberry jam and luscious dark chocolate of oak spices, sweet but not clumsy, pleasingly balanced with a bit of tartness, not at all hotly alcoholic, bit of warm vanilla on the finish.  Perfect with many foods from savory cheese plates to decadent chocolate desserts.

Full-bodied PinotThe backbone of this blend comes from one of our favorite vineyards in the Russian River Valley located between Sebastopol and Forestville on gently sloping hills.An extended cool and unusually wet spring set the stage for a late harvest. A long, temperate growing season followed, allowing for slow, full and even ripening of the fruit. The multiple sun exposures and the diverse clonal selection of this vineyard enabled us to be more flexible with our picking dates for an optimum maturity of our different blocks. The wine displays its typical Russian River attributes such as cola, orange peel, macerated cherries and oriental spices while its dark and earthy structure reveal an ageing potential for the next 4 to 6 years.

This elegant and highly-toned Syrah comes from a cooler vineyard in the Columbia Valley in Washington State.100% of this Columbia Valley is sourced from Boushey Vineyard, close to the town of Grandview in the mid-Yakima Valley, at 900-1200 feet elevation. Syrah grapes are grown on a particular south facing slope called “Grande Côte” characterized by good air drainage and cooler climate compared to other regions. The owner, Dick Boushey, is one of the most reputable grower in Washington state, serving for years as a leader in Washington’s budding wine industry. The long growing season (harvest in October) and the unique soil greatly enhance the wines complexity: blackcurrant, minerality and sustained acidity characterize this wines' s aromatic profile.
The limestone widely found in the southwest of France appelation “Cote de Gascogne” reveals in this French Colombard a fresh minerality and subtle roundness.

Fine tiny bubbles and a long lasting mousse are the usual footprints of the L’Ermitage cuvée. This cuvee of the Millenium is fruity (apple, peach) with a delicate bread crust note. Mouth feel is on well balanced wine with baked apple flavors and a long and round creamy finish.

Vineyard Blend:  Sauvignon Blanc:73% Griva Vineyard, 23% Ventana Vineyard, both Arroyo Seco Appellation  Semillon: 4% Takahashi Vineyard, Napa Appellation
Delicate, charming, elegant, refined and fruity.

Our Pinot Noir has a bright red fruit profile with a nice strawberry jam and black cherry aroma. Smooth and round interlaced with a hint of raspberry and white pepper. Good acid backbone, well focused on the finish with light toasted oak and some tannins.

Dark black-ruby. A deliciously floral nose of violets, lavender, licorice, and black olive. Can you say “Côte-Rôtie”? Quite fleshy on entry but not at all heavy or over the top. Flavors of blackberry, cherry, and olive tapenade are supported by fine tannins and acidity. Concentrated yet elegant. A joy to drink and a wine that we would like to achieve in every vintage. Drink 2008 through 2015.

my_notes: Gave to Danie and Aron as a dinner gift

Dark ruby-purple. Gorgeous aromas of gun powder, crushed rock, black pepper, and blackberries with hints of citrus and raw beef. On the palate, moderately full-bodied with savory flavors of pepper, beef, minerals, and dark berries. Very complex! Refreshing acidity and tannin on the finish indicate that this wine should develop beautifully in bottle. Drink 2009 through 2018.

Opaque black-purple. Aromas of black plums, blackberries, and crème de cassis are highlighted by notes of spring flowers and pain grillé. On the palate, opulent and full-bodied with near perfect balance. Easily the finest we have done to date with this vineyard. While enjoyable now with decanting, optimum drinking should be 2009 through 2016.

Opaque inky-purple. A pure and expressive nose of cassis, blackberry, green olive, and Asian Five-Spice. Reminds me of walking into Pier One Imports as a kid. All those exotic wood and incense smells! A full and rich entry leads to a tannic but long finish. Like the Cardiac Hill, this wine should age quite well. Drink 2009 through 2018. (MRO – 10/15/07)

Very dark black-ruby. Nearly opaque. Wickedly dark, luscious aromas of blackberry, black cherry, and a dash of vanilla. Mmmmm! Impressively concentrated yet quite suave in texture with fine grained tannins on the finish. Much more showy than the 2004 at this stage yet lower alcohol as well. Drink 2008 through 2014. (MRO – 10/15/07)

Flavors of black licorice and berry compote carry through to the impressive finish. Dee-lish! Drink mid-2008 through 2017. (MRO – 10/15/07)

Dark purple-ruby. A drop-dead gorgeous nose of spring flowers, mulberry, cassis, and spice. Classic Carlisle Vineyard. On the palate, full and rich with an explosion of raspberry, cassis, and briery flavors. Quite structured and serious for zinfandel. Interestingly, although a bit riper than the ’04, much fresher and without any notes of surmaturité. A true reflection of the vintage. Enjoy 2009 through 2015. (MRO – 10/15/07)

The palate is lush with bright fruit flavors and the finish is balanced by perfect acidity.  Try one in 2008, but the patient will be rewarded from 2009 and on.

The 2006 version shows classic Rosella’s Vineyard characteristics, and is a testament to Gary Franscioni’s unparalleled farming of his vineyard.  It starts with the intriguingly spicy and fruit-driven nose which immediately tells you the wine is from the Santa Lucia Highlands.  The natural acidity on the palate brings the wonderful rhubarb and cola flavors into focus in time for the long, slightly toasty finish.  The 2006 Rosella’s Pinot Noir should drink well from the end of 2008 through at least 2012.

The 2006 Rosella’s Pinot Noir should drink well from the end of 2008 through at least 2012.

The 2006 version shows classic Rosella’s Vineyard characteristics, and is a testament to Gary Franscioni’s unparalleled farming of his vineyard.  It starts with the intriguingly spicy and fruit-driven nose which immediately tells you the wine is from the Santa Lucia Highlands.  The natural acidity on the palate brings the wonderful rhubarb and cola flavors into focus in time for the long, slightly toasty finish.  The 2006 Rosella’s Pinot Noir should drink well from the end of 2008 through at least 2012.

Unlike the other 2005 Pinot Noirs I made for August West, Freeman and Fort Ross, which were all bottled after 10 to 11 months in barrel, the Sandler saw an extra year in barrel. I wouldn't say this made for an oakier wine as it did a softer, less acidic and more accessible wine. I suggest trying a bottle of the 2005 Sonoma Coast Pinot soon and then deciding how much more cellar aging it needs. I predict it will be drinking well almost right away.The vineyards which make up the 2005 Sandler Sonoma Coast Pinot Noir are Rayhill, Guidici, Thorn Ridge, Kanzler and Graham. They're some of the finest vineyards in Sonoma County, and they are all worthy of single vineyard status. It's very interesting for me to be able to put them together in this negociant cuvée.

At this young stage, the wine is showing an intense black pepper nose, with a full palate and plenty of youthful but not obtrusive tannin. It seems to benefit from a couple hours in a decanter.

my_notes: Traded with Paul for a bottle to be named later
other_notes: At this young stage, the wine is showing an intense black pepper nose, with a full palate and plenty of youthful but not obtrusive tannin. It seems to benefit from a couple hours in a decanter.

The 2005 Columbia Valley Cabernet Sauvignon (97% Cabernet Sauvignon, 3% Merlot) is loaded with blackberry, blueberry, plum and cassis with nuances of dark chocolate and violets. Classically structured, this complex wine has remarkable elegance and persistence on the long, pure finish. Approachable now, it should reach maturity around 2012 and age for 25 or more years. While we are particularly proud of the last three vintages of our flagship wine, the 2005 Cabernet Sauvignon easily rivals them as one of the best wines our estate has ever produced.

Rated 89+ by Wine Advocate. A dark ruby color, this Cabernet Sauvignon was aged for 18 months in French Oak barrels, 75% new. This well balanced wine has great structure. It is full bodied, yet elegant and refined. It has an intense nose of blackberry and black cherry, dark chocolate and sweet integrated oak. The flavors continue through the mid palate with the addition of spice and fine soft tannin.

Rated 91 by Wine Advocate. Aged for 18 months in French Oak barrels, 75% new, with a blend of Kenefic Ranch and Blackbird Vineyards, creates a medium dark ruby Merlot. It opens with a dense aroma of cedar cassis, black cherry and blackberry with a long powerful finish of coffee and dark chocolate. This huge expressive Merlot has good structure, supple integrated oak and great balance.

variety: Hapa Rhone Blend, 65% Syrah, 20% Grenache, 15% Mourvedre
vineyard: Syrah & Grenache, Tierra Alta. Mourvedre,Camp Four & Tierra Alta
my_notes: This was delicious.  Nice fruit, with blueberries as it opened up.  The next day it was different - more chocolate, tobacco, less fruit
other_notes: This was amazing. So much so I just drank and didn't even think of evaluating. What I remember is that it had a nice dusky red-purple color. Nice fruit acid balance. The grenache, although only 20% was noticeable and that is good. It was like drinking candy. We have a small amount left and will try and update this

my_notes: This was wonderful with a salad of romaine, roasted chicken, blue cheese and tomato.
other_notes: Tight on opening; a lot of heat and sweet. After a couple hours the flavors and body fell into balance, and it remained an interesting wine through finish the next evening. Pencil, floral notes, vanilla, and spice among the cherry aromas. Candy dark fruit with nice citrus acidity; a little raspberry sweetart in the middle. Earthy, peppery finish. Very flavorful on its own, but also very good food wine.

Tight on opening; a lot of heat and sweet. After a couple hours the flavors and body fell into balance, and it remained an interesting wine through finish the next evening. Pencil, floral notes, vanilla, and spice among the cherry aromas. Candy dark fruit with nice citrus acidity; a little raspberry sweetart in the middle. Earthy, peppery finish. Very flavorful on its own, but also very good food wine.
Wine Spectator: 92 pts. Generous layers of ripe blackberry, wild berry and raspberry are tight focused, long and persistent, ending with firm, ripe tannins and a nice spicy edge.
Wine Spectator: 92 pts. Generous layers of ripe blackberry, wild berry and raspberry are tight focused, long and persistent, ending with firm, ripe tannins and a nice spicy edge.

winery: Chateau Ste. Michelle & Dr. Loosen Eroica

other_notes: Medium dark ruby in color. Nose is vibrant and redolent with aromas of boysenberry and black raspberry framed in oak vanillins with a touch of herb. Expansive and fruit forward on the palate with cherries, black raspberries, white pepper, Oriental spice and earthiness, with a touch of cedar on the finish. Juicy and seamless, full bodied and rich. Moderate tannins that will soften with time. Rustic elegance. The best expression yet of terroir from this Humboldt vineyard.

Light to medium ruby in color, this offering evokes a perfume of flowers, Naked Ladies and Musk Rose, as well as brown sugar, strawberries and raspberries, with cardamom adding spice; herbal, smoky overtones, a complex tapestry of aromatics. On the palate, this classic Russian River Valley gushes with cherries, cola, red licorice, and warm strawberry rhubarb pie. Finishes with flinty, chalky and earthy tones, rich, and well integrated with sweet oak. Beware this silken offering is seductive, bottle after bottle. Should cellar well for at least 6 - 8 years. Fill ones mouth and kiss thy lover! Splendor in the glass indeed!

Intense dark razzberry fruit, very smoky-chocolatey oak, almost cola-like - nose opens up more with an hour to breathe.  Very rich and dense mouthfeel, nice creamy vanilla-cocoa oak, long blackberry finish.  Still young, needs 6 months to get over bottle shock and will cellar another 5 years.

Intense dark razzberry fruit, very smoky-chocolatey oak, almost cola-like - nose opens up more with an hour to breathe.  Very rich and dense mouthfeel, nice creamy vanilla-cocoa oak, long blackberry finish.  Still young, needs 6 months to get over bottle shock and will cellar another 5 years.

Wonderfully wildberry fruit nose, very pretty with candied violets and a bit of orange peel, nice warm brown spices like nutmeg and clove.  Lots of stuff going on once it opens up.  Nice soft mouthfeel - creamy oak but showcases fruit more than oak - not heavy in body but good intensity nonetheless.  Needs to open more but is showing well now too - can age another 5 years.

Wonderfully wildberry fruit nose, very pretty with candied violets and a bit of orange peel, nice warm brown spices like nutmeg and clove.  Lots of stuff going on once it opens up.  Nice soft mouthfeel - creamy oak but showcases fruit more than oak - not heavy in body but good intensity nonetheless.  Needs to open more but is showing well now too - can age another 5 years.

Dark ruby-purple. Red fruits (raspberries, cherries, and plums) are mixed with suggestions of chocolate and loamy earth. On the palate, full bodied with a mouth-counting richness that belies the acidity and tannin. Optimum enjoyment should be between late 2008 and 2014.

Dark ruby-garnet. Classic Montafi aromas of red and black berries intertwined with notes of bay leaf and eucalyptus. On the palate, full-bodied and well-balanced with flavors echoing the aromas. Very long on the finish. Less like the 2005 and more like the 2004. Man this is good! Drink 2008-2012

Dark ruby-garnet. Classic Montafi aromas of red and black berries intertwined with notes of bay leaf and eucalyptus. On the palate, full-bodied and well-balanced with flavors echoing the aromas. Very long on the finish. Less like the 2005 and more like the 2004. Man this is good! Drink 2008-2012

Medium-dark to dark ruby. Wow! Head-turning aromas of black cherry and blackberry are mixed with notes of red licorice and allsorts. What a sniff! Full bodied but impeccably balanced. This is a real step up from the excellent 2005. Drinking well now, we see little reason to wait. Enjoy 2008-2011

Medium-dark to dark ruby. Wow! Head-turning aromas of black cherry and blackberry are mixed with notes of red licorice and allsorts. What a sniff! Full bodied but impeccably balanced. This is a real step up from the excellent 2005. Drinking well now, we see little reason to wait. Enjoy 2008-2011

Dark ruby-purple. Nearly opaque. An absolutely intoxicating nose of black raspberry, briar, and herbs. Fabulous! The wine enters full and rich but acidity and tannins are in perfect balance. As seamless a zinfandel as we have ever produced. Enjoy this bit of history from release through 2013.

Dark ruby-purple. Nearly opaque. An absolutely intoxicating nose of black raspberry, briar, and herbs. Fabulous! The wine enters full and rich but acidity and tannins are in perfect balance. As seamless a zinfandel as we have ever produced. Enjoy this bit of history from release through 2013.

Dark ruby-purple. Nearly opaque. An absolutely intoxicating nose of black raspberry, briar, and herbs. Fabulous! The wine enters full and rich but acidity and tannins are in perfect balance. As seamless a zinfandel as we have ever produced. Enjoy this bit of history from release through 2013.

Dark ruby-garnet. Gorgeous aromas of blackberry, crème de cassis, and spring flowers meet the nose. On the palate, flavors of blackberry and herbs. Full-bodied but with refreshing tannins on the finish. While enjoyable now, additional complexity should develop with bottle age. Drink 2009-2016.

Dark ruby-garnet. Gorgeous aromas of blackberry, crème de cassis, and spring flowers meet the nose. On the palate, flavors of blackberry and herbs. Full-bodied but with refreshing tannins on the finish. While enjoyable now, additional complexity should develop with bottle age. Drink 2009-2016.

Medium-dark to dark ruby. Delicious scents of red and black cherries are mixed with hints of iron, earth, and freshly roasted coffee beans. While full-bodied on entry, the petite sirah component quickly flexes its muscle, with sweet tannins appearing in the mid-palate through the lusty finish. Unquestionably our best Dry Creek Valley Zinfandel since the 2002. Optimum drinking should be between late 2008 through 2013.

Medium-dark ruby. Maraschino cherries, red licorice whips, and just a hint of buttery-goodness greet the nose. Mmmmmm! On the palate, quite full-bodied but with ample tannins and acidity, not at all flabby or oafish. This should age quite well. Begin drinking in mid-2009 and enjoy through 2015

Medium-dark ruby. Maraschino cherries, red licorice whips, and just a hint of buttery-goodness greet the nose. Mmmmmm! On the palate, quite full-bodied but with ample tannins and acidity, not at all flabby or oafish. This should age quite well. Begin drinking in mid-2009 and enjoy through 2015

Dark ruby-garnet. Heady aromas of blackberry and crème de cassis emerge from the glass but this time, mixed with a suggestion of talc and earth. Full-bodied and opulent. The ample tannins are nearly obscured by the abundant fruit. This wine should provide optimum pleasure between 2008 and 2015

Dark ruby-garnet. Heady aromas of blackberry and crème de cassis emerge from the glass but this time, mixed with a suggestion of talc and earth. Full-bodied and opulent. The ample tannins are nearly obscured by the abundant fruit. This wine should provide optimum pleasure between 2008 and 2015

Dark ruby-garnet. Fascinating aromas of buttered popcorn and ruby red grapefruit (the signature of Rosella’s syrah) soar from the glass. On the palate, full bodied with a burst of grapefruit on the long finish. Of the three syrahs released this spring, this is the most forward and approachable. Enjoy 2008 through 2013.

Dark ruby-garnet. Fascinating aromas of buttered popcorn and ruby red grapefruit (the signature of Rosella’s syrah) soar from the glass. On the palate, full bodied with a burst of grapefruit on the long finish. Of the three syrahs released this spring, this is the most forward and approachable. Enjoy 2008 through 2013.

Unquestionably our best Dry Creek Valley Zinfandel since the 2002. Optimum drinking should be between late 2008 through 2013.
