Aromatics:  Complex and enticing. Ripe black cherrry, lush blackberry with earthy undertones of mushroom, smoke and a dusting of cocoa.On the palate:  A true expression of Sonoma Coast, the 2006 vintage is deep and exotic with layers of ripe black and red fruit and a touch of pie crust. This dense wine fills the palate and yet exhibits hints of minerality, with a lengthy finish. The intense flavors of blackberry, green tea and earthy notes are a prelude to a very long, elegant finish.

Aromatics:  Complex and enticing. Ripe black cherrry, lush blackberry with earthy undertones of mushroom, smoke and a dusting of cocoa.On the palate:  A true expression of Sonoma Coast, the 2006 vintage is deep and exotic with layers of ripe black and red fruit and a touch of pie crust. This dense wine fills the palate and yet exhibits hints of minerality, with a lengthy finish. The intense flavors of blackberry, green tea and earthy notes are a prelude to a very long, elegant finish

Aromatics:  Briary, with ripe blackberry and soft notes of tobacco. Hints of cocoa offer a dark background.On the palate:  Mouth-coating with initial flavors of freshly crushed blueberries. The midpalate reveals traces of cigar box, hints of cedar and cracked pepper. The gripping texture carries the melody of flavors to a beautiful, lengthy finish.

Aromatics:  Intense raspberry, sweet plum and strawberry.On the palate:  The 2006 Russian River Valley Pinot Noir initially delivers deep flavors of cola, dark cherry and sweet spices. Traces of vanilla bean crème brûlée pleasantly greet the midpalate. Touches of wet stone and sassafras add to the enjoyable texture and exhilarating finish.

Aromatics:  Intense raspberry, sweet plum and strawberry.On the palate:  The 2006 Russian River Valley Pinot Noir initially delivers deep flavors of cola, dark cherry and sweet spices. Traces of vanilla bean crème brûlée pleasantly greet the midpalate. Touches of wet stone and sassafras add to the enjoyable texture and exhilarating finish.

Aromatics:  Bright cherry and rose petal with a hint of spice.On the palate:  Traces of cream laced with ripe cherry and a dusting of citrus. Hints of sweet raspberry are balanced with fresh, elegant acidity.

Aromatics:  Bright cherry and rose petal with a hint of spice.On the palate:  Traces of cream laced with ripe cherry and a dusting of citrus. Hints of sweet raspberry are balanced with fresh, elegant acidity.

Medium-dark ruby. Maraschino cherries, red licorice whips, and just a hint of buttery-goodness greet the nose. Mmmmmm! On the palate, quite full-bodied but with ample tannins and acidity, not at all flabby or oafish. This should age quite well. Begin drinking in mid-2009 and enjoy through 2015

Lush blueberry and plum fruit, smoky-earthy essence and a nice bit of white pepper and Asian lilies.  Round and juicy and meaty in flavors.  Can age for at least 5 years.  Great with hearty foods, stews.

The 2006 Freeman Sonoma Coast Pinot Noir shows off blackberry, roasted tea and fennel scents from its subtle nose.  The palate is probably the fullest on a Freeman Sonoma Coast since the 2003.  There are plenty of chewy tannins which surround a mouthful of rich fruit and a long finish, and we predict this will be drinking well from late 2008 through 2015.

Usually, the Akiko’s Cuvée has the shyest nose among our Pinot Noirs, but this is not so with the 2006 version.  There are intriguing aromas of dried roses, sassafras and forest floor which practically jump out of the glass within 5 minutes of the bottle being opened.  The palate is pleasantly soft with perfectly balanced acidity and pretty fruit flavors.  There is a fair amount of tannin in the long, berry-like finish.  We would say the 2006 Akiko’s will be approachable soon after release in 2008 and it should drink well for at least 7 more years.

Similar to 2005, the 2006 Freeman Russian River Valley Pinot Noir will be the most approachable Pinot in our line up.  The nose is shy at first, but opens up to reveal interesting scents of pomegranates and earth.  The palate is lush with plum flavors, round tannins and fairly low acidity.  The fruit goes on and on in the finish and predicts a Pinot which should drink well for the next 6 years.

The 2006 Freeman Sonoma Coast Pinot Noir shows off blackberry, roasted tea and fennel scents from its subtle nose.  The palate is probably the fullest on a Freeman Sonoma Coast since the 2003.  There are plenty of chewy tannins which surround a mouthful of rich fruit and a long finish, and we predict this will be drinking well from late 2008 through 2015.

This is the third of our three new vineyards in 2006.  Aubaine is an amazing site located just north of Santa Maria along the coast between Nipomo and Pismo Beach. The wine is dominated by a very beautiful deep red fruit nose - one of those wines that makes you want to curl up inot the glass for a while.  The wine is big and plush, but carries the weight well.

A “classic” Cargasacchi Pinot, with deep red fruit and forest floor nose, plush midpaalte, and great finish.  Peter is constanly experimenting in the vineyard - fine tuning his already proven farming practices.

A “classic” Cargasacchi Pinot, with deep red fruit and forest floor nose, plush midpaalte, and great finish.  Peter is constanly experimenting in the vineyard - fine tuning his already proven farming practices.

Big, focused, intense wine - but what else would you expect from Clos Pepe?  Big black and red fruit nose with lots of spice (white pepper, nutmeg).  Very focused and plush on the palate, with great acidity and balance.  This wine will probably age well, and given how good it tastes now, I think this will prove to be the best wine we’ve ever made.  It continues to impress us more and more as it develops in the bottle.

Big, focused, intense wine - but what else would you expect from Clos Pepe?  Big black and red fruit nose with lots of spice (white pepper, nutmeg).  Very focused and plush on the palate, with great acidity and balance.  This wine will probably age well, and given how good it tastes now, I think this will prove to be the best wine we’ve ever made.  It continues to impress us more and more as it develops in the bottle.

This is a HUGE wine.  Big, deep, super black fruit nose. Super deep and plush on the palate.  It doesn’t really present as a typical Santa Maria Pinot-more like Sta. Rita Hills.  This is a WOW wine for me every time I taste it, and is one of my favorites of the vintage.

This is a HUGE wine.  Big, deep, super black fruit nose. Super deep and plush on the palate.  It doesn’t really present as a typical Santa Maria Pinot-more like Sta. Rita Hills.  This is a WOW wine for me every time I taste it, and is one of my favorites of the vintage.

From an incredibly steep, limestone vineyard on the West Side -- this wine is intense without being heavy.  Surprisingly, it’s the most elegant of our Spring Release wines, despite coming from an area known more for Rhone Style wines.  Black and red fruit profile, with nice baking spice elements.  The wine has a nice touch of oak, good acidity, and sweet tannins that balance out the fruit.

my_notes: Seems to go especially well with chili pepper.  Alan had chipotle chili with popcorn and says it goes extremely well.  We had
other_notes: Bright, pale yellow. Fruit-driven aromas of dried peach and apricot, with a buttery nuance. Silky, round and soft, with just enough acidity to maintain its freshness and shape and buffer its ten grams of sugar. Flavor of vineyard peach. Very easy to drink. Stephen Tanzer 87

We're happy to say it is delicious. This Touraine combines the finesse, subtley, and herbed, succulent fruit of Pinot Noir with the refreshing gulpable, snappiness of rose. It is the perfect accompaniment to cool, herbed meals of summer, and boy does it refresh the core on a hot day///(2006) refreshing crisp and clean mouthfeel. Better when it warm up a bit.

A crisp, fresh, zesty wine composed of ugni blanc and colombard. So refreshing, so versatile, so affordable! Proprietor Yves Grassa, a wine-making visionary, took grapes destined for the distillery, applied modern vinification practices that best capture and retain the vivacity of young white wine, and produced one of the best wine values of the world for the last 20+ years!!! I love this wine served as cold as you can get it. "If Domaine de Pouy isn't one of the finest white values in the world.....than I will show up in public with a glass of V-8 juice(Valtellina).....the 2006 continues a nearly 20 year run of excellence of this Cotes de Gascogne.....light(10.5% alcohol),loaded with crisp grapefruit and lime-like notes....zesty....fresh...and clean as a mountain spring....this is delicious wine that is totally tank fermented and aged....available just about every good wine shop for $10 or less....and finished with a screwcap for you corkophobes...the newly released 2006...an excellent vintage for white varietals in that neck of the world...is going down the gullet as I type...and holding up nicely with some very spicy homemade Maryland crab soup...just think-for the price of one bottle of oxidized white Burgundy you can have 24-36 bottles of something delicious....give me pleasure over prestige anytime...any place...." - Robert Parker

winery: Domaine de La Petite Cassagne Costiéres de Nîmes
other_notes: This very pleasant Rhone white, based on Grenache Blanc, exhibits plenty of peach and tropical fruit. Perfectly gulpable, and very affordable.-- Patrick Mitten, Wine House Staff Notes, April 8, 2008

winery: Domaine de La Petite Cassagne Costiéres de Nîmes
my_notes: Good, hearty rose’.  Very dry. Really good with Alapai Chicken Piccata
other_notes: With its scents of melon rind and wet stones, this is clearly no tutti-frutti rosé. There’s a hint of cherry, but the emphasis is on lipsmacking minerality from the start all the way through the long, mouthwatering finish. Score: 88. —Joe Czerwinski, July 01, 2007. Wine Enthusiast 88 point

A blend of 60% Grenache, 20% Syrah, 12% Mourvedre and 8% Cinsault, this wine likewise hails from 4 different terroirs (hence Les Quatre Terres): 1/3 each Rasteau, Seguret and a mix of Vacqueyras and Rouaix. While this is clearly not site specific, this creates a composite immediately identifiable as Southern Rhone. A beautiful fresh rasperry-like robe prepares intense aromas of garrigue and black pepper. Although this has a ripe core of brambly fruit, it leaves a primary impression of intense spice and smoked meat. This can stand firm alongside many a fine Vacqueyras or Gigondas.-- Patrick Mitten, Wine House Staff Notes, January 17, 2008Robert Parker's Wine Advocate:  84 point

Chocolaty, earthy, and full-bodied is the 2003 Cotes du Rhone-Villages Rasteau Les Blovac, a blend of 70% Grenache, 15% Syrah, and 15% Mourvedre. A deep ruby/purple hue is followed by scents of chocolate, berries, truffles, and a hint of scorched earth in this full-bodied, rustic, flavorful, substantial wine.Reviewed By: Wine Advocate Rating: 87 Wine Spectator:  86 points

appellation: Vin de Pays d'Oc, from the Languedoc-Roussillon area in Mediterranean France
other_notes: Grenache and Roussanne working very well together here, the former lending a fine honied texture, the latter spring flower aromatics and definition on the palateSimon Field M.W. - Rhône BuyerDrink: 2008-2009Medium-Full Bodied, Dry, White, Southern Rhône Blend, Drink or Keep, 13% alc.
(2005) Varied ratings averaging 87.8 pts. Comments all over the board

Bright, refreshing and clean as a whistle, this 50/50 Sauvignon/Semillon blend provides plenty of snappy grapefruit and green pea character. Succulent on the palate, where tangerines chime in, the finish is brisk and invigorating.-- Patrick Mitten, Wine House Staff Notes, March 20, 2008
Deep blackberry fruit, with bit of black pepper spice.  Cedary oak spice, very dark chocolate, bit of warm vanilla at finish.  Structured tannins for aging.  Very young, better in six months.
Jammy red berry fruit, moderate creamy-caramel oak, rosemary and cardamon, white pepper in finish.  HUGE mouthful of wine, a bit chewy at the moment.
Deep blackberry fruit and big spice plus black pepper, a touch of chocolate and cola in the oak contribution.  Richly textured in mouth, good structure for aging, long black fruit finish.

variety: Late Harvest Trousseau Gris Gray Riesling  Sweeter Caroline
other_notes: It is a very decadent and unctuous ambrosia of peachy-honeyed yumminess.
In the upcoming March issue of Wine Enthusiast Magazine we will be receiving the following review: 95 Points          Editor’s Choice                        2005 Novy Santa Lucia Highlands Syrah

my_notes: This was great from start to finish
other_notes: The Papera Ranch has a long history, being planted in the 1930s, a long-time single vineyard designated wine by DeLoach Winery, then purchased by Constellation Wines, and ultimately, purchased again by StuartColson.Fortunately, throughout all of this movement one thing has remained constant - the quality of the grapes. The fruit that emerges from the Papera Ranch is simply some of the finest fruit we purchase each year.One thing that distinguishes the Papera from our other Zinfandel Vineyards is the high proportion of Zinfandel vines actually planted in the vineyard. Many of these older vineyards have a number of “mixed blacks” interplanted throughout the vineyard and this often gives the wines a different character. Being almost all Zin, the Novy Papera Ranch bottling possessessoaring aromatics with raspberry and black cherry fruit aromas. The palate is more serious with rich red and black fruit and hints of herbs but also great levels of natural acidity which help keep this hedonistic wine in check. This is everything we want in a Zinfandel!.

my_notes: It was sooo good at the Open House

other_notes: The first two releases from the Sonatera Vine- yard received 91 point ratings . from Robert Parker and the 2005 Pinot received 92 points from Wine Spectator Magazine .  But there’s more to it than great reviews.  There’s also a synergy between the grower and the winery that is vital.  This syn- ergy extends to the farming practices, the commitment of both parties to increasing qual- ity, and even to the grower sup- porting the winery by showing up at tastings and working to- gether to promote the wines.  Marne and Debbie are two of our most passionate growers who strive to increase grape quality every vintage, who are willing to honestly criticize what they have done in the past and work to make improvements in the future and who believe that the best is yet to come both for the Sonatera Vineyard and for Siduri Wines.  These are the types of growers we love. The 2006 Sonatera Vineyard Pinot Noir is certainly as suc- cessful and the past releases and perhaps even surpasses them.  It is a blend of 32% Pommard clone with the remainder equally spread out between 115, 667, and 777 clones.  The wine was aged in 81% new French oak for ten months and, once again, bottled without fining or filtration. Despite its low alcohol (at least these days—it is only 13.6%), the 2006 Sonatera Pinot Noir is one of our darkest and most extracted Pinots.  With black- berry, blueberry, and even hints of pepper and chocolate this impressive Pinot Noir drinks well now but will undoubtedly cellar well for 5+ years.95 Points Connoisseurs’ Guide to Fine Wine

The 2006 Novy Sonoma County Syrah is perhaps the most complex offering we have offered under this label. The wine marries the diverse vineyard locations revealing black cherry, rhubarb, mint, and cocoa powder flavors. There is a distinct cedar note and also an earthy, coal like character. This is a young wine that opens up with several hours of aeration. It can be paired now with hearty dishes but will certainly benefit if tucked away in a cellar for several years.The 2006 Sonoma County Syrah is a blend of fruit from six different vineyards stretching from the warmer northern end of Dry Creek Valley to the cool Bennett Valley. However, that has not always been the case with this wine. Back in 1998, our first year of Novy, we produced 7 barrels of Sonoma County Syrah. Those 7 barrels all came from the same place, the Stage Gulch Vineyard, in the Sonoma Coast appellation. After a couple of vintages we moved on to other sites but continued with the Sonoma County designated wine, using it as an opportunity to blend the richnessof warmer growing areas with the more complex flavors that seem to occur in cooler regions.

winery: Domaine de La Petite Cassagne Costiéres de Nîmes
my_notes: Good, hearty rose’.  Very dry. Really good with Alapai Chicken Piccata
other_notes: With its scents of melon rind and wet stones, this is clearly no tutti-frutti rosé. There’s a hint of cherry, but the emphasis is on lipsmacking minerality from the start all the way through the long, mouthwatering finish. Score: 88. —Joe Czerwinski, July 01, 2007. Wine Enthusiast 88 point

vineyard: Hansel Family Vineyards  The North Slope

appellation: Santa Barbara County, Santa Maria Valley

my_notes: Tasted at Clos Pepe with Wes.  Great to pair with food
Tasted at Clos Pepe with Wes.  Great to pair with food

appellation: Santa Barbara County, Santa Maria Valley

other_notes: Dark raspberry and wild blackberry notes are accented by the characteristic "sauvage" note of our special terroir. Flavors lean towards the fresh raspberry end of the spectrum, with sexy mocha and complex forest floor nuances.

Dark raspberry and wild blackberry notes are accented by the characteristic "sauvage" note of our special terroir. Flavors lean towards the fresh raspberry end of the spectrum, with sexy mocha and complex forest floor nuances.

Nearly opaque in color, with maroon highlights, it is very impressive in the glass. Aromas of grilled meat, blackberry, black cherry, smoke, espresso and lavender are complemented by similar, very rich flavors. The wine is enormous in the mouth—an “Adult Portion” as we like to say—but it retains a sense of elegance, grace and vibrancy that is uncommon for such Syrahs.

Grown on the highest section of our Purisima Mountain Vineyard at an elevation of 1,275 feet, the fruit from Block Six came in with exceptional ripeness and balance in 2006. Late-season heat delivered a soft and supple style of Syrah with intense plum, roasted fig, bacon fat and mineral aromas alongside rich flavors of black cherry, boysenberry and white pepper. With great structure, big tannins and a long, complex finish, this wine has the stuff to age for up to a decade.

The aromatics combine high-tone layers of pomegranate and cranberry with deeper elements of boysenberry and black licorice. On the palate, this Grenache shows big weight and robust dark cherry, grenadine and boysenberry flavors accented by notes of black pepper, suede and spice. Everything comes together in a long, spicy finish that balances firm minerality with a taste of dark chocolate.

Hard to believe that this is the fifth vintage of a Rancho Santa Rosa vineyard designated wine for Flying Goat Cellars! Planted in 1998 with the first harvest in 2002, the 240-acre vineyard is sub-divided into 35 unique blocks, each with different soils, aspects, clones, and rootstocks painstakingly matched to that particular site. The fruit for the 2006 Flying Goat Cellars wine hails from block 16, a fabulous little hillside bowl interlaced with chunks of limestone – the holy grail of soil for Pinot Noir!There is a definite new world attitude exhibited by the 2006 Pinot Noir, Ranch Santa Rosa. A rich ruby color and a brilliant clarity first entices. Aromas of black cherry, red plum and blueberry burst from the glass and are echoed on the palate with a first sip. This is a big, Sta. Rita Hills styled wine with exuberant proclamations of ripe plums, concentrated blueberries, a hint of pomegranate and sassafras spice. Yet, for all the lively fruit notes, the wine is stylish – a silky texture, superb balance and elegant tannins round out the profile of this vibrant wine. Delightful now, the 2006 Pinot Noir, Rancho Santa Rosa will continue to age gracefully for 5-7 years.

Our 2004 Rancho Ontiveros Vineyard pinot noir is from the second block planted and grown by James Ontiveros in the southern end of the Santa Maria Valley. It is a blend of two classic pinot clones: Swan and Mt. Eden. Enticing aromas are enhanced with a small percentage of whole cluster to round out this rich wine.

Like a hummingbird that has found its perfect flower, this Viognier offers all of the traditional flavors one expects from this temperamental grape. Finicky to grow, one must pick the Viognier grape at its peak of ripeness or the balance of acidity and alcohol will be lost in the shuffle of fruitiness and flavor. A Caribbean abyss awaits in every glass, starting with a nose full of orange blossoms and honeysuckles and a palate ripe with apricots and peaches. A hint of pink grapefruit finishes with the classic touch of honey that marks a hand crafted Viognier aged in neutral French oak. Always a favorite for those hot summer nights, pair this Viognier with some spicy grilled shrimp and a fresh berry tart and watch the bottle disappear!

Like a hummingbird that has found its perfect flower, this Viognier offers all of the traditional flavors one expects from this temperamental grape. Finicky to grow, one must pick the Viognier grape at its peak of ripeness or the balance of acidity and alcohol will be lost in the shuffle of fruitiness and flavor. A Caribbean abyss awaits in every glass, starting with a nose full of orange blossoms and honeysuckles and a palate ripe with apricots and peaches. A hint of pink grapefruit finishes with the classic touch of honey that marks a hand crafted Viognier aged in neutral French oak. Always a favorite for those hot summer nights, pair this Viognier with some spicy grilled shrimp and a fresh berry tart and watch the bottle disappear!

A hint of pink grapefruit finishes with the classic touch of honey that marks a hand crafted Viognier aged in neutral French oak. Always a favorite for those hot summer nights, pair this Viognier with some spicy grilled shrimp and a fresh berry tart and watch the bottle disappear!

Yummy! Delicious! Outstanding! Just a few of the enthusiastic words we’ve heard to describe this blend over the years, and we couldn’t agree more. A favorite among the staff, there is something so satisfying about a wine that offers an intoxicating nose, a smooth palate, and a long smoky finish without any harsh edges or overly tart aspects. Based on the Chateuaneuf du Pape region of the southern Rhone Valley this blend is known for its perfect harmony of acidity and tannins offering a mouthful of berry flavors while also providing the toasty middle palate associated with the wonderful varietal Mourvedre. In the end, this wine is just lovely and perfect for an afternoon picnic in the rose garden with a bowl full of cherries to indulge.

The wine has a pale, straw color. The aroma is a fragrant mixture of blossoms, cantaloupe and brown spices such as nutmeg and cinnamon. On the palate it is immediately lean with flavors of melons and spices. A nice richness is beginning to develop mid-palate and will continue to do so with another year of bottle aging.  It has a long, refreshing finish due to the naturally high acidity and will pair well with scallops, shrimp, oysters and crab salad.

This wine is tank fermented cold, prohibited from malolactic fermentation, and undergoes brief aging in neutral French oak barrels. The result is a fresh, vibrant wine; lean and dry, yet with a balancing rich, creamy aspect with a lemon-vanilla nuance.It’s best paired with lighter cuisine, main course salads and simple fish preparations.

This wine is tank fermented cold, prohibited from malolactic fermentation, and undergoes brief aging in neutral French oak barrels. The result is a fresh, vibrant wine; lean and dry, yet with a balancing rich, creamy aspect with a lemon-vanilla nuance.It’s best paired with lighter cuisine, main course salads and simple fish preparations.

Grown in the cool Arroyo Seco area of Monterey County. This Sauvignon Blanc is made from the Musque Clone which gives it the intense distinct aromatics of citrus flowers and gooseberry. The wine is abundant with flavors of grapefruit, kiwi and guava. We fermented this wine in small stainless steel barrels and inhibited malolactic fermentation. It has a steely, bracing acidity that makes it a perfect match for lighter seafood like oysters, scallops and red snapper.

This is a California Pinot Noir lovers Pinot. It offers up generous notes of ripe Chandler strawberries, raspberries and blueberries, while all the while entertaining a flavor beam of leather and cedar box. This young Pinot benefits greatly from an hour or so of decanting prior to imbibing.

appellation: Santa Rita Hills, Los Alamos Estate
my_notes: A nice citrus, pineapple, crisp.  Acidity went well with the peanut sauce.
other_notes: Tasting Notes:   Yellow-green gold in color, this chardonnay exudes fascinating yellow, white and green aromatics of cherimoya, cactus, cassava, lime skin, yellow plum, yellow raspberry, jicama, chalk, gardenia and plantains. Other ethereal nuances drift towards agave, salt, quartz, granite, sage, anise, honey and walnut. The wine is crisp and driven on the palate finishing with a graceful weight and abundant texture.

appellation: Santa Rita Hills, Los Alamos Estate

other_notes: “The warmth of the Wahluke Slope consistently produces Chardonnays with an appealing tropical fruit character. The 2006 bottling delivers pineapple, butterscotch, and vanilla aromas with notes of brown sugar and spice. The Indian Wells Chardonnay is soft and rich yet maintains a beautiful elegance. I like this wine with scallops, scampi or pasta with slightly richer sauces.”

This complex yet elegant Syrah comes from grapes sourced from the renowned Boushey Vineyard in the cool upper Yakima Valley (900-1200 feet) of Eastern Washington State. Syrah grapes are grown on a particular south facing slope characterized by good air drainage and cooler climate compared to other regions.It is richly flavored with dark plum and berry fruit, hints of dried lavender, and a soft finish of chocolate and dried figs. The owner, Dick Boushey, is one of the most reputable grower in Washington state, serving for years as a leader in Washington’s budding wine industry.

The 2006 Sonoma’s North Coast harvest varied greatly within its sub-appellations. Our cool climate vineyards (Freestone and Petaluma Gap) kept the yields down and the acidity.This vintage of our Sonoma Coast Pinot Noir benefits from the addition of some of our Russian River Valley cuvee, and more than a hint of that appellation does show: on the lush base of bright red Sonoma Coast cherry and strawberry fruit, layers of dark cherry, Asian spice and orange peel add lovely complexity. Careful barrel aging provides delicious notes of baked goods such as cherry pie and ginger bread, as well as soft fine grain tannins and creamy texture. Enjoy!

The wine comes from “Villa San Juliette” vineyard, located on the northeast side of the Paso Robles appellation. These mature vines are grown on a limestone hillside soil also benefiting from a southern exposure. The 2006 growing season started with an extended cool spring weather. Then an ideal, long, temperature growing season followed, allowing for slow, full and even ripening of the fruit. The harvest began later than usual. As a result, the wine can be characterized as rich and elegant with gorgeous aromatics. The pale straw color is subtle and pure. The nose is fresh, flinty and the wine expresses tropical notes of ripe peaches and agrumes. The wine is balanced by mineral acidity and fine grain tannins that keep the palate fresh, vibrant and crisp. This food-friendly wine is ideal for light summer fare. Please serve chilled.

It's probably the 75% syrah that gives this rose so much oomph and depth. Fragrant red cherry fruit flavors are tempered by a dry finish, making this wine the ideal match for a main-course Salade Nicoise, tabbouleh, or Chinese chicken salad.

my_notes: We had this wine at Pacific Cafe on our anniversary. It was good for the price.
other_notes: Growing up in Napa has given Joel a great appreciation for having the right antidote for hot, late-summer days; so if you are craving something that delivers plenty of citrusy zing and has a refreshing, zesty finish, this sauvignon blanc is just the ticket. Try with oysters on the half shell or shrimp sauteed with lots of butter and garlic over noodles!

variety: Champagne Cava Made entirely of Spanish varietals, Macabeo, Parellada and Xarel-lo
other_notes: This is an unbelievable value for sparkling wine - or any wine for that matter! Our staff is responsible for depleting stock with a bottle or two making its way home on a regular basis. Made entirely of Spanish varietals, Macabeo, Parellada and Xarel-lo, using traditional methode champenoise sparkling winemaking, it has a lovely floral quality and finishes with a delicately creamy palate.

Hey, who stuck the big bottle in the Dirty Dozen? That's right, a whole LITER of goodness! This German quaffer comes from a young vintner who is restricting yields to produce one of the world's tastiest Silvaner. It will magically disappear from your glass without any effort. Slightly off-dry with plenty of minerality, try it with spicy peanut-sauced soba noodles or lemongrass-spiked Salmon burgers.

Owner Maurice Barnouin, a pepinierst (try to say that 10 times fast!) aka a vine rootstock and clone expert, continues to make sleek, crisp viognier that plays up the exotic aromatics while keeping the tropical flavors in check. Accompany this fun little white with end of summer fruit (think melons and nectarines) all done up in a salsa with grilled chicken breasts.

Gavi, an appellation within Piemonte, is made from the Cortese grape. A new direct-import find for The Wine House, Ernesto Picollo represents the small, hands-on producer we admire. This wine comes from younger vines, is stainless steel tank fermented, and is perfect for pre-dinner relaxation. Want to carry it over to mealtime? Try with pan-seared halibut with capers or grilled gambero-Va Bene!!!

Our relationship with Enrico is now in its eleventh year. His vision and passion have transformed his family's winery into one that is showered with praise from wine enthusiasst around the world. We like to think we helped a little to get the word out, but it's his wine that does all the talking necessary. Ladle up a bowl of pasta, serve it with this delicious Chianti, and you've got yourself a perfect evening!

In great Bordeaux vintages like 2005, it is not just the top First Growths that pull in stellar wines. For example, this amazing little number displays all you could want from a Bordeaux: 1) great fruit impact, 2) classic aromatics of herbs & earth, and 3) structure and finesse. If you find yourself impressed with this now, just wait what it'll do in 7-10 years!

Nothing says "garrigue" quite like Santa Duc. What is garrigue? Garrigue is a term the French use for the earth and spice aromas unique to wines of the Rhone and nearby appellations. One whiff of this dense old-vine red and you'll immediately understand the term! This wine begs to be drunk with slow-braised stews!

my_notes: Laureen would rather not drink this again.  Tasted watered down.  Alan says there are enough other wines that are better for this price.
other_notes: Medium-bodied and elegant, this tank-fermented syrah is brimming with red and black currant fruit notes. It is easy-going and accessible, just the right red for pizza-and-a-movie-night or with leftovers and the NFL.

Imagine a small, intimate restaurant illuminated by candlelight. You sit down to an impeccably executed Bistro meal. The waiter suggests the perfect Beaujolais. The perfect Beaujolais would have to be this one! The rich, deeply concentrated fruit exudes blueberries and stone. To continue the Bistro theme: pair with roast chicken sprinkled with Herbes de Provence and a vegetable tian.

This Loire Valley red, comprised of mostly cabernet franc, mingles red berry fruit with a violet nose. Despite the lack of new oak, this wine packs a punch! Mouth-coating, velvety tannins carry the wine to a very long finish. Not sure what red to go with Indian? Try this one with Tandoori. How about Carne Asada? This will meld nicely with the heat. Sweet, sticky ribs? Yes, yes, yes!!!

my_notes: Alan says this was good the first day and also the second.  By the third day it had lost something.
other_notes: Red and black cherry flavors abound with a note of spice from oak aging.  Rich in texture with a lingering finish and versatile enough to complement just about any cuisine.

One of the finest Spanish sherries; light hazelnut and vanilla character with just a hint of sweetness; wonderful to serve slightly chilled as an aperitif.Tio Pepe's distinctive aroma and lightly nutty taste with a hint of almonds and an ABV of 15%, compliments savoury foods such as seafood, smoked salmon and tapas - yet powerful enough to cope with robust flavours such as chorizo sausage, anchovies and spicy foods

variety: Champagne Brut Blanc de Noirs mostly Pinot Noir
my_notes: Good with the Mexican meal we had, but Laureen doesn’t think it stands on its own
other_notes: A classic wine, the beautifully refined non vintage Gruet Blanc de Noirs Sparkling Wine from New Mexico exhibits tasteful dried strawberry flavors; a dry, easy finish.

Our barrel fermented Central Coast Chardonnay displays tropical and peach aromas. The wine is soft on entry; with dominant fruit flavors of peach, pear and pineapple. Subtle oak notes and a hint of toast make this wine rich and full-bodied with a lingering after taste that invites you back.

my_notes: Brought to Jim and Linda’s for Thanksgiving
other_notes: The striking color of our 06 Rosella’s Vineayrd Syrah hints at its depth and intensity.  A strong core of fruit is balanced by complex layers of herb and tea-like components from 50% whole cluster fermentation.  A bit shy at first-a characteristic of the vintage - this wine will continue to evolve; offering a large window of time for drinking at many stages through the nest 5-7 years

A deftly balanced wine of tremendous substance, our 06 Garys’ Vineyard Syrah displays generous blackberry with notes of tea and tobacco.  On the palate, the wineis big, but not heavy-handed, with sandy tannins and an overall structure that will allow the iwne to develop even more interest with 2 or more years of cellaring.

Those patient enough to cellar our 2006 Pisoni Vineayrd Pinot Noir will be rewarded mightily with layers of complexity that are hinted at now, but will magnify with age.  On the nose the wine offers dried cherries, cranberries and a slight rhubabr nuttiness.  The mouthfeel is round and generous and the tannis are silky. Can cellar for up to 7 years

Those patient enough to cellar our 2006 Pisoni Vineayrd Pinot Noir will be rewarded mightily with layers of complexity that are hinted at now, but will magnify with age.  On the nose the wine offers dried cherries, cranberries and a slight rhubabr nuttiness.  The mouthfeel is round and generous and the tannis are silky. Can cellar for up to 7 years
Delicately made, yet packed with flavor, fresh fig & grapefruit come to mind. The refreshing acidity and a sleek, lean body, lead to a long lasting tropical fruit finish.
Delicately made, yet packed with flavor, fresh fig & grapefruit come to mind. The refreshing acidity and a sleek, lean body, lead to a long lasting tropical fruit finish.

variety: Cabernet Sauvignon  88% Cabernet Sauvignon. 8% Petit Verdot, and 4% Merlot   Elevation
other_notes: Elevation refers both to vineyard location and the raising of the winemaking artistry bar. The Rockpile Vineyard is 2000 feet above sea level on the historic Tennessee Bishop Ranch. It is the highest vineyard in the exclusive Rockpile appellation between Lake Sonoma and the Pacific Ocean. The shallow rocky soil, long sunny days and temperate nights are ideal for cultivating intense, dense, complex Bordeaux varietals. Open top fermenters with submerged caps coupled with duel temperature fermentation, add richness, balance and character to this exceptional wine.

winery: Everett Ridge Winery  Esterlina Vineyards and Wimery
other_notes: The 2007 Dry Riesling is a lovely wine. It starts with scents of pineapple, white peach and a hint of petroleum. The mouth is full of tangy green apple, citrus, and mineral flavors. The finish is long and satisfying. Served at a White House dinner several months ago, we suggest serving it at your house with tuna carpaccio and a lime-mango salsa, grilled chicken kabob, or by itself.

variety: Diablita Blanca  Sauvignon Blanc, Semillon, Riesling and Viognier
Diablita Blanca  Sauvignon Blanc, Semillon, Riesling and Viognier
Diablita Blanca  Sauvignon Blanc, Semillon, Riesling and Viognier
Diablita Blanca  Sauvignon Blanc, Semillon, Riesling and Viognier

winery: Everett Ridge Winery  Esterlina Vineyards and Wimery
other_notes: The 2007 Dry Riesling is a lovely wine. It starts with scents of pineapple, white peach and a hint of petroleum. The mouth is full of tangy green apple, citrus, and mineral flavors. The finish is long and satisfying. Served at a White House dinner several months ago, we suggest serving it at your house with tuna carpaccio and a lime-mango salsa, grilled chicken kabob, or by itself.

Pleasing aromas of pear, mango and clove along with a hint of vanilla mingle on the nose of this classic Sonoma County Chardonnay. The well-balanced acidity wraps around a luscious core of pineapple, lemon and melon flavors and creates a creamy palate. The wine has a refreshing finish.

The warmth of the Wahluke Slope consistently produces Chardonnays with an appealing tropical fruit character. The 2006 bottling delivers pineapple, butterscotch, and vanilla aromas with notes of brown sugar and spice. The Indian Wells Chardonnay is soft and rich yet maintains a beautiful elegance. I like this wine with scallops, scampi or pasta with slightly richer sauces

Bright, intense aromas of grapefruit peel, citrus and gooseberry accented with grassy notes. The palate is rich and vibrant, showcasing crisp, full-bodied and complex flavors of grapefruit, melon and tropical fruits with a long, lush finish.

90 Points Wine Spectator Magazine  Ripe and plump, with supple plum, black cherry and wild berry fruit that's full-bodied and easy to enjoy, with enough complexity and depth to hold your interest. Drink now through 2012.Tierra Alta Vineyards sits on the eastern edge of Ballard Canyon with a steep south east orientation. The soils here are clay with high amounts of limestone providing great minerality in the fruit. The Grenache is located at the top of the vineyard at about 1200 feet above sea level. The section is planted to the Tablas clone of Grenache and is well suited to the vineyard. I did about 15% whole-cluster with this vineyard and really liked the way it turned out. The fruit was fermented using native yeasts and pressed off before dryness to finish up in barrel. I used three year old French Allier barrels for aging.  The wine spent almost two years in barrel before bottling in June of 2008. The wine is filtered but not fined.

90 Points Wine Spectator MagazineOffers plump, ripe and generous plum and black cherry fruit that builds intensity and structure, firming up on the finish. Full-bodied and brimming with ripe fruit. Drink now.Larner Vineyard is located on the western edge of the Ballard Canyon. This is a small family run vineyard with approximately 40 acres of grapes. The Grenache is planted on a south facing hillside at the top of the vineyard. The soil is very sandy, so there is great drainage and just the right amount of stress on the vines to keep the yields low. My particular section is planted with ENTAV clone 362 which is supposedly the lowest yielding of all Grenache clones. I love working with Grenache from this vineyard and I was once again awestruck by the color and intensity of the fruit. The fruit was fermented using native yeast and pressed off a little sweet straight to barrel to finish primary fermentation. I used 4 three year old French barrels so as not to overshadow the fruit. The wine spent 20 months in 3 year old Allier French oak before bottling in June of 2008.

The Santa Ynez Valley is a blend of two Grenache vineyards. The wine is blend of 40% Larner Vineyard-60% Tierra Alta Vineyard. This represents a great cross section of terroir between sandy soil and limestone in Ballard Canyon. Native yeast and neutral barrel fermentation allow for soft textures and aromas.

variety: Rhone Blend Hapa  65%Syrah, 20%Grenache, both from the Tierra Alta Vineyard and 15%Mourvedres from Camp Four Vineyard.
my_notes: Took to Daniel and Christina’s house
other_notes: Hapa the Hawaiian word meaning part or fraction, part Hawaiian was chose for this high end cuvee of 65%Syrah, 20%Grenache, both from the Tierra Alta Vineyard and 15%Mourvedres from Camp Four Vineyard. Tierra Alta Vineyards sits on the eastern edge of Ballard Canyon with a steep south east orientation. The soils here are clay with high amounts of limestone providing great minerality and intensity in the fruit. The Grenache is located at the top of the vineyard at about 1200 feet above sea level and is planted to the Tablas clone of Grenache. The Syrah sits just below the Grenache and is chosen from block 5 planted to the Shiraz clone #1 and produced a deeply concentrated wine. Camp Four Vineyard located in the eastern end of the Santa Ynez Valley is perfectly situated for optimally ripening Mourvedre with its rocky clay soils. The wines fermented separately using native yeasts and were blended post MLF. The wine spent 20 months in 2 year old Allier 300 liter French oak barrels before bottling in June of 2008. 150 Cases produced

variety: Rhone Blend Hapa  65%Syrah, 20%Grenache, both from the Tierra Alta Vineyard and 15%Mourvedres from Camp Four Vineyard.

my_notes: Brought to Sedar with Kathleen and Ernest
other_notes: Hapa the Hawaiian word meaning part or fraction, part Hawaiian was chose for this high end cuvee of 65%Syrah, 20%Grenache, both from the Tierra Alta Vineyard and 15%Mourvedres from Camp Four Vineyard. Hale is the Hawaiian word for house. This wine for this blend just needed a little more time in barrel to soften out the tannin profile of the wine. Almost 3 years! The end result is a soft and well balanced wine with just the right amount of oak and tannin with ample fruit and complexity. Just what I look for in a house wine!

Hale is the Hawaiian word for house. This wine for this blend just needed a little more time in barrel to soften out the tannin profile of the wine. Almost 3 years! The end result is a soft and well balanced wine with just the right amount of oak and tannin with ample fruit and complexity. Just what I look for in a house wine!

Hale is the Hawaiian word for house. This wine for this blend just needed a little more time in barrel to soften out the tannin profile of the wine. Almost 3 years! The end result is a soft and well balanced wine with just the right amount of oak and tannin with ample fruit and complexity. Just what I look for in a house wine!

This is the inaugural year for the Hapa Blanc which is a blend of 50% Grenache Blanc and 50% Roussanne. The fruit was sourced from Camp Four vineyard located on the eastern edge of the Santa Ynez Valley. The climate is warmer here providing an ideal site to ripen these two southern Rhone varietals. The wined was blended post primary fermentation. The wine has aromas of passion fruit, lychee and pineapple. The fruit is supple in the mouth with great length and a lush finish.

The 2007 is very plush with an almost atypical sweet fruit profile. It's also a bit less earthy than in the past. It somewhat pushes the envelope for Sonoma Coast in bigness and fruit. The 2007 Durell has been one of the favorite wines when doing barrel tastings this past year.

Garys' Vineyard seems to keep getting better and better. Maybe it's the age of the vines. Maybe we're getting better at working with the fruit. Whatever the reason, the 2007 Garys' is killer. All of the bright, focused fruit you're used to - with more depth and complexity than ever.

A bit bigger in profile than our 2006, it remains one of the prettiest wines we make each year. It's very typical of Russian River in its brightness, both on the nose and palate. We just wish there had been more fruit - the yield was really low at Graham in 2007.

Probably the biggest Keefer Ranch Pinot we've ever made. It has the typical Keefer cherry profile, but is a bit richer and deeper than our 2005 or 2006. The refreshing acid level is still there, which keeps the wine bright and a great accompaniment to food.

Prior to harvest, Ed Kurtzman at August West asked if we'd like to swap an acre of our 667 clone for an acre of his 828 clone, since Ed thought the 828 was a bit too big for his preferred style of wine. We gladly accepted! The result is that our 2007 Rosella's is definitely the biggest we've made in years. Super rich and plush, it's also more fruit forward than we've seen of Rosella's lately. Like the Durell, the earthy component is downplayed in favor of better fruit.

Aromas of vanilla spice pear and nectarines are complemented by tropical fruit, with ample acidity and a long, soft finish.

Opaque black-purple. Even the bubbles are black! On the nose, deep, dark aromas of loamy earth and blueberry pie. The wine enters full and rich, coating the palate with its black and blue fruit flavors. A-B-C-D-licious! For a pet, surprisingly round and approachable. But don’t be fooled, there is plenty of structure and tannin to ensure a long life. Drink 2009 through 2020. (MRO – 10/30/08)

Black ruby-purple. Glass-staining. A perfumed nose of blackberry, game, and spring flowers lead to flavors of crushed rock, tar, pepper, and black fruits. Cornas on steroids! The richness and extract completely cloak the considerable tannins and acidity. A very special syrah that should age extremely well. Drink 2010 through 2020. (MRO – 10/30/08)

Black-purple. Nearly opaque. Heady aromas of blackberry, blueberry, and fig are complicated by notes of new leather and violets. On the palate, full-bodied and deceptively smooth on entry. Refreshing tannins and acidity creep in on the persistent finish. A powerful wine with a long life ahead of it. Optimum drinking should be late-2009 (if you like ‘em young) through 2018. (MRO – 10/30/08)

Very dark ruby-purple. Aromas of blackberry and Satsuma plum with suggestions of Jujubes, tar, meat, and vanilla. A wonderful sniff! Full-bodied but not at all fat due to the mountain-grown tannins. Really blossoms texturally on day two, an indication of the good things to come. Drink this age-worthy wine from 2010 through 2020. (MRO – 10/30/08)

my_notes: Wow.  It was so mellow and wonderful.  Great flavor and smoothness.  Hints of chocolate and pepper

Opaque black-purple. Gorgeous, head-turning aromas of blackberry, cassis, and violet. On the palate, full-bodied but at the same time remarkably elegant. Flavors of blackberry, black raspberry, and Asian spice build through the long, mineral-laden finish. A seamless wine that clearly speaks of its exceptional terroir. Drink late-2009 through 2018. (MRO – 10/30/08)

Opaque black-purple. Gorgeous, head-turning aromas of blackberry, cassis, and violet. On the palate, full-bodied but at the same time remarkably elegant. Flavors of blackberry, black raspberry, and Asian spice build through the long, mineral-laden finish. A seamless wine that clearly speaks of its exceptional terroir. Drink late-2009 through 2018. (MRO – 10/30/08)

Dark ruby-purple, verging on opaque. A wonderful nose of black olive, cherry, plum, blood orange, herbs and spice. Very complex! On the palate, flavors echo the aromas. Impressively concentrated yet deliciously approachable. Enjoy this wine upon release through 2018. (MRO – 10/30/08)

Dark ruby-purple, verging on opaque. A wonderful nose of black olive, cherry, plum, blood orange, herbs and spice. Very complex! On the palate, flavors echo the aromas. Impressively concentrated yet deliciously approachable. Enjoy this wine upon release through 2018. (MRO – 10/30/08)

variety: Rhone Blend Two Acres 75% Mourvèdre, 10% Petite Sirah, 8% Carignane, 5% Syrah, 2% Alicante Bouschet
other_notes: Dark ruby-red. An incredibly seductive, intoxicating nose of tree bark, blood orange, meat, iron, cardamom, and olive. On the palate, full-bodied and mouth coating, with a Häagen Dazs-like intensity. Way too easy to slurp now (especially if thrown into a decanter) but will benefit with age. Certainly one of our finest Two Acres. Drink from 2009 through 2018. (MRO – 10/30/08)

Dark purple-ruby. Classic aromas of mulberry, cassis, briar, and spring flowers. No mistaking this wine’s origins! On the palate, full and rich with bright acidity and silky tannins framing the raspberry and cassis-like flavors. Our best balanced Carlisle Vineyard Zinfandel to date. Enjoy this elegant, age-worthy zinfandel from late-2009 through 2017. (MRO – 10/30/08)

Dark ruby-red. Powerful, deep aromas of black raspberry, fig, and Christmas spice (cardamom, clove, cinnamon – I’m reminded of gløgg, the Danish spiced mulled wine served during the holidays). Very full-bodied but with plenty of laser-like acidity to keep the wine fresh and lively on the palate. Optimum drinking should be from early-2009 through 2013. (MRO – 10/30/08)

Tasting Note: Medium-dark ruby-red. Hi-toned aromas of red cherries, orange rind, and bittersweet chocolate. Quite smooth on entry, the wine quickly coats the palate but never becomes dull or heavy thanks to invigorating tannins on the finish. Age-worthy. A recently opened bottle showed no signs of deterioration after five days on the counter. Optimum drinking should be from early-2010 through 2019. (MRO – 10/30/08)

Big and rich, but never “over-the-top,” we believe this is a Clos that will improve with some time in bottle. Wine Spectator rated this wine 91 Points and said this,“sleek, elegant and refined, showing a mix of dried currant, black cherry, herb and light cedary oak, with hints of spice and herb. Impressive for its balance, depth, restraint, and complexity.”

the Novy Papera Ranch bottling possesses soaring aromatics with raspberry and black cherry fruit aromas. The palate is more serious with rich red and black fruit and hints of herbs but also great levels of natural acidity which help keep this hedonistic wine in check. This is everything we want in a Zinfandel!.

The 2006 Carlisle Zinfandel is more structured than previous wines, with a unique black licorice component which is joined by sage, black raspberry, and espresso flavors. The finish has tannins but they soften with 4+ hours of airing and the wine becomes more generous. We really think this Zinfandel deserves some cellar time. Perhaps celebrating the start of the 2009 football season would be good timing to pop a bottle.

With crisp pear and peach aromas, wonderfully forward and sweet tasting fruit, and a long, crisp finish, this is the perfect wine to serve at the beginning of a meal.

This golden colored wine with dry fruits scents is exclusively made from White Grenache.It can be savoured as much as an aperitif or an accompaniment for foie gras, ewe cheese or desserts. It will also be really enjoyable with apricot salads during summer or with a crème brûlée

This Viognier possesses beautiful aromas of apricots and peaches gently touched by vanilla and cinnamon. A palate loaded with honeyed apricots, rich vanillas, subtle hints of tropical fruit and just a touch of toasted oak complete this elegant wine.This wine is perfect as an aperitif; or will accompany grilled swordfish or frogs legs in cream sauce.

Pinot Noir is a full and hearty wine that should always be paired with a fine meal. Our Pinot has a rich velvety character that is ideal when paired with a rosemary lamb or a grilled salmon. Spicy food is made more savory when combined with a fine Pinot Noir. Remember to save this wine for a special dinner party.

vineyard: Old Hill Ranch Bambino Field Blend
other_notes: The color of our signature Old Hill Zin is dark purple and the aromas are wonderfully complex. Old Hill Zin is known for its herbal complexity and the 2006 is no exception. This spice character tends towards lavender, eucalyptus and cardamom while the fruit component has an impressive array of cherries, blackberries, and ripe plums. The French oak contributes toast and vanilla aromas while the tannins are very ripe and smooth on the finish. Follow the evolution of this wine in your glass as it opens up or decant if you are in a hurry. The wine will reach its peak maturity in 7-10 years.870 cases produced

my_notes: Let Wes know how much we like the wine.  It was great.  We took it to Jim and Linda’s Memorial Day bbq and everyone liked it.
other_notes: Given to us by Wes
this wine has a wide range of aromas from tropical fruit and stone fruit through herbaceousness.

A spicy, overt and fruit forward wine, filled with bright raspberry and cherry flavors.  This enticing Zinfandel finds its flavored inspiration in a delicious mix of grapes from an array of exceptional vineyards.  We recommend pairing this versatile and delicious Zinfandel with Italian and Mediterranean foods.
this wine has a wide range of aromas from tropical fruit and stone fruit through herbaceousness.

Our Indian Wells series wines showcase a signature fruit forward, mouth-filing style.  Wines from this area are intensely ripe and boldly flavored.  Rich and velvety, this Chardonnay is scented with pineapple and mango.  Luscious flavors of caramel and butterscotch intermingle with tropical fruit, leading to a decadent finish.

Big creme caramel aromas, hazelnutty milk chocolate and vanilla, walnuts, orange peel, dried fruits, it just goes on and on and on.  Sweet but bright acidity, not at all hot - smooth and sensual and luxurious.  Since this rare bottling has spent almost 4 years in oak, it is like a tawny port in style.  It can age indefinitely longer.  Serve with chocolate, dried fruits, nuts and strong cheeses.

my_notes: Took to Holiday Blind Bottle event

other_notes: Inky black purple, bordering on opaque. Deep, captivating aromas of blackberry, blueberry, licorice, and graham cracker. Yum! On the palate, incredibly rich, even thick, with a massive wave of berry fruit flavor nearly obscuring the ripe tannins on the finish. Although approachable now (if you like ‘em young), this wine should age quite well. Drink late 2009-2021. (MRO – 03/10/09)

Black ruby-purple. A perfumed nose of blackberry, cassis, and spring flowers (the viognier perhaps?) emerges from the glass. Full-bodied but like a welterweight champion, light on its feet thanks to healthy acidity and refreshing tannins on the finish. Drink this refined but authoritative syrah from 2012 through 2020. (MRO – 03/10/09)

An opaque black-purple core leads to a deep ruby rim. Head-turning aromas of mulberry, black olive, licorice, and violets titillate the senses. On the palate, full-bodied but smooth as silk. Nary a rough edge to be found. Enjoy this hedonistic wine (and raise a glass to Papa!) from release through 2014. (MRO – 03/10/09)

Opaque purple. Even the bubbles are black. Concentrated, brooding aromas of blackberry, acacia flower, graphite, and peppery spice. What a sniff! On the palate, totally seamless with impeccable balance. Served blind, many knowledgeable wine drinkers might guess Crozes-Hermitage. While enjoyable now with a good decanting, peak drinking should be between 2010 through 2016. (MRO – 03/10/09)

Opaque purple. Even the bubbles are black. Concentrated, brooding aromas of blackberry, acacia flower, graphite, and peppery spice. What a sniff! On the palate, totally seamless with impeccable balance. Served blind, many knowledgeable wine drinkers might guess Crozes-Hermitage. While enjoyable now with a good decanting, peak drinking should be between 2010 through 2016. (MRO – 03/10/09)

Opaque black ruby-purple to the rim. OMG! Drop-dead gorgeous aromas of blackberry and ruby-red grapefruit are punctuated by notes of dry-cured black olives, Asian spices, and cracked black pepper. The nose alone is a total turn-on! The wine enters full and rich, displaying great purity and freshness, finishing with an intriguing saline-like quality. Quite honestly, this is simply one of the most delicious young wines I’ve had the pleasure to drink. Stunning! Enjoy late 2009 through 2016. (MRO – 03/10/09)

The nose alone is a total turn-on! The wine enters full and rich, displaying great purity and freshness, finishing with an intriguing saline-like quality. Quite honestly, this is simply one of the most delicious young wines I’ve had the pleasure to drink. Stunning! Enjoy late 2009 through 2016. (MRO – 03/10/09)

Medium-dark to dark garnet-ruby. Scents of ripe red cherries are mixed with hints of iron and dusty, red earth. Quintessential Dry Creek. Full-bodied on entry but with ample acidity. Not at all fat and ponderous. Optimum drinking should be from release through 2012. (MRO – 03/10/09)

Medium-dark to dark garnet-ruby. Scents of ripe red cherries are mixed with hints of iron and dusty, red earth. Quintessential Dry Creek. Full-bodied on entry but with ample acidity. Not at all fat and ponderous. Optimum drinking should be from release through 2012. (MRO – 03/10/09)

Black ruby-purple, almost opaque. The nose offers a veritable cornucopia of berry fruits (boysenberry, blackberry, raspberry) with notes of spice, lavender, and eucalyptus. On the palate, full-bodied but amazingly precise and focused. Stylistically, similar to the 2005, yet more concentrated à la 2004. There have been many great Montafi’s (aka Tom Feeney) over the years but this is surely one of the best. Drink this age worthy zinfandel from 2010 through 2015. (MRO – 03/10/09)

Cork Finish Medium-dark ruby. Fragrant, textbook aromas of red cherries, briar, and pepper. This wine shouts “I am Zinfandel! Hear me roar!” On the palate, medium-full to full-bodied with red berries and spice charging the way through the lip-smacking finish. An incredible wine at an even more incredible price. Optimum enjoyment should be between late 2010 and 2015. (MRO – 03/10/09)

The wine has beautiful, saturated dense garnet color, the characteristic blackberry, blueberry and strawberry fruit supported by good acidity and some lovely mineral notes.

my_notes: It's hard to pinpoint how a wine will mature, but with the 2005 and 2006's really starting to settle down and strut their stuff, I have great faith that this will be another great wine for either drinking young and fruity, or allowing to settle for up to a decade in a cellar.

The 2007 Clos Pepe Estate Pinot Noir 'Vigneron Select' is a wine chosen and blended by 'Vigneron' Steve Pepe and the rest of our winemaking team as a 'friends and family' style reserve wine. A blend of our favorite barrels from each of the clonal selections (667, 115 and 777), the wine shows a little extra French Oak in its youth and is always a fantastic candidate for a long rest in the cellar.The 2007 'VS' is a 72 case production and is always highly allocated--we suggest you get your order in as soon as possible to guarantee availability. The wine is right at 14% alcohol, very dark and rich in its youth. We expect the baby fat to fall off this bright and fruity young wine in about 2010 and start showing its minerally underbelly. 2007 is certainly a special, long growing season for us with small yields and the longest hangtime in our history on the property. It's always difficult to imagine how these wines with mature, but I have great faith this will be one of the finest wines we've made. Expect youthful and vibrant fruit in its youth, and long, complex and earthy flavors in its maturity.

Aromatics:Aromas of fresh cherry, bright strawberry, kirsch and a hint of rich brown spices and stone fruit offer a forward introduction.On the palate:The first sip delivers a complex rush of flavors - rich raspberry, ripe Bing cherries and soft notes of cinnamon saturate and spread evenly around the palate. A slight hint of minerals, supported by soft tones of orange zest and sassafras are revealed through the silky finish. While the flavors are intense, it’s abalanced and sexy wine.

Aromatics:Dominant notes of ripe raspberries and dark cherries. Slight traces of wet stone interplay with the fruit and encourage you to taste.On the palate:Overlapping flavors of boysenberry, dark cherry, traces of nutmeg, savory baking spices and mouthwatering acidity mingle in perfect balance. The distinct fruit grabs your attention with its mid-palate saturation which is the precursor to a long, delectable finish. This is the perfect combination of intensity and elegance.

Very round and lush. The intense fruit is balanced with supple tannins and acidity
This rose is explosive, with a fruitful strawberry blossom nose and a soft and generous palate.  A fistful of fresh watermelon flavors wash over a bright lively frame.

my_notes: Tasted at Open House.  nicely structured
Tasted at Open House.  nicely structured
Tasted at Open House.  nicely structured
It was great, especially for price.  92% Sonatera Vineyard
other_notes: The 2007 Sonoma County shows loads of up-front fruit, with pretty blackberry, black cherry, and plum flavors. These flavors broaden on the mid-palate as the wine gains in richness and adds hints of dried herbs. The finish is smooth with very little tannins. This is definitely drinkable now and while it should last fine for a few years, it is ideal for nearer term consumption.Wine Spectator 90 points

Pinot Report  94 Points ~ Medium-deep ruby color; deep, full black cherry and plum aromas with earthy, spicy notes; complex, ripe and full flavored with black cherry and plum, earthy and pepper notes; some tannin and toasty oak; good structure and balance; long finish. Complex, deep Pinot that needs air in the glass to open up and will definitely benefit from some cellar restraint.Connoisseurs’ Guide to California Wines  93 Points ~ Santa Lucia Highland Pinot Noirs are very often defined by their ripeness and weight, and, while this bottling is lacking in neither, it is the wine's balance and sense of real polish that sets it apart. Velvety smooth, yet with a fine spine of acid, it is everywhere keyed on youthful cherry-like fruit and is filled in with mildly creamy oak at every stop. A classy and complete package that ranks among Siduri's best efforts in 2006, it is at once irresistible now and seems likely to gain still further refinement with time.

We consider to be our best Rosella’s Vineyard Pinot Noir yet. Fortunately, we were not alone in this assessment as Wine Spectator Magazine rated this wine 93 points and described it thusly, “Supple and engaging, with ripe, generous plum, black cherry, mineral, spice, and subtle cedary oak nuances. This full-bodied Pinot possesses depth, concentration and complexity, with excellent balance and length. Drink now thru 2015.”Wine Spectator  93 PointsSupple and engaging, with ripe, generous plum, black cherry, mineral, spice and subtle cedary oak nuances. This full-bodied Pinot possesses depth, concentration and complexity, with excellent balance and length. Drink now through 2015. 730 cases made. –JLConnoisseurs Guide to California wine  91 PointsTWO STARS:(91-94 points) A highly distinctive wine. Likely to be memorable. If concerned first and foremost with bright, but well-ripened, red-cherry fruit, this comparatively complex young Pinot shows varied elements of creme brulee and vanilla in addition to subtle accents of woodsy spice. It is slightly viscous and fairly full at the start but picks up a trim of finishing toughness, and, while it can be enjoyed now with heartier meat entrees, it will benefit from a few years of age.

Intensely jammy, black razzberry fruit, vibrant and alive in both nose and mouth, nice hit of black pepper. Smoothly textured in mouth, creamy vanilla oak, and the finish is long and lushly jammy fruit—dangerously good!

Deeper black raspberry fruit, super smoky oak with tones of caramello chocolate that carry from aroma to mouth.   Smooth and juicy flavors, great with grilled beast or veggies - tomatto sauces, Szechwan maybe?

variety: Sweet Caroline Late Harvest Trousseau gris
other_notes: Pale peach-blush color, lovely nose of honeyed pears and white peaches, delicately floral with a touch of mineral, mint and yuzu grapefruit. Sweetin mouth but not cloying or heavy—very crisply balanced with acidity and long-lasting peachy fruit finish.

Very complexly layered spice and black fruits, pretty blueberry fragrance, creamy oak, a bit of vanilla, dark chocolate, brown spices - nutmeg/cinnamon. Rich in mouth, good structure for aging, a bit chewy in its youth.  Try this with lamb or duck with a nice fruit-based sauce (like blueberries)
Deep blackberry fruit and big spice plus black pepper, a touch of chocolate and cola in the oak contribution. Richly textured in mouth, good structure for aging, long black fruit finish.

A beautiful combination of earthiness, fruit, and luscious fine red tannins, it boasts a balanced complexity that only a truly compelling blend can offer.Food Pairing: Try it with stews, turkey and triple cream cheeses! (From website)Supple and juicy, with lively black cherry, blackberry and minty, spicy notes that that are elegant, full-bodied and persistent. (Wine Spectator 89)Dark ruby hue, with delicate aromas of cherry, plum, and holiday spices. On the palate, dark fruit flavors, especially juicy black cherry, come intermixed with some raspberry notes and forest floor. Medium to full bodied with a velvety mouth feel. (Cellar tracker review)
Crisp, fruit-focused and food friendly.  Delicate melon, citrus and mineral aromas.
Rich and creamy
Peach, ripe apricot and citrus flavors

Verve French Colombard comes from the “Domaine de Mirail” located in the heart of Gascony in southwest France. The specific site is in the Cotes de Gascogne region, and is an old, densely planted vineyard situated on a south-facing limestone and clay hillside. The grapes were harvested at night to allow for a brief period of cold skin maceration. Fermentation occurred in stainless steel, with the temperature stabilized to a very cool 59-62 degrees Fahrenheit in order to preserve the floral aromatics and fresh tropical and citrus fruit characteristics. Four months ageing on the lies adds a hint of creaminess and roundness to the wine’s texture, but does not mask the racy acidity typical of French Colombard from the Cotes de Gascogne. Served well-chilled, Verve French Colombard will prove a classic match with fish, oysters and other shellfish, salad or goat cheese.
Crisp, fruit-focused and food friendly.  Delicate melon, citrus and mineral aromas.
Aromas of vanilla spice pear and nectarines are complemented by tropical fruit, with ample acidity and a long, soft finish.
Kabinett: The lightest and most delicate style, from normally ripe grapes picked early in the harvest.
Put your spicy entrees up against the sweet, tropical flavors of mango, lychee, and passionfruit.

variety: Red blend Carignane, Syrah and even some white
purchased_from: Gift from Daniel and Christina’s wedding
other_notes: Carignane, Syrah, a splash of sweet Symphony and a dash of love are the main components of this wine, which was produced to honor and surprise our father, Don Phillips, on his 75th birthday. This is an atypical blend of red and white wines, with lovely fruity characteristics of Symphony added in order to please Don's amiable palate. This is an easy-drinking, everyday, great quality, red table wine.

90 pts on cork’d  Another very good medium bodied white wine with decent depth and complexity. Yellow color, a little light. Floral nose. The usual lemony, citrus and pear flavors are accented by some honeysuckle and melon. A little spicy. Persistent, but not overpowering acid. Pretty heavy in the mouth, leading to a long pleasing, leesy finish.
Pinot Blanc is a well-structured wine from the middle of our range with a dry character.   Goes well with any dish needing a light white wine - summer salads, quiches and terrines fish meuniere
Charming, with melon, peach and apricot notes that are ripe and fleshy, with spicy tobacco, lentil and mineral accents. There's great focus and intensity.
The wine draws your attetion with aromas of ripe apples and peaches.  On the palate Nora has an excellent balance of fresh fruit flavors and rich silky texture.

Sourced from the selected site at Hauer of the Dauen Vineyard, Verve Janka sweet wine has an extraordinary depth of flavor that marks the finest Gewurztraminer fruit form the Willamette Valley appellation.Janka wine displays a beautiful golden color, while offering aroma’s of honey, apricots, nectarine and an intense floral-perfume. In the mouth, this wine is sweet, round and yet balanced with its acidity and explodes with fruit flavors and a smooth lingering finish. This particular sweet wine will beneficiate from being poured chilled. Keep in the refrigerator, will remain fresh even after being opened for up to and beyond three weeks.

Medium dark ruby in color, our 2007 Rosella’s Pinot Noir displays a classic Santa Lucia Highlands spicy nose, with fragrant berry fruits and toast. The palate is focused with very good acidity and tannins which enter the finish along with flavorful oak notes.WINE ADVOCATE  93 ~ ROAR Rosella's Vineyard Pinot Noir 2007 "The 2007 Pinot Noir Rosella’s Vineyard exhibits a sweet, smoky nose of black raspberries, spring flowers, herbs, and meat juices as well as a hint of underbrush. This dense Pinot’s Burgundian-styled aromatic profile is followed by a wine with California ripeness, richness, and texture in addition to a full-bodied, long, silky mouthfeel."WINE SPECTATOR  93 ~ ROAR WINES Pinot Noir Rosella's Vineyard Santa Lucia Highlands 2007 "Exhibits a complex array of black cherry, cola, fresh earth, floral and sage notes in a full-bodied style, turning elegant and delicate on the finish, but keeping its detailed fruit and spice flavors and a touch of tar. Drink now through 2012.

Strikingly dark in color, our 2007 Rosella’s Vineyard Syrah  exhibits smoked tea, herbs de Provence and black and white pepper aromatics followed by a full bodied palate with round tannins and chewy fruit. The finish is very long and balanced.WINE ADVOCATE  94 ~ ROAR Rosella's Vineyard Syrah 2007 "The 2007 Syrah Rosella’s Vineyard offers... fabulous fruit, a full-bodied mouthfeel, sweet but noticeable tannin, and an exceptionally long, textured, plush finish. Drinking beautifully already, it should develop even more over the next 2-3 years. One of two tremendous Syrah offerings from Roar that are about as good as one can find in New World Syrah." WINE SPECTATOR  92 ~ ROAR Rosella's Vineyard Syrah 2007 " Beautifully crafted, rich and spicy, showing notable pepper, wild berry, plum and blueberry notes, with beefy, meaty character that extends its range of flavors. Full-bodied, blanced, focused and persistant, ending with a long, intricate finish.

Light golden in color, our inaugural 2007 Rosella’s Vineyard Chardonnay opens with fresh hazelnut and ripe peach aromatics, which give way to an incredibly rich palate with bright acidity that lingers long into the finish.

A blend assembled from some of the Sonoma Coast's finest vineyards, many of which go into our vineyard designated offerings. Medium ruby in the glass, a remarkable array of aromas leap forward, with pomegranate, cherry, anise, rose, orange peel, cinnamon and coriander, and just a hint of iron. Red and black cherry, licorice, and refreshing acidity allow the complexity of the nose to meld seamlessly with the bright, lively palate. This wine delivers incredible value for fans of pinot that expresses the character of the foggy, windswept Sonoma Coast.

Our 2008 Bluffs is definitely the wine for those who prefer bigger, richer pinot noir. Deep red in color, the nose offers date, plum, marshmallow, and candied red and black fruit. Big, expressive cherry and raspberry liqueur leap to the front, but the palate remains sophisticated thanks to its structure. Rich, round tannins carry cherry and raspberry preserves through to the long, sweet fruit finish.

Deep ruby in color, the 2008 Huntington explodes with aromas of black cherry, strawberry, maple, rhubarb, wildflowers and créme fraiche. Intense strawberry and cherry follow through on the palette, joined by hints of mango, white pepper, herbal tea and sage. Sweet red fruit lingers on the long, smooth finish. While rich and mouth-filling, the 2008 Huntington remains light on its feet thanks to good acidity and an impression of freshness imbued in every layer of flavor. This level of complexity and finesse would be impressive even in a wine costing twice as much.

Ripe, dark fruit, wild raspberry with hints of cola, a light touch of vanilla and nutmeg. Your first sensation is intense black cherry with a hint of semi-sweet chocolate and raspberry preserves. Soft notes of pomegranate intermingle with layers of black fruit. These mouthwatering flavors reveal a long, lingering finish with a touch of dust and rich cola.

Exotic and enticing. Raspberry Jolly Rancher candy with notes of Earl Gray tea. Restrained, yet focused. This Pinot Noir enters the palate with notes of dried cranberry & cherry with a hint of smoke and a touch of orange zest. The midpalate excites your senses with juicy, creamy red fruit. All of which leads to a long cola, raspberry and cherry finish.

Red licorice, bright red cherry fruit with hints of cranberry, red apple skin and a touch of cinnamon.On the palate:  The entrance fills your senses with intense raspberry, Maraschino cherry, structured acidity and sweet, ripe plum. The midpalate is creamy and coating with a long, red berry finish.

Red licorice, bright red cherry fruit with hints of cranberry, red apple skin and a touch of cinnamon.On the palate:  The entrance fills your senses with intense raspberry, Maraschino cherry, structured acidity and sweet, ripe plum. The midpalate is creamy and coating with a long, red berry finish.

Extremely floral with traces of wild, ripe strawberry, soft hints of raspberry and undertones of violet and lavender.On the palate:  The approach reveals slightly crushed plum, boysenberry and a touch of savory oak with creamy strawberries. The rich midpalate is balanced, yet elegant with a long supportive finish.

The 2006 Pisoni Estate Pinot Noir possesses very complex aromatics.  It is hard to find wines with a combination of fruit, spice and floral notes.  The fruit-driven notes are the most forward with raspberry and black cherry up front.  More subtle are the baking spices, especially clove aromas.  Also, hints of purple rose petals seem to weave in and out.  The palate broadens out quickly with tight-grained tannins framing the wine.  The tannins turn more velvety as the taper off to a long, fine finish.  2006 is another good year for acid levels, providing great balance to the full-bodied texture.

Rich and creamy with fragrant apricot and tropical fruit flavors.  Try it with grilled or roasted chicken, shellfish, or spicy Asian cuisine.
Refreshing off-dry wine with prominent peach, melon aromas and flavors.

Soft and fruity with aromas of ripe mango and rose petals with flavors of fresh peaches, lychee, honeysuckle and spice with a smooth finish.  Enjoy with light cheese, fruit, salads, prawns and anything else you can put in your mouth.
Flavors of peaches, apricots and tropical fruits with just a touch of creamy vanilla and cinnamon spice.  Rich cheeses, roasted poultry or salad.
Rich fruit and spice flavors are tempered by a fruit forward sweetness.  A perfect match for hors d’oevures or spicy pan Asian cuisine.

The Lucia Cabernet Sauvignon is a traditional cool-climate Cabernet. It does not display the riper aromatics commonly found from this varietal when grown in warmer appellations. The wine is full of black currants, cedar, cocoa powder, hints of vanilla and the minty/herbal note characteristic of the cool growing season. On the palate, the tannins are more refined than in previous vintages. To tame the structure, this wine was left in barrel longer. Decanting is recommended

The wine possesses a very deep purple color. The nose istypical of Syrah from this cool site: a combination ofbaking spice, floral notes, perfume and slight hints ofpepper. The ripe tannins are very full and round. Theyprovide a very long-lasting texture that stays on the palatefor a drawn-out and velvety finish.
Elegant and refined, this wine has aromas of vanilla and spice, flavors of fig, pear and butterscotch are accented by seductive smoky, toasty oak, with a finish that sails on and on
With flavors of rose petals and summer berries, this wine is perfectly balanced for easy drinking. Pairs perfectly with crab cakes.

The 2006 Novy Judge Family Vineyard Grenache shows a distinct spicy character, with hints of black pepper and herbs. Wild berry flavors contrast against a slight earthiness. The finish is tannic (but not harshly so). This wine drinks very well now after being open a couple of hours so either decant it or let it rest in your cellar for a year or two.

The finish is tannic (but not harshly so). This wine drinks very well now after being open a couple of hours so either decant it or let it rest in your cellar for a year or two.

It possesses some of the midpalate weight and richness of Chardonnay but with exceptional acidity. The nose, however, is a bit more exotic with hints of orange and cherry fruits. Quite frankly, it smells more like Marsanne or Rousanne but, combined with the weight and fruit flavors, it ultimately is its own uniquely wonderful wine.
