Upon opening, the 2007 displays aromas of exotic herbs, stem inclusion, earth and menthol. As the wine opens up layers of black cherry, tobacco and anise are exposed. The tannins are perfect, slightly more than silky provide the grip that gives the wine structure and a long finish. The finish is polished off by the refreshing swipe of vibrant acidity. This wine will not doubt improve with some cellaring, but it may be hard to resist popping open bottles sooner rather than later.Wine Enthusiast 90 PointsShows an exotic array of flavors, including blackberry and cherry jam, Dr. Pepper, mashed ripe dates, milk chocolate, orage zest and black pepper. The wine is dry, although it's a little too soft. - S.H.Wine Spectator91 PointsEnticing loamy earth, dried currant and black cherry fruit is supple and elegant, medium- to full-bodied. Complex and layered, ending with caressing tannins and a long finish. Drink now through 2014. 703 cases made. –JLConnoisseur’s Guide to California Wine  93 PointsTWO STARS:(91-94 points) A highly distinctive wine. Likely to be memorable. As in the previous vintage, so again does the Sonatera Vineyard bottling win the nod as one of Siduri's very best efforts in 2007. Absolutely laden with optimally ripened, black-cherry fruit and filled out with a full measure of seamlessly fit oak, the wine is deep, dense and involving from front to back. Its considerable concentration and deft sense of balance garner it big points in the near term, but it will only get better with age and deserves at least of few years patience.

Complex and layered, ending with caressing tannins and a long finish. Drink now through 2014. 703 cases made. –JLConnoisseur’s Guide to California Wine  93 PointsTWO STARS:(91-94 points) A highly distinctive wine. Likely to be memorable. As in the previous vintage, so again does the Sonatera Vineyard bottling win the nod as one of Siduri's very best efforts in 2007. Absolutely laden with optimally ripened, black-cherry fruit and filled out with a full measure of seamlessly fit oak, the wine is deep, dense and involving from front to back. Its considerable concentration and deft sense of balance garner it big points in the near term, but it will only get better with age and deserves at least of few years patience.

my_notes: Very smooth and silky. Too bad it was so limited and we only had one bottle.
other_notes: Black-purple.  Opaque.  Deep, captivating aromas of blackberry, blueberry, licorice, and vanilla (remember though, no new oak). On the palate, full-bodied but surprisingly civilized with fine tannins leading to a long finish.  One of the most concentrated and balanced petite sirahs I've tasted in a long time.  Enjoyable now through 2020.

Black ruby-purple. A knockout nose of black and blue fruits is highlighted by suggestions of black pepper, wild herbs, coffee bean, and raw beef. Medium-full to full-bodied with an explosion of berry fruit on the palate. A more elegant version than the 2006 but no less concentrated or flavorful. Drinkable now (if you’re not tannin adverse), this wine should age wonderfully for several decades. (MRO – 07/17/09)

variety: Rhone Blend Two Acres Red Wine Blend
other_notes: Medium-dark ruby-garnet. Complex aromas of red berries, underbrush, rose petal, cardamom, and game. Quite smooth on entry with flavors of cherry, tree bark, spice and licorice framed by suave and gentle tannins on the finish. A very feminine and elegant mourvèdre, more reminiscent of something from Châteauneuf du Pape as opposed to Bandol. Hard to resist now but has the ability to age well and develop for at least a decade. (MRO – 07/17/09)

variety: Rhone Blend Two Acres Red Wine Blend

Dark ruby-purple. Nearly opaque. A perfumed nose of blackberry, violets, black olive, and pepper. Full-bodied but not heavy thanks to refreshing acidity and invigorating tannins. While obviously Californian, something very Northern Rhone-like about this wine. Cornas perhaps? Enjoy from release through 2020. (MRO – 07/17/09)

Dark ruby-purple. Nearly opaque. A perfumed nose of blackberry, violets, black olive, and pepper. Full-bodied but not heavy thanks to refreshing acidity and invigorating tannins. While obviously Californian, something very Northern Rhone-like about this wine. Cornas perhaps? Enjoy from release through 2020. (MRO – 07/17/09)

Opaque black-purple. Thick, heady aromas of blackberry, black raspberry, minerals and spice. A rich, muscular wine but paradoxically, very pure, fresh, and even, dare we say, elegant? The magic of calcareous soils! While more tannic than the 2006, there is also considerably more flesh on the bones. Hence, the wine can be enjoyed in its youth or aged 15 years or more. Just depends on how you like ‘em! (MRO – 07/1

Medium to medium-dark ruby-garnet. An alluring nose of fresh cherries, red licorice whips, and Dry Creek earth. Full-bodied but bright and focused with its mouth filling cherry fruit punctuated by invigorating tannins on the finish. Our best Gold Mine to date? We think so. Optimum enjoyment should be 2010 through 2014. (MRO – 7/17/09)

Medium to medium-dark ruby-garnet. An alluring nose of fresh cherries, red licorice whips, and Dry Creek earth. Full-bodied but bright and focused with its mouth filling cherry fruit punctuated by invigorating tannins on the finish. Our best Gold Mine to date? We think so. Optimum enjoyment should be 2010 through 2014. (MRO – 7/17/09)

Very dark ruby-red. Classic Carlisle Vineyard aromas of mulberry, raspberry, spring flowers, and briar. On the palate, full-bodied with laser-like acidity framing the red-berry fruit. Not a light zin by any means but still very refreshing and exceptionally well-balanced. Drink 2009 through 2015. (MRO – 7/17/09)

Very dark ruby-red. Classic Carlisle Vineyard aromas of mulberry, raspberry, spring flowers, and briar. On the palate, full-bodied with laser-like acidity framing the red-berry fruit. Not a light zin by any means but still very refreshing and exceptionally well-balanced. Drink 2009 through 2015. (MRO – 7/17/09)

Dark ruby-purple, nearly opaque. A compelling, exotic nose of raspberry liqueur, briar, pepper, and incense. Not as floral as Carlisle Vineyard but it’s obvious this comes from the same ‘hood. On the palate, full-bodied with explosive flavors of kirsch and black raspberry leading to a long and persistent finish. A wine that manages to be both powerful and graceful at the same time. Easily our best Papera Ranch Zinfandel to date. Enjoy this age-worthy zinfandel from mid-2010 through 2018. (MRO – 07/17/09)

Dark ruby-purple, nearly opaque. A compelling, exotic nose of raspberry liqueur, briar, pepper, and incense. Not as floral as Carlisle Vineyard but it’s obvious this comes from the same ‘hood. On the palate, full-bodied with explosive flavors of kirsch and black raspberry leading to a long and persistent finish. A wine that manages to be both powerful and graceful at the same time. Easily our best Papera Ranch Zinfandel to date. Enjoy this age-worthy zinfandel from mid-2010 through 2018. (MRO – 07/17/09)

Big blackberry fruit and heaps of black pepper, creamy vanilla oak, rounder in mouth than expected of most Petite Sirahs.  Long elegant finish, still a bit chewy.  Compliments hearty winter stews, roast beast, big food for big wine!

Pretty blackberry fruit and exotic lavendar floral.  Black pepper, a touch of cocoa-chocolate.  Richly textured in mouth, good structure for aging, long black fruit finish.  Very young yet, better in six months.

Wonderfully wildberry fruit nose, very pretty with candied violets and a bit of orange peel, nice warm brown spices like nutmeg and clove.  Lots of stuff going on once it opens up.  Nice soft mouthfeel - creamy oak but showcases fruit more than oak - not heavy in body but good intensity nonetheless.  Needs to open more but is showing well now too - can age another 5 years.

Intensely jammy, black razzberry fruit, vibrant and alive in both nose and mouth, nice hit of black pepper. Smoothly textured in mouth, creamy vanilla oak, and the finish is long and lushly jammy fruit—dangerously good!
Very bright pomegranate-wild cherry fruit, brown sugary-caramel oak,fragrant Asian spices—Chinese 5-spice, still a bit young and chewy,but quite drinkable now

Intensely jammy, black razzberry fruit, vibrant and alive in both nose and mouth, nice hit of black pepper. Smoothly textured in mouth, creamy vanilla oak, and the finish is long and lushly jammy fruit—dangerously good!

Zin-a has sweet aromas of blackberry, vanilla and toasted oak. The juicy black fruit flavors are balanced with good acidity and structure. Made from a blend of grapes from our Estate and the esteemed Bacigalupi vineyard, Zin-a (say “Zee-na”) tastes great

The oldest sister, Diablita is a blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Syrah and Petite Sirah.  She grabs your attention with her looks and great taste.  Unpretentious enough to have with a pizza, she’s sufficiently elegant to accompany upscale fare like filet mignon.The Diablita Red Wine is Rich and juicy blackberry, plum and black cherry flavors with an integrated band of French Oak. It has soft tannins and good balances, our Diablita goes well with grilled fare, like tri-tip and chicken, or by itself.

A light, bright, refreshing Rose for Spring and Summer quaffing,A 125 case production of pinot noir rose'. The wine weighs in around 12% alcohol and is very light and refreshing.Fantastic with sushi, crab, oysters--the wine has spectacular acidity and only the slightest hint of residual sugar for balance.This one's a slurper--not a wine to be considered or cellared. Chill these down and drink with gusto!

The 2008 Clos Pepe Estate Pinot Noir has been a pleasure to follow in barrel. The wine is amazingly structured and mineral even in its youth--bright, elegant and stacked with character.It reminds me of a young Puligny Montrachet pinot noir--packed with mineral pedigree, fruity and fresh, but showing a lot more verve and earth than I'm used to in such a young wine. The wine has a smooth cherry and vanilla entry, good stuffing, but a finish that is more about terroir than concentration. After finishing tasting each barrel and blend, I am extremely excited about the ability of this wine to integrate with food and show off the dirt and climate of Clos Pepe.

Tasted 8/26/09: Nose shows hazelnut, green apple, pear, loamy mineral--almost as much Cote de Beaune as Chablis--more ML character than barrel-- In the mouth it's not buttery or soft, instead proud , structured and focused on minerals and acidity. Rich mouthfeel with good stuffing and intensity, but a very loamy structure filled with perky acid, pebbly minerals and firm acidity. Throw it blind into a tasting of French Chablis or White Burgundies, and you'll see whay we're so proud of the 2008!

With a nose full of brambly wild blackberries, the ’08 Buck Hill shows classic Zinfandel character.  The palate is ripe, rich and well-balanced, with perfect acidity.  I’m not one to age Zinfandels for very long, and I like to drink them within three years of their release.  There are many folks who disagree with that approach to Zin enjoyment, so maybe hang onto a couple of these to see how they age over the years.

my_notes: This was drinking really well when we picked it up on 1/2/2010
other_notes: The wine begins with some intriguing scents of rhubarb and cola followed by hints of black cherry.  On the palate there’s a liveliness which brings together ripe fruitiness with perfect acidity and fairly low tannin.  We expect this wine to be drinking at its best between 2010 and 2014.

The nose is pure Graham with scents of ripe cherries, earth, forest floor and a slight menthol note.  On the youthful palate there’s lively acidity surrounding an abundance of fruit with well-balanced tannins.  A pleasant taste of gorgeous French oak rounds out the long finish.  Enjoy this wine through 2015 at least and hopefully longer.

my_notes: The Rosella’s nose quickly disappeared.  Very smooth and wonderful.
other_notes: A soft nose of ripe blackberries and cola is the first impression of the ’08 Rosella’s Pinot.  This broadens out with aeration to reveal some of the familiar Santa Lucia Highlands spiciness.  The deep and round palate is an explosion of various fruits including ripe plums and berries.  There’s plenty of acidity and tannin, but in this youthful state, the fruit seems to be in the forefront of the mouthfeel.  A two minute finish predicts a long life for the wine, so expect the 2008 Rosella’s to drink well through 2016 and beyond.

That familiar white pepper fragrance is the most prominent feature of the nose.  Many people who try it say it reminds them more of a Northern Rhone than a California Syrah.  In spite of the 100% whole cluster fermentation, the tannins are not obtrusive, although they will most likely help this wine age gracefully for many years to come.  Don’t be in too much of a hurry to try one of these, but with a good, multi-hour decanting, the ’08 Connell Syrah is drinking very well.

This is definitely a Cabernet made by a Pinot guy.  It has distinct Cabernet flavors but also shows a delicacy more similar to Pinot.  The nose is full of dark berries with subtle herbaceous hints.  And on the palate the ripeness of this very warm Dry Creek site is apparent with the round tannins, lower acidity and nice fruit flavors.  I believe this ’06 Cab will age nicely for at least another 5 years.

variety: Syrah/Shiraz, Mourvedre, Viognier The Wolftrap.  Rhone Blend
other_notes: The Wolftrap is a spicy, aromatic, red blend that has been French oak matured.

It is a portrait of simplicity, a mark of the territory: a wine of the people, that has always been made in the Langa and that has been made to be as fresh and clean as possible. The vineyards are traditionally grown in the lower strips of the Fiasco and Vignolo vineyards in Castiglione Falletto.

Crafted with hand-picked grapes from picturesque vineyards in the heart of Tuscany, Bivio Italia reveals Italy’s renowned winemaking tradition in its own distinctly modern style.  Our richly textured Chianti boasts blackberry and raspbery flavors with notes of violet and toasted almond leading to a lush, satisfying finish.  A perfect complement to Parmigiano Reggiano cheese, wild mushroom risotto or farfalle with sausage.

Clear almost colourless - just a slight hint of pale straw - Youthful. Clean and expressive nose (mod) of guava and lime. Dry with crisp citrus on the palate with mod+ acid and alcohol and moderate body. Very creamy finish that's a bit hot from the alcohol. Drink now

Dolcetto, a northern Italian varietal from the Piedmont region, is a lighter bodied red. This wine is fruity and means 'little sweet one' in Italian. Some will opt to put a slight chill on it. Perfect with Mediterrean cuisine such as grilled meats and vegetables. Enjoy as a summertime delight.

my_notes: We really liked this at Word Up!  It still needs some time
other_notes: Mojon’s Bench 2004 Estate Merlot combines fine estate grown merlot with a touch of cabernet franc to achieve a wine that’s soft, ripe and complex. The 2007 mesh Eden Valley Riesling is green and vibrant in appearance. The aroma is zesty lemon and white flowers with a hint of spice. The palate is powerful, lively and generous, with intense citrus fruit flavours. The wine finishes clean and dry with refreshing slatey acidity.

The estate-grown Dr. Loosen Riesling Kabinett embodies the racy, mineral driven style of steep, blue slate vineyards in the famous middle Mosel villages of Bernkastel, Graach and Wehlen.  It’s a crisp, juicey Riesling that makes an ideal aperitif, and pairs well with spicy Asian cuisine.

Medium and bright ruby color, with a good fruity nose of ripe cherries, blueberries and root beer. The full palate has very good acidity and has all the flavors of the nose with the addition of raspberries and cinnamon. The acidity and oak on the finish blend nicely with the fruit and spice.

The nose is full of dark fruits, earth, and a bit of wet stone. In the mouth there are blackberries, plums, and hints of dried herbs and even a bit of minerality. There are some tannins on the end of the wine, but not too many, as the flavors continue to build throughout the lingering finish. Although we like this wine a great deal now we believe it will only be better with a few years in the cellar.Cases: 235Released: April 2009logo 90 PointsRipe to the point of super-mature, this Pinot explodes with flavors of black and red raspberries, cherries, milk chocolate, coffee and spice. Almost like a glass of Kahlua, with the softness that implies. - S.H.

Upon opening, the 2007 displays aromas of exotic herbs, stem inclusion, earth and menthol. As the wine opens up layers of black cherry, tobacco and anise are exposed. The tannins are perfect, slightly more than silky provide the grip that gives the wine structure and a long finish. The finish is polished off by the refreshing swipe of vibrant acidity. This wine will not doubt improve with some cellaring, but it may be hard to resist popping open bottles sooner rather than later.Production: 700 CasesRelease Date: February 2009logo 90 PointsShows an exotic array of flavors, including blackberry and cherry jam, Dr. Pepper, mashed ripe dates, milk chocolate, orage zest and black pepper. The wine is dry, although it's a little too soft. - S.H.91 PointsEnticing loamy earth, dried currant and black cherry fruit is supple and elegant, medium- to full-bodied. Complex and layered, ending with caressing tannins and a long finish. Drink now through 2014. 703 cases made. –JLlogo 93 PointsTWO STARS:(91-94 points) A highly distinctive wine. Likely to be memorable. As in the previous vintage, so again does the Sonatera Vineyard bottling win the nod as one of Siduri's very best efforts in 2007. Absolutely laden with optimally ripened, black-cherry fruit and filled out with a full measure of seamlessly fit oak, the wine is deep, dense and involving from front to back. Its considerable concentration and deft sense of balance garner it big points in the near term, but it will only get better with age and deserves at least of few years patience.

Upon opening, the 2007 displays aromas of exotic herbs, stem inclusion, earth and menthol. As the wine opens up layers of black cherry, tobacco and anise are exposed. The tannins are perfect, slightly more than silky provide the grip that gives the wine structure and a long finish. The finish is polished off by the refreshing swipe of vibrant acidity. This wine will not doubt improve with some cellaring, but it may be hard to resist popping open bottles sooner rather than later.Production: 700 CasesRelease Date: February 2009logo 90 PointsShows an exotic array of flavors, including blackberry and cherry jam, Dr. Pepper, mashed ripe dates, milk chocolate, orage zest and black pepper. The wine is dry, although it's a little too soft. - S.H.91 PointsEnticing loamy earth, dried currant and black cherry fruit is supple and elegant, medium- to full-bodied. Complex and layered, ending with caressing tannins and a long finish. Drink now through 2014. 703 cases made. –JLlogo 93 PointsTWO STARS:(91-94 points) A highly distinctive wine. Likely to be memorable. As in the previous vintage, so again does the Sonatera Vineyard bottling win the nod as one of Siduri's very best efforts in 2007. Absolutely laden with optimally ripened, black-cherry fruit and filled out with a full measure of seamlessly fit oak, the wine is deep, dense and involving from front to back. Its considerable concentration and deft sense of balance garner it big points in the near term, but it will only get better with age and deserves at least of few years patience.

“The generic 2006 Syrah Santa Lucia Highlands is a full-bodied beauty offering up notions of tapenade, creme de cassis, black cherries, forest floor, and damp earth. This dense, supple-textured effort is a glorious, fruit-driven Syrah with plenty of personality. Enjoy it over the next 3-4 years.”From the Arizona Daily Sun, azdailysun.comVineyards of Syrah keep expanding, making it an increasingly prominent grape in California. This new beauty has gorgeous purple-hued color, full-bodied flavors, exceptional complexity and an extended finish. Medium-soft tannins allow for a few years of aging. Ideal with full-flavored dishes such as pot roasts and game. - John Vankat

Ideal with full-flavored dishes such as pot roasts and game. - John Vankat

The 2008 Novy Rosella’s Vineyard Chardonnay tastes of pears and vanilla. It shows just the beginnings of a creaminess in the mouth but this is cut short by its lively acidity. This wine actually strikes us as a Chardonnay that will benefit from some age. We’d recommend hiding it in the cellar and pulling it out in 6 months and seeing at that time how it is progressing.90-93 points Robert Parker’s Wine Advocate

This wine actually strikes us as a Chardonnay that will benefit from some age. We’d recommend hiding it in the cellar and pulling it out in 6 months and seeing at that time how it is progressing.90-93 points Robert Parker’s Wine Advocate

The 2007 Novy Papera Vineyard Zinfandel is bigger and a bit more earthy than previous Papera vintages, reminding us a bit more of a Chateauneuf-du-Pape. With currant and black cherry flavors on the nose, but hints of tar, oak, and bramble on the palate, and then good levels of natural acidity, this is a Zinfandel that will truly benefit from a couple of years of age.

The 2007 Novy Papera Vineyard Zinfandel is bigger and a bit more earthy than previous Papera vintages, reminding us a bit more of a Chateauneuf-du-Pape. With currant and black cherry flavors on the nose, but hints of tar, oak, and bramble on the palate, and then good levels of natural acidity, this is a Zinfandel that will truly benefit from a couple of years of age.

The 2007 Novy Papera Vineyard Zinfandel is bigger and a bit more earthy than previous Papera vintages, reminding us a bit more of a Chateauneuf-du-Pape. With currant and black cherry flavors on the nose, but hints of tar, oak, and bramble on the palate, and then good levels of natural acidity, this is a Zinfandel that will truly benefit from a couple of years of age.

variety: Late Harvest Sauvignon Blanc Ode to Joy
other_notes: Classic Sauvignon Blanc flavors and characters are all here - citrus, apple, and tropical fruits intertwine perfectly with a subtle grassiness which is followed on the finish with ripe peach, apricot and that mysterious “toast/marmalade” character.

All those familiar flavors of Blueberry, Cassis, Black Cherry and Peppercorn are there in abundance.  It has that deep dark core of minerality, but it is far more opulent, the tannins are far more ripe and plentiful, it’s a fatter richer wine compared to the perhaps more elegant ‘05.
Dark & brooding with deep concentration and good tannin structure, this wine is luscious, pretty and will be remembered by all who experience its powerful charm.
You will find this wine packed full of floral notes, seductive blueberry and raspberry fruit, with a full and lingering mouthfeel.
Deep blackberry fruit and big spice plus black pepper, a touch of chocolate and cola in the oak contribution. Richly textured in mouth, good structure for aging, long black fruit finish.
90 Pts. Wine Spectator  Deep raspberry fruit, black pepper spice ad smoky cocoa-oak with a lusciously juicy mouthfeel.  Pairs beautifully with grilled food, tomato sauces, and chipotle seasoning.
Winemaker's Tasting Notes: Inky blue-purple in color, very deep blackberry fruit, smoky oak creaminess, very dark chocolate, dash of pepper, elegantly structured tannins for aging
Big Zin, inky in color, with deep, rich, complex spice and concentrated blueberry-pie fruit.

Deep dark milk chocolate (Belgian?) and sweet cherry fruit, that Chinese 5-spice typical of this vineyard, bit of pungent herbs.  Needs time to open up, so decant and splash well, or shake partial bottle before serving!
Lush cassis fruit, chocolatey oak with just a trace of the herbal “green bean.”  Very soft tannins, succulent and round, yet firm tannins to age nice minerality typical of Rockpile.

Opaque black-purple. Head-turning aromas of blackberry, black olive, and white pepper. A fabulous sniff! On the palate, full-bodied and smooth but with tremendous underlying structure. Notes of white pepper and violets echo on the finish. Gorgeous stuff with a long life ahead. Enjoy 2011 through 2020.

Opaque black-purple. Head-turning aromas of blackberry, black olive, and white pepper. A fabulous sniff! On the palate, full-bodied and smooth but with tremendous underlying structure. Notes of white pepper and violets echo on the finish. Gorgeous stuff with a long life ahead. Enjoy 2011 through 2020.

Opaque black-purple. Head-turning aromas of blackberry, black olive, and white pepper. A fabulous sniff! On the palate, full-bodied and smooth but with tremendous underlying structure. Notes of white pepper and violets echo on the finish. Gorgeous stuff with a long life ahead. Enjoy 2011 through 2020.

Very dark ruby-purple. Verging on opaque. Concentrated aromas of blackberry, raw beef, and a touch of pepper exude from the glass. Full-bodied and concentrated but not at all oafish or “lazy” thanks to invigorating tannins and acidity. A terrific syrah at an even better price. Optimum drinking should be between 2011 and 2020.

Very dark ruby-purple. Verging on opaque. Concentrated aromas of blackberry, raw beef, and a touch of pepper exude from the glass. Full-bodied and concentrated but not at all oafish or “lazy” thanks to invigorating tannins and acidity. A terrific syrah at an even better price. Optimum drinking should be between 2011 and 2020.

Very dark ruby-purple. Verging on opaque. Concentrated aromas of blackberry, raw beef, and a touch of pepper exude from the glass. Full-bodied and concentrated but not at all oafish or “lazy” thanks to invigorating tannins and acidity. A terrific syrah at an even better price. Optimum drinking should be between 2011 and 2020.

Medium ruby-garnet. Intoxicating aromas of cardamom, white pepper, tree bark, shoe polish, and cherries. Fascinating and complex! On the palate, medium-full to full bodied with Rhone-like flavors of kirsch, spice box, and sandalwood. Even some garrigue-like funk, in a good way! Finishes with plenty of cut and definition. This wine can be enjoyed now but should be at its best between 2011 and 2020.

Medium ruby-garnet. Intoxicating aromas of cardamom, white pepper, tree bark, shoe polish, and cherries. Fascinating and complex! On the palate, medium-full to full bodied with Rhone-like flavors of kirsch, spice box, and sandalwood. Even some garrigue-like funk, in a good way! Finishes with plenty of cut and definition. This wine can be enjoyed now but should be at its best between 2011 and 2020.

Medium to medium-dark garnet-ruby. Classic Dry Creek zin aromas of red cherries, minerals, and dusty, red earth. Bright and lively in the mouth with plenty of cherry-laced fruit flowing into the persistent, sappy finish. Strikes a lovely balance between ripeness and freshness. Enjoy 2011 through 2018.

Medium to medium-dark garnet-ruby. Classic Dry Creek zin aromas of red cherries, minerals, and dusty, red earth. Bright and lively in the mouth with plenty of cherry-laced fruit flowing into the persistent, sappy finish. Strikes a lovely balance between ripeness and freshness. Enjoy 2011 through 2018.

Medium to medium-dark ruby-garnet. Scents of kirsch liqueur are intertwined with hints of iron and loamy earth. No doubt this is Dry Creek zinfandel! Full-bodied on the palate with a suppleness that belies its structure and framework underneath the red cherry fruit. Finishes seductive and silky with impressive length. This should be enjoyable on release but will age well through 2017.

Medium to medium-dark ruby-garnet. Scents of kirsch liqueur are intertwined with hints of iron and loamy earth. No doubt this is Dry Creek zinfandel! Full-bodied on the palate with a suppleness that belies its structure and framework underneath the red cherry fruit. Finishes seductive and silky with impressive length. This should be enjoyable on release but will age well through 2017.

Medium-dark garnet-ruby. Aromas of raspberries and fraise des bois are punctuated by notes of briary spice and licorice. The wine enters full and rich with aromas echoed in the flavors. Plenty of acidity keeps the wine light on its feet. Notes of black pepper emerge in the long and energetic finish. Optimum drinking should be from late 2010 through 2015.

Medium-dark to dark ruby-purple. Gorgeous aromas of blackberries and raspberries are laced with notes of menthol and spice. On the palate, medium-full to full-bodied but amazingly precise and focused. Stylistically, more in the vein of the 2005 and 2007, our two favorite Montafi (aka Tom Feeney) bottlings. Drinkable on release but best between 2012 and 2018.

Medium-dark to dark ruby-purple. Gorgeous aromas of blackberries and raspberries are laced with notes of menthol and spice. On the palate, medium-full to full-bodied but amazingly precise and focused. Stylistically, more in the vein of the 2005 and 2007, our two favorite Montafi (aka Tom Feeney) bottlings. Drinkable on release but best between 2012 and 2018.

Medium-dark to dark ruby-purple. Gorgeous aromas of blackberries and raspberries are laced with notes of menthol and spice. On the palate, medium-full to full-bodied but amazingly precise and focused. Stylistically, more in the vein of the 2005 and 2007, our two favorite Montafi (aka Tom Feeney) bottlings. Drinkable on release but best between 2012 and 2018.

Medium-dark ruby-garnet. Red cherries, berry compote, and notes of bittersweet chocolate and brown spices greet the nose. Fresh and juicy on the palate with red and black berry fruits highlighted by hints of licorice, smoked meat, and earth. Finishes with great energy and thrust. Once again, an absolute steal for the price. Optimum enjoyment should be between late 2011 and 2018.

Medium-dark ruby-garnet. Red cherries, berry compote, and notes of bittersweet chocolate and brown spices greet the nose. Fresh and juicy on the palate with red and black berry fruits highlighted by hints of licorice, smoked meat, and earth. Finishes with great energy and thrust. Once again, an absolute steal for the price. Optimum enjoyment should be between late 2011 and 2018.

Once again, an absolute steal for the price. Optimum enjoyment should be between late 2011 and 2018.

Once again, an absolute steal for the price. Optimum enjoyment should be between late 2011 and 2018.

This single vineyard version of our Russian River Valley Pinot Noir comes from one of our favorite vineyards of that appellation, Emeritus Vineyard, which is located west of Sebastopol, and was planted 8 years ago with clones 777 and Cruz. This site has given us a wine that combines the deep, dark, voluptuous cherry we expect out of the Russian River Valley with complex under-pinnings of mineral-laced earthiness. Broad but not hard in the palate, the wine mingles Bing cherry, brown sugar and spice from Rousseau barrels, and that hint of graphite which makes us sure this wine is only going to get better and better over time.

Verve French Colombard comes from the “Domaine de Mirail” located in the heart of Gascony in southwest France. The specific site is in the Cotes de Gascogne region. Fermentation occurred in stainless steel, with the temperature stabilized to a very cool 59-62 degrees Fahrenheit in order to preserve the floral aromatics and fresh tropical and citrus fruit characteristics. Four months ageing on the lies adds a hint of creaminess and roundness to the wine’s texture, but does not mask the racy acidity typical of French Colombard from the Cotes de Gascogne. This wine is a bit riper and the fruit more concentrated and exotic than the 2007 French Colombard which is more mineral and focused. Served well-chilled, Verve French Colombard will prove a classic match with fish, oysters and other shellfish, salad or goat cheese.

The estate-grown Dr. Loosen Riesling Kabinett embodies the racy, mineral-driven style of steep blue slate vineyards in the famous middle Mosel villages of Bernkastel, Graach and Wehlen.  It’s a crisp, juicy Riseling that makes an ideal aperitif, and pairs well with spicy Asian cuisine (or creole).

The estate-grown Dr. Loosen Riesling Kabinett embodies the racy, mineral-driven style of steep blue slate vineyards in the famous middle Mosel villages of Bernkastel, Graach and Wehlen.  It’s a crisp, juicy Riseling that makes an ideal aperitif, and pairs well with spicy Asian cuisine (or creole).

This is the second year for the Hapa Blanc which is a blend of 60% Grenache Blanc and 40% Roussanne. The fruit was sourced from Camp Four vineyard located on the eastern edge of the Santa Ynez Valley. The climate is warmer here providing an ideal site to ripen these two southern Rhone varietals. The wined was blended post primary fermentation. The wine has aromas of passion fruit, lychee and pineapple. The fruit is supple in the mouth with great length and a lush finish.

This is the second year for the Hapa Blanc which is a blend of 60% Grenache Blanc and 40% Roussanne. The fruit was sourced from Camp Four vineyard located on the eastern edge of the Santa Ynez Valley. The climate is warmer here providing an ideal site to ripen these two southern Rhone varietals. The wined was blended post primary fermentation. The wine has aromas of passion fruit, lychee and pineapple. The fruit is supple in the mouth with great length and a lush finish.

The wined was blended post primary fermentation. The wine has aromas of passion fruit, lychee and pineapple. The fruit is supple in the mouth with great length and a lush finish.

Portraying bright crispness, subtle sweetness and aromas of jasmine, pear and apple, this wine exemplifies the harmony of Riesling.  The sweetness plays wonderfully with fiery fare (from Thai to Mexican), while the natural acidity stands up to richer foods (from French to German).
The Russian River Valley’s cool climate allows slow ripening and gives this wine its lively fruit aromas, crisp flavors and broad finish.

This wine made from mature hillside vines has ripe, deep and exotic layaered aromas built around plums, smoke and earth.  The rich palate shows multiple layers of concentrated black fruit with chocolate, spices and roasted flavors.  The wine has a full and smooth palate that displays a linearity and purity of fruit.  The finish lingers with fruit freshness and acidity.  Wine will gain in depth and complexity if decanted at room temperature for 2 or 3 hours before serving.

The careful mix of clones, including old vine Martini, results in a layered, complete wine full of sweet cherries and exotic spice.  The fleshy, silky weight is balanced by the inherent acidity of this cool climate vineyard; and careful use of French oak in fermentation and aging provides delicious background notes of sweet chocolate and savory briar.  Delicious on its own, this Pinot Noir will match well with lighter meats, most fowl, and fish such as SALMON.

Bright acidity underlies the juicy red cherry flavors that predomiate; but hints of strawberry and cranberry fruit add lovely high tones,.  Clean attractive briary and floral notes mingle with hints of white spices and tea leaves.  Moderate but sweet caramel and milk chocolate linger in the finish from the new Sait Martin barrel used for aging.  The soft fine grain tannins of this vibrant and yet accessible wine allow for immediate pleasure.
Unique richness and complexity complemented by tropical fruit, peaches and pineapple on the palate.  The finish is well-rounded with toasty coconut and butterscotch notes.
Unique richness and complexity complemented by tropical fruit, peaches and pineapple on the palate.  The finish is well-rounded with toasty coconut and butterscotch notes.
Unique richness and complexity complemented by tropical fruit, peaches and pineapple on the palate.  The finish is well-rounded with toasty coconut and butterscotch notes.

Your nose will be greeted with ripe tropical fruits including mango and peaches.  The flavors are bright, with hints of apple and pear.  It rounds out nicely with creamy, lemon-honey tones and the finish is lengthy and pleasantly sweet.  We like to up-end a glass with seafood appetizers or main meals with a spicy little kick.

Your nose will be greeted with ripe tropical fruits including mango and peaches.  The flavors are bright, with hints of apple and pear.  It rounds out nicely with creamy, lemon-honey tones and the finish is lengthy and pleasantly sweet.  We like to up-end a glass with seafood appetizers or main meals with a spicy little kick.
A perfect summer wine, Lucy's essence of Pinot Noir and fresh acidity allow for pairings with a variety of dishes.

Wonderfully wildberry fruit nose, very pretty with candied violets and a bit of orange peel, nice warm brown spices like nutmeg and clove.  Lots of stuff going on once it opens up.  Nice soft mouthfeel - creamy oak but showcases fruit more than oak - not heavy in body but good intensity nonetheless.  Needs to open more but is showing well now too - can age another 5 years.
Deep blackberry fruit, with bit of black pepper spice.  Cedary oak spice, very dark chocolate, bit of warm vanilla at finish.  Structured tannins for aging.  Very young, better in six months.

variety: Rhone Blend Hapa  60% Syrah, 30% Grenache, 10% Mourvedre
appellation: Ballard Canyon and Santa Ynez Valley
vineyard: Tierra Alta and Camp Four Vineyards
other_notes: Wonderful intensity, balance, focus and purity of flavor built around ripe blackberry and wild berry, boysenberry and cherry, joined by herb, mineral and spice. Delicious.

The wine possesses a very deep purple color. The nose istypical of Syrah from this cool site: a combination ofbaking spice, floral notes, perfume and slight hints ofpepper. The ripe tannins are very full and round. Theyprovide a very long-lasting texture that stays on the palatefor a drawn-out and velvety finish.

The oldest sister, Diablita is a blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Syrah and Petite Sirah.  She grabs your attention with her looks and great taste.  Unpretentious enough to have with a pizza, she’s sufficiently elegant to accompany upscale fare like filet mignon.The Diablita Red Wine is Rich and juicy blackberry, plum and black cherry flavors with an integrated band of French Oak. It has soft tannins and good balances, our Diablita goes well with grilled fare, like tri-tip and chicken, or by itself.

variety: Coquille Blanc  Grenache Blanc, Roussanne, Viognier
other_notes: Exotic nose of spicy pears and white peaches, almond paste/marzipan, yuzu/grapefruit, with a touch of honeysuckle perfume.  In the mouth it is crisply dry, yet creamy, round and full-bodies.  It has the sense of umami or deliciousness and wholeness.  Divinely delicious with seafood risotta, grilled diver scallops or lemongrass soup

Deeper black raspberry fruit, super smoky oak with tones of caramello chocolate that carry from aroma to mouth.   Smooth and juicy flavors, great with grilled beast or veggies - tomatto sauces, Szechwan maybe?

Deep dark milk chocolate and sweet cherry fruit, that Chinese 5-spice typical of this vineyard, bit of pungent herbs.  Needs time to open up, so decant and splash well, or shake partial bottle before serving
Spicy blackberry fruit framed in sweet vanilla oak, nice dash of black pepper and earth.  Great structure for aging, still opening up in noswe, let it breathe!

Deeper darker chocolate, almost coca-cola aroma, very dark blackberry fruit with a hint of orange zest.  Roasty oak flavors, smoky and toasty, plush mouthfeel, long spicy finish - great with grilled lamb, Moroccan style!

Big creme caramel aromas, hazelnutty milk chocolate and vanilla, walnuts, orange peel, dried fruits, it just goes on and on and on.  Sweet but bright acidity, not at all hot - smooth and sensual and luxurious.  Since this rare bottling has spent almost 4 years in oak, it is like a tawny port in style.  It can age indefinitely longer.  Serve with chocolate, dried fruits, nuts and strong cheeses.

Neon dark ruby-red. Fantastic color for carignane. On the nose, ripe red cherry dominates but there’s a hint of sous bois, dried caraway, and orange rind lurking in the background. As the wine enters, it coats the palate with creamy cherry fruit. Bright acidity from mid-palate to finish (This is carignane after all!) keeps the mouth refreshed.Texturally, reminds me a bit of a great Chinon from a ripe year. Should be very versatile at the table, pairing well with anything from burgers to pastas to steaks. Enjoy from release through 2020.

Neon dark ruby-red. Fantastic color for carignane. On the nose, ripe red cherry dominates but there’s a hint of sous bois, dried caraway, and orange rind lurking in the background. As the wine enters, it coats the palate with creamy cherry fruit. Bright acidity from mid-palate to finish (This is carignane after all!) keeps the mouth refreshed.Texturally, reminds me a bit of a great Chinon from a ripe year. Should be very versatile at the table, pairing well with anything from burgers to pastas to steaks. Enjoy from release through 2020.

Black ruby-purple. Captivating, perfumed aromas of blackberry, peat, and licorice allsorts. On the palate, incredibly smooth and harmonious, with flavors of blueberry, blackberry, and loamy earth. Amazingly approachable, especially for a petite sirah. Drink from release (if you like ‘em young) through 2020.

Opaque black-purple. Can red wine be any darker? A knockout nose of blueberries, wild herbs, and white and black pepper. In fact, reminds me of what I smell when I walk the vineyard, crushing the aromatic wild herbs under my feet. On the palate, immensely concentrated, like essence of petite sirah, with plenty of blackberry fruit and licorice. Tannins in the finish indicate this wine will age. In fact, drink it on release with a grilled Flannery RibEye or age it up to 30 years. Either way, major yums!

Vibrant dark ruby purple. Nearly opaque. Head-turning, high-toned aromas of violets, white pepper, crushed rock, and crème de cassis. Classic syrah! On the palate, full-bodied with concentrated flavors of blackberry, black olive, and savory herbs. Very persistent with great definition and cut. A long, spice-laden finish. As much as we loved the 2007, this is even better. Enjoy 2011 through 2020.

Very dark ruby-purple. Compelling aromas of blackberry, plum, and apricot (the viognier?) are intertwined with notes of charcoal, and herbs. The wine enters full and rich, with flavors of blackberry, smoke, and gardenia. More approachable than the 2007 but with plenty of structure to age, this wine should be at its best between 2013 and 2022.

Dark garnet-ruby. Deep, concentrated aromas of blackberry, creosote, smoked game, and vanilla bean. Full-bodied but very harmonious, with suave tannins persisting through the long berry-laden finish. The new oak percentage is high for us but by using barrels that contribute texture and little in the way of flavor and aroma, the wood is already perfectly integrated. While enjoyable now, especially if decanted, this wine should be at its peak between 2013 and 2021.

Inky, dark purple-garnet. Opaque. Rich, heady scents of blackberry, blueberry, chalky earth, and violet pastilles. Full-bodied but with a lightness that belies its size, no doubt due to the highly calcareous soils. There are tannins present but they are overwhelmed by the abundant blue and black fruit. Depending on whether you prefer your wine young or old, enjoy this powerful, delicious syrah anytime between 2011 and 2025.

variety: Rhone Blend Two Acres Red Wine Blend79% Mourvèdre 7% Petite Sirah 6% Syrah 5% Carignane 3% Alicante Bouchet
other_notes: Medium-dark to dark garnet-ruby. A sexy bouquet of raspberry, kirsch, bittersweet chocolate, and cardamom is highlighted by a suggestion of rose petal. Medium full-bodied, the palate explodes with berry fruit, tree bark, and orange peel. With aeration, a note of smoked game emerges. Very complex! While slightly richer than the 2007, lively acidity keeps the wine fresh and vibrant. Like many mourvèdre-based wines, this will age very well. Drink from late 2012 through 2022

Medium-dark ruby-purple. Raspberry and mulberry combine in a complex, perfumed aroma with highlights of rose hip and Asian spice. What a nose! Medium full to full-bodied with an ethereal elegance thanks to vivacious acidity. Flavors of red cherry and black raspberry are complimented by notes of bittersweet chocolate, candied flowers, and white pepper. Very long on the energetic finish. Enjoyable now but best between late 2011 through 2015.

Medium-dark to dark ruby-purple. Alluring aromas of raspberry, citrus, cherry pit, and fraises des bois. On the palate, full-bodied but amazingly precise and focused with flavors of cherry, pomegranate, and marzipan. There’s both balance and intensity here that can only come from old vines carefully farmed. Ample acidity in the finish dictates this wine will age well. Drink from release through 2018.#19 Wine Spectator Top 100 for 2011

Medium-dark ruby-garnet. Explosive aromas of macerated red cherries, earth and orange zest emerge from the glass. Full-bodied with aromas echoed in the flavors. A note of pepper emerges in the mid-palate. The long cherryfilled finish is punctuated by firm but gentle tannins. A real standout at a tasting earlier this year of all Rossi Ranch zins we’ve produced to date. Should age very well. Enjoy from 2012 to 2020.

Bright fruit balanced by mouthwatering acidity and great texture. I’ve been making rose for a while now and can honestly say that this is the best one I have done to date. One bottle is never enough.
Wine Spectator August 2009 Firm, intense and rustic, full-bodied, with chewy wild berry and blackberry scents, firm tannins and good length. Well-focused. Drink now through 2013.
Wine Spectator August 2009 Firm, intense and rustic, full-bodied, with chewy wild berry and blackberry scents, firm tannins and good length. Well-focused. Drink now through 2013.

The first of the Pali AVA blends, the Huntington is ripe, lush and concentrated. Lifted aromatics of ripe plums, earth, wild blackberries and white pepper. A medium weight wine with round and lush mouth feel. Fruit-driven with layers of juicy red cherries, cranberries, toasty oak and sweet tannin.

The first of the Pali AVA blends, the Huntington is ripe, lush and concentrated. Lifted aromatics of ripe plums, earth, wild blackberries and white pepper. A medium weight wine with round and lush mouth feel. Fruit-driven with layers of juicy red cherries, cranberries, toasty oak and sweet tannin.
Light cranberry color, juicy strawberry-watermelon fruit aromas, nice mineral, hint of pink grapefruit. Refreshingly crisp and dry. Great with almost any food, from sushi to salmon to BBQ!
Light cranberry color, juicy strawberry-watermelon fruit aromas, nice mineral, hint of pink grapefruit. Refreshingly crisp and dry. Great with almost any food, from sushi to salmon to BBQ!
Very bright pomegranate-wild cherry fruit, brown sugary-caramel oak, fragrant Asian spices—Chinese 5-spice. Mouthfeel is still a bit young and chewy, but quite drinkable now. Very mouthfilling!

Very complexly layered spice and black fruits, pretty blueberry fragrance, creamy oak, a bit of vanilla, dark chocolate, brown spices - nutmeg/cinnamon. Rich in mouth, good structure for aging, a bit chewy in its youth.
Inky blue-purple in color, very deep blackberry fruit, spicy oak creaminess, very dark chocolate, dash of pepper, elegantly structured tannins for aging.

variety: Zinfandel  Bacchus Laureate Reserve Zin  88% Zinfandel, 4% Syrah, 3% Petite Sirah, 3% Carignane, 2% Alicante Bouschet
appellation: Sonoma  85% Dry Creek Valley, 15% Russian River Valley
other_notes: Deep blackberry fruit and big spice plus black pepper, a touch of chocolate and cola in the oak contribution. Richly textured in mouth, good structure for aging, long black fruit finish.

variety: Rhone Blend Hapa  60% Syrah, 30% Grenache, 10% Mourvedre
appellation: Ballard Canyon and Santa Ynez Valley
vineyard: Tierra Alta and Camp Four Vineyards
other_notes: Wonderful intensity, balance, focus and purity of flavor built around ripe blackberry and wild berry, boysenberry and cherry, joined by herb, mineral and spice. Delicious.

The Toasted Head Chardonnay is fresh and vibrant with loads of apple and citrus flavors; very fruit forward and long in the aftertaste.

The nose offers ripe pineapple and peach aromas with toasted graham cracker. The bright straw color prepares the palate for the rich tropical fruit and luscious stone fruit with a viscous mouth feel accented by toasted coconut, vanilla and butterscotch. The creamy finish lingers with hints of buttered toast and lemon zest. This wine will pair well with creamy Italian pasta dishes, roasted chicken or fish, and fresh summer corn.

93 points Wine Spectator: "Bright, vivid, intense and concentrated blackberry and wild berry fruit has floral and spicy edges, with a tight structured focus, firming up nicely on the finish where the tannins are full-bodied. Drink now through 2014. 350 cases made.

94 points Wine Spectator: "Offers wonderful purity of fruit. Ripe, rich, intense and focused, with tiers of currant, black cherry and blueberry fruit that's simply delicious. Supple, layered and complex. Long and lingering on the finish. Drink now through 2014

This Pinot Noir offers a tantalizing bouquet of raspberries, white pepper and herb. The palate is dry, light bodied, with moderate tannins. Flavors of raspberries, cranberry, and white pepper create a wonderfully long finish. No Pinot envy here in this little gem.
Intense, vibrant and full-bodied, with spicy, minerally wild berry, sage and cedar notes that are pure and delicate, ending with firm tannins. Drink now through 2014

other_notes: Deep blackberry fruit and big spice plus black pepper, a touch of chocolate and cola in the oak contribution. Richly textured in mouth, good structure for aging, long black fruit finish.

Deeper darker chocolate, almost coca-cola aroma, very dark blackberry fruit with a hint of orange zest.  Roasty oak flavors, smoky and toasty, plush mouthfeel, long spicy finish - great with grilled lamb, Moroccan style!

Intensely jammy, black razzberry fruit, vibrant and alive in both nose and mouth, nice hit of black pepper. Smoothly textured in mouth, creamy vanilla oak, and the finish is long and lushly jammy fruit—dangerously good!

The 2009 Sauvignon Blanc shows a straw to pale gold color with pale intensity and bright clarity in appearance. The nose shows medium plus intensity with a youthful development and aromas of lychee, pineapple, candied banana, melon and gooseberry. The palate is dry with medium plus acidity, body, flavor intensity and length, showing additional notes of grapefruit, green apple and honey. The lively, refreshing acidity and expressive fresh fruit in this wine should complement a variety of seafood dishes, as well as fresh salads and rich cheeses.

my_notes: Slightly dry, but firm enough to withstand spicy foods.
other_notes: Per Christy, really good with Vietnamese food

my_notes: This went great with a Caesar salad
other_notes: The 2009 vintage has terrific lime, tropical fruit and floral aromas. There is also a nice mineral characteristic to the flavor of this wine, to go along with the delicious grapefruit, green apple and lime flavors.

Only available at the winery. Nose of flowers and flowery soap. Mouth - light vanilla, full bodied and bitter

my_notes: This is a little different from the description, the Extra Dry label is sold only at the winery and is a little bit sweeter.
other_notes: The wine is two-thirds Pinot Noir which produces a red fruit forward nose (cherry and plum) combined with one-third Chardonnay which adds the tropical expression of lychee nut and mango. The 100% malolactic fermentation adds a vanilla cream character producing a round and full-bodied wine. After approximately two years on the lees, there are notes of freshly baked bread and pastry that enhances the more fruit forward style of the wine. Finally, after several months on the cork, the wine develops caramel and hazel complexors.

Delightful fragrances of vanilla-accented cherry, French plum and spice swim on a bed of iris blossoms.  The inviting mouth entry composed of lush blackberry jam and cassis, highlighted with spicy cayenne pepper, lead to a firm core of plush tannins accented with chocolate bark.

Delightful fragrances of vanilla-accented cherry, French plum and spice swim on a bed of iris blossoms.  The inviting mouth entry composed of lush blackberry jam and cassis, highlighted with spicy cayenne pepper, lead to a firm core of plush tannins accented with chocolate bark.
Seems to be a bit smoother than most of the Ridge zins. Nice fruit, minimal alcohol.
Delicate light color. Very floral and grassy nose. Demure ripe strawberry and cherry flavors with plenty of finesse and a spark of acidity.

For the 2006 vintage:  Elegant yet powerful in the nose, this is quintessential Malbec. The initial aromas of ripe strawberries, dried fruit, and dust are complimented by wet dirt and herbs. The wine is fresh and vibrant on the front palate, with loads of red fruit and a dash of white pepper. The tannins of this Bordeaux varietal are present from start to finish, but without the normal astringency that can accompany it. Quite the opposite, the Rockpile Malbec exhibits a lush mouth feel with rich accents along the way. The youthful tannins on the finish make you aware that the wine will age gracefully for the next 8-10 years, but it is more than enjoyable now.

variety: Terranova blend Zinfandel Carignane Petit Sirah
other_notes: Dark, dark purple color foreshadows that the heft of this vintage’s Terranova will rival one of Dan’s Reserve Zinfandels. The massive tannins soften up after only a few minutes in the glass and take a back seat to heaps of fruit. Blackberry up front and blueberry on the finish. Drink now or in 5 years for the ultimate Teldeschi experience

From the outset, this Pinot captivates with its jewel-like quality. The aroma has many facets ― dark cherry, rich plum and chocolate. As you swirl it in your glass, the complexity unfolds and expands, manifesting accents of licorice, vanilla bean and spicy oak. An enticing, succulent entry on the palate opens with masses of ripe fruit and a hint of earthiness, while firm, tarry tannins fill the extended finish. This wine will surprise you with its age-worthiness!

Black razzberry fruit, vibrant and alive in both nose and mouth, nice oaky-smokiness, hit of black pepper. Smoothly textured in mouth, the finish is long and lushly jammy fruit—dangerously good! Certified CCOF Organically Grown

Deeper black raspberry fruit, still nice pepper and lightly smoky, but oak is more vanilla-creamy and chocolatey.  This wine is rounder and fatter than the 2006, with a longer juicy finish.  Still pairs up with tomato sauces and spicy seasonings, and also is superb with grilled meats.
Spicy blackberry fruit framed in sweet vanilla oak, nice dash of black pepper and earth.  Great structure for aging, still opening up in nose, let it breathe!

Very bright pomegranate-wild cherry fruit, brown sugary-caramel oak, fragrant Asian spices—Chinese 5-spice. Mouthfeel is still a bit young and chewy, but quite drinkable now. Very mouthfilling! CCOF Certified Organically Grown

Deep darker milk chocolate - Cadbury’s Fruit & Nut bar - touch of dried cranberry and raisin, as well as a sprinkling of brown sugar.  Still that charming Asian 5-spice, a bit more cinnamon, and a bit of pungent herbs.  Needs time to open up, so decant and splash well, or shake the partial bottle before opening.

Big blackberry fruit and heaps of black pepper, creamy vanilla oak, rounder in mouth than expected of most Petite Sirahs.  Long elegant finish, still a bit chewy.  Complements hearty winter stews, roast beast, big food for big wine!

Intriguing aromatics of brambly black cherry with sweet alluring raspberry contrasts with fleshy rare steak spiced with sea salt, lavender and sage.  The Ruby red color is deceptive with its weighty blueberry and bright cherry core.  Bright with acidity and metallic notes tightly wound with espresso and soy/miso undertones.  The finish is powerful, layered and complete.

This dark Pinot Noir has aromas of black cherry and blackberry, with lots of spice, a bit of black peppercorn and nuances of minerality and violets.  It sits broadly on the palate with lush blackberry and candied cherry and a trace of espresso folding into sweet rich tannins.

Opaque, neon black-purple. The color alone is a turn-on! Deep, concentrated aromas of blackberry, blueberry, and white chocolate. On the palate, mouth-coating black and blue fruits are supported by fine-grained tannins. Powerful yet quite elegant, especially for the variety. Easily one of the finest Petite Sirah we’ve produced. Enjoyable now but will age well.

Very dark ruby-purple. Verging on opaque. Cool climate aromas of grapefruit, smoke, white pepper, and herbs. On the palate, full-bodied and smooth but with tremendous underlying structure. Notes of white pepper and violets echo on the finish. Reminds me a bit of a great St. Joseph. This will age well

appellation: Sonoma County  39%  Sonoma Valley Syrah, Rossi Ranch 23% Paso Robles Syrah 19% Russian River Syrah, Papa's Block  19% Sonoma Mountain Syrah, Steiner Vineyard
other_notes: Dark garnet-purple with a magenta rim. High pitched, explosive aromas of blackberry, smoked game, black olives, and violets leap from the glass. Very Syrah! The wine enters full and rich, with flavors of blackberry and violet enveloping the tongue. Suave tannins from mid-palate through the finish provide plenty of clarity and cut. Delicious now, optimum drinking should be between release and 2017.

appellation: Sonoma County: 65% Sonoma Valley Grenache,Rossi Ranch, 12% Dry Creek Valley Grenache, Teldeschi Ranch, 17% Sonoma Valley Mourvèdre, Rossi Ranch, 6% Syrah Sonoma Valley, Rossi Ranch
other_notes: Medium to medium-dark ruby-garnet. Enticing aromas of cardamom, sandalwood, orange peel, and kirsch liqueur. The wine enters smooth and round, with flavors of cherry, spice box, and truffle. Gentle tannins build from mid-palate through the long finish. Although my favorite Three Birds to date (we’re beginning to understand Grenache!), I suspect this wine is holding something back at the moment and will develop and age exceptionally well.

appellation: Sonoma County: 65% Sonoma Valley Grenache,Rossi Ranch, 12% Dry Creek Valley Grenache, Teldeschi Ranch, 17% Sonoma Valley Mourvèdre, Rossi Ranch, 6% Syrah Sonoma Valley, Rossi Ranch
other_notes: Medium to medium-dark ruby-garnet. Enticing aromas of cardamom, sandalwood, orange peel, and kirsch liqueur. The wine enters smooth and round, with flavors of cherry, spice box, and truffle. Gentle tannins build from mid-palate through the long finish. Although my favorite Three Birds to date (we’re beginning to understand Grenache!), I suspect this wine is holding something back at the moment and will develop and age exceptionally well.

Medium garnet-ruby. Deep, brooding aromas of cherries, minerals, incense, and dusty, red earth. An intriguing herbal note adds interest and complexity. On the palate, ripe red cherries take center stage, framed by supple tannin and sound acidity. Displays great density and texture yet is incredibly harmonious and balanced. A very impressive Dry Creek Zinfandel that will develop for at least several more years. Enjoy 2011 through 2017. (MRO – 3/15/11)

Medium garnet-ruby. Deep, brooding aromas of cherries, minerals, incense, and dusty, red earth. An intriguing herbal note adds interest and complexity. On the palate, ripe red cherries take center stage, framed by supple tannin and sound acidity. Displays great density and texture yet is incredibly harmonious and balanced. A very impressive Dry Creek Zinfandel that will develop for at least several more years. Enjoy 2011 through 2017. (MRO – 3/15/11)

A very impressive Dry Creek Zinfandel that will develop for at least several more years. Enjoy 2011 through 2017. (MRO – 3/15/11)

Medium-dark ruby-garnet. Exotic, perfumed aromas of red berries, potpourri, red licorice whips, and spice. One of the most captivating, complex Zinfandels I have ever had the pleasure of smelling! Dense and full-bodied on entry, a cornucopia of fruits (red berries, figs, stone fruits) explode on the palate. Completely dry but with fruit and glycerin nearly obscuring the brisk acidity. A magnificent wine of great symmetry and balance. Optimum drinking should be from release through 2016 (but it may age and develop even longer). (MRO – 3/15/11)

Medium-dark to opaque ruby-purple. Blackberry confiture and cassis are highlighted by notes of eucalyptus, peach, and spice. On the palate, medium-full to full-bodied but amazingly precise and focused, with flavors of blackberry and one of my favorite holiday desserts, persimmon pudding. Montafi has been on a roll lately with the 2007, 2008, and 2009 all besting previous vintages. Drinkable on release but given the verve and energy of this wine, enjoy from 2013 through 2019. (MRO – 3/15/11)

Medium to medium-dark ruby-garnet. A compelling bouquet of cherries, red currants, lilac, and underbrush greets the nose. Succulent and supple on entry, flavors of raspberries and cherry coat the palate, persisting through the spice-laden finish. Some of our Sonoma County Zinfandels have required time in bottle to be at their best. This rendition will be ready on release. Enjoy 2011 through 2015.

Medium-dark ruby-purple. Hi-toned aromas of black raspberry, orange peel, rose petal, candied violet, and spicecake. A fabulous sniff! Sweet (from glycerin, not sugar) and concentrated on the palate with flavors of plum, blackcurrant, and licorice. Really coats the palate through the long fruit-filled finish. Enjoy from release through 2015.

Dark garnet-ruby. Blackberry, cherry, pepper, and just a touch of mocha provide for an olfactory smorgasbord. The wine enters oh-so smoothly but tannins and acidity on the finish ensure the palate stays refreshed, eager for another sip. Normally it takes us a couple vintages to best understand a vineyard but in our first year here, we seem to have hit it out of the park. A testament to how great this vineyard is. Optimum drinking should be from release through 2016

my_notes: We liked it tasting in Central Healdsburg

other_notes: This pure expression of Viognier-the most floral of white wines-is exotically perfumed with honeysuckle and plumeria flower.  In the mouth, its tropical fruit flavors of mango, guava andlychee are released, floowerd by a vibrant and flinty acidity.  Such and extroverted wine, this Viognier can take on bold flavors and would compelemnt dishes such as grilled sea bass with mango salsa, Indian green curry chicken or Thai coconut shrimp.  Drink within two years, as it is ripe for enjoying now and requires little aging to develop its full aromatic complexity.

Such and extroverted wine, this Viognier can take on bold flavors and would compelemnt dishes such as grilled sea bass with mango salsa, Indian green curry chicken or Thai coconut shrimp.  Drink within two years, as it is ripe for enjoying now and requires little aging to develop its full aromatic complexity.

The 2007 Cole Ranch Cabernet Sauvignon is a deeply colored and finely composed expresion of the vineyard at its best.  The aromas of black currant and olive are complemented by anise, sweet tobacco, coffee, allspice, and toasty oak.  Balanced and elegant, it possesses a firm structure, beginning as tighlty wound around a solid core and then unfolding on the palate into a fine-grained and smooth finish.  AGe for three to five years to evolve.  Pair this Cabernet Sauvignon with spring lamb chops with chopped parsly and mint.
Big, ripe and juicy, but continues to be elegant. It starts with terrific aromas of sweet oak, black berry and baking spice. The mouth has lots of juicy blueberry, coffee and black cherry.
Big, ripe and juicy, but continues to be elegant. It starts with terrific aromas of sweet oak, black berry and baking spice. The mouth has lots of juicy blueberry, coffee and black cherry.

The oldest sister, Diablita is a blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Syrah and Petite Sirah.  She grabs your attention with her looks and great taste.  Unpretentious enough to have with a pizza, she’s sufficiently elegant to accompany upscale fare like filet mignon.The Diablita Red Wine is Rich and juicy blackberry, plum and black cherry flavors with an integrated band of French Oak. It has soft tannins and good balances, our Diablita goes well with grilled fare, like tri-tip and chicken, or by itself.

winery: Le Cigare Blanc  a Bonny Doon wine
variety: White Rhone Blend 57% Roussanne 43% Grenache Blanc
my_notes: We had at tasting.  Complex notes of butterscotch
Very smooth, easily drinkable right when opened
Very smooth, easily drinkable right when opened

other_notes: A dry white wine with peach skin and lime perfumes, hinting at lavendar and lemon verbena
Tannat is dark, some say impenetrable. This one has an aroma of blueberry and boysenberry fruitwith undertones of a thick beefy consommé
Tannat is dark, some say impenetrable. This one has an aroma of blueberry and boysenberry fruit with undertones of a thick beefy consommé
A dry white wine with peach skin and lime perfumes, hinting at lavendar and lemon verbena
Bright fruit balanced by mouthwatering acidity and great texture. I’ve been making rose for a while now and can honestly say that this is the best one I have done to date. One bottle is never enough.
Bright fruit balanced by mouthwatering acidity and great texture. I’ve been making rose for a while now and can honestly say that this is the best one I have done to date. One bottle is never enough.

Wine Spectator 95 points  Sleek, refined and appealing for its deft balance, playing its pure blueberry and current fruit against hints of cream and spice. The finish sails off and on against polished tannins. Drink now through 2018.

New to us this fall is this yummy unpretentious German quaffer from importer Rudi Wiest. Sourced from vineyards in the Nahe, this perfectly balanced Riesling sings of clean, pear-like fruit. It's off-dry, so it works well with spicy Szechzuan fare.

Our most popular sparkler, the Segura Viudas tips the quality-for-price meter completely over! Made from Macabeo, Parellada, and Xarel-lo, it has to be the best fizz in this price range. It has a pleasant creaminess, a hint of citrus blossom, and finishes fairly crisp. Best thing is, if someone wants to make mimosas, they can do it here ... guilt free

variety: Montravel Blanc Terrement, Sauvignon Blanc and Sauvignon Gris
other_notes: Winemaker Daniel Hecquet blends equal parts Sauvignon Blanc and Sauvignon Gris for his 'Terrement', and the result is pure magic. The Gris gives the wine its plump fruity middle and the Sauvignon Blanc does the rest with its fresh acidity and flavor profile. Daniel may not be able to write White Bordeaux on the label, but it may as well be. Bowl o'mussels here.

In this corner, hailing from La Mancha region in Spain, is this 100% Macabeo from Destinos. We now know that Macabeo is a grape that is blended to make the sparkling Cava, but here it is on its own. It's lean, light, and crisp with hints of citrus blossoms and zippy apples. A versatile, easy-going wine, it works well as an aperitif or better with a shrimp salad.

We can't say enough about our friends Corinne and Philippe Ehrhart from Wettolsheim, Alsace. Philippe's grandfather instilled organic farming techniques and now the Domaine has the official Agricole Biologique status. This Pinot Gris is teeming with aromatic wonderfulness. On the palate it is dry, rich, and balanced. One for that bockworst and cabbage.

f you can find a better deal on a bottle of white wine than this, we need to know about it! Seriously, bang for your buck, Barbier's white offers stunning value. Clean and crisp and coming in at 11.5%, it's great with ceviche.

my_notes: Dirty Dozen Alan liked it but Laureen thought it tasted flat.
other_notes: Nestled in a warm pocket of micro-climate in the Costières de Nîmes is Domaine de Saint Antoine. Run by husband and wife Jean-Louis and Marlène Emmanuel, the wines from this property proudly carry their representation of place. Aromas of briary black and red fruit, herbs, and earth are met with a medium body that would stand up nicely to a prime rib.

variety: Red Blend of Syrah, Zinfandel, Pinot Noir and Alicante
other_notes: Pretty much the best deal we've got these days on a California red wine has to be the Shebang! Made by Bedrock's en fuego Morgan Twain-Peterson, it's a blend of Syrah, Zinfandel, Pinot Noir, and Alicante and according to the SF Chronicle's Jon Bonné tasts like a bottle worth almost twice the price. Would make a fine addition to the holiday table.

Looks like our Greek section is growing! A recent peek revealed 4 wines from the land of the Odyssey. Composed chiefly of Greek native Aghiorghitiko, it benefits from a kiss of Cabernet Sauvignon. It goes without saying lamb skewers work.

variety: Dao Vinho Tinto Portuguese grape Jaen
my_notes: Dirty Dozen.  This went nicely with pork with chile. Very mellow.
other_notes: Another hit in the November DD, Correio's Dão Tinto comes mostly from the Portuguese grape Jaen. It undergoes just a little barrel aging to give it some texture and it boasts some medium red fruit and violet flavors. It's great with pizza.

my_notes: Dirty Dozen - “this one you can cellar”
other_notes: November always marks the arrival of nouveaux Beaujolais, and we really feel that does a disservice to the quality of the region's top wines, or Cru Beaujolais. A recent scouting trip to France uncovered the gem of a Château, Raousset. The 2009 vintage was astounding for these top Cru wines, we strongly urge you to try this Morgon; you can cellar this one!

As if this month's DD needed a trump card! This 100% Mourvèdre CdR tips the scales for quality/price. Think dark, earthy briary berries wrapped up in a fresh, zippy elixir with silky tannins. That's what you get. We're proud to be the only shop in the country with this wine. That's why we're here; that's what we do. We find great wines from afar and bring them home for you and yours to enjoy. Enjoy this with a log on the fire and someone special by your side.

variety: Cotes du Rhone Blanc White Rhone Blend Roussanne, Grenache Blance, Clairette
my_notes: We bought 2 based on their review email, and took one to Jim’s for the Stanford-Oregon game.  We liked it so much, we bought 8 more, and Jim bought 12.  Very crisp and citrusy.  Very food friendly
other_notes: Woo Hoo! Today is an exciting day here at TWH. One of our all-time favorite wines is back on the shelves! André Brunel's Domaine Becassonne Côtes du Rhône Blanc is here!!! The 2010 version just arrived and we can't contain our excitement. If you've had this wine before, you know what we're talking about. If you haven't, prepare yourself for one of the best deals available on a white wine.We've gone on about Monsieur Brunel for some time now, and why not? Even today his wines receive a ton of praise. He's not just known for his red wines either. His white Châteauneuf-du-Papes are some of the finest, complex representations of the region. The 2010 Becassonne Blanc is not a far cry from CdP, and it is priced right in our sweet spot. Made from Roussanne (55%), Grenache Blanc (30%), and Clairette (15%), Brunel's white Côtes du Rhône trumps a lot of white Cdp's on the market today. Trumps them. Hands down; at a fraction of the price. One sip of this beauty will have you hooked. You'll get aromas of fresh stone fruit, citrus, and minerals, the palate is lively and balanced with a fleshy, round, white peachy middle all leading to a fine, crisp finish. It is a tremendously food-friendly wine and will suit anything from lobster thermidor to a chicken sandwich. Hmmm. Come to think of it, there's a holiday coming up that is known for a large celebratory feast. The 2010 André Brunel Domaine Becassonne Côtes du Rhône would suit the Turkey Day table to a T! We received a good chunk of this wine, but based on past experience, we expect this wine to sell out soon

my_notes: We bought 2 based on their review email, and took one to Jim’s for the Stanford-Oregon game.  We liked it so much, we bought 8 more, and Jim bought 12.  Very crisp and citrusy.  Very food friendly
other_notes: Woo Hoo! Today is an exciting day here at TWH. One of our all-time favorite wines is back on the shelves! André Brunel's Domaine Becassonne Côtes du Rhône Blanc is here!!! The 2010 version just arrived and we can't contain our excitement. If you've had this wine before, you know what we're talking about. If you haven't, prepare yourself for one of the best deals available on a white wine.We've gone on about Monsieur Brunel for some time now, and why not? Even today his wines receive a ton of praise. He's not just known for his red wines either. His white Châteauneuf-du-Papes are some of the finest, complex representations of the region. The 2010 Becassonne Blanc is not a far cry from CdP, and it is priced right in our sweet spot. Made from Roussanne (55%), Grenache Blanc (30%), and Clairette (15%), Brunel's white Côtes du Rhône trumps a lot of white Cdp's on the market today. Trumps them. Hands down; at a fraction of the price. One sip of this beauty will have you hooked. You'll get aromas of fresh stone fruit, citrus, and minerals, the palate is lively and balanced with a fleshy, round, white peachy middle all leading to a fine, crisp finish. It is a tremendously food-friendly wine and will suit anything from lobster thermidor to a chicken sandwich. Hmmm. Come to think of it, there's a holiday coming up that is known for a large celebratory feast. The 2010 André Brunel Domaine Becassonne Côtes du Rhône would suit the Turkey Day table to a T! We received a good chunk of this wine, but based on past experience, we expect this wine to sell out soon

Our 2008 Momtazi Vineyard Pinot Noir shows remarkably pure and delineated red fruit, with layers of candied red cherry and fresh raspberry, with hints of pomegranate. By no means simple, however, all this lifted fruit is underpinned by complex notes of tea-leaf, confectionary orange peel, and clean, wet brick. In a phrase: lollypop and loam! The wine's bright acidity and slightly firm tannins make it mouth-wateringly attractive now, and promise excellent future pleasure as well. It will match wonderfully with pork and richer preparations of chicken and salmon. Enjoy!

This complex yet elegant Syrah comes from the renowned Boushey Vineyard in the cool upper Yakima Valley (900-1200 feet) of Eastern Washington State. The owner, Dick Boushey, is one of the most reputable growers in Washington State, serving for years as a leader in Washington’s wine industry.It is richly flavored with dark, even black plum and berry fruit, with hints of sweet incense, dried tobacco, and smoked meats. The finish is long, with generous chocolate, and ample tannin and acidic structure to maintain excellent balance.

Sourced from selected sites at Anindor Vineyard and Mary’s Peak Vineyard, Verve Janka sweet wine has an extraordinary depth of flavor that marks the finest Gewurztraminer fruit from Oregon.  Janka wine displays a beautiful golden color, while offering aromas of honey, apricots, nectarine and an intense floral perfume.  In the mouth, this wine is sweet, round and yet balanced with its acidity; it explores with fruit flavors and has a smooth lingering finish.  Serve chilled. Kept in the refrigerator, it will remain fresh after opening for up three weeks.

my_notes: We had this at the Cellars 33 Wine Dinner at Zazie.  It’s crisp with no hint of butter.  We thought it was better stand alone than with the salad.
other_notes: Displaying classic Keefer Chardonnay notes of tropical fruits and lemon meringue, this lush chardonnay has a nice round mouth-feel betraying its light use of new oak. We've enjoyed this wine so much, we're now making more and more of it each year!

90 Points Wine SpectatorAlso earning outstanding marks this week is the Novy Viognier Russian River Valley 2009. Novy is owned by the folks behind Siduri Wines—Adam and Dianna Lee—and their extended family. This is a wonderful expression of California Viognier, with all the aromatics you’d expect, but fermented in stainless steel, without malolactic fermentation, keeping the flavors crisp and fresh.NOVY Viognier Russian River Valley 2009 Score: 90 | $22    A refreshing and intriguing mix of tangy, juicy lemon drop, peach and green apple flavors, with a mouthwatering acidity and details of yellow raisin and spice complexity on the finish. Drink now. 483 cases made. —M.W

Medium-dark to dark ruby.  A mélange of cherry and blueberry fruit is complemented by notes of bittersweet cocoa powder and pleasant woodsy aromas.  Full-bodied and supple on entry, velvety tannins slowly build through the persistent finish.  Enjoyable now but very age worthy due to Mourvèdre’s anti-oxidative properties.  Optimum drinking of this rare and special wine should be between 2013 and 2024.

Optimum drinking of this rare and special wine should be between 2013 and 2024.

Opaque black-purple.  Even the bubbles are black!  Gorgeous aromas of blueberry preserves, licorice, white pepper, and violets are at once deep yet effusive.  Rich and concentrated on the palate, flavors of blackberry, blueberry, and earth build to a crescendo in the finish.  Certainly one the most harmonious and suave Pets I’ve had the pleasure to drink.  If you enjoy your wines young, drink now.  Otherwise, give it a few years in bottle and enjoy through 2020.

Black-purple with a magenta rim.  Intense, high-toned aromas of blackberry, crushed rock, and anise.  Medium-full to full bodied with flavors of blackberry, black olive, spice, and violets.  Mmmmm…  So good!  At present, more tightly coiled than our Dry Creek Valley Petite Sirah but a wine that will reward greatly with patience. If you do decide to open one early, decant and/or pour through a Vinturi wine aerator and enjoy with a nice piece of grilled meat or some aged cheddar (I recommend Lincolnshire Poacher from Neal’s Yard).  Otherwise, drink any time from 2016 through 2035.

Neon black-purple.  Completely opaque.  Room-filling aromas of blackberry, violets, crushed rocks, spring flowers, cured meat, and a hint of pepper.  Very Cornas!  Medium-full bodied and quite smooth on entry, refined tannins build slowly through the lip-smacking finish.  A very savory, even meaty, Syrah.  This wine offers up considerable complexity already but should be in its sweet spot between 2013 and 2022.
