Opaque crimson-purple.  Glass staining.  An explosive nose of blackberry, creosote, narcissus, coffee-bean and vanilla.  Sexiness just oozes out of the glass!  On the palate, concentrated, thick, but with a wonderful sense of balance.  More approachable at this point than the previous four vintages. Enjoy this delicious bad boy from release through 2020.

Opaque crimson-purple.  Glass staining.  An explosive nose of blackberry, creosote, narcissus, coffee-bean and vanilla.  Sexiness just oozes out of the glass!  On the palate, concentrated, thick, but with a wonderful sense of balance.  More approachable at this point than the previous four vintages. Enjoy this delicious bad boy from release through 2020.

Dark ruby-purple.  Nearly opaque.  A fascinating nose of stone fruits – white peach, nectarine, Satsuma plum – is intertwined with violets, blood orange, espresso, and Chinese five spice.  Wow!  The wine enters full and rich but is powerfully structured.  No doubt this is mountain-grown fruit!  A wave of blackcurrant fruit and spice persist through the long finish.  With a good decant, this wine can be enjoyed now.  But if past Pelkan Ranch Syrahs are any indication, this wine has a long life ahead of it.  Drink 2013 through 2024.

Medium to medium-dark garnet.  Classic Two Acres aromas of red cherry and rose petal.  A slight hint of licorice lurks in the background.  On the palate, a wonderful creaminess (not from oak but from fruit), a trademark of this vineyard.  Loamy earth and mineral notes complement the cherry fruit through the finish.  Stylistically similar to the 2007 but slightly richer and more expressive.  This wine will age very well, developing further complexity, but can certainly be enjoyed young.  Drink from release (with a good decant) through 2023.

Medium to medium-dark ruby-garnet.   Fragrant, perfumed aromas of cherries, red currants, and anise lead to similar flavors on the palate.  Succulent and supple on entry with tangy acidity and lively tannins accentuating the iron-like mineral notes so often found in Dry Creek Valley Zinfandels.  Really develops on day two, becoming quite harmonious and complete.  Easily the best Gold Mine we’ve made to date.  Enjoy 2012 through 2018.

Medium-dark to dark violet-ruby.  Heady aromas of mulberry, raspberry, brier, pepper, and incense spill from the glass.  Serious stuff!  The wine glides smoothly across the palate with lively acidity giving delineation to the bright raspberry and Asian spice flavors.  Amazingly well balanced for such a powerful wine.  Carlisle Vineyard always seems to produce a wine that benefits from at least several years of aging.  This rendition is no exception.  Drink from 2013 through 2020.

Dark ruby-garnet.  Verging on opaque.  Black raspberry, fresh cream, licorice, and herbs provide a fabulous sniff.  On the palate, incredibly concentrated with great weight and mouth-feel.  Seemingly darker and deeper than previous vintages.  Totally dry but at the same time Chambord-like with laser-like acidity to keep the mouth refreshed.  Papera Ranch is truly one of the great old-vine vineyards of California.  Enjoy this magnificent Zinfandel from release through 2017.

appellation: Ballard Canyon, Santa Ynez Valley, Santa Barbara
other_notes: Tasting Notes for Nebbiolo: High tannins, cherries, chocolate, truffles, voilets, licorice, prunes, tar, roses, cinnamon.  Try the following foods with this wine:  Beef, Hard cheese, Lamb, Mushroom sauce, Veal Scallopino

appellation: Ballard Canyon, Santa Ynez Valley, Santa Barbara
my_notes: It tasted nicely at the winery when we went to pick up the Viognier.
other_notes: Tasting Notes for Nebbiolo: High tannins, cherries, chocolate, truffles, violets, licorice, prunes, tar, roses, cinnamon.  Try the following foods with this wine:  Beef, Hard cheese, Lamb, Mushroom sauce, Veal Scallopino

Upon opening, the 2009 displays aromas of exotic herbs, stem inclusion, earth and menthol. As the wine opens up layers of black cherry, tobacco and anise are exposed. The tannins are apparent, but the fruit is so concentrated that they seem to disappear in the mouth (though the do appear stronger after 30 minutes of aeration). The finish is polished off by the refreshing swipe of vibrant acidity. This wine will not doubt improve with some cellaring, but it may be hard to resist popping open bottles sooner rather than later.4/2011

Dry wet stone aromas that develop into a good amount of floral on the nose.  Flavors include crisp bright green apple with a hint of pear - striking note of minerality through the mid palate. Finishes dry, minimal residual sugar on the finish.  A Riesling that doesn't call for food in particularly, delicious on its own

Dry wet stone aromas that develop into a good amount of floral on the nose.  Flavors include crisp bright green apple with a hint of pear - striking note of minerality through the mid palate. Finishes dry, minimal residual sugar on the finish.  A Riesling that doesn't call for food in particularly, delicious on its own

This pure expression of Viognier – the most floral of white wines—is exotically perfumed with honeysuckle and plumeria flower. In the mouth, its tropical fruit flavors of mango, guava and lychee are released, followed by a vibrant and flinty acidity. Such an extroverted wine, this Viognier can take on bold flavors and would complement dishes such as grilled sea bass with mango salsa, Indian green curry chicken or Thai coconut shrimp. Drink within two years, as it is ripe for enjoying now and requires little aging to develop its full aromatic complexity.

Distinctively Dry Creek. Readily expresses its lifted, spicy aromas of black pepper, clove, star anise and cardamom. Zingy blackberry fruit drives the flavor by mouth. The Everett Ridge Estate Zinfandel is approachable and delicious now and through the next two years.Uncork a bottle to complete any zesty summertime meal. Got spicy baby back ribs? This is your match.

This is your match.
Composed of a graceful blend of Riesling and Sauvignon Blanc, Diablita Blanca is delicately perfumed with a fruity and floral fragrance. Bright and fresh, she leaves a lively sparkle on your tongue.
Composed of a graceful blend of Riesling and Sauvignon Blanc, Diablita Blanca is delicately perfumed with a fruity and floral fragrance. Bright and fresh, she leaves a lively sparkle on your tongue.

The 2007 Esterlina Vineyards Cole Ranch Merlot offers a remarkable balance of intensity and elegance. The concentrated dark berry aroma is spiced with sweet oak characters of cocoa, cloves and allspice. The wine enters with bright and tightly focused fruit and explodes across the palate with cherry-infused ripeness. It finishes with a long lingering impression of its lushness and luxurious smoothness.Enjoy our supple Cole Ranch Merlot with a creamy pate, a rich sheep milk cheese gratin, or a grilled sirloin of beef. A lively complement to its fruity spiciness would be mu shu pork with hoisin sauce. Delicious now, but will continue to develop if cellared for five to seven years.

Rose petal pink in color and brilliant in clarity, this rosé is as attractive as it is delicious. The aroma is bursting with fresh strawberries and peaches. Citrusy and spicy in flavor, it finishes with zesty acidity. Made in the style of a rosé of Champagne, with gentle pressing of Syrah grapes to reveal a pretty pale color yet maintain delicacy in texture, followed by a cool fermentation to retain fruity and floral aromatics. The Everett Ridge Syrah Rosé is a mouthwatering and refreshing wine that you may wish to quaff by itself on a hot afternoon; still, you will find this rosé to be so food-friendly that it may become your wine of choice to stand in on any occasion as the ideal match for whatever you serve. Try it with salmon tartare, fried calamari, white pizza, or grilled turkey burgers. Drink now, while young and fresh.

The 2009 Everett Ridge Cole Ranch Pinot Noir exemplifies the elegance and complexity of the Pinot Noir wines generated from the unique growing site of Cole Ranch.  Cherry infused aromas evolve into ripe plum and sweet fig on the nose.  The bright raspberry flavors are fused with anise and nutmeg-spice oak.  Its mouthfeel is distinguished by exceptional silkiness and remarkable length on the palate.  This is lovely and utterly accessible as a young wine and will improve with cellaring thorugh the next five years.  Serve this splendidly smooth Cole Ranch Pinot wiht wild mushroom gnocchi or roasted pork loin with fennel.
Composed of a graceful blend of Riesling and Sauvignon Blanc, Diablita Blanca is delicately perfumed with a fruity and floral fragrance. Bright and fresh, she leaves a lively sparkle on your tongue.

This Dry Creek Zinfandel, flourishing its characteristic splendid spiciness, was created in celebration of the joint Esterlina and Everett Ridge anniversaries.  Its aroma is a profusion of black pepper, cloves and cinnamon.  Jammy blackberryfruit powers its concentrated flavor.  The 2009 Esterlina and Everett Ridge Anmiverary Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley is enjoyable now and thorugh the next three years.  Pair this intensely flavored Zinfandel with grilled butterflied leg of lamb.

Black razzberry fruit, vibrant and alive in both nose and mouth, nice oaky-smokiness, hit of black pepper. Smoothly textured in mouth, the finish is long and lushly jammy fruit—dangerously good!Certified CCOF Organically GrownWine Spectator 90 pointsDeeper black raspberry fruit, still nice pepper and lightly smoky, but oak is more vanilla-creamy and chocolatey.  This wine is rounder and fatter than the 2006, with a longer juicy finish. Still pairs up with tomato sauces and spicy seasonings, and also is superb with grilled meats—yum
91 Points Wine SpectatorVery deep blackberry fruit with smoky oak creaminess, dark chocolate, a dash of pepper, and elegantly structured tannins for aging. Great with red meat, especially lamb!

91 points Wine & SpiritsMilk chocolate—Belgian nougat style!—and cherry-pomegranate fruit. Plus that charming Asian 5-spice typical of this vineyard, and a bit of pungent herbs.  It is finally opening up (now that it is almost gone) and much softer in mouth, tho still a BIG mouthful!.

The nose offers ripe pineapple and peach aromas with toasted graham cracker. The bright straw color prepares the palate for the rich tropical fruit and luscious stone fruit with a viscous mouth feel accented by toasted coconut, vanilla and butterscotch. The creamy finish lingers with hints of buttered toast and lemon zest. This wine will pair well with creamy Italian pasta dishes, roasted chicken or fish, and fresh summer corn.

my_notes: It was a good wine with the oysters

other_notes: Aromatics;  Fresh blackberry, raspberry, green tea, vanilla bean and lightly roasted nuts.On the palate: An intense mouthful of rich cherry, ripe raspberry and soothing cola. Soft tones of caramel and semi-sweet chocolate leading to a balanced, pleasing and silky finish.

Aromatics: Intense, dark and dense, hints of ripe high-tone fruit with traces of stone fruit, ripe plum and red apple skin.On the palate: Crushed wild berries, strawberry and boysenberry dominate the midpalate. Hints of bright acidity and minerality drive down the center palate and frame the mouthfeel. The core of mouthwatering flavors meld into a captivating, lengthy and precise finish.

Aromatics:Fresh raspberries, ripe cranberry, pomegranate, red apple skin, citrus and a subtle dose of tangerine zest.On the palate: Sweet Rainier cherries, raspberries, pomegranate and soft notes of cola. Rich raspberry and a dose of cream lead to a silky finish. Medium weight on the palate and bursting with juicy acidity and intense red fruit character. Focused and yet, very pretty and elegant.

Aromatics: An exciting mixture of briary blackberry and black cherry fill the glass. Exotic spices intermingle with the lush berries. Intense is an understatement!On the palate: Rich and well structured. A core of blackberry and raspberry envelope the midpalate. Layers of succulent dark fruits are beautifully balanced with acidity, spice and minerality. The alluring finish lingers with perfect elegance.

A crisp refreshing wine with a tropical fruit nose and a citrus back that drinks especially well in warm weather and pairs beautifully with Southwestern and Asian cuisine.  It's a great food wine and an age-worthy Chardonnay that rivals any Chassagne-Montrachet.
The short skin contact results in a wine lighter in color and lighter on the palate. A perfect summer wine, Lucy's essence of Pinot Noir and fresh acidity allow for pairings with a variety of dishes.

Awarded 90 points by Robert Parker who said: "Made by Andrew Murray, this beautiful Syrah displays wonderful elegance as well as a floral blue and blackberry nose, with hints of licorice and tar. The wine exhibits a balanced mouthfeel with outstanding ripeness and good acidity, giving vibrancy and freshness to its rich fruit. This wine should drink nicely for 5-6 years."

my_notes: We both enjoyed this at SWS.  Very drinkable for a 2010 Grenache
other_notes: We were the first people to taste this, so need to go look for reviews later

my_notes: We both enjoyed this at SWS.  Very drinkable for a 2010 Grenache
other_notes: We were the first people to taste this, so need to go look for reviews later

my_notes: This was great at SWS, Ed’s wines tasting.  It was the wine I wanted to keep tasting after the initial pours.
other_notes: Full red. High-pitched red fruits, blood orange and minerals on the nose, with deeper black cardamom and cola notes arriving with air. Taut and sharply focused but concentrated as well, offering spicy black raspberry and bitter cherry flavors and a floral touch. Unwinds slowly and finishes with fine-grained tannins, youthful grip and impressive persistence. This is very promising but could use some air or bottle age

94 points Wine Spectator: "Offers wonderful purity of fruit. Ripe, rich, intense and focused, with tiers of currant, black cherry and blueberry fruit that's simply delicious. Supple, layered and complex. Long and lingering on the finish. Drink now through 2014

This brooding and complex Syrah comes from the Rocky Hill Farm on the eastern side of Sonoma Mountain. 6 barrels made

Pale, white gold with a shimmering tinge of green-yellow.  Gorgeous, high-toned aromas of lychee, damask rose, and myrrh.  Smells like one of my favorite heirloom roses, Madame Isaac Pereire!  Medium bodied with a pleasing silkiness, flavors of pear, tangerine, and lychee flow through the mineral-laden, bone-dry finish. Enjoy this highly perfumed and refreshing wine from release through 2014. (MRO – 01/17/12)

Medium bodied with a pleasing silkiness, flavors of pear, tangerine, and lychee flow through the mineral-laden, bone-dry finish. Black as night.  Opaque.  Deep, concentrated aromas of blackberries and blueberries with a slight note of vanilla.  By no means oaky though.  (We prefer flavors of fruit, not wood.)  Quite rich and full bodied with a cornucopia of black and blue fruits joined by a hint of licorice and earth.  Youthful tannins (as there should be with this variety) build from the mid palate through the finish.  Given the voluptuous fruit, this wine can be enjoyed now with a good decant and a nice piece of beef.  But no rush.  I’m sure it will drink well for at least 15 years. (MRO – 01/17/12)

Very dark purple garnet.  Verging on opaque.  A fabulous sniff of blackberry compote, black and green pepper, and spring flowers.  An intriguing element of green olive lurks in the background, most likely from the whole cluster inclusion.  On the palate, pure silk with an explosion of blackberry fruit.  So delicious now that we see no reason to wait.  Dive right in!  The water’s fine!  (MRO – 01/17/12)

Very dark ruby-garnet. Aromas of blackberry and creosote with a floral lift. Medium-full to full bodied, the wine has terrific cut and precision thanks to refreshing acidity and tannin. Although a mere eight miles south of Rosella’s, not a bit of grapefruit in this wine, only pure blackberry yumminess! While enjoyable now, this Syrah should be at its best from 2014 through 2020. (MRO – 01/17/12)

Medium ruby-garnet.  Kirsch, raspberry and spice box flow from the glass.  On the palate, medium-full to full bodied with flavors of cherry, red currant, and earth.  Much more primary and fruit driven than the charcuterie-laced 2009.  A bit softer too!  Enjoy this imminently drinkable wine from late 2012 through 2018. (MRO –0 1/17/12)

Medium ruby-garnet.  Kirsch, raspberry and spice box flow from the glass.  On the palate, medium-full to full bodied with flavors of cherry, red currant, and earth.  Much more primary and fruit driven than the charcuterie-laced 2009.  A bit softer too!  Enjoy this imminently drinkable wine from late 2012 through 2018. (MRO –0 1/17/12)

Dark ruby-garnet.  Beautiful aromas of black cherry and loamy, iron-laden soil greet the nose.  Not as red fruit oriented as years past but also not overripe or port-like.  On the palate, rich and full bodied with a delicious “pop” of Zin-berry fruit so typical of Dry Creek Zinfandels.  Plenty of acidity in the finish keeps the wine lively and fresh.  With ample acidity and tannin, give this bad boy some time and enjoy from 2014 through 2020.. (MRO – 01/17/12)

Note: Dark ruby-garnet.  Verging on opaque.  Classic Russian River Zinfandel aromas of boysenberry, black raspberry, spice, and pepper.  The smell alone is a turn on!  Quite deep and full-bodied but with excellent acidity.  A powerful, concentrated wine that can certainly be enjoyed now but should continue to develop with additional bottle age.  Drink 2013 through 2017.. (MRO – 01/17/12)

Very dark ruby-purple. A fascinating nose of blackberry, cherry, and of all things, peaches! Reminds me of Kendall’s summer-time cobbler. Smooth and full-bodied on entry, flavors of stone fruits (black plums, peaches, and apricots) build through the lip-smacking finish. Either enjoy this wine upon release or give it until 2014 to allow some the youthful tannins to subside. A winner at any price but given what we’re selling it for, crazy QPR! (MRO – 01/17/12)

Medium to medium-dark ruby. Heady aromas of Zin-berry (imagine a cross of raspberry and cherry), figs, and orange zest. Oh my! The wine enters smoothly, enveloping the palate with its weight and concentration, yet ample acidity keeps the wine from becoming heavy or ponderous. Incredibly well balanced for such a large-framed wine. Drink from late 2012 through 2016, perhaps even longer. (MRO – 01/17/12

Very dark ruby-garnet.  A brooding nose of red currants, black cherry, orange rind, and freshly tilled loam.  Très serieux! On the palate, rich but not heavy, with flavors of dark cherries, bittersweet cocoa, and the signature Rossi garrigue (a resinous herbal quality that reminds me of walking through a forest).  Suave tannins frame the wine nicely, giving ample structure to ensure further development.  Enjoy from 2013 through 2019. (MRO – 01/17/12)

Very dark ruby-garnet.  A brooding nose of red currants, black cherry, orange rind, and freshly tilled loam.  Très serieux! On the palate, rich but not heavy, with flavors of dark cherries, bittersweet cocoa, and the signature Rossi garrigue (a resinous herbal quality that reminds me of walking through a forest).  Suave tannins frame the wine nicely, giving ample structure to ensure further development.  Enjoy from 2013 through 2019. (MRO – 01/17/12)
Light cranberry color, juicy strawberry-watermelon fruit aromas, nice mineral, hint of pink grapefruit. Refreshingly crisp and dry. Great with almost any food, from sushi to salmon to BBQ!
Black cherry and raspberry fruit, nice oaky-vanilla loveliness, smoothly textured in mouth, very creamy and round, the finish is long and lushly jammy fruit—dangerously good!

Spicy black ollalieberry, black cherry, clove, dark dusty cocoa, with a touch of caramel in the nose. Round, juicy fruit in the mouth, spiced cherries, caramel, and soft toasted oak flavors of chocolatey vanilla cream

Huge complex wine! Bright black cherry, crème de cassis, fresh herbs and mint, slate, choco-oak, cedar cigar box, and vanilla aromas. Flavorful cherry vanilla, dark chocolate, warm oaky smoothness that ends in silky tannins on a long, jammy finish that is plush and creamy

Deep violet color.  Blackberry, blueberry, black cherry, cola, and deep cedary oak with hints of tobacco and minerally earth – this is a big wine with fine tannins that are tamed by creamy vanilla oak tones.

variety: Black Magic Late Harvest Dessert Wine
other_notes: Mocha, cherry cordial, caramelized sugar, chocolate syrup, with a slight touch of mint chip, black pepper, and orange peel on the nose.  In the mouth are explosions of coffee, chocolate, black jammy raspberry with a slightly chewy texture and well-balanced sweetness.

Two Dijon clones (115 & 667) combine harmoniously to yield black cherry fruit, peppery spice, and a touch of warm earth. Its soft texture and firm yet supple tannins deliver an “iron fist in a velvet glove.”
Black cherry and raspberry fruit, nice oaky-vanilla loveliness, smoothly textured in mouth, very creamy and round, the finish is long and lushly jammy fruit—dangerously good!
Spicy blackberry fruit framed in sweet vanilla oak, nice dash of black pepper and earth.  Great structure for aging, still opening up in nose, let it breathe!

Deep darker milk chocolate - Cadbury’s Fruit & Nut bar - touch of dried cranberry and raisin, as well as a sprinkling of brown sugar.  Still that charming Asian 5-spice, a bit more cinnamon, and a bit of pungent herbs.  Needs time to open up, so decant and splash well, or shake the partial bottle before opening.

There is nothing “petite” about the Everett Ridge Petite Sirah; rather, it is all about masculine power and brawny structure. This dark and brooding Petite Sirah is so deeply colored that it is nearly opaque, like ink.  Aromas of leather, cigar box, sweet tobacco and charred oak suspend over a dense backdrop of blackberry fruit. Layered and chewy tannins make a big textural statement in the mouth. The intensity of fruit is supported by mouthwatering acidity for a bright finish. Though bold, this wine is not a rough or coarse: it makes its grand exit with a well-mannered display of subtle tannins. Try decanting Petite Sirah, especially while it is in its youth, to enjoy its full aromatic complexity. Will mellow over time and can age up to 10 years. Pair this robust and muscly wine with equally big foods: grilled steak, lamb sausages, blackberry-glazed baby back ribs (or the spit-roasted wild boar from your last hunt!).

This Merlot-driven blend reflects our Cole Ranch Appellation’s unique character and distinctive elegance. The 2007 Everett Ridge Ensemble flourishes an extraordinary lushness in mouth feel. Its texture is so round, supple and plush that it conveys the impression of velvet in the mouth. Evident ripeness gives the perception of sweetness and persistence to the generous red currant and black cherry fruit flavors. This wine is immediately approachable and already delicious, though it is best to age it for another year or two to appreciate its full potential. Highlight the seamless texture of this wine by enjoying with soft teleme cheese or serving with ground veal and mushroom ragu over pappardelle.

We never really have ‘favorite’ wines, but we often have ‘favorite’ things about a vintage. My favorite part of the 2009 vintage of Pisoni Estate Pinot Noir is thinking about how the wine will taste in five to ten years and beyond. This wine has remarkable structure and aging potential. At the moment, its aromas are full of fresh blackberries and dark cherries, spiced almonds, sage and a slightly gamey sauvage note. The impact on the palate is immense. Although the 2009 has a very high level of tannin, the highest we have seen in years, the structure of the tannins is very fine. Along with the crisp acidity, the flavor and the finish linger on the palate and show the wine is very young in its years. Decant prior to drinking.

Along with the crisp acidity, the flavor and the finish linger on the palate and show the wine is very young in its years. Decant prior to drinking.

Luscious and crisp.  Wine Enthusiast's Steve Heimoff says, "Sweet and sour acidity marks this dry wine, made from a variety that’s been out of fashion for decades. With just a touch of oak, its tart tangerine, citron, lemongrass and mineral flavors star. Drink as an offbeat, low-alcohol alternative to Sauvignon Blanc and Pinot Grigio."

This unique mountainside location, only five miles away from the Pacific Ocean, produces high quality grapes, consistently. Cool afternoon ocean breezes prolong the growing season, allowing development of rich yet soft tannins while retaining good acid levels. Aromas of raspberry, black pepper, violets, with hints of olive and tobacco. This is my go-to weeknight local Cabernet Sauvignon!

This dry Chenin Blanc exudes supple melon aromas with a brilliantly crisp and layered fresh herbs and mint finish. A perfect complement to any meal, whether it’s on a white cloth or a picnic cloth.  Night picked, stainless steel fermented except the Chardonnay.

The nose offers ripe pineapple and peach aromas with toasted graham cracker. The bright straw color prepares the palate for the rich tropical fruit and luscious stone fruit with a viscous mouth feel accented by toasted coconut, vanilla and butterscotch. The creamy finish lingers with hints of buttered toast and lemon zest. This wine will pair well with creamy Italian pasta dishes, roasted chicken or fish, and fresh summer corn.

The creamy finish lingers with hints of buttered toast and lemon zest. This wine will pair well with creamy Italian pasta dishes, roasted chicken or fish, and fresh summer corn.

It's hard to believe "French Colombard", or Côtes de Gascogne as it's known in South-West France, was the most-planted grape in the U.S. in the 1970's. Today, domestically, most Colombard vineyards have been replaced with Chardonnay. This "Renaissance" Colombard comes from a 35-year-old dry-farmed vineyard.  Maceration 7 hours on the skins, elevage sur lies 5 months, aged in 85% stainless steel, 15% neutral French oak barrels. 12.8% alcohol. Wine Enthusiast's Steve Heimoff says, "Sweet and sour acidity marks this dry wine, made from a variety that’s been out of fashion for decades. With just a touch of oak, its tart tangerine, citron, lemongrass and mineral flavors star. Drink as an offbeat, low-alcohol alternative to Sauvignon Blanc and Pinot Grigio."

Note about 2009 not 2008.  2009 Alta Mesa Cellars, Estate Tannat, Alta Mesa. $20.  Owner/Grower/Winemaker: Ron Silva. Tannat originated in South West France in the Madiran AOC.  A classic grape of Madeira, a fortified wine from the Portuguese Madeira islands, it’s often blended with Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Fer to soften its astringency. Tannat is dark, some say impenetrable.  This one has an aroma of blueberry and boysenberry fruit that melts in your mouth like a good beef stew. 125 cases produced.  http://www.thesecretwineshop.com/wine/alta-mesa-cellars  For optimal enjoyment, open this a couple hours before drinking, it will keep changing in your glass.

Cloudy Chenin Blanc, unfined and unfiltered to the extreme. A minimal interventionist approach taken by young winemaker Andrew Jones. Creamy ripe apple, melon, nuts on the nose with a finish of minerals and acidity. Aged in 50% stainless steel, 50% neutral French oak for 6 months. "The label art is taken from photographs of starlings in flight, unstaged patterns that can never be repeated nor replicated.  In the same way, each bottle of Field Recordings Wine captures the inimitable circumstances of each vineyard, vintage, and friendship that made it possible."  -Field Recordings Website   http://fieldrecordingswine.com

my_notes: It was surprisingly great with a very spicy hot cheese that Christy served.  Would be good with a very spicy dish.

variety: California Red Wine The Archer Blend: 95% Grenache, 5% Syrah
my_notes: Very smooth, easily drinkable right when opened
other_notes: This wine is a secret find at Envy Winery in Calistoga.  Envy is Mark Carter's budget version of his famous Carter Cellars Cabernet Sauvignon made from Beckstoffer & To Kalon fruit with legendary winemaker Nils Venge.  Mark's girlfriend, Sheri Dubey, is one lucky girl, getting to buy some high quality fruit on the side & getting some expert winemaking for her label Ruby Kurant.  She calls it "daily decadence."  You will agree!  http://www.rubykurant.com

The 2007 Cole Ranch Cabernet Sauvignon is a deeply colored and finely composed expresion of the vineyard at its best.  The aromas of black currant and olive are complemented by anise, sweet tobacco, coffee, allspice, and toasty oak.  Balanced and elegant, it possesses a firm structure, beginning as tighlty wound around a solid core and then unfolding on the palate into a fine-grained and smooth finish.  AGe for three to five years to evolve.  Pair this Cabernet Sauvignon with spring lamb chops with chopped parsly and min.

This wine possesses the pretty feminine characteristics that Rosella's Vineyard wines often do while also demonstrating a strong backbone without too much extraction. Power and finesse married together reflecting the natural harmony of these two neighboring vineyards. A long, easy finish forecasts a drinking window between 2013-2019.

Fans of the '09 Cellars 33 Keefer Chardonnay will notice a more focused 2010 version which reflects the better structure and acid profile of Clone 4 chardonnay. Medium-bodied and well-balanced, this lower alcohol chardonnay possesses light tropical fruit and lemon custard flavors with a firm backbone of minerality. A long lasting finish hints at a lengthy life ahead. Best between 2013-2020.

The Clone 1 provides the minerality and citrus notes while the Musque clone brings the richer tropical flavors of mango, pear and papaya. The combination results in a clean, crisp and balanced sauv blanc without any grassy notes. A wonderful pairing with many seafood dishes or mild cheeses.

Spicy blackberry fruit framed in sweet vanilla oak, nice dash of black pepper and earth.  Great structure for aging, still opening up in noswe, let it breathe!

Very dark purple garnet.  Verging on opaque.  A fabulous sniff of blackberry compote, black and green pepper, and spring flowers.  An intriguing element of green olive lurks in the background, most likely from the whole cluster inclusion.  On the palate, pure silk with an explosion of blackberry fruit.  So delicious now that we see no reason to wait.  Dive right in!  The water’s fine!  (MRO – 01/17/12)

Dark ruby-garnet.  Verging on opaque.  Classic Russian River Zinfandel aromas of boysenberry, black raspberry, spice, and pepper.  The smell alone is a turn on!  Quite deep and full-bodied but with excellent acidity.  A powerful, concentrated wine that can certainly be enjoyed now but should continue to develop with additional bottle age.  Drink 2013 through 2017.. (MRO – 01/17/12)

Medium to medium-dark ruby. Heady aromas of Zin-berry (imagine a cross of raspberry and cherry), figs, and orange zest. Oh my! The wine enters smoothly, enveloping the palate with its weight and concentration, yet ample acidity keeps the wine from becoming heavy or ponderous. Incredibly well balanced for such a large-framed wine. Drink from late 2012 through 2016, perhaps even longer. (MRO – 01/17/12)

Classic vintage port made from estate-grown fruit, including Touriga Naiconal, a traditional Portuguese varietal, blended with Petite Sirah and Zinfandel. Fortifying spirits were distilled by a local artisan distillery from estate-grown fruit. Through 5 years of barrel aging, this port has developed its lightly tawny color and shows sotness and ocmpelxity in flavors.  Rich, deep and intensely concentrated, with spiced black fig and distinctive nuttiness, the 2006 Everett Ridge Port possesses a full body and heady power.  You can expect this port to continue to improve over ten years of aging in the bottle.  Serve this sweet dessert wine accompanied by a plate of dark chocolates and toasted almonds for a divine finish to a meal.

Distinctively Dry Creek.  Readily expresses its lifted, spicy aromas of black pepper, clove, star anise and cardamom.  Zingy blackberry fruit drives the flavor by mouth.  The Everett Ridge Zinfandel is approachable and delicious now and through the next two years.  Uncork a bottle to complete any zesty summertime meal.  Got spicy baby back ribs?  This is your match.

Pale straw in color and freshly frgrant, the 2011 Everett Ridge Sauvignon Blanc is refreshingly vibrant and citrusy.  Flavors of Granny Smith apple and pear are infused with clover, basil, ginger and lemongrass.  With yeasty richness of toasted brioche adding depth and textural complexity, the wine finished with crisp acidity and an energetic hint of lime zest.  Seize this wine in its youthful exuberance by enjoying within a year.  Serve this bright and lively Sauvignon Blanc with spicy shrimp or an herbed goat cheese tart.

One of the things we like best about the 2009 Novy Keefer Ranch Chardonnay is the wine’s crisp texture (due, undoubtedly, to the low pH). This crispness gives lift to the intense tangerine and pear flavors in the wine and also seems to bring out a bit of a minerality in the wine’s mid-palate and finish.

my_notes: Was tasting well at the winery. Last of the Nebbiolos
Was tasting well at the winery. Last of the Nebbiolos

other_notes: This is the second of two bottles, with the first one back in March. I opened this one yesterday, it comes with screw top so I simply put the cap on last night and back into the cellar. The aromatics on this wine are really true to the SLH teroir, with smoke and pepper. The color is very dark, stains the side of the glass. It's very easy to get fired up over CA syrah with these aromatics and color, just great. The palate is more medium weight with this bottle, as I thought I recalled the first bottle being bigger but this is really about medium weight, maybe medium plus but not by much. Lots of juicy dark fruit with black licorice, tar and lingering citrus. The chocolate and vanilla bean notes that emerge on the wine upon first being opened faded off since last night, too. This is really quite good, leaner with nice acid, juicy dark fruit and excellent color. A real nice showing for this young vineyard and as I said in my last note, which I'll affirm again, I'll add this to my annual Novy order of the SLH syrahs. Terrific. (282 views) - report issue | favorite authorTasted by Gestalted on 5/14/2012 & rated 94 points: Wow, I can't recall the last time I had a Syrah like this. First, it pours this beautiful black-purple, striking in color at the edges. The nose is this bright sweet blackberries-and-cream with nuances of pepper and smoke. The midpalate is this glycerin-like, silky texture yet has nice weight to it (very trademark Santa Lucia Highlands Syrah). Finish explodes with juicy black fruits, smoke and vanilla. I mean really juicy! This is how acidity is mastered. After each sip, I can't wait for the next.

Aromas of ripe fruit and meat with a forest floor and sliced muchroom character. Tar too. Full-bodied, with lots of funky and fun character. Decadent and stylish. Drink now or hold. One of the best Siduri Pinots out there.

92 POINT RATING, WINE ADVOCATE  Tightly wound, brooding, and more about earthy, peppery flavors at the moment, this Rosella’s Syrah needs a few years in the cellar to truly show its best, but should blossom with time into something truly special.

other_notes: This Zinfandel is a symphonic masterpiece of rich berry flavors, showing blackberry and black raspberry with hints of red currant.  The wine is rich and mouth feeling with a long finish showing exotic spice.

my_notes: Crisp with great fruit flavors. Very refreshing.
other_notes: We bottled a delightful fruity Grenache Rosé and let it sit on encapsulated yeast for four years, where it continued to develop toasty flavors and aromas.  The result is a multi-layered bouquet ripe with white grape, white peach and baked yeasty aromas followed by flavors of strawberry shortcake, peach and rose petal.

variety: Coquille Blanc White Rhone Blend 57% Grenache Blanc, 25% Roussanne, 18% Mausanne, Viognier
other_notes: Exotic nose of spicy pears and white peaches, almond paste/marzipan, yuzu/grapefruit, with a touch of honeysuckle perfume. In the mouth it is crisply dry, yet creamy, round and full-bodied—it has a true sense of umami, or deliciousness and “wholeness.” Yum

winery: Secret Wine Shop - Mary Elke Vineyards
my_notes: August 2012 Wine Club Unlabeled, 2011, "raw" Pinot Gris, Donnelly Vineyard, Anderson Valley. $20.  Our very first “Secret Wine”!  Fruit grown by Mary Elke in Anderson Valley.  Winemaker Matt Evans, in order to “make” this cloudy Pinot Gris, discovered the technique of doing  nothing!  The juice was left on its lees in a stainless steel container, then just bottled.  No fining, no filtering, no pasteurizing, nothing except pouring it into bottles & putting in the cork.  Pale white/yellow color, citrusy with a mineral edge, and a bite of apple seed on the palate.  Best opened a little before serving so it can warm up just a tad, perfect with green papaya Asian salad.
other_notes: Pale white/yellow color, citrusy with a mineral edge, and a bite of apple seed on the palate.  Best opened a little before serving so it can warm up just a tad, perfect with green papaya Asian salad.

my_notes: August 2012 Wine Club 2009 Loxton Cellars, Zinfandel, Hillside Vineyards, Sonoma Valley.  $25.  Screwtop.  According to owner/winemaker Chris Loxton, "The '09 Hillside blend is 43% from the Stonetree Vineyard at the top of the Mayacamas range, 37% from the Buck Hill Vineyard, also in the Mayacamas range and 20% from Rossi Ranch.  Hillside fruit is usually more concentrated and this wine has flavors of cherry and dark fruits, a wonderful rich mouthfeel and good tannin structure. Not too much alcohol or oak." 345 cases produced.  My favorite food pairing is mushrooms à la forestière, the blue cheese in the recipe pairs great with Zinfandel.
other_notes: Hillside fruit is usually more concentrated and this wine has flavors of cherry and dark fruits, a wonderful rich mouthfeel and good tannin structure. Not too much alcohol or oak." 345 cases produced.  My favorite food pairing is mushrooms à la forestière, the blue cheese in the recipe pairs great with Zinfandel.

my_notes: July 2012 Wine Club 2011 Mary Elke Vineyards, Pinot Gris, Donnelly Creek Vineyard, Anderson Valley.  $16.  Crisp, dry Alsatian style Pinot Gris from the unique Donnelly Vineyard in Anderson Valley.  Mary Elke has been growing fruit for others for more than 20 years. The vines are cane-pruned and grown on elevated red sandy loam benchland dotted with large round stones.  White flowers, beeswax, bright melon on the nose, minerals, melon and bite of apple seed on the palate, graceful grapefruit finish.
other_notes: White flowers, beeswax, bright melon on the nose, minerals, melon and bite of apple seed on the palate, graceful grapefruit finish.

my_notes: July 2012 Wine Club 2007 Wellington Vineyards, Cabernet Sauvignon, Morhardt Ridge, Sonoma Valley.  $25.  This unique mountainside location, only five miles away from the Pacific Ocean, produces high quality grapes, consistently. Cool afternoon ocean breezes prolong the growing season, allowing development of rich yet soft tannins while retaining good acid levels. Aromas of raspberry, black pepper, with hints of barnyard, olive and tobacco. This is my go-to weeknight local Cabernet Sauvignon!
other_notes: Aromas of raspberry, black pepper, with hints of barnyard, olive and tobacco. This is my go-to weeknight local Cabernet Sauvignon!

my_notes: September 2012 Wine Club  This went well with poke at Jim’s house
other_notes: Think of Vermentino as where Pinot Grigio meets Gruner Veltliner, having aromas and flavors of pear, lime, green melon, and (horrors) cilantro-like mint.  Our Vermentino will partner well with seafood, more delicate Southeast Asian cuisine like Thai or Vietnamese, chicken, pasta, or any Mediterranean dish calling for a white wine.

An original field-planted block, these 120-year-old Carignane plants are interspersed with Palomino (white variety from Jerez) and Alicante (a teinturier varietal, which means red grape with red juice). Decomposed sandy soils make it impossible for the vine-pest phylloxera to survive, leaving these some of the last remaining self-rooted vines in the state. The berries are fermented whole, under a constant blanket of C02 until their native yeasts begin to ferment the grape sugars from the inside out.  Very rare to find in a domestic wine.  Vivid red fruit, refreshing acidity, mineral finish, and only 12.8% alcohol.

variety: California Red Blend of 3 Italian grapes - 50% Monepulciano, 25% Aglianico, and 25% Sangiovese
my_notes: We tried it at Secret Wine Cellar with the Winemaker.  It will go great with Italian and tomato sauces, pasta or pizza
other_notes: Three amazing Italian grape varieties all blended together!  This bottle is even better the 2nd day after its been opened.  Aromas of pepper and jammy briary red fruit, dark red cherries on the palate backed by hibiscus and oak note. Suggested food pairing: thin crust margherita pizza topped with baby arugula.

variety: California Red Blend of 3 Italian grapes - 50% Monepulciano, 25% Aglianico, and 25% Sangiovese
my_notes: We tried it at Secret Wine Cellar with the Winemaker.  It will go great with Italian and tomato sauces, pasta or pizza

Aromas of pepper and jammy briary red fruit, dark red cherries on the palate backed by hibiscus and oak note. Suggested food pairing: thin crust margherita pizza topped with baby arugula.

my_notes: We had this at the Secret Wine Shop with the Winemaker.  It would go well with tomato sauces.

other_notes: Black razzberry fruit, vibrant and alive in both nose and mouth, nice oaky-smokiness, hit of black pepper. Smoothly textured in mouth, the finish is long and lushly jammy fruit—dangerously good!Certified CCOF Organically GrownWine Spectator 90 pointsDeeper black raspberry fruit, still nice pepper and lightly smoky, but oak is more vanilla-creamy and chocolatey.  This wine is rounder and fatter than the 2006, with a longer juicy finish. Still pairs up with tomato sauces and spicy seasonings, and also is superb with grilled meats—yum
91 Points Wine SpectatorVery deep blackberry fruit with smoky oak creaminess, dark chocolate, a dash of pepper, and elegantly structured tannins for aging. Great with red meat, especially lamb!

Black razzberry fruit, vibrant and alive in both nose and mouth, nice oaky-smokiness, hit of black pepper. Smoothly textured in mouth, the finish is long and lushly jammy fruit—dangerously good!Certified CCOF Organically GrownWine Spectator 90 pointsDeeper black raspberry fruit, still nice pepper and lightly smoky, but oak is more vanilla-creamy and chocolatey.  This wine is rounder and fatter than the 2006, with a longer juicy finish. Still pairs up with tomato sauces and spicy seasonings, and also is superb with grilled meats—yum

Wet stone/riverbed, apple, gooseberry, flinty and bright.  Compelling and complex.MOUTH: Bigger mouth presence than 2009 with sterner structure as well. Fruit still shy and sublimated with intense structure — it is a wine of texture and place, not of fruit and fluff. Full bodied yet angular, 3 years in the cellar (at least) is recommended. This is one for the cellar! Try with oysters, fish dishes with cream & butter or short ribs.

COLOR: Medium to medium plus straw colored.NOSE: Nicely integrated in the nose, giving a young Mersaultlike aroma. Stony and wet-pebbles in the mouth, bright apple, pineapple  and peach-skin notes, with more varietal character showing in this wine (when young) than the Homage.MOUTH: Nose is more advanced and complex than the mouth at this stage of infancy.   Parts are all there, but just needs time to integrate.  Acid still very showy in this wine, and we expect it will need a year or two to come around into the wine we expect.  Drink up the 2009 BF’s while the 2010’s mature .  Oak shows more in the mouth/finish with a hint of toasted oak and browned butter.

This wine SCREAMS Keefer Ranch. A laser beam focused rush of bright cherry on the nose. Big, expansive mouthfeel of cherry and tangy acidity. If youre a fan of Keefer Ranch, you will be thrilled with this wine.
Dark and brooding, the 2006 Durell is packed with dark fruits and forest floor on the nose. Super rich and concentrated, with a nice earthy component. Nice hint of tannin adds to a killer finish.

Big and bold -- another winner from the Santa Rita Hills. Rivaling the Momtazi in weight, the Turner's nose is all about black fruit and spice. Reminiscent of early Clos Pepe Pinots, this wine shows huge depth and structure.

The 2007 Pali Boer Family Vineyard Pinot Noir is a ripe and concentrated wine, and has been a staff favorite during barrel tastings. Red raspberries, pomegranates and anise greet the nose. The wine opens into a rich and deep palate, with complex flavors of juicy black cherries, huckleberries and earthy tannins.

This is Peter Cargasacchi’s new vineyard, located just west of the Santa Rita Hills AVA.  This vineyard, like Turner, produces big, Santa Rita Hills profile wine.  The Pali Cargasacchi has really nice forest floor, anise and smoky oak components that complement the bold and bright fruit.
Wine Spectator August 2009 Firm, intense and rustic, full-bodied, with chewy wild berry and blackberry scents, firm tannins and good length. Well-focused. Drink now through 2013.

The 2007 Pali Fiddlestix Vineyard Pinot Noir is all about structure and balance. The nose features polished red fruits, iron, meat and Christmas spice. Understated dark fruits are on the palate, along with forest floor spices, sweet oak, and juicy, bright acidity that leads to a long finish.

The 2007 Pali Inman Olivet Vineyard Pinot Noir opens with fresh wild fruit that seems to leap from the glass, with notes of Bing cherry, plum, raspberry and strawberry. Concentrated red fruits are engulfed in a smoothly textured, almost velvety mouthfeel, with a resonating perfume lingering on the finish. This is the perfect red wine for a warm summer night.

The 2008 Zinfandel releases warm aromas of caramel, cranberries and sweet baked strawberries.  Bursting with flavors of juicy red and black fruit, this medium-bodied wine finishes with smooth tannins and lingering hints of pepper and pipe tobacco.

The 2008 Zinfandel releases warm aromas of caramel, cranberries and sweet baked strawberries.  Bursting with flavors of juicy red and black fruit, this medium-bodied wine finishes with smooth tannins and lingering hints of pepper and pipe tobacco.

my_notes: Wine for working the East Bay wine event
other_notes: Sourced from selected sites at Anindor Vineyard and Mary’s Peak Vineyard, Verve Janka sweet wine has an extraordinary depth of flavor that marks the finest Gewurztraminer fruit from Oregon.  Janka wine displays a beautiful golden color, while offering aromas of honey, apricots, nectarine and an intense floral perfume.  In the mouth, this wine is sweet, round and yet balanced with its acidity; it explores with fruit flavors and has a smooth lingering finish.  Serve chilled. Kept in the refrigerator, it will remain fresh after opening for up three weeks.

Plush and round, this Pinot Noir from the small Klein Family Vineyard in the Santa Cruz Mountians shows the depth and lyaers of mountain fruit, as well as the fresh dliciousness of the modern 115 and 667 clones planted in the vineyard.  The wine explores with juicy red an dark cherry flavors laced with the complexity of tea leaf and forest floor. The finish is long, with ultra-fine tannins, and notes of milk chocolate from the careful use of fine French oak from the Saint Martin cooeprage.

my_notes: Wine for working the East Bay wine event
other_notes: Plush and round, this Pinot Noir from the small Klein Family Vineyard in the Santa Cruz Mountians shows the depth and lyaers of mountain fruit, as well as the fresh dliciousness of the modern 115 and 667 clones planted in the vineyard.  The wine explores with juicy red an dark cherry flavors laced with the complexity of tea leaf and forest floor. The finish is long, with ultra-fine tannins, and notes of milk chocolate from the careful use of fine French oak from the Saint Martin cooeprage.

(This is) a wine that combines the deep, dark, voluptuous cherry fruit we expect out of the Russian River Valley with a complex mix of exotic spice and candied orange peel.  Broad and lush in the palate, the wine mingles both red and black cherry, brown sugar and savory spice from Rousseau barrel.  Ready to enjoy now, it has ample soft structure to continue to improve for many years.

This wine...shows layered floral and ripe fruit aromas focused on blackberries and damson plums.  Its rich palate show multiple lyaers of dark fruit with plum, berries and fig intermingled with mocha, slate and hints of dried meat.  The wine has a full and smooth palate that displays a linearity and purity of fruit that expressed its mountain fruit sourcing.  The finish lingers with fruit freshness and acidity, blaanced by soft, graphite-laced tannins.  The wine will gain in depth and complexity if decanted at room temperature for 2 or 3 hours before serving.
This young ruby is perfectly balanced with light sweetness and a spicy finish.

Luscious and crisp.  Wine Enthusiast's Steve Heimoff says, "Sweet and sour acidity marks this dry wine, made from a variety that’s been out of fashion for decades. With just a touch of oak, its tart tangerine, citron, lemongrass and mineral flavors star. Drink as an offbeat, low-alcohol alternative to Sauvignon Blanc and Pinot Grigio."
A “strong” wine, hence the weight lifter on the label, with huge tannins and acidity, black as night, blackberry and cedar.  Pair with a charcoal steak, chocolate, or coffeee featured foods.

Back in stock by popular demand!  Owner/winemaker Jim Moore, formerly of Robert Mondavi and Bonny Doon.  Cold maceration, aged 6 months in 16% new Hungarian oak, 8% in 1-year old Hungarian oak, the rest in neutral French oak.  Fruit, soft, supple with aromas of black cherry, boysenberry, anise, vanilla.  Elegant finish.

Elegant, crisp, refreshing with aromas of orange blossom, stone fruits, white peach, melon, and honeysuckle, with a spine of minerality. There is a slightly phenolic grip on the finish that helps it stand up to moderately spicy Asian dishes with ginger and chilies.

Classic Merlot dusky aromas and flavors, soft blue-blackberry fruit, hint of cardamom and clove. Aged in French Oak for 24 months, made from CCOF-certified organically grown fruit. Perfect pairing with Indian food.  1% of Terra Sávia sales proceeds support local Wildlife Rescue.

my_notes: Cole Ranch is the smallest appelation in the U.S.

other_notes: From an organic vineyard in Potter Valley, Mendocino.  Native yest, stainless steel fermented, semi-carbonic maceration, and aged i large-format (500 gallon) French barrels.  Tastes of fresh figs with an intriguing nose of dusty fruit, fenugreek, black & white pepper that will keep you coming back for more.
Composed of a graceful blend of Riesling and Sauvignon Blanc, Diablita Blanca is delicately perfumed with a fruity and floral fragrance. Bright and fresh, she leaves a lively sparkle on your tongue.
Composed of a graceful blend of Riesling and Sauvignon Blanc, Diablita Blanca is delicately perfumed with a fruity and floral fragrance. Bright and fresh, she leaves a lively sparkle on your tongue.

variety: Rhone Blend The Duet Grenache and Syrah
Rhone Blend The Duet Grenache and Syrah

other_notes: Medium-dark to dark ruby.  James Brown, funk-a-licious aromas of blueberry, plums, violets, tree bark, and orange rind.  This is Mourvèdre baby!  Texturally, quite creamy, with tannins building from the mid-palate to the persistent finish.  A darker, more masculine wine than Two Acres, our other Mourvèdre-based wine.  Can this wine be enjoyed now?  Absolutely, especially with a good decant!  But being Mourvèdre, a variety high in antioxidants, we are confident that this wine will develop for at least 15 years, perhaps even longer.  Enjoy 2016 through 2028. (MRO – 07/18/12)

Impenetrably black.  Take opaque and multiply it by 10.  Very expressive, high-toned aromas of blueberries, iron-laden earth, and white pepper.  Serious stuff!  On the palate, full-bodied and concentrated.  Essence of Petite Sirah.  Deceptively smooth on the finish.  When to enjoy this beauty?  I’m conflicted.  It’s so enjoyable now yet I see so much potential with age.  Hmmm… Let’s call it 2015 to 2030 but be sure to check our drinkability chart for updates. (MRO – 09/25/11)

Very dark crimson purple.  Nearly opaque.  Explosive aromas of blackberry, graphite, and spring flowers.  Really blossoms with air.  The wine enters smoothly, displaying plenty of black and blue fruit with a note of violet.  Quite suave and sophisticated on the palate with caressing tannins on the finish.  A beautifully balanced cool-climate Syrah that has a long, long life ahead of it.  Optimum drinking should be 2015 to 2025. (MRO – 07/18/12)

Very dark ruby-garnet.  Bordering on opaque.  Deep, heady aromas of blackberries and cream are marked by notes of violets and licorice.  A gorgeous sniff!  Full bodied on the palate, with flavors of blackberry, blueberry, and earth.  Tannins and acidity ensure the wine stays light on its feet.  While perhaps not as “large-framed” as previous renditions, qualitatively, every bit as delicious.  Enjoyable now but best between 2014 and 2024. (MRO – 07/18/12)

Very dark ruby-purple.  Verging on opaque.  Precise, pure aromas of blackberry, sage, and spice.  Quite poised on the palate, with plenty of mouth-watering black fruits that persist into the violet-tinged finish.  For all its explosiveness, displays remarkable finesse and elegance.  To borrow an old phrase, an iron fist in a velvet glove!  Enjoy 2013 through at least 2022. (MRO – 07/18/12)

Medium-dark to dark ruby-garnet.  Kirsch, tobacco, savory herbs, and white pepper emanate from the glass.  Interestingly, in this cool vintage, not a trace of the signature ruby-red grapefruit.  On the palate, medium-full to full bodied.  A very savory and herb-laced finish with an intriguing saline note, perhaps from the salt-laden air blowing in from Monterey Bay.  Optimum drinking for this elegant Syrah should be from 2014 through 2020.  (MRO – 07/18/12)

Medium-dark ruby-garnet. Intense aromas of red cherries and black raspberries are complemented by suggestions of forest floor, red licorice, and spring flowers. Very compelling! On entry, quite harmonious with a luscious, mouth-coating texture. But at 14.7%, not at all heavy or tiring. Finishes long with gentle tannins and sound acidity. While certainly enjoyable now, like other Two Acres, this wine will age exceptionally well. Enjoy from 2014 through 2024. (MRO – 07/18/12)

Pale yellow with a touch of green-gold. Aeration and slight warming reveals aromas of lemon curd, white fig, clove, ginger, and a faint hint of honey. Quite smooth and suave on entry with a glycerol-like feel, laser-like acidity asserts itself in the zesty, lemon-lime and mineral-laden flavors. Texturally, I’m reminded of Chablis, or perhaps something from the Loire. A wine that pairs well with everything from roasted chicken to sole in lemon beurre blanc. Although drinkable now, given the large percentage of Semillon, we suspect it will age quite well. (MRO – 07/18/12)

Pale yellow with a touch of green-gold. Aeration and slight warming reveals aromas of lemon curd, white fig, clove, ginger, and a faint hint of honey. Quite smooth and suave on entry with a glycerol-like feel, laser-like acidity asserts itself in the zesty, lemon-lime and mineral-laden flavors. Texturally, I’m reminded of Chablis, or perhaps something from the Loire. A wine that pairs well with everything from roasted chicken to sole in lemon beurre blanc. Although drinkable now, given the large percentage of Semillon, we suspect it will age quite well. (MRO – 07/18/12)

Medium-dark garnet.  A fascinating nose of stone fruits such as peaches and apricots are mixed with a tinge of blackberry.  As my grandmother would say, A-B-C-Delicious!  On the palate, medium-full to full bodied with flavors of peach and cherry.  Smooth as silk, pleasing acidity and tannin kick in on the finish.  An old-vine Zinfandel of great harmony and balance.  Optimum enjoyment should be from 2013 through 2018. (MRO – 07/18/12)

Medium-dark garnet.  A fascinating nose of stone fruits such as peaches and apricots are mixed with a tinge of blackberry.  As my grandmother would say, A-B-C-Delicious!  On the palate, medium-full to full bodied with flavors of peach and cherry.  Smooth as silk, pleasing acidity and tannin kick in on the finish.  An old-vine Zinfandel of great harmony and balance.  Optimum enjoyment should be from 2013 through 2018. (MRO – 07/18/12)

Medium-dark to dark ruby-garnet.  Heady, perfumed scents of raspberries and red cherries with a touch of citrus rind and Christmas spice cake.  On the palate, obviously no shy wall flower with explosive flavors of raspberry and mulberry.  Despite its size, brisk acidity keeps this wine firmly on the rails.  A favorite at ZAP’s Grand Tasting in January 2012, even among those preferring lighter, more elegant wines.  Drink from mid-2013 through 2018. (MRO – 07/18/12)

Medium-dark to dark ruby-garnet.  Heady, perfumed scents of raspberries and red cherries with a touch of citrus rind and Christmas spice cake.  On the palate, obviously no shy wall flower with explosive flavors of raspberry and mulberry.  Despite its size, brisk acidity keeps this wine firmly on the rails.  A favorite at ZAP’s Grand Tasting in January 2012, even among those preferring lighter, more elegant wines.  Drink from mid-2013 through 2018. (MRO – 07/18/12)

Very dark ruby-garnet with a bright crimson edge.  Verging on opaque.  Deep, brooding aromas of blackberry, bittersweet chocolate, cola, and earth.  Full bodied with flavors of black and blue berries.  For a Zinfandel, offers impressive cut and definition.  In fact, almost Cabernet-like in its structure.  Notes of bittersweet chocolate reemerge in the lengthy finish.  Better than the 2009?  Too close to call.  Certainly more age-worthy.  Drink 2013 to 2022. (MRO – 07/18/12)

Very dark ruby-garnet with a bright crimson edge.  Verging on opaque.  Deep, brooding aromas of blackberry, bittersweet chocolate, cola, and earth.  Full bodied with flavors of black and blue berries.  For a Zinfandel, offers impressive cut and definition.  In fact, almost Cabernet-like in its structure.  Notes of bittersweet chocolate reemerge in the lengthy finish.  Better than the 2009?  Too close to call.  Certainly more age-worthy.  Drink 2013 to 2022. (MRO – 07/18/12)

Notes of bittersweet chocolate reemerge in the lengthy finish.  Better than the 2009?  Too close to call.  Certainly more age-worthy.  Drink 2013 to 2022. (MRO – 07/18/12)

Medium-dark to dark ruby. Whoa! Knock-out aromas of cherry, berry compote, and white figs. I could smell this all night long! Rich and full-bodied, the wine explodes on the palate with red and black fruits. Despite the forwardness of this wine, ample tannins and acidity keep the wine fresh on the palate, drawing you back for another sip. Enjoy from mid-2013 through 2018. (MRO – 07/18/12)

Medium-dark to dark ruby. Whoa! Knock-out aromas of cherry, berry compote, and white figs. I could smell this all night long! Rich and full-bodied, the wine explodes on the palate with red and black fruits. Despite the forwardness of this wine, ample tannins and acidity keep the wine fresh on the palate, drawing you back for another sip. Enjoy from mid-2013 through 2018. (MRO – 07/18/12)

94-year-old vines result in very bright pomegranate-wild cherry fruit, brown sugary-caramel oak, fragrant Asian spices—Chinese 5-spice.  Mouthfeel is still a bit young and chewy, but quite drinkable now.  Very mouthfilling!

Co-fermentation allowed the flavors to meld early on and develop layers of depth and complexity.  Warm red raspberry fruit with a bit of strawberry jam are laced with black pepper spice and creamy vanilla oak for a delish treat of a wine, great with our Raspberry Pork Tenderloin recipe from the website
This sparkling wine offers a fresh and vibrant bouquet of golden apple, white peach and honeysuckle.

Plush and round, this Pinot Noir from the small Klein Family Vineyard in the Santa Cruz Mountians shows the depth and lyaers of mountain fruit, as well as the fresh dliciousness of the modern 115 and 667 clones planted in the vineyard.  The wine explores with juicy red an dark cherry flavors laced with the complexity of tea leaf and forest floor. The finish is long, with ultra-fine tannins, and notes of milk chocolate from the careful use of fine French oak from the Saint Martin cooeprage.
Hardly, Strictly Bluegrass

This years Hapa Blanc was barrel aged for 13 months to round out the Grenache Blanc's majority lead. Lees were stirred every two weeks for three months to give the wine its great textural element. The Grenache Blanc is from Camp Four in the eastern portion of the Santa Ynez Valley with the Roussanne hailing from one of the premiere vineyard sites in Ballard Canyon

This years Hapa Blanc was barrel aged for 13 months to round out the Grenache Blanc's majority lead. Lees were stirred every two weeks for three months to give the wine its great textural element. The Grenache Blanc is from Camp Four in the eastern portion of the Santa Ynez Valley with the Roussanne hailing from one of the premiere vineyard sites in Ballard Canyon

This years Hapa Blanc was barrel aged for 13 months to round out the Grenache Blanc's majority lead. Lees were stirred every two weeks for three months to give the wine its great textural element. The Grenache Blanc is from Camp Four in the eastern portion of the Santa Ynez Valley with the Roussanne hailing from one of the premiere vineyard sites in Ballard Canyon

Intensely deep in aromatics with raspberry, dark cherry and licorice, combining with high toned aromas of incense, cigar box and earth. Complex flavors of dark cherry, pomegranate and raspberry give way to a lush core of chocolate, leather, and sweet tobacco, finishing long and seductive with the perfect balance between mineral and tannin.

variety: Rhone Blend The Jetty 62% Grenache 33% Syrah 5% Mourvèdre
other_notes: Deep ruby in color, verging on purple, the nose shows classic Grenache aromas of cherry and violets, along with darker notes of blackberry, sage and earth from the Syrah and Mourvèdre. The palate is full-bodied yet balanced, echoing the cherry and blackberry notes fro the nose, and finishing with plush tannins and a spicy, smoky finish with just a hint of vanilla. "The Jetty" is inspired by the Grenache-based blends of the Southern Rhone Valley. The 2010 vintage uses fruit sourced entirely from Paso Robles, where Rhone varieties thrive.

variety: Rhone Blend The Jetty 62% Grenache 33% Syrah 5% Mourvèdre

A powerful classy white wine with fragrances of white peaches and juicy star fruit, with nuances of cherry and lime.  A mouthful of ripe grapefruit, tangerine, chalk and bread dough.
A powerful classy white wine with fragrances of white peaches and juicy star fruit, with nuances of cherry and lime.  A mouthful of ripe grapefruit, tangerine, chalk and bread dough.

my_notes: It was nice with Shrimp & Asparagus in an Asian orange sauce
other_notes: A powerful classy white wine with fragrances of white peaches and juicy star fruit, with nuances of cherry and lime.  A mouthful of ripe grapefruit, tangerine, chalk and bread dough.

variety: Red Wiine Blend Pinot Noir, Charbono,
my_notes: This was good with Crab/Andouille Jambalaya that Alan made.

other_notes: The nose offers ripe pineapple and peach aromas with toasted graham cracker. The bright straw color prepares the palate for the rich tropical fruit and luscious stone fruit with a viscous mouth feel accented by toasted coconut, vanilla and butterscotch. The creamy finish lingers with hints of buttered toast and lemon zest. This wine will pair well with creamy Italian pasta dishes, roasted chicken or fish, and fresh summer corn.

The creamy finish lingers with hints of buttered toast and lemon zest. This wine will pair well with creamy Italian pasta dishes, roasted chicken or fish, and fresh summer corn.

Big creme caramel aromas, hazelnutty milk chocolate and vanilla, walnuts, orange peel, dried fruits, it just goes on and on and on.  Sweet but bright acidity, not at all hot - smooth and sensual and luxurious.  Since this rare bottling has spent almost 4 years in oak, it is like a tawny port in style.  It can age indefinitely longer.  Serve with chocolate, dried fruits, nuts and strong cheeses.

variety: Rhone Blend The Duet Grenache and Syrah

other_notes: Rich black cherry fruit, nice black pepper spice and touch of earth. Firm tannins cloaked in velvety plush silkiness, nice spicy finish. More fruit than a lot of Pinot Noirs

Spicy black ollalieberry, black cherry, clove, dark dusty cocoa, with a touch of caramel in the nose. Round, juicy fruit in the mouth, spiced cherries, caramel, and soft toasted oak flavors of chocolatey vanilla cream

Aromas of black cherry, plum and raspbery fruit combine witha beautiful hint of vanilla-oak loveliness, smoothly textured in mouth, very creamy and round, the finish is long and has lush jammy fruit - this wine is dangerously good!

94-year-old vines result in very bright pomegranate-wild cherry fruit, brown sugary-caramel oak, fragrant Asian spices—Chinese 5-spice.  Mouthfeel is still a bit young and chewy, but quite drinkable now.  Very mouthfilling!

variety: Black Magic Late Harvest Dessert Wine
other_notes: Mocha, cherry cordial, caramelized sugar, chocolate syrup, with a slight touch of mint chip, black pepper, and orange peel on the nose.  In the mouth are explosions of coffee, chocolate, black jammy raspberry with a slightly chewy texture and well-balanced sweetness.

my_notes: Gift from Pisoni for Valentine’s Day

other_notes: 95 points Pinot Report
95 points Pinot Report
94 points Pinot Report
94 points Pinot Report

The nose offers ripe pineapple and peach aromas with toasted graham cracker. The bright straw color prepares the palate for the rich tropical fruit and luscious stone fruit with a viscous mouth feel accented by toasted coconut, vanilla and butterscotch. The creamy finish lingers with hints of buttered toast and lemon zest. This wine will pair well with creamy Italian pasta dishes, roasted chicken or fish, and fresh summer corn.

The nose offers ripe pineapple and peach aromas with toasted graham cracker. The bright straw color prepares the palate for the rich tropical fruit and luscious stone fruit with a viscous mouth feel accented by toasted coconut, vanilla and butterscotch. The creamy finish lingers with hints of buttered toast and lemon zest. This wine will pair well with creamy Italian pasta dishes, roasted chicken or fish, and fresh summer corn.

The 2011 Esterlina Cole Ranch Dry Riesling is charming and delicate, with an abundant florla bouquet and lively acidity. Displaying a profusion of pear, greebn apple, lime and jasmine aromatics along with bright flavors of citrus zest, ginger and nectarine this minerally Riesling has a crisp and refreshing finish. Dry Riesling is the perfect partner to sushi. Enjoy the 2011 Esterlina Cole Ranch Dry Riesling in the freshness of its youth.

The 2011 Esterlina Cole Ranch Dry Riesling is charming and delicate, with an abundant florla bouquet and lively acidity. Displaying a profusion of pear, greebn apple, lime and jasmine aromatics along with bright flavors of citrus zest, ginger and nectarine this minerally Riesling has a crisp and refreshing finish. Dry Riesling is the perfect partner to sushi. Enjoy the 2011 Esterlina Cole Ranch Dry Riesling in the freshness of its youth.

The 2009 exhibits intensity of fruit balanced with restrained tannins. A surge of black cherry and currant aromas cascade into a generous complex of cherry, ripe olive, fennel, dried herb, and mocha flavors. Its smooth and supple mouthfeel leads to a dark sweet cherry, nutmeg and vanilla finish. Cellar for five to eight years to enjoy it in a peak of velvety teture, Drink it alongside roast beef or broiled lamb.

Fire up the grill, because this is the perfect wine to enjoy with all of those hot, smoky, succulent barbecued meats in which you wish to indluge before you retreat to the cozy indoors. The Everett Ridge Estate Syrah, with characteristic meaty flavors and dense tannins delivering mouthfuls of grip and power, is a muscular wine that’s tough enough to stand up to barbecue. A big blaze of peppery blackberry fruit fuses with char, tobacco and leather in the mouth. Bacon blue cheese burgers: ,meet your match!

Pale straw in color and freshly fragrant, the 2011 Everett Ridge Suvignon Blanc is refreshingly vibrant and citrusy. Flavors of Granny Smith apple and pear are infused with clover, basil, ginger and lemongrass. With yeasty richness of toasted brioche adding depth and textural complexity, the wine finishes with crsp acidity and an energetic hint of lime zest. Seize this wine in its youthful exuberance by enjoying within a year. Serve this bright and lively Sauvignon Blanc with spicy shrimp or on herbed goat cheese tart.

This is a classic Dry Creek Zinfandel, showcased by an abundance of jammy, ripe blackberry fruit infused with black pepper and clove. Inky purple in color, the wine displays its charisma through expressive aromas and concentrate dflavors, densely packed with brambly fruit. Emjoy this spicy Zifandel with Italian sausages or chipotle chile-rubbed hangar steak. Uncork a bottle for the quintessential Zin partner: the juicy burger. Delicious now and through the next three years.

There is nothing “petite” about this wine; rather, it is all about masculine power and brawny structure. This dark and brooding Petite Sirah is so deeply colored that it is nealry opaque, like ink. Aromas of leather, cigar box, sweet tobacco and charred oak suspend over a dense backdroop of blackberry fruit. Layered and chewy tannins make a big textural statement in the mouth. The inensit o fruit is supported by mouthwatering acidity for a bright finish. Though bold, this wine is not rough or coarse: it makes its grnad exit with a well-mannered display of subtle tannins. Will mellow over time and can age up to 10 years. Pair this robust and muscular wine with equally big foods: grilled steak, lamb sausages, blackberry glazed baby back ribs or the spit-roasted wild boar from your last hunt.

my_notes: We liked the smooth quality of this wine
other_notes: Diablita Zin-a-- our spicy muñequita! Smooth and voluptuous, Zin-a is an alluring, full-bodied Zinfandel, bursting with zesty flavor. She is sweet enough to take home to your mama; she’s the ideal date, aptly easy-going and approachable, to introduce to your friends; yet, she’s so desirable that you’ll want to keep her for yourself. What delirious dreams she’ll inspire! But beware: she has the power to melt you, make you believe what’s impossible and forget what’s not.

my_notes: We really liked the smoothness on first taste. Then the tannins catch you in the finish.
other_notes: Dark fruit, spice, pepper, leathery notes, and smokey oak. Avg. 90 on Cellar Tracker

my_notes: It was both creamy and clean.
other_notes: The cooler weather produced an invigorating, Chablislike Chardonnay with lively acidity and loads of citrus and stone fruits. Aromas of peach, lime rind, tangerine and orange blossom follow on the palate, along with a refreshing minerality, green apple and toasty vanilla notes on the finish. This is a medium-bodied, food-friendly wine that pairs well with herb-crusted grilled shrimp, crab cakes, white fish in Meuniere sauce and roasted chicken.

variety: Petite Sirah PETITE SIRAH (80%), CARIGNANE (10%), ZINFANDEL (5.5%), GRENACHE (4.5%)
my_notes: Would go great with burgers, spaghetti, pizza, etc.
other_notes: On the nose, blueberries, dark chocolate and black cherry are the predominant aromatics with a touch of floral and spice. In the mouth, Lot 96 tastes smooth, fruity and is very approachable with ripe blackberry, plum, blueberry and red cherry. It features well-integrated, supple tannins balanced with a strong backbone of acidity and fruit. The finish of blackberry and vanilla lingers for minutes. Enjoy this wine with grilled meats and hearty, aged cheeses.

Medium-light yellow-gold. Absolutely stunning aromas of white grapefruit, pepper, mango, snap pea, and gardenia. Great stuff! In the mouth, medium-full bodied with flavors of nectarine, apricot, grapefruit, and pineapple. Despite the fireworks on the palate, quite aristocratic and fine-boned thanks to perfectly balanced acidity. As someone who enjoys a lot of the top Grüners of Austria, I find this to be comparable. Drink this very special wine from release through 2015. (MRO – 01/17/13)

Medium-light yellow-gold. Absolutely stunning aromas of white grapefruit, pepper, mango, snap pea, and gardenia. Great stuff! In the mouth, medium-full bodied with flavors of nectarine, apricot, grapefruit, and pineapple. Drink this very special wine from release through 2015. (MRO – 01/17/13)

Black-purple. Opaque. Head-turning aromas of blackberry, red grapefruit (but not like our Rosella’s Vineyard Syrah), and licorice with a slight whiff of charcoal. A polished entry leads to a medium-full to full bodied texture with flavors of mulberry, blackberry, and savory herbs. Firm but gentle tannins carry through the long and persistent finish. While this wine can be enjoyed now, for optimum pleasure we suggest holding off for a couple of years and then enjoying through 2023.  (MRO – 01/17/13)

Opaque inky-purple. A vinous black hole. A heavenly bouquet of blackberry cobbler is highlighted by incense and flowers. Just thinking about how this wine smells makes me salivate! The wine hits the palate with great richness and viscosity but ample acidity and fine-grained tannins keeps the wine fresh and lively. Flavors of crème de cassis, blackberry liqueur, and blood orange flow through the minute-long finish. Enjoy this compelling Syrah from release through 2020. (MRO – 01/17/13)

variety: Rhone Blend Three Birds, 51% Dry Creek Valley Grenache, Teldeschi Ranch, 27% Sonoma Valley Grenache, Rossi Ranch, 13% Sonoma Valley Mourvèdre, Rossi Ranch, 3% Sonoma Valley Mourvèdre, Bedrock Vineyard, 6% Russian River Valley Syrah, Papa’s Block
other_notes: Medium ruby-garnet. With swirling and aeration, aromas of kirsch, orange zest, and sandalwood emerge from the glass. On the palate, a smooth-as-silk entry leads to flavors of cherry and smoked meats. Very captivating and interestingly, somewhat reminiscent of a red Burgundy. Medium-full bodied. A very elegant and pure wine that will age quite well. Enjoy from late 2014 through 2021. (MRO –0 1/17/13)

variety: Rhone Blend Three Birds, 51% Dry Creek Valley Grenache, Teldeschi Ranch, 27% Sonoma Valley Grenache, Rossi Ranch, 13% Sonoma Valley Mourvèdre, Rossi Ranch, 3% Sonoma Valley Mourvèdre, Bedrock Vineyard, 6% Russian River Valley Syrah, Papa’s Block

variety: Compagni Portis100% Field blend of Gewurztraminer, Trousseau gris, Riesling, and other mixed whites
other_notes: Pale white-gold. Head-turning, perfumed aromas of lychee, pear, and damask rose. Boy is this ever fun to smell! Medium bodied. Flavors of green apple, pear, lime, and tangerine caress the palate through the highly energetic finish. Optimum enjoyment of this very unique, old-vine white wine should be from release through 2015. (MRO – 01/17/13)

vineyard: 60% Dry Creek Valley Zinfandel, Teldeschi Ranch, 28% Dry Creek Valley Zinfandel, Mounts Ranch, 12% Dry Creek ValleyPetite Sirah, Del Carlo Ranch
other_notes: Medium-dark to dark ruby. Drop-dead gorgeous aromas of cherry, herbs, and spice box spill from the glass. I could smell this all day! On the palate, full bodied with an explosion of red cherry fruit. Suave tannins build through the long finish. A remarkable wine combining both power and elegance. Drink from release with a good decant through 2020. (MRO – 01/17/13)

vineyard: 60% Dry Creek Valley Zinfandel, Teldeschi Ranch, 28% Dry Creek Valley Zinfandel, Mounts Ranch, 12% Dry Creek ValleyPetite Sirah, Del Carlo Ranch

Medium-dark to dark ruby-garnet. Aromas of cranberries, plum pudding, and spice cake. Christmas in a glass! Quite deep and full bodied on the palate with flavors of cherries, red currants, and cracked black pepper. Powerful but totally seamless and balanced. Enjoy from release through 2016. (MRO – 01/17/13)

Medium-dark to dark ruby-garnet. Aromas of cranberries, plum pudding, and spice cake. Christmas in a glass! Quite deep and full bodied on the palate with flavors of cherries, red currants, and cracked black pepper. Powerful but totally seamless and balanced. Enjoy from release through 2016. (MRO – 01/17/13)

Saturated ruby-red. A very deep, aristocratic nose of raspberry, cherry, bittersweet chocolate, spice, and mint. Like so many of our 2011s, a beautiful seamless and creamy texture. Flavors of cherry, spice, and earth. Very persistent on the finish with ripe tannins and harmonious acidity framing the wine nicely. You can really taste the nobility of this vineyard. Enjoy this Grand Cru Zinfandel from late 2013 through the end of 2019. (MRO – 01/17/13)

Saturated ruby-red. A very deep, aristocratic nose of raspberry, cherry, bittersweet chocolate, spice, and mint. Like so many of our 2011s, a beautiful seamless and creamy texture. Flavors of cherry, spice, and earth. Very persistent on the finish with ripe tannins and harmonious acidity framing the wine nicely. You can really taste the nobility of this vineyard. Enjoy this Grand Cru Zinfandel from late 2013 through the end of 2019. (MRO – 01/17/13)

Medium-dark red-purple. A very deep, brooding nose of blackberry, black raspberry, and earth with just a slight suggestion of eucalyptus. On the palate, tremendous purity with flavors of black fruits, orange, and spice. A very serious Zinfandel with the acidity and tannin to ensure a very long life. Best bet for enjoying this wine is 2016 through 2024. (MRO – 01/17/13)

39% Russian River Valley Zinfandel, Fanucchi Wood Road Vineyard, 23% Russian River Valley Zinfandel, Carlisle Vineyard, 11% Sonoma County Zinfandel, Rowe Vineyard, 10%  Sonoma Valley Zinfandel, Rossi Ranch, 9%    Russian River Valley Zinfandel, Lingenfelder Vineyard, 8% Sonoma Valley Zinfandel, Bedrock VineyardMedium-dark ruby-garnet.  A classic “zin-berry” (raspberry, cherry) aroma is highlighted by notes of briary spice and black pepper.  Smooth and full-bodied on entry, a wave of red fruits envelops the palate while refined tannins build through the finish.  The texture and precision of this wine is simply amazing!  Drink now.  Drink next year.  Drink all the way until 2018!  No matter what you do, you can’t go wrong! (MRO – 01/17/13)
