Medium-dark ruby.  Seductive aromas of peach, blood orange, raspberry, and cherry ooze from the glass.  This is quite the sniff!  On entry, the most incredible, sexy texture, like having the finest silk flowing gently over your skin.  The aromas carry through to the palate with peach and blood orange becoming especially prominent.  Phew!  I think I need a cigarette!  ;-)  Enjoy this very sensual wine from release through 2018. (MRO – 01/17/13)

On entry, the most incredible, sexy texture, like having the finest silk flowing gently over your skin.  The aromas carry through to the palate with peach and blood orange becoming especially prominent.  Phew!  I think I need a cigarette!  ;-)  Enjoy this very sensual wine from release through 2018. Medium-dark ruby-garnet.  Crushed cherries, orange zest (a common characteristic in this vintage), and chocolate greet the nose.  Normally, Monte Rosso creates Zinfandels that can be quite brooding and rustic, wines that demand time, but in this vintage we see the more feminine side of the vineyard.  Medium-full to full bodied, a smooth, mouth-filling entry leads to flavors of red berries, spice, and bittersweet chocolate.  Incredibly well balanced with a long, lingering finish.  Drink from release through 2018. (MRO – 01/17/13)

Normally, Monte Rosso creates Zinfandels that can be quite brooding and rustic, wines that demand time, but in this vintage we see the more feminine side of the vineyard.  Medium-full to full bodied, a smooth, mouth-filling entry leads to flavors of red berries, spice, and bittersweet chocolate.  Incredibly well balanced with a long, lingering finish.  Drink from release through 2018. (MRO – 01/17/13)

Bright medium ruby-garnet.  An intoxicating nose of cherries, earth, and what we like to call the Rossi garrigue (the aroma of the native vegetation in and around this organically farmed 101 year-old vineyard).  Medium weight in body with flavors of red currants, orange rind, briar, and pepper.  Damn this is a pretty wine! Sound acidity and gentle tannins emerge on the persistent finish.  While drinkable now, this wine should continue to improve and develop with age.  Enjoy from release through 2020. (MRO – 01/17/13)

variety: Rosé Rendezvous Rose 90% Carignane 2.5% Zinfandel 2.5% Petite Sirah 2.5% Pinot Noir 2.5% Cabernet Sauvignon
other_notes: Light cranberry color, juicy strawberry-watermelon fruit aromas, nice mineral, hint of pink grapefruit.  Refreshingly crisp and dry.  Great with almost any food, from sushi to salmon to BBQ!

Aromas of black cherry, plum and raspberry fruit combine with a beautiful hint of vanilla-oak loveliness, smoothly textured in mouth, very creamy and round, the finish is long and has lush jammy fruit — this wine is dangerously good!   Remember – you are what you drink ….

Very bright pomegranate cherry fruit, brown sugary-caramel oak.  Fragrant Asian spices—Chinese 5-spice in milk chocolate/cocoa; Mouthfeel is still a bit young and chewy, but quite drinkable now.  Very mouthfilling!
Rated 91 pts. in Conno1sseurs' Guide To California Wine & Gold Medal at SF Chronicle Wine Competition

variety: Zinfandel Karma Zin, 86% Zinfandel, 10% Alicante Bouschet, 4% Petite Sirah
other_notes: Very complexly layered spice and black fruits, lively!  Dark chocolate, Creamy oak, a bit of vanilla cola, brown spices-nutmeg/cinnamon.  Rich in mouth, good structure for aging, a bit chewy in its youth.
With crisp pear and peach aromas, wonderfully forward and sweet tasting fruit, and a long, crisp finish, this is the perfect wine to serve at the beginning of a meal.

The 2011 Siduri Sonoma Coast Pinot Noir is one of the most remarkably different Pinot Noirs that we have ever produced. The wine is simultaneously rich and concentrated, and yet also structured and age worthy. At only 12.9% alcohol this is (technically) one of the leanest Pinot Noirs we have ever made, and yet it possesses crushed flowers, spices, dried cherries and licorice all melding beautifully together."Delicate flavors emerge from this en-gaging foundation like ephemeral stars rising in the night sky. There are delicate flashes of earth and fruit that deliver on the palate promises made in the wine's evocative bouquet, which is full of that ethereal quality I like to call the pinot thing.

The 2011 Siduri Garys’ Vineyard Pinot Noir shows a very aromatic nose, with loads of floral and dried herb scents.  On the palate, the wine is mid-weight, with more red raspberry fruits though there are some darker fruit flavors hiding underneath.  There are hints of herbs and dried leaves (probably from the use of whole clusters in the ferment) along with some vanilla from the oak.  The wine still shows some baby fat, but is certainly a great candidate for the cellar.

One of the things we like best about the 2010 Novy Keefer Ranch Chardonnay is the wine's crisp texture (due, undoubtedly, to the low pH). This crispness gives lift to the intense tangerine and pear flavors in the wine and also seems to bring out a bit of a minerality in the wine's mid-palate and finish. We certainly enjoy drinking this wine now, but feel that it will really be singing come summertime.

Ultimately, we decided that (while we could have de-acidified the wine) the best course of action was to let the wine be what it wanted to be, reflective of both the place and the vintage. The wine shows wonderful spicy pineappple, fig, and mineral notes. The wine shows its fruit, but this is balanced by the crispness from its bracing acidity.

variety: Diablita Blanca Riesling and Sauvignon Blanc
other_notes: Diablita Blanca is delicatley perfumed with a fruity and floral fragrance. Bright and fresh, she leaves a lively sparkle on your tongue. Drinking this Blanca will compel you to get your tiara on!

The wine’s aroma leads with vivid cherry and wild raspberry, then gives way to a swell of lavender and sandalwood, The layers of concentrated flavors emanate from a bright black cherry core, revealing pomegranate, sassafrass, star anise, allspice, cardamom, cocoa and toffee. Supple and silky in mouth fell, it has a seamless texture that finishes with velvety plushness This is a Pinot Noir that will age gracefully; expect it to continue to develop over the next eight years with proper cellaring. Pair with creamy mushroom risotto or braised pork belly cured with Asian spices. WineryLight reddishpurple color in the glass. Aromas of oak-kissed red fruits including strawberries with hints of cedar. Moderately light on the palate, yet noticeable staying power on the long finish. Delicious over time in the glass offering flavors of red and blue berries, baking spice, and subtle oak. Easy to like and very giving. Very good. PinotFile

This mighty Everett Ridge Estate wine is a classic Dry Creek Zinfandel, showcased by an abundance of jammy, ripe blackberry fruit infused with black pepper and clove. Inky purple in color, the wine displys its charisma through expressive aromas and concentrated flavors, densely packed with brambly fruit. Enjoy this spicy Zinfandel with Italian sausages or chipotle chile-rubbed hangar steak. Uncork a bottle for the quintessential Zin partner: the juicy burger

Intensely deep in aromatics with raspberry, dark cherry and licorice, combining with high toned aromas of incense, cigar box and earth. Complex flavors of dark cherry, pomegranate and raspberry give way to a lush core of chocolate, leather, and sweet tobacco, finishing long and seductive with the perfect balance between mineral and tannin.

Highly aromatic nose with jasmine, honey suckle and ginger along with white peach and spicy undertones. The mouth gives up juicy peach and white plum flavors that lead to a lush core filled with spice, mineral and lemon oil. The finish is long lasting wtih well-balanced acidity.

Deep aromas of raspberry, black cherry and grenadine give way to licorice, white pepper and herbs de PROVENCE. IN THE MOUTH FLAVORS OF RASPBERRY, PLUM, CRANBERRY AND RHUBARB LEAD THE WAY, FOLLOWED BY A SPICY CORE FILLED WITH LEATHER, COCOA, WHITE PEPPER, HERBS DE PROVENCE AND TOBACCO, THE FINISH IS WRAPPED UP BY JUICY POMEGRANATE FLAVORS THAT CONTINUE TO LINGER LONG AFTER THE WINE IS GONE.

my_notes: We enjoyed tasting at their new tasting room with Loring
We enjoyed tasting at their new tasting room with Loring
We enjoyed tasting in the Lompoc Wine Ghetto
Lovely lemony smoothness. Tasted in Lompoc Wine Ghetto
other_notes: Made from Robert Young Clone 17 from the Sierra Madre Vineyard, our 2009 Chardonnay highlights the cool climate characteristics of the Santa Maria Valley with its citrus, lemony notes and vibrant acidity, making this a wonderful food wine.  On the palate, a surprisingly round and weighty texture.  On the nose, just a touch of smokiness.

my_notes: It was nice and crisp. Would be great with food.

other_notes: The 2011 Siduri Van der Kamp Vineyard  Pinot Noir just received a 90 point rating from the Wine Advocate and was described this way, “Savory herbs, olives, menthol, game, tar and licorice all take shape in the 2011 Pinot Noir Van Der Kamp Vineyard. An unrestrained Pinot, the 2011 is laced with wild animal notes throughout. This is another of the more powerful, angular Pinots in the range, but there is no shortage of personality or intrigue.”
92pts “Cellar Selection”  Wine Enthusiast

The 2011 Siduri Garys’ Vineyard Pinot Noir shows a very aromatic nose, with loads of floral and dried herb scents.  On the palate, the wine is mid-weight, with more red raspberry fruits though there are some darker fruit flavors hiding underneath.  There are hints of herbs and dried leaves (probably from the use of whole clusters in the ferment) along with some vanilla from the oak.  The wine still shows some baby fat, but is certainly a great candidate for the cellar. 92pts “Cellar Selection” Wine Enthusiast
“Skin-Soaked”
Passionate purple in color, lively black peppery spice on perfumey blue-blackberry fruit along with Cedary oak spice, dusty cocoa, warm vanilla creme at finish, structured tannins for aging.
Composed of a graceful blend of Riesling and Sauvignon Blanc, Diablita Blanca is delicately perfumed with a fruity and floral fragrance. Bright and fresh, she leaves a lively sparkle on your tongue.

my_notes: Gifted when we helped pour at Family Winemakers
Gifted when we helped pour at Family Winemakers
Gifted when we helped pour at Family Winemakers

variety: Fresco Red Wine 35% Alvarelhao, 33% Peloursin, 32% Cabernet Sauvignon
other_notes: 400 cases produced.  Unfiltered, unfined.

From the bottle:  The Wild Thing derives its name from the use of a"wild yeast" fermentation, using only the native yeasts of both vineyard and winery.  This gives the wine a more fully integrated mouthfeel and more completely in aroma than wines made by selected yeast culture additions.  The vines in the Cox Vineyard, north of Ukiah in Mendocino County, were grown on gentle hills of rocky soils, which yielded a wine of deep raspberry fruit and vibrant black pepper spice.

High toned aromas of cherry, rhubarb and pomegranate lead to perfume, herbs de Provence, white pepper and mineral.Bright raspberry, pomegranate and cherry flavors give way to a silky core highlighted by bakers spice, cranberry, vanilla and herb de Provence finishing long with delicate tannins and lasting flavor.

Aromas of raspberry, dark cherry and licorice, combining with incense, cigar box and earth. Complex flavors of dark cherry, pomegranate and raspberry give way to a juicy core of cocoa, leather, and sweet tobacco, finishing long and seductive with the perfect balance between acidity and tannin.

Aromas of raspberry, dark cherry and licorice, combining with incense, cigar box and earth. Complex flavors of dark cherry, pomegranate and raspberry give way to a juicy core of cocoa, leather, and sweet tobacco, finishing long and seductive with the perfect balance between acidity and tannin.

Aromas of raspberry, dark cherry and licorice, combining with incense, cigar box and earth. Complex flavors of dark cherry, pomegranate and raspberry give way to a juicy core of cocoa, leather, and sweet tobacco, finishing long and seductive with the perfect balance between acidity and tannin.

Perfumed aromas of sandalwood, lavender, earth and clove along with ripe cherry, raspberry and plum. The ripe flavors are then echoed in the mouth with cherry, raspberry and pomegranate that lead to rich core filled with bakers spice, leather, dark chocolate and herbs de Provence finishing with rich, dense tannins that last. This could be my best to date.

Parker 88 This Grenache rose is a fun dark pink in the glass hinting at ripe California fruit.  It's got a playful candied yet fresh nose evoking vanilla, hot cotton candy, and circus peanuts.  The wine-maker does a good job of taming the ripeness of the fruit and bringing out lovely clean strawberry and Asian pear flavors riding on a silky smooth body.  This wine ends super clean with just a hint of green on the finish.

Dark ruby-garnet. An intriguing woodsy nose of pine forest, sandalwood, and spice. Smells more savory than fruity. The wine glides smoothly over the palate with spice and black pepper flavors emerging on the pleasantly tannic finish. Overall, I am reminded of a rustic but satisfying Languedoc red, appropriate since Grand Noir’s birthplace was near Montpellier in the Languedoc-Roussillon region of southern France. Enjoy this very age-worthy wine from 2015 through 2024.

Dark ruby-garnet. An intriguing woodsy nose of pine forest, sandalwood, and spice. Smells more savory than fruity. The wine glides smoothly over the palate with spice and black pepper flavors emerging on the pleasantly tannic finish. Overall, I am reminded of a rustic but satisfying Languedoc red, appropriate since Grand Noir’s birthplace was near Montpellier in the Languedoc-Roussillon region of southern France. Enjoy this very age-worthy wine from 2015 through 2024.

Medium-dark ruby. Classic Mourvèdre aromas of cherries, game, and dried rose petals. On the palate, impeccably well balanced with flavors of cherries, earth, and dried flowers. Finishes juicy and ripe with polished tannins providing ample structure. Very civilized yet being Mourvèdre, surely very age-worthy. Drink from 2014 through 2022.

Medium to medium-dark ruby. Exotic, perfumed aromas of cherry, forest floor, blood orange, and black licorice. On the palate, a subtle smokiness (not from oak, this wine saw no new oak) with flavors of game, cherry, and spice persisting through the mineral-laden finish. Really broadens with aeration. Comes across as much fuller bodied than 12.8%. Terrific with mesquite-grilled, citrus-marinated chicken recently but for optimum pleasure, I’d suggest holding off until 2016 and then enjoying through 2024.

Medium to medium-dark ruby. Exotic, perfumed aromas of cherry, forest floor, blood orange, and black licorice. On the palate, a subtle smokiness (not from oak, this wine saw no new oak) with flavors of game, cherry, and spice persisting through the mineral-laden finish. Really broadens with aeration. Comes across as much fuller bodied than 12.8%. Terrific with mesquite-grilled, citrus-marinated chicken recently but for optimum pleasure, I’d suggest holding off until 2016 and then enjoying through 2024.

Opaque black light purple. A deep, dark nose of blackberry, charcoal, incense, and flowers. Medium-full to full-bodied but surprisingly graceful and elegant. Plenty of blackberry and blueberry fruit to buffer the tannins. Reminds me a lot of the 2006 when it was released (which happens to be drinking fabulously now). Give this three to four years in the cellar and then enjoy the show until 2023.

Very dark ruby-purple. Bordering on opaque. Aromas of blueberry and black raspberry with savory notes of herbs and pepper. Curiously, and I’ve noticed this in the last few vintages, no ruby-red grapefruit as is typically expressed by this site. On the palate, a beautiful mid-weight presence with near perfect texture and mouthfeel. Blueberries and savory herbs persist in the mildly tannic finish. Enjoy this Syrah from 2015 through 2023.

Dark ruby-garnet. A very savory nose of white pepper, violets, and herbed, dried black olives. Offering plenty of verve and sap, the wine is surprisingly supple and approachable with impeccable balance. Red and blue fruits carry though the lip-smacking finish. Fans of more elegant Syrahs (as often found in the Northern Rhône) should find plenty to like in this wine. Drink from release (although with a decant) through 2020

Pale white-gold. Pungent aromas of white grapefruit, lemon zest, fresh herbs, and a hint of vanilla. Very expressive with the Semillon currently taking center stage. The wine glides smoothly across the palate as flavors of citrus and quinine weave in and out of the silken texture. A bit less zippy than the 2010 but still more than enough acidity to keep the palate refreshed. Drink from release through 2015, perhaps longer given Semillon’s proclivity for aging.

Pale white-gold. Pungent aromas of white grapefruit, lemon zest, fresh herbs, and a hint of vanilla. Very expressive with the Semillon currently taking center stage. The wine glides smoothly across the palate as flavors of citrus and quinine weave in and out of the silken texture. A bit less zippy than the 2010 but still more than enough acidity to keep the palate refreshed. Drink from release through 2015, perhaps longer given Semillon’s proclivity for aging.

Dark ruby-garnet.  A powerful mélange of spiced red and black fruits – raspberry, cherry, boysenberry, mulberry – spill from the glass.  On the palate, seamless, with fruit, acid, and tannin all in perfect harmony.  Reminiscent of the 2009.  Notwithstanding the non-existent 2010, Carlisle Vineyard has certainly been on a roll since 2007.  Enjoy this compelling field-blended Zinfandel from release through 2020.

Dark ruby-garnet.  A powerful mélange of spiced red and black fruits – raspberry, cherry, boysenberry, mulberry – spill from the glass.  On the palate, seamless, with fruit, acid, and tannin all in perfect harmony.  Reminiscent of the 2009.  Notwithstanding the non-existent 2010, Carlisle Vineyard has certainly been on a roll since 2007.  Enjoy this compelling field-blended Zinfandel from release through 2020.

Notwithstanding the non-existent 2010, Carlisle Vineyard has certainly been on a roll since 2007.  Enjoy this compelling field-blended Zinfandel from release through 2020.

Medium-dark ruby-garnet.  Wild, intoxicating aromas of raspberry, cranberry, cracked pepper, and brier.  The nose alone is quite the turn on!  Medium full-bodied, the palate offers intense raspberry fruit combined with plenty of spice.  Quite structured with fine-grained tannins and acidity punctuating the lengthy finish.  With two to three years of bottle age, this wine should be absolutely stunning.  Drink mid-2015 to 2024.

Medium-dark ruby-garnet.  Wild, intoxicating aromas of raspberry, cranberry, cracked pepper, and brier.  The nose alone is quite the turn on!  Medium full-bodied, the palate offers intense raspberry fruit combined with plenty of spice.  Quite structured with fine-grained tannins and acidity punctuating the lengthy finish.  With two to three years of bottle age, this wine should be absolutely stunning.  Drink mid-2015 to 2024.

Dark ruby garnet.  Assertive, perfumed aromas of raspberry and red cherry are complemented by notes of blood orange, rose petal, and briery spice.  A heavenly sniff!  On the palate, full-bodied with a burst of red fruit, spice, and a touch of vanilla (but by no means oaky).  Quite long and persistent on the finish.  Approachable today, enjoy this wine from release through 2021

Dark ruby garnet.  Assertive, perfumed aromas of raspberry and red cherry are complemented by notes of blood orange, rose petal, and briery spice.  A heavenly sniff!  On the palate, full-bodied with a burst of red fruit, spice, and a touch of vanilla (but by no means oaky).  Quite long and persistent on the finish.  Approachable today, enjoy this wine from release through 2021

Dark ruby garnet.  Assertive, perfumed aromas of raspberry and red cherry are complemented by notes of blood orange, rose petal, and briery spice.  A heavenly sniff!  On the palate, full-bodied with a burst of red fruit, spice, and a touch of vanilla (but by no means oaky).  Quite long and persistent on the finish.  Approachable today, enjoy this wine from release through 2021

Deep ruby-purple.  Bordering on opaque.  An intoxicating nose of black raspberry and licorice allsorts is complemented by notes of blood orange and violet.  On the palate, an explosion of black raspberry fruit. Suave and harmonious tannins build through the long, spice-laden finish.  Like so many of our 2011s, there is great purity, freshness, and precision in this wine.  Optimum drinking for this beauty should be from late 2014 through the end of 2021.

Medium to medium-dark ruby-garnet.  Aromas of cherry, cola nut, dark chocolate, and just a hint of vanilla.  Very sexy!  On the palate, voluptuous, velvety, full-bodied.  By no means over the top.  Just very well-balanced, pure, clean Zinfandel.  While more approachable than most of our other 2011 Zinfandels, this too should age well.  Enjoy from release (if you prefer youthful flavors and aromas) through 2020 (if you prefer more secondary characteristics and nuance).

Medium to medium-dark ruby-garnet.  Aromas of cherry, cola nut, dark chocolate, and just a hint of vanilla.  Very sexy!  On the palate, voluptuous, velvety, full-bodied.  By no means over the top.  Just very well-balanced, pure, clean Zinfandel.  While more approachable than most of our other 2011 Zinfandels, this too should age well.  Enjoy from release (if you prefer youthful flavors and aromas) through 2020 (if you prefer more secondary characteristics and nuance).

variety: White Wine Blend Elegancia Chardonnay & Dry Riesling
other_notes: There are plenty of tropical flavor and aromas - pineapple, lemon, a bit of mango. Try it with a spicy ahi tartar

Red cherry aromas mix with ripe cassis and cinnamon on the nose. The raspberry, cherry and plum flavors are complimented with anise and nutmeg-spiced oak. This is lovely now, and it will improved with cellaring through the next five years. Serve this lovely Cole Ranch Pinot with roasted sage and garlic chicken breasts.

The 2010 Sangiovese is a big ripe, and satisfying vinatge of this vino. While the wine is balanced and complex, the full-bodied ripeness of this Sangiovese removes all thoughts of finesse or delicacy. The nose is baked berry pie, with spice notes. Blackberry and cherry flavors are the most intense flavors in the mouth, with a bit of anise and nutmeg in the finish.

appellation: Chehalem Mountains of the Willamette Valley
other_notes: It is the most forward of our Oregon Pinot Noirs. It shows beautiful, rich red fruits with even a bit more dark fruit character that is unusual for Oregon. It also possesses a wonderfully rich, velvet-like mid-palate along with hints of underbrush.
The Bucher Vineyard Pinot Noir is classic RRV Pinot Noir with dark cherries, chocolate, and cola flavors. The wine is concentrated and yet surprisingly light on its feet.

For the Sonoma Coast, the 2012 Siduri Pratt Vineyard – Sexton Road Pinot Noir is a surprisingly full bodied wine (more reminiscent in weight of some of our Sta. Rita Hills offerings). But, in addition to this weight, the wine shows a nervous tension and a forest-floor, dried herb component that seems to be unique to the Sonoma Coast.

The 2012 Siduri Keefer Ranch Vineyard Pinot Noir represents one of the most complex Keefer Pinots we have ever produced. The wine certainly shows the rich fruit that Keefer is known for, but that is tempered with a more earthy, mineral char- acter than we usually see in this wine. We believe that this additional complexity will only allow the wine to become more compelling with the passage of time.

Siduri’s 2012 Pinot Noir Sierra Mar Vineayrd impresses for its pure delineaiton and vibrancy. Crushed rocks, tar, plus and black cherry notes jump from the glass. The aromas and flavors are dazzling in their crystalline purity and vibrancy.

It is a big, rich wine with plenty of boisterous personality. It possesses great fruit and a rich, velvet-like palate. On the finish, a bit of the whole cluster character sneaks in, providing the wine with balancing backbone and tannins. Like most of our Pisoni Pinot Noirs, this wine should age well for quite a few years, with the biggest challenge being holding the bottles rather than drinking them.

93 points Antonio Galloni. A drop-dead beauty, the 2012 Pinot Noir Cargasacchi Vineyard is one of the most beautiful wines I have ever tasted from this site, where so often the wines are wild and animalisitic. Some of those qualities are always part of Cargasacchi Pinots, but they are beutifully balanced by layers of sumptuous, generous, depply expressive fruit.

The 2011 Novy Keefer Ranch Vineyard Charodnnay begins with beguiling pear notes on the nose. On the palate the wine shows flavors of melons, pears, and crisp fresh apples. The wine is young and tight on the finish, but there is a burtst of flavor that makes your mouth water for another sip. We love this wine with shellfish as well as with sushi and sashimi.

The 2011 Van de Kamp Pinot Meunier is a superb example of the grape. While it is a bit Pinot Noir like, it also shows the telltale raspberry fruit character that epitomizes Pinot Meunier. a bit more lively and precise on the palate than Pinot Noir this wine pairs wonderfully with turkey or even ham, making it a fantastic and fun accompaniment to your holiday meals.

Robert Parker’s Wine Advocate rated the 2011 Susan’s Hill Syrah 93 points and gave the wine one of the best reviews we have received on any of our Syrahs. Here’s how it was described in print: “The 2011 Syrah Susan’s Hill Vineyard offers up a gorgeous, mineral-drenched array of black and red raspberry fruits, crushed stone, licorice and wood spice to go with a medium to full-bodied, rich, yet elegant and strealined palate fell. still youthfully tight and backwards, yet with excellent mid-palate density, this is an outstanding Syrah that should hit prime time drinking in a year or two and have 7-8 years or more of ultimate longevity.

Robert Parker’s Wine Advocate rated this wine 91 points. “Slightly more vivid and aromatic, with the signature acid profile of the vintage (and vineyard),  the 2011 Syrah Rosella’s Vineyard dishes out complex notes of black currants, sappy green herbs, mint, licorice and underbrush to go with a firm, beautifully focused apalte that carries ripe tannin and bright acidity.

The 2011 Novy Garys’ Syrah shows lush fruit, but also good tannins and backbone. It was recently rated 91 points by the Wine Advocate. “More angular and firm, with notes of coffee bean, chocolate and smoked fruit, the 2011 Syrah Garys’ Vineyard has bright acidity, ripe tannin and a medium to full-bodied profiel on the palate.
Rich black cherry fruit, nice black pepper spice and touch of earth.  Firm tannins cloaked in velvety plush silkiness, nice spicy finish.  More fruit than a lot of Pinot Noirs—a Zin-lover’s Pinot!

Nicely layered oaky spice and earthy BLACK fruits, lively!  Mocha-cocoa, Creamy vanilla oak, a bit of brown spice raisin cookie--nutmeg/cinnamon.  Nice weight to go with food, good structure for aging.
Nice dark-red in color, big blueberry-blackberry fruit, spicy-chocolatey oak, nicely focused acidity enhances mineral flavors, elegantly structured tannins for aging, super plush long finish!

Inky blue-purple in color, yummy deep razz-blackberry jam and luscious dark chocolate of oak spices, sweet but not clumsy, pleasingly balanced with a bit a tartness, not at all hotly alcoholic, bit of warm vanilla at finish.

appellation: California Monterey, Santa Barbara, Sonoma Counties

other_notes: Medium-light green-yellow.  Aromas of pineapple, white grapefruit, dried hay, and white peppercorn make for quite a sniff.  Aristocratic and juicy in the mouth, the wine offers flavors of green mango, yellow plum, and spice.  Finishes long with impressive clarity and cut.  Compared to the 2011, seems more Austrian and a little less Californian.  Optimum enjoyment for this wine should be from release through 2018. (MRO – 01/18/14)

Medium-light green-yellow.  Aromas of pineapple, white grapefruit, dried hay, and white peppercorn make for quite a sniff.  Aristocratic and juicy in the mouth, the wine offers flavors of green mango, yellow plum, and spice.  Finishes long with impressive clarity and cut.  Compared to the 2011, seems more Austrian and a little less Californian.  Optimum enjoyment for this wine should be from release through 2018. (MRO – 01/18/14)

Totally black.  Opaque.  Any blacker and you’d have to worry about nearby objects being sucked in and lost forever.  A powerful, concentrated nose of delicious blueberry and blackberry goodness.  On the palate, full-bodied with the typical Pet tannins nearly overwhelmed by the abundant fruit.  Very consistent with previous releases.  When to drink?  We prefer our Pets on the young side but there’s no doubt this wine can go 20 years or more.  Just depends on whether you like your Pets very primary and fruit forward or more mellow with secondary characteristics

Translucent medium ruby-garnet.  A gorgeous, perfumed nose of strawberries, red cherries, Asian five-spice, and vanilla (but again, absolutely no new oak on this wine).  I could sniff this all night!  Quite seamless on entry, red fruits and spice expand across the palate as fine-grained tannins build through a mineral-laden finish.  A very sexy wine!  Enjoy from release through 2022. (MRO –0 1/18/14)

Translucent medium ruby-garnet.  A gorgeous, perfumed nose of strawberries, red cherries, Asian five-spice, and vanilla (but again, absolutely no new oak on this wine).  I could sniff this all night!  Quite seamless on entry, red fruits and spice expand across the palate as fine-grained tannins build through a mineral-laden finish.  A very sexy wine!  Enjoy from release through 2022. (MRO –0 1/18/14)

Translucent medium ruby-garnet.  A gorgeous, perfumed nose of strawberries, red cherries, Asian five-spice, and vanilla (but again, absolutely no new oak on this wine).  I could sniff this all night!  Quite seamless on entry, red fruits and spice expand across the palate as fine-grained tannins build through a mineral-laden finish.  A very sexy wine!  Enjoy from release through 2022. (MRO –0 1/18/14)

Very dark ruby-purple.  Bordering on opaque.  Absolutely stunning aromas of blackberry, savory herbs, and charcoal.  A slight but pleasing note of capsicum as well.  Heady stuff!  On the palate, tightly coiled, precise and focused, with flavors of blackberry, cassis, and violet pastilles.  Although there is plenty of upfront appeal, the wine’s structure and tannin indicate a long life of development ahead.  As my grandmother used to say, A-B-C-D-licious!  Drink 2015 through 2025.  (MRO – 01/18/14)

Very dark ruby-purple.  Bordering on opaque.  Absolutely stunning aromas of blackberry, savory herbs, and charcoal.  A slight but pleasing note of capsicum as well.  Heady stuff!  On the palate, tightly coiled, precise and focused, with flavors of blackberry, cassis, and violet pastilles.  Although there is plenty of upfront appeal, the wine’s structure and tannin indicate a long life of development ahead.  As my grandmother used to say, A-B-C-D-licious!  Drink 2015 through 2025.  (MRO – 01/18/14)

Opaque, blacklight purple.  Glass staining.  A totally compelling bouquet of blackberry, flowers, licorice allsorts, and creosote.  Compared to Papa’s Block, more bass and less treble.  Quite rich and full bodied with ample structure framing the umami and dark fruit flavors.  Luscious.  A captivating wine that can be enjoyed now for its power and intensity or left alone for up to 10 years to become something more civilized. (MRO – 01/18/14)

Opaque, blacklight purple.  Glass staining.  A totally compelling bouquet of blackberry, flowers, licorice allsorts, and creosote.  Compared to Papa’s Block, more bass and less treble.  Quite rich and full bodied with ample structure framing the umami and dark fruit flavors.  Luscious.  A captivating wine that can be enjoyed now for its power and intensity or left alone for up to 10 years to become something more civilized. (MRO – 01/18/14)

variety: Compagni Portis White Wine: Gewurztraminer, Trousseau gris, Riesling, et.l.
other_notes: Pale white-yellow. An absolute knockout perfumed nose of lychee, damask rose, and citrus fruits. Wow! The wine enters medium-bodied with flavors of rose hip, kaffir lime, and tart green apple. Not at all fat with acidity providing plenty of cut and verve. Very refreshing. We don’t have a long track record with this vineyard but I suspect this should age well. Enjoy from release through 2021. (MRO – 01/18/14)

Medium-dark ruby-red.  Explosive, hi-toned aromas of red cherry and raspberry with subtle notes of candied flowers and iron-laced earth.  Quite seductive on entry, flavors of cherry and earth dance across the palate towards the spice and fruit-filled finish.  An incredibly harmonious and balanced wine with outstanding precision and focus.  For my palate, Dry Creek Zinfandel doesn’t get much better than this.  Enjoy from release through 2021. (MRO – 01/18/14)

Medium-dark ruby-red.  Explosive, hi-toned aromas of red cherry and raspberry with subtle notes of candied flowers and iron-laced earth.  Quite seductive on entry, flavors of cherry and earth dance across the palate towards the spice and fruit-filled finish.  An incredibly harmonious and balanced wine with outstanding precision and focus.  For my palate, Dry Creek Zinfandel doesn’t get much better than this.  Enjoy from release through 2021. (MRO – 01/18/14)

Medium-dark ruby-red.  Explosive, hi-toned aromas of red cherry and raspberry with subtle notes of candied flowers and iron-laced earth.  Quite seductive on entry, flavors of cherry and earth dance across the palate towards the spice and fruit-filled finish.  An incredibly harmonious and balanced wine with outstanding precision and focus.  For my palate, Dry Creek Zinfandel doesn’t get much better than this.  Enjoy from release through 2021. (MRO – 01/18/14)

Bright, medium ruby-red.  Cherries, white pepper, and a subtle earthiness greet the nose.  The wine enters smoothly and then explodes on the palate with a mélange of red fruit flavors.  Suave tannins and refreshing acidity make their presence known in the lip-smacking finish.  Surprisingly feminine.  In fact, bordering on Pinot Noir-like.  Drinkable now but should gain considerably with a few years in bottle.  Drink 2015 to 2020. (MRO – 01/18/14)

Bright, medium ruby-red.  Cherries, white pepper, and a subtle earthiness greet the nose.  The wine enters smoothly and then explodes on the palate with a mélange of red fruit flavors.  Suave tannins and refreshing acidity make their presence known in the lip-smacking finish.  Surprisingly feminine.  In fact, bordering on Pinot Noir-like.  Drinkable now but should gain considerably with a few years in bottle.  Drink 2015 to 2020. (MRO – 01/18/14)

Medium-dark ruby-garnet.  Aromas of cranberries, red cherries, black pepper, and allspice.  A subtle resinous/woodsy note reminiscent of the forest that surrounds the vineyard.  With ample acidity, sharply delineated and laser-like in its focus, flavors of pomegranate, raspberry, and tart red cherry flow through the persistent finish.  All the elements are in place for this wine to develop and age gracefully.  Best from 2015 through 2024. (MRO – 01/18/14)

Medium-dark ruby-garnet.  Aromas of cranberries, red cherries, black pepper, and allspice.  A subtle resinous/woodsy note reminiscent of the forest that surrounds the vineyard.  With ample acidity, sharply delineated and laser-like in its focus, flavors of pomegranate, raspberry, and tart red cherry flow through the persistent finish.  All the elements are in place for this wine to develop and age gracefully.  Best from 2015 through 2024. (MRO – 01/18/14)

Medium-dark to dark ruby-red.  Powerful, penetrating aromas of black raspberry, blood orange, bay leaf, and earth emerge from the glass.  Quite concentrated and palate-coating.  Red and black berry flavors are enhanced by tangy acidity and supple tannins.  A less nervy, more voluptuous wine than the 2011.  Optimum drinking for this “grand cru” Zinfandel should be from late 2014 through 2022. (MRO – 01/18/14)

Medium-dark to dark ruby-red.  Powerful, penetrating aromas of black raspberry, blood orange, bay leaf, and earth emerge from the glass.  Quite concentrated and palate-coating.  Red and black berry flavors are enhanced by tangy acidity and supple tannins.  A less nervy, more voluptuous wine than the 2011.  Optimum drinking for this “grand cru” Zinfandel should be from late 2014 through 2022. (MRO – 01/18/14)

Medium to medium-dark garnet-ruby.  Cherry, red licorice whips, a hint of cocoa, iron, and a whisper of savory herbs flow from the glass.  Smells more Dry Creek-y than Russian River-y, not surprising given Sodini’s iron-rich soils and its close proximity to Dry Creek Valley.  On the palate, full-bodied with plenty of verve and structure.  Flavors of red cherry build through the mineral-y finish.  Enjoy this elegant, graceful Zinfandel from release through 2022. (MRO – 01/18/14)

Medium to medium-dark garnet-ruby.  Cherry, red licorice whips, a hint of cocoa, iron, and a whisper of savory herbs flow from the glass.  Smells more Dry Creek-y than Russian River-y, not surprising given Sodini’s iron-rich soils and its close proximity to Dry Creek Valley.  On the palate, full-bodied with plenty of verve and structure.  Flavors of red cherry build through the mineral-y finish.  Enjoy this elegant, graceful Zinfandel from release through 2022. (MRO – 01/18/14)

Medium-dark purple-ruby.  Aromas of raspberry, cherry, orange rind, and spice.  Full-bodied with flavors of boysenberry, black cherry, and a touch of loamy earth.  Very harmonious on the palate with a caressing mouthfeel and subtle tannins on the finish.  Mind blowing quality for price.  Most wineries would charge double to triple what we are for a wine like this.  Drink from release through 2021. (MRO – 01/18/14)

Medium-dark purple-ruby.  Aromas of raspberry, cherry, orange rind, and spice.  Full-bodied with flavors of boysenberry, black cherry, and a touch of loamy earth.  Very harmonious on the palate with a caressing mouthfeel and subtle tannins on the finish.  Mind blowing quality for price.  Most wineries would charge double to triple what we are for a wine like this.  Drink from release through 2021. (MRO – 01/18/14)

Medium-dark purple-ruby.  Aromas of raspberry, cherry, orange rind, and spice.  Full-bodied with flavors of boysenberry, black cherry, and a touch of loamy earth.  Very harmonious on the palate with a caressing mouthfeel and subtle tannins on the finish.  Mind blowing quality for price.  Most wineries would charge double to triple what we are for a wine like this.  Drink from release through 2021. (MRO – 01/18/14)

Medium-dark purple-ruby.  Aromas of raspberry, cherry, orange rind, and spice.  Full-bodied with flavors of boysenberry, black cherry, and a touch of loamy earth.  Very harmonious on the palate with a caressing mouthfeel and subtle tannins on the finish.  Mind blowing quality for price.  Most wineries would charge double to triple what we are for a wine like this.  Drink from release through 2021. (MRO – 01/18/14)

Medium-dark purple-ruby.  Aromas of raspberry, cherry, orange rind, and spice.  Full-bodied with flavors of boysenberry, black cherry, and a touch of loamy earth.  Very harmonious on the palate with a caressing mouthfeel and subtle tannins on the finish.  Mind blowing quality for price.  Most wineries would charge double to triple what we are for a wine like this.  Drink from release through 2021. (MRO – 01/18/14)

Medium-dark ruby-garnet.  With swirling and aeration, a brooding nose of red cherries, orange zest, and chocolate emerges.  For some reason, the words “breed” and “class” come to mind when I smell this wine.  Delightfully refined on the palate, the wine displays impressive depth and purity in its red and blue fruit flavors.  Amazingly well-balanced.  You can’t help but feel you’re drinking something quite noble and special.  Enjoy from mid-2014 through 2022. (MRO – 01/18/14)

Medium-dark ruby-garnet.  With swirling and aeration, a brooding nose of red cherries, orange zest, and chocolate emerges.  For some reason, the words “breed” and “class” come to mind when I smell this wine.  Delightfully refined on the palate, the wine displays impressive depth and purity in its red and blue fruit flavors.  Amazingly well-balanced.  You can’t help but feel you’re drinking something quite noble and special.  Enjoy from mid-2014 through 2022. (MRO – 01/18/14)

The 2012 harvest was one of the best we have ever experienced at the Cole Ranch property. The Rieslings from this vintage are particularly good. The 2012 Dry Riesling starts with citrus hints, primarily lime and grapefruit, and a floral-honey aroma, too. The flavors that stand out for us are the green apple, peach, pear and lemon. With its great acidity, this Riesling goes great with light fish and seafood, such as grilled shrimp with a lime and mango salsa.

The 2010 Alexander Valley Cabernet Sauvignon is a powerful, distinctive wine, which is consistent with the wines we get from the Alexander Valley vineyard that is the sourceo fo this fruit. As usual, you get lots of black cherry and cassis aromas, with a welcome hint of French oak. The mouth has firm structure, wiht plenty of tannins and enough acidity to compliment even the biggest foods. The cherry, plum and berry flavors are complimented by the cola, and cocoa notes. if you like to grill, enjoy a tri-tip or a filet with this one. Feel free to enjoy it by itself. This Cabernet Sauvignon will continue to evolve and get better over the next eight years.

The Zinfandels grown in the Dry Creek appellation are known for ripe, black fruit flavors, with spice. This 2010 Zinfandel is full of those attributes, and more. This wine has lots of blackberry, pepper, clove and anise aromas. The initial, upfront flavors are blackberry and blueberries. Again, however, there is plenty of spice and some dark chocolate, too. Although the wine is ripe, there is good balance. Our Zinfnadel is ready to drink now, and should be wonderful for the next five years. Chicken cacciatore or a rosemary turkey casserole would be great matches for this one.

When we think of Sauvignon Blanc, what comes to mind is a fresh, elegant and acid forward wine, and this particular exampleof the varietal does not disappoint. the nosehas hints of lemon grass and fresh thyme, but evolves to uncover traces of passion fruit ending with a rich but elegant finish with hints of lemon peel. This is a great “drink now” wine that would go brilliantly with grilled garden vegetables, especially asparagus, or fresh seafood like oysters or scallosp in a spring green salad.

The Petite Sirah, inky and purple, is a wine of deep flavor and complexity. The nose is all about weight’ meaty and leather with hints of clove, black pepper and cigar box, tricking you into thinking this wine will be all power and no finesse. But the tides turn with the first taste’ full of bright ripe black berries, vanilla bean, anise and a note of cran berry tartness. the wine has firm structural tannins to create a plesan tbut not overbearing mouthfeel, and a long finish that brings you back around to that first initial impression fo weight an depth. This wine will pair well with a filet mignon in a red wine and balsamic reduction, or a juicy burger and duck fat fries. Drinking well now, but can age easily for 5-10 years.

The 2011 Sangiovese, with its brick-ruby color and spicy leather nose, screams old classic Tuscany. The wine has a complex palate of ripe fig, black currants and plums; vivid, but integrated acidity carries through to a long finish filled with dried cranberries, clove, vanilla, morels and forest floor. This is a wine that obviously pairs perfectly with pizza or pasta, but would also make a great tapas wine; it evolves constantly in the glass and is up to the challenge of matching both light and heavy dishes. This wine is ready to dirnk, but could also be cellared for up to five years.
Light cranberry color, juicy strawberry-watermelon fruit aromas, nice mineral, hint of pink grapefruit.  Refreshingly crisp and dry.  Great with almost any food, from sushi to salmon to BBQ!

Aromas of black cherry, plum and raspberry fruit combine with a beautiful hint of vanilla-oak loveliness, smoothly textured in mouth, very creamy and round, the finish is long and has lush jammy fruit — this wine is dangerously good!
Nice dark-red in color, big blueberry-blackberry fruit, spicy-chocolatey oak, nicely focused acidity enhances mineral flavors, elegantly structured tannins for aging, super plush long finish!

Very complexly layered spice and black fruits, lively!  Dark chocolate, Creamy oak, a bit of vanilla cola, brown spices-nutmeg/cinnamon. Rich in mouth, good structure for aging, a bit chewy in its youth.
Passionate purple in color, lively black peppery spice on perfumey blue-blackberry fruit along with Cedary oak spice, dusty cocoa, warm vanilla creme at finish, structured tannins for aging.

variety: Ronin Red Wine Malbec and Grenache
Hapa Blanc Roussane, Grenache Blanc, Viognier

other_notes: This complex yet elegant Syrah comes from the renowned Boushey Vineyard in the cool upper Yakima Valley (900-1200 feet) of Eastern Washington State. The owner, Dick Boushey, is one of the most reputable growers in Washington State, serving for years as a leader in Washington’s wine industry.It is a richly flavored wine with dark, even black plum and berry fruit, with hints of sweet incense, dried tobacco, and clean, loamy earth. The finish is long, with sweet milk chocolate, and its elegant tannin and acid structure promises a long window of enjoyment.

Like a mouthful of cherry pie, this jammy old vine Pinot Noir is redolent of ripe Bing cherries, with brown sugar and graham cracker notes from judicious new French oak barrel aging (Rousseau “Allegro”).  Offering immediate pleasure, the wine is plump and juicy, yet with a complex earthy spiciness: a result of sustainably farmed, balanced older vines rooted deep into the silt, sand and gravel soils of the Salinas River Valley of Monterey.

Sourced from selected sites at Anindor Vineyard and Mary's Peak vineyard, Verve’s Janka sweet wine has an extraordinary depth of flavor that marks the finest Gewurztraminer fruit from Oregon. Janka displays a beautiful golden color, and offers aromas and flavors of dried apricot and golden raisins laced with classic varietal “gewurz” spices of white pepper, fennel seed and coriander.  In the mouth, this wine is lush and viscous and its exceptionally long finish evokes crème brûlée with orange zest.  Serve chilled, but let it warm and expand in the glass.  Kept in the refrigerator, it will remain fresh after opening for up three weeks.

Bright aromas of cherry, rhubarb and grenadine lead to citrus rind, pink peppercorn, perfume and lavender scents. Juicy flavors of cherry, cranberry and fruit leather lead toa  spicy core of white pepper, herbs de Provence, coca and cinnamon, finishing fresh and elegant with well balanced acidity.

Fresh amonas of melon, pineapple and citrus combine with scents of ginger, lemongrass and mineral. They lead to a delicate core of mineral,fresh cut herb and white pepper, finishing fresh, with well balanced acidity.

There are aromas of plums and toast with a huge mouthful of ripe bery fruit that follows. Tannins do add a nice framework to the finish, but this 2011 Sierra Mar has so much fruit and spice, the tannins do not detract at all.

There are aromas of plums and toast with a huge mouthful of ripe bery fruit that follows. Tannins do add a nice framework to the finish, but this 2011 Sierra Mar has so much fruit and spice, the tannins do not detract at all.

Starting with aromas of sandalwood, black raspberries and cola, the ‘11 Rosella’s enters the palate with plenty of up front fruit, framed nicely by firm tannins and acidity. The berry and signature Santa Lucia Highlands spicy Pinot flavors linger long into the finish.

Starting with aromas of sandalwood, black raspberries and cola, the ‘11 Rosella’s enters the palate with plenty of up front fruit, framed nicely by firm tannins and acidity. The berry and signature Santa Lucia Highlands spicy Pinot flavors linger long into the finish.
The unique aromas of forest floor, chanterelles and ripe Russian River Valley Pinot Noir evolve on the palate into Asian spice fruit with a perfect acid balance.
The unique aromas of forest floor, chanterelles and ripe Russian River Valley Pinot Noir evolve on the palate into Asian spice fruit with a perfect acid balance.
Clear Rasberry fruit, nice warm spices and toasty vanilla creme ok, Sooth, soft but with bright acidity and firm tannin core to help with aging.

Even more luciously layered than previous vintages, more honeyed almond, delicate spiced peaches and cream. A bit fatter than some previous years, tho still shows bright acidity and clear tropical fruit, lemony deliciousness.

Black cherry fruit with nice roasty oak toast and a bit of peppery spice, Vanilla creme. The mouthfeel shows the Iron Fist in a Velvet Glove, which meansa firm tannin core but very soft and supple going down, bright acid at finish.

Tart blueberry-raspberry, a bit of an earthy layer, creamy sweet oak and vanilla, dusty cocoa, hint of bay leaf. Soft and long with bright acid and spicy oak finish. Wee bit leaner than some years, but will go superbly with rich food.
Nice blackberry with a whiff of blueberry, spicy rich toasty oak, almost chocolatey. Great structure, lighter in body than some years but very refined and sophisticated, elegance personified.
Gently herbal nose with a soft berry-cherry-cassis behind it, nice sweet vanilla French oak hit. Lighter than the 2009 but layered and well-structured. Bit of green herbs. Firm acidity

Very elegant and pretty nose, full of ripe red currants and nicely layered oak. Dusty vanilla-cocoa and a bit of clove spice, touch of black pepper. In mouth it shows creamy vanilla oak and delicate fruit, restrained well. Nice lighter weight to go with food, almost like a rich Pinot Noir, good structure for aging.

Zippy Bing cherry pie in a graham cracker crust, creamy Hershey’s milk chocolate and a bit of toasted marshmallow - not sweet, but soft and round, balanced by juicy acidity, with creamy caramello oak and a long cherry finish.S’mores with cherry jam inside?

Very bright pomegranate cherry fruit, brown sugary-caramel oak, fragrnt Asian spices - Chinese 5 spice in milk chocolate/cocoa. Mouthfeel is creamy yet tangy, quite drinkable now but a chewy mouthful in its youth.
Passionate purple in color, lively black peppery spice on perfumey blue-blackberry fruit along with cedary oak spice, dusty cocoa, warm vanilla creme at finish, structured tannins for aging

Tart blueverry-raspberry creamy sweet oak and vanilla, dusty cocoa, hint of bay leaf. Soft and long with bright acid and spicy oak finish. Wee bit leaner than some years, but will go superbly with rich food.

Inky blue-purple in color, yummy deep raspberry-blackberry jam and luscious dark chocolate with oak spices, sweet but not clumsy, pleasingly balanced with a bit of tartness, not at all hotly alcoholic, bit of warm vanilla at finish. Designed to match perfectly with our dark chocolate treats

Medium to medium-dark ruby-garnet. Scents of macerated cherries, earth, and tree bark emerge from the glass. On the palate, red cherries and a dusty,iron-like quality. Quite polished and well-mannered with suave tannins building on the finish. Approachable now but being Mourvedre, certianly very age worth. Put it away for a couple years and then enjoy from 2016 to 2028

my_notes: Ready to drink now (with a good decant)
other_notes: Medium-dark to dark ruby-purple. Sexy aromas of black raspberry, allsorts (?), tree bark, and roses. As compelling as the nose is, it’s the palate that really turns me on, offering flavors of rose petal, red berries, and orange peel. At once both full-bodied and elegant with tremendous flavor and a mouth coating texture. Enjoy it from release (but give it a good decant) through 2030

Black neon-purple. A concentrated, forceful nose of blackberry, cassis, and cream with a suggestion of spring flowers such as lily and hyacinth. The wine enters full and rich as dark berry fruit quickly takes center stage. While no shy wallflower, a wine of impeccable balance. Tannins from mid-palate through the finish (no doubt a result of the incredible tiny berry size in 2012) indicate a very long life ahead

Very dark ruby-purple. Bordering on opaque. Unmistakable Syrah aromas of white pepper, violets, and blackberry fruit. Once again, not a trace of the ruby red grapefruit that defined this wine for so many vintages. Perhaps the vines have outgrown this flavor? Plush on entry, berries and spice and all things nice envelop the palate. The only sign of whole cluster is a slight but pleasing chalkiness in the spice-laden, savory finish. Delicious now but it should be at its best between 2016 and 2024

variety: The Derivative White Wine Semillon, Muscadelle and Palomino
other_notes: Pale straw-yellow. Perfumed aromas of lemon, quince, beeswax, and lanolin. A dichotomous wine, it enters the mouth surprisingly full-bodied (no doubt the Semillon speaking) but laser-like acidity cuts the richness and keeps the palate fresh and invigorated. This rendition reminds me of a hypotheitcal blend of the 2010 and 2011. Easily the best we’ve made so far. With only three vintages under our belt, it’s hard to predict the aging curve on this wine.

Dark ruby-garnet, Effusive aromas of raspberry, cherry, rose petals, and a hint of camphor. In the mouth, luscious, rich and powerful. Yet at the same time, amazingly polished and balanced with flavors of black raspberry, licorice, and rose. A wine that evolves and develops int he glass, displaying the full glory of this truly majestice vineyard. Delicious now, enjoy from release through 2020.

Dark ruby-garnet. A heady and intoxicating nose of black raspberry compote with a strong note of blood orange. This is a wine that announces its presence wiht authority! But on the palate, as seamless and harmonious as they come with concentrated flavors of red and black berry fruit building through the long and gently tannic finish. A wine of both power and finesse. Enjoy from release through 2020

Medium-dark to dark ruby-garnet. Hi-toned, mouthwatering aromas of cherry, pomegranate, and violets possess uncommon depth and concentration. The wine enters the mouth with an explosion of licorice-tinged red cherry fruit. Texturally, this wine is all aobut balance and leegance. In fact, it’s downright sensuous! A stunning new wine that we are thrilled to have in our portfolio. Drink from release to 2020

Medium-dark ruby-garnet. Red fruits - raspberry, strawberry, cranberry - dominate the deep and powerful nose. The wine enters full and rich with red fruits, blood orange, and spice buffering the silky tannins. Surprisingly, a more masculine Zinfandel in this vintage than Carlisle Vineyard despite the lack of significant mixed blacks. Enjoy 2015 thorugh 2020

Medium-dark to dark ruby-purple. Black raspberry, licorice and dried orange ppel greet the nose. On the palate, a potpourri of berry fruit with a soupçon of Asian spice. Full-bodied and supple on entry, the wine shows plenty of verve and definition thanks to healthy acidity and fine-grained tannins. Although Carlisle, Papera, and Saitone are all a stone’s throw from ech other, each wine is distinct and unique. I’d suggest holding htis wine until 2015 and then enjoying through 2022

my_notes: Ready to drink now with a good decant.
other_notes: Medium-dark ruby-garnet. Knowckout, head-turning aromas of blackberry, blueberry, and blood orange with a pleasing subtle herbaceousness.  Really gorgeous stuff! The wine glides across the palate wiht a satin-like texture, displaying plenty of dark, luscious cherry and berry fruit. From mid-palate through finish, mineral inflected flavors that bring to mind the vineyard’s rocky soils play off the refined tannins. This will age well. Enjoy 2015 with a good decant through 2024

A glass-staining, Syrah-like dark ruby-neon purple. Nearly opaque. A heavenly nose of blackberry, licorice, and Middle Eastern spices. Very different from our other Zinfandels but no less compelling. On the palate, medium-full to full bodied with viscous flavors of blackberry liquor punctuated by refreshing tannins and acidity. Yowzers! Drink this from mid-2015 through 2022.

The combination of cool weather and mountian grown fruit make for a unique wine, unlike all of our other Pinots, with a bit less polish, but more earthen concentration. The wine always has a distinct smoked meat character that seems to divide tasters. That is exactly what we want in a single-vineayrd Pinot Noir; distinct character. The 2012 Vander Kamp does  show a bit more fruit than previous vinatges and a richness that makes it truly impressive to drink now,e specially with fairly hearty meat dishes.

Vibrant ruby. A powerfully scented bouquet evokes raspberry and boysenberry preserves, cola, licorice and potpourri. Lush and creamy intexture, offering sweet red and dark bery preserve and cherry-cola flavors, with notes of rose pastille and tangy minerals adding vibrancy. Silky tannins frame the powerful fruit and carry through a long, prcise, floral-driven finish.

It is perhaps a touch lighter than Pinot Noir, with lifted aromatics and more red fruit than black fruit. it is lively and fairly exotic. And it is our favorite pairing with Thanksgiving dinner. That sounds random, we realize, but the wine simply matches extraordinarily well with the wide variety of flavors that are found at the table during a Thanksgiving meal.
It has the effusive fruit of the Russian River Valley and a high level of concentration and complexity.
This demonstrates the unique character of the site, wiht the richness of the Russian River Valley and the forest floor character of the Sonoma Coast.
Grace and elegance for this site
Demonstratesthe weight and concentration of the best Russian River Valley Pinot Noirs
Highly complex

As with previous Sierra Mar Syrahs, the 2012 shows a plushness and roundness in the mmouth that is surprising given its depth and conecentration of flavors. The tannins are present on the finish; enough so that we think that this wine will improve for many more years.

appellation: Russian River Valley and Santa Lucia Highlands
vineyard: Irwin Lane Vineayrd and Rosella’s Vineyard
other_notes: This wine shows the best characteristics of both sites with a tropical fruit flavor profile along with the hints of vanilla and crisp acid.

my_notes: Nice blend of three vineyards in RRV, including Carlisle. Well worth the price.
Nice blend of three vineyards in RRV, including Carlisle. Well worth the price.
Nice blend of three vineyards in RRV, including Carlisle. Well worth the price.
Nice blend of three vineyards in RRV, including Carlisle. Well worth the price.
Nice blend of three vineyards in RRV, including Carlisle. Well worth the price.
Nice blend of three vineyards in RRV, including Carlisle. Well worth the price.

other_notes: The nose has hints of lemon grass and fresh thyme, but evolves to uncover traces of passion fruit and the slightest touch of orange blossom. The wine has crisp acidity, but a nice round mid-palate with a fuller expression of the passion fruit ending with a rich but elegant finish with hints of lemon peel. This is a great “drink now wine” that would go brilliantly with grilled garden vegetalbes, especially asparagus, or fresh seafood like oysters or scallops in a spring green salad

variety: White Wine combination of Chardonnay and Riesling Elegancia
other_notes: Elegant, fruit forward. There are plenty of tropical flavor and aromas - pineapple, lemon, a bit of mango. When combined with great acidity, it presents an appealing bottle of wine.

Still in its infancy, it is drinking well, but owuld defnintely benefit from some time forgotten in a cellar to become even more complex and layered. The wine is bold, with rich ripe cherry notes, earth tones, vanilla and cloves. The palate is still very tight, but when decanted opens up into a rich and velvety wine, wiht beautiful red currant and black cherry fruit character along with a real earthiness, as if you could taste the soil in which the vine was planted.

This is the perfect wine to enjoy with all of those hot, smoky succulent barbecued meats in which you wish to indulge before you retreat to the cozy indoors. The Everett Ridge Estate Syrah, with characterisitc meaty flavors and dense tannins delivering mouthfuls of grip and power, isa  muscular wine that’s tough enough to stand up to barbecue. A big blaze of peppery blackberry fruit fuses with char, tobacco and leather in the mouth. Bacon blue cheese burgers meet your match!
This sparkling wine offers a fresh and vibrant bouquet of golden apple, white peach, and honeysuckle.

Aromas of pear, granny smith apple and lychee along with jasmine, tuberose and ginger. Upfront flavors of pear and apricot lead to a zesty core of mineral, ginger and keylime pie finishing with great acidity and lemon zest.

Bright aromas of cherry, currant and raspberry along with earth, cinnamon, sandalwood, licorice and herb de Provence. Juicy flavors of cherry, raspberry and pomegranate give way toa  delicious core filled with cinnamon, mocha, suede and herbs de Provence finishing with long lasting chewy tannins.

variety: Rhone Blend Red Hapa Red 50% Syrah, 25% Grenache, 15% Cabernet Sauvignon, 10% Malbec
other_notes: Aromas of blackberry and plum give way to sweet pipe tobacco, allspice, violet and earth. Bright uprfront flavors of cherry, plum and boysenberry lead to a complex core of cocoa, nutmeg, leather, mineral and herbs de Provence, finishing with great balance between acid and tannin.

Wow! What a wine! Medium to medium dark ruby. Soaring aromatics of sandalwood, kirsch, and cured ham. On the palate, full-bodied but totally seamless with perfect balance. Explosive flavors of kirsch an Asian five-spice linger through the long and gently tannic finish. Not only one of the most complex, delicious Grenaches from California to ever pass over my lips, but perhaps one of the greatest wines we have ever produced.

Brilliant medium-light to medium green-yellow. Intense, fragrant aromas of pineapple, canteloupe, and acacia honey, On the palate, medium-bodied but surprisingly powerful with flavors of pineapple, mango, lime and flinty minerals. Despite the tropical fruit and honey descriptors, completely dry with no residual sugar. Fermented and aged in all stainless steel. If I didn’t know better, I would swear this wine was from Austria. Enjoyable now, this wine will benefit from some age.

I could just repeat the note for the 2012. Color? Black with black light purple bubbles. Completely opaque. Fruit? Blueberries and blackberries galore! Full-bodied but with some of the plushes, most round tannins you’ll ever encounter in a Petite Sirah, a result of the extended maceration. The 20% new oak is nowhere to be found. If you enjoy powerful, concentrated wines, this wine can certainly be consumed young. But there’s no doubt that it will also age gloriously for quite some time. Hence, a wide drinking window.

Newly opaque ruby-purple. Blackberry, cassis, violets, and white pepper spill from the glass. As the wine enters the mouth, it quickly envelops the palate with flavors of blackberr, licorice, and spice. Full-bodied, mild, chalky tannins make an appearance in the persistent and energetic finish. Age worthy.

vineyard: Papa’s block, Steiner and Rossi Ranch
other_notes: Very dark ruby-purple. With swirling armoas of blackberry, smoke, game, and cracked black pepper emerge. Surprisingly elegant, the wine flows over the palate with notes of blackberry, boysenberry, and a hint of bitter chocolate. Like most of our 2013s, just remendous balance. Supple tannins and a gentle grip emerge on the long, focused finish. A wine that drinks at several times above its price point. Enjoy this beauty.

Pale white-yellow. A stunningly beautiful nose of lychee, heirloom rose, lime, and musk. The aromas are totally addictive! Medium-bodied and bone dry, flavors of lime, green apple, and rose on the palate. As with previous versions, very refreshing with great persistence and cut on the finish. Pairs very well with roasted pork tenderloin in a Calvaos reduction sauce. Based on how the first couple of vintages are aging, enjoy this delisious, perfumed white from release through 2022

vineyard: Teldeschi Ranch, Mounts Ranch and Del Carlo Ranch
other_notes: Medium-dark ruby-red. Expressive aromas of red cherry, raspberry, dried tobacco, and dusty, iron-laced earth. Medium full-bodied, this is a very pretty Zinfandel showing plenty of finesse in its bright red fruit and ineral-laced flavors. This wine makes me think of Audrey Hepburn - beautiful, classic, elegant. it speaks clearly and precisely of Dry Creek Valley. For optimum pleasure, we’d recommend holding until 2016.

Pale yellow-gold. Totally old-school aromas of quince, quinine, and flint. Reminds me of some of the whites produced in california in the ‘60s and ‘70s. The wine slips smoothly over the palate, displaying zesty quince and quinine flavors. Perhaps a note of lemon pith as well. Finishes with tremendous clarity and cut. Very mineral driven with impressive but well-blanced acidity. This is history in a glass.

Brilliant, translucent ruby-red. Aromas of red cherries, fresh tobacco, and spice box wiht a slight note of earthiness. Very sexy! On the palate, medium full-bodied with red fruits that bring to mind raspberries and cherries. Overall, smooth as silk with tannins and acidity in perfect harmony, a common thread through our 2013s. Like the 2012, almost Pinot Noir-like, but this is a step up. Given its exceptional balance, this wine should age well. However, it’s so delicious now, we’d recommend enjoying from release thorugh 2021

Medium-dark to dary ruby-garnet. An incredibly complex nose that brings to mind pine forest, Christmas baking spices, figs, and licorice allsorts. Whata  sniff! In the mouth, the complexity continues with an explosion of dark berry fruit, figs, and spice. As complex a Zinfandel as I can recall. Normally our DuPratt Zinfandel needs some time to show its best but this is already surprisingly drinkable.

Dark ruby-red. Verging on opaque. It’s obvious there are some teinturiers (red juiced grapes such as Alicante Bouchet) in the blend. A drop-dead gorgeous nose of blackberyr, black raspberry, sage and eucalyptus. Classic Montafi! On the palate, powerful, concentrated, yet the wine is perfectly balanced between tannins, acid, and fruit. The quintessential Carlisle Zinfandel? I suspect amny would say so.

Medium-dark to dark purple-ruby. A deep, concentrated nose of raspberyr and cherry with a subtle note of baking spices lurking in the background. No mistaking this for anything but classic Zinfandel. On entry, supple with tremendous symmetry between fruit, alcohol, tannin, and acid. Like so many of our other 2013s, the balance is breathtaking. My favorite Sonoma County Zinfandel we’ve produced to date.

Medium-dark ruby-garnet. Highly perfumed aromas of red berries, blood orange, and spice greet the nose. In a word, stunning! Deeply fruited, the wine showcases what only 100-plus-year-old, mountian grown Zinfandel can produce - nobility, breed, class, power. Lush, harmonious tannins on the finish indicate a long life ahead.

Medium-dark to dark ruby-purple. Powerful aromas of boysenberry, black cherry, and peppery spice. The Rossi garrigue is back! On the palate, dark berry fruit, spice, and licorice are framed by the velvety tannins so typical of this organically farmed site. Optimum enjoyment for this special Zinfandel should be between 2016 and 2022

appellation: Mendocino County, Sonoma County, Placer County, Paso Robles
other_notes: Light cranberry color, juicy strawberry-watermelon fruit aromas, nice mieral, a hint of pink grapefruit. Refreshingly crisp and dry. Great with almost any food, from sushi to salmon to BBQ!

Aromas of black cherry, plum and raspberry fruit combine with a beautiful hint of vanilla-oak loveliness, smoothly textured in mouth, very creamy and round, the finish is long and has lush jammy fruit - this wine is dangerously good!
Rich and fruit forward, this wine has aromas of bold black cherry, licorice and plum - combined with a spicy and jammy conplexity in the mouth - leading to a lingering, silky vanilla-cream finish.

Wow - big smoky-caramel oakiness on a deep razzbery fruit core. Cremay in mouth, a bit of brown spices-nutmeg/cinnamon, with lively acidity, good depth of fruit without being jammy or overripe. Lingering razzberry=chocolate finish, great with pork tenderloin, strawbery salad or even grilled salmon. Try it with the Pomegranate Chicken recipe
Nice dark-red in color, big blueberyr-blackberry fruit, spicy-chocolatey oak, nicely focused acidity enhances mineral flavors, elegantly structured tannins for aging, super plush long finish -yum
Dark red in color. Black cherry-cola and cassis fruit, long and deep on nose and palate. Cedary aok spice and warm pipe tobacco aromas, dark chocolate, vanilla at finish, smoothly structured tannins.
Rich and fruit forward, this wine has aromas of bold black cherry, licorice and plum - combined with a spicy and jammy conplexity in the mouth - leading to a lingering, silky vanilla-cream finish.

Zippy Bing cherry pie in a graham cracker crust, creamy Hershey’s milk chocolate and a bit of toasted marshmallow - not sweet but soft and round balanced by juicy acidity, with creamy caramello oak and a long cherry finish. S’mores with cherry jam.
Offers a lovely mix of coconut water and melon flavors, with a touch of mango, all set on a smooth, medium body. Finishes with just the right amount of juicy acidity.
Offers a lovely mix of coconut water and melon flavors, with a touch of mango, all set on a smooth, medium body. Finishes with just the right amount of juicy acidity.

Beautifully aromatic, effusively fruity white wine that is perfect for summer

The 2012s combine ripe flavors with Oregon’s natrual penchant for trnsparency amd eleganc,e exactly what happens in a typically cool climate when Mother Nature lavishes sun and warmth on a small than usual crop. It is tru to its place with bright red fruits, vibrant acidity, and the additional compelxity o a forest floor, pine neelde character.

Additional levels of complexity while maintaining the wine’s refined fruit character. As always, the 2013 Ewald Vineyard Pinot Noir represents one of the most classic, blaanced, and well-defined wines in our portfolios o Pinot Noirs.
Atypical Keefer Pinot with backbone and complexity. This may be the finest and most complete 2013 Siduri Pinot Noir yet.

Much like the Keefer Ranch the goal here is tot ake the ample ruit character and build in additional layers of complexity and backbone. The fruit is darker than with the Keefer Pinot and the wine a bit bolder.

We hope that this is our most complex and compelling Sierra Mar yet and taht (much loike the 2001 and 2002 vintages at the Garys’ Vineyard) we have tamed a bit of the teenage recklessness in this wine.
Our goal was to preserve the freshness and vibrancy in the wine. It will improve given a few years in the cellar.

We were able to capture a freshness of fruit and liveliness in the wine that could have easily been missed in the 2013. Oh, it is still a Sta. Rita Hills Pinot, darkly colored with the signature earthiness of the region.

The wine shows a richness that makes it incredibly enjoyable to drink right now. Interestingly, it is after being opened a few hours that the backbone of the wine becomes apparent. I love wines like this, that drink well right off but with some time open they actually pull bakc upon themselves a bit. That seems to bode well for ageability.

The Carlisle Vineyard always shows a bit ore “Rhone-like” than the Papera Vineyard Zinfandel, which is no surprise given the higher percentage of “mixed blacks” in the vineyard. The 2013 Zinfandel Carlisle Vineyard hits the palate with an intriguing melange of dark blue and purplish fruit, sweet psices, tobacco, cedar and lavender. Exotic and juicy to the core, the Carlisle is another delicious red from Novy.

Inky blue and black fruits, dark spices, licorice, leather and lavender meld otgether in the 2013 Zinfandel Papaera vineayrd. In this vintage, the Papera is decidedly more powerful, mos tof that a conscious decision by Adam Lee to give the wine more darkness and overall intensity, qualities this site seems to generate in abundance on its own.

my_notes: Should be great with Pork with chili
It’d be great to compare with the 2012
Enjoyed it at Ed’s Open House
